Text_en: Auntie, good morning!
Text_ortho: Auntie, good morning.

Text_en: Good morning!
Text_ortho: Good morning!

Text_en: How are you now?
Text_ortho: How you dey now?

Text_en: I'm fine.
Text_ortho: I dey fine.

Text_en: How was your night?
Text_ortho: How your night?

Text_en: We thank God.
Text_ortho: We thank God.

Text_en: Hope you slept well?
Text_ortho: Hope sey you sleep well?

Text_en: Ah, my sister, I slept well.
Text_ortho: Ah my sister, I sleep well o!

Text_en: You had electricity in your area last night?
Text_ortho: Una get light for una area last night?

Text_en: We didn't.
Text_ortho: We no get o.

Text_en: Ah, what happened now?
Text_ortho: Ah wetin happen now?

Text_en: It's NEPA.
Text_ortho: Toh na NEPA o!

Text_en: Aha, these people, I heard that they share the light.
Text_ortho: Aha dese people, I hear sey de dey share di light.

Text_en: My sister, it's tiring.
Text_ortho: My sister, di tin tire me o!

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: They share it yet they bring overestimated bills.
Text_ortho: De just dey share am, but de go dey bring big bill.

Text_en: Our ah...
Text_ortho: Our ah...

Text_en: In fact, that bill is another thing again.
Text_ortho: In fact, dat bill na anoder tin again.

Text_en: That it is, my sister.
Text_ortho: Na so my sister.

Text_en: How much do they... how much... how much did they charge you on the bill?
Text_ortho: How much de dey, how much, how much de dey give una for una bill?

Text_en: Ah, my sister, it's seven thousand.
Text_ortho: Ah my sister, na seven thousand o!

Text_en: Jesus!
Text_ortho: Jesus!

Text_en: Seven thousand for the light we don't have?
Text_ortho: Seven thousand for di light wey we no dey see?

Text_en: That's right!
Text_ortho: Na so o!

Text_en: Ah, these people... eh, they won't kill someone.
Text_ortho: Ah dese people, eh de no go kill person o!

Text_en: My sister.
Text_ortho: My sister toh.

Text_en: How are you managing?
Text_ortho: Toh how you dey manage now?

Text_en: How is your business?
Text_ortho: How your business?

Text_en: My sister, I'm managing.
Text_ortho: My sister, I dey manage am.

Text_en: Thank God.
Text_ortho: Thank God!

Text_en: Eyah, God will help us.
Text_ortho: Eyah God go help us.

Text_en: Amen!
Text_ortho: Amen o!

Text_en: There is one...
Text_ortho: Toh e get one...

Text_en: There is a kind of dish that Mama Maro taught me.
Text_ortho: E get one soup like dat wey Mama Maro bin teach me.

Text_en: The dish is good.
Text_ortho: Di soup make sense.

Text_en: I heard that it's an Ibo dish.
Text_ortho: I hear sey na Ibo soup.

Text_en: Uhuh?
Text_ortho: Ehn?

Text_en: Uhuh?
Text_ortho: Ehn?

Text_en: Ehn!
Text_ortho: Ehn!

Text_en: I know you'll like it.
Text_ortho: I know sey you go like am.

Text_en: Teach me too.
Text_ortho: Teach me too now.

Text_en: Hope you know banga soup?
Text_ortho: Shebi you know banga soup?

Text_en: I know banga soup.
Text_ortho: I know banga soup.

Text_en: Ehn... it's the soup.
Text_ortho: Ehn na di soup.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Okay!

Text_en: So, it's like I'll come so you and I can do it.
Text_ortho: So it's like I go come, me, and you go, go do am.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Okay!

Text_en: The dish will be good.
Text_ortho: Di soup go make sense.

Text_en: You'll like it a lot.
Text_ortho: You go like am well, well.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Okay!

Text_en: Or should I give it to you?
Text_ortho: Abi meh I give you.

Text_en: So...
Text_ortho: So...

Text_en: Like can you tell me how they...
Text_ortho: Like you fit tell me how de take dey...

Text_en: Do you know how they prepare the dish?
Text_ortho: You know how de take dey cook di soup?

Text_en: Ah, my sister... my younger sister taught me how they cook it.
Text_ortho: Ah my sister, my junior sister bin teach me how de take dey cook am o.

Text_en: Can you tell me a little?
Text_ortho: You fit tell me small?

Text_en: She said...
Text_ortho: E say...

Text_en: She said you'll parboil the banga.
Text_ortho: Eh e say you go parboil di banga.

Text_en: Uhuh.
Text_ortho: Ehen.

Text_en: After you've parboiled it, then you'll pound it.
Text_ortho: After you parboil am, you go come pound am.

Text_en: Yes?
Text_ortho: Yes?

Text_en: When you pound it, you filter it.
Text_ortho: When you pound am, you filter am.

Text_en: Then, you add your ingredients.
Text_ortho: Den you put eh your ingredient inside.

Text_en: That's how my sister taught me.
Text_ortho: Na so my teacher, my sister take teach me.

Text_en: Okay.
Text_ortho: Okay na so.

Text_en: You like...
Text_ortho: You dey like...

Text_en: You ch-... which... as in which food... like what do you eat it with?
Text_ortho: You ch-... which, as in which food, like which swallow you dey use like to eat am?

Text_en: Hey! My sister, I like...
Text_ortho: Hey my sister, I dey like...

Text_en: Is it starch or eba?
Text_ortho: Na starch, or na eba?

Text_en: I like starch a lot.
Text_ortho: I dey like starch well, well.

Text_en: Oh, good!
Text_ortho: Oh confirm!

Text_en: Starch hm, starch is what I like.
Text_ortho: Starch hm, na starch I dey like.

Text_en: haha.
Text_ortho: Hehe.

Text_en: F-... starch is what goes well with it.
Text_ortho: Na f-... na starch dey go well.

Text_en: Uh, that's what I like the most.
Text_ortho: Ehn na dat one I dey like pass.

Text_en: Okay now!
Text_ortho: Okay now!

Text_en: Alright.
Text_ortho: Toh.

Text_en: This morning, what did you eat before you came here?
Text_ortho: Dis morning, wetin you eat before you come here?

Text_en: Ah, my sister, well, I ate eba!
Text_ortho: Ah my sister o, mtschew toh I eat eba o!

Text_en: Hey eba?
Text_ortho: Hey eba?

Text_en: Hehe, why didn't you drink tea?
Text_ortho: Hehe why you no drink tea?

Text_en: Hm, my sister, I don't really like tea.
Text_ortho: Hm my sister, I no dey too like tea.

Text_en: Okay.
Text_ortho: Okay.

Text_en: Who now?
Text_ortho: Who sha?

Text_en: Swallow is what I like the most.
Text_ortho: Na swallow I like pass.

Text_en: What did you eat before you went to bed?
Text_ortho: Okay wetin you eat before you sleep for di night?

Text_en: Ah, well, my sister, I just ate a litle rice.
Text_ortho: Ah well my sister, I just take small rice.

Text_en: Okay.
Text_ortho: Okay.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: I hope the rice was tasty?
Text_ortho: Hope sey di rice sweet sha?

Text_en: It was tasty, aha!
Text_ortho: E sweet aha!

Text_en: Okay.
Text_ortho: Okay.

Text_en: So, any, any news?
Text_ortho: So, any, any news?

Text_en: Did you hear any news about this place?
Text_ortho: You hear any news for area?

Text_en: Ah! My sis-...
Text_ortho: Ah my sis-...

Text_en: Concerning this NEPA issue of ours, I heard that they said they want to come and disconnect the power tomorrow.
Text_ortho: Concerning dis our NEPA issue, I bin hear sey de say de wan come cut light tomorrow.

Text_en: My sister, that is how I heard it.
Text_ortho: My sister, na so I hear am o.

Text_en: They said, they want to come and disconnect the power tomorrow.
Text_ortho: De say de wan come cut light tomorrow.

Text_en: Please!
Text_ortho: Abeg o!

Text_en: They shouldn't come because we are tired of them!
Text_ortho: Make dese people no come o because we don tire for dem!

Text_en: Even me, I don't have money to pay.
Text_ortho: Me masef, I no even get money to pay.

Text_en: This is a problem.
Text_ortho: Hey dis one na wahala o.

Text_en: That everywhere is dry, there is no money.
Text_ortho: Dis one wey everywhere dry, no money.

Text_en: I just pray that they don't come.
Text_ortho: I just pray make dem no come.

Text_en: Ah, please!
Text_ortho: Ah abeg o!

Text_en: Don't let them come!
Text_ortho: Make dem no come!

Text_en: Because if they come, it means it's the whole area that will have their lights disconnected.
Text_ortho: Because if de come, dat means na all di whole area dem go cut deir light o.

Text_en: That's it.
Text_ortho: Na so.

Text_en: Because people don't have money.
Text_ortho: Because people no, no money.

Text_en: Because there is no money.
Text_ortho: Because no money.

Text_en: And we don't see any light.
Text_ortho: And we no dey see light.

Text_en: At all.
Text_ortho: At all!

Text_en: Please!
Text_ortho: Ah abeg kai!

Text_en: Hm NEPA should not try us.
Text_ortho: Hm meh NEPA no try us o!

Text_en: I'm not sure that they will even come.
Text_ortho: I no sure sey dem go even come sef.

Text_en: Haha.
Text_ortho: Haha.

Text_en: Ma'am, I want you and me to go to the market next market day.
Text_ortho: Madam, I wan make me, and you go market next market day.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Okay!

Text_en: Gwagwalada Market or Kwali?
Text_ortho: Gwagwalada Market, abi Kwali?

Text_en: First we'll go to Kw-...
Text_ortho: We go first go Kw-...

Text_en: What day is Kwali Market?
Text_ortho: Which day be Kwali market?

Text_en: Hm, it's tomorrow.
Text_ortho: Hm na tomorrow.

Text_en: Tomorrow?
Text_ortho: Tomorrow?

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehn!

Text_en: Ah, we'll try to go.
Text_ortho: Ah we go try go o.

Text_en: What do you want to go buy?
Text_ortho: Wetin you wan go buy now?

Text_en: There are some kind...
Text_ortho: E get some kind...

Text_en: I want to go buy my shop items.
Text_ortho: I wan go buy shop tins.

Text_en: There are some things that I need in my shop.
Text_ortho: Mtschew e get some kind tins wey I need for my shop.

Text_en: I want you and me to go.
Text_ortho: I wan make me, and you go.

Text_en: Like what?
Text_ortho: Like what?

Text_en: Like shampoo...
Text_ortho: Like shampoo.

Text_en: Because you won't see provisions there.
Text_ortho: Because you no go see provision dere o.

Text_en: It's true.
Text_ortho: Eh na true o.

Text_en: Will I see shampoo and attach?
Text_ortho: I fit see shampoo, and attach ba?

Text_en: My sister, you won't see any.
Text_ortho: My sister, you no go see o!

Text_en: It's food products they have.
Text_ortho: Na food product dey dere.

Text_en: Food products?
Text_ortho: Food product?

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: Alright.
Text_ortho: Toh.

Text_en: That means wo-...
Text_ortho: Dat means wo-...

Text_en: If we go, we'll just buy ingredients that we use to cook some dishes.
Text_ortho: If we go toh, we would just buy tins wey we go take cook some kind soup.

Text_en: Okay now.
Text_ortho: Okay now.

Text_en: When I want to go, I'll come call you.
Text_ortho: When I wan go, I go come call you.

Text_en: Okay, no problem.
Text_ortho: Okay no wahala!

Text_en: I'll be at home waiting for you.
Text_ortho: I go house dey wait you.

Text_en: No problem then.
Text_ortho: No problem now!

Text_en: Me too, let me go hustle for money so that if we go I can buy enough things.
Text_ortho: Me too, mey I go hustle for money so dat if we go, I go buy enough tins.

Text_en: No problem!
Text_ortho: No problem!

Text_en: I'll call you.
Text_ortho: I go call you.

Text_en: Okay, no problem.
Text_ortho: Okay no wahala!

Text_en: Your number that you gave me last week, it's still the number you're using, right?
Text_ortho: Dat your number wey give me last, eh last week, shebi na di number you still dey use?

Text_en: It's what I still use.
Text_ortho: Na im I still dey use.

Text_en: X sometimes, I try to call the number.
Text_ortho: X sometime, I dey try di number.

Text_en: The number doesn't connect.
Text_ortho: Di number no dey go o.

Text_en: It's the network.
Text_ortho: Ayah na network.

Text_en: Ah, this network again!
Text_ortho: Ah dis network again!

Text_en: Okay then.
Text_ortho: Okay now.

Text_en: I'll give you my number before we leave here.
Text_ortho: I go flash you with my number before we leave here.

Text_en: No problem then!
Text_ortho: No problem now!

Text_en: I'm expecting it.
Text_ortho: I dey expect am.

Text_en: What church do you go to?
Text_ortho: Which church you dey go now?

Text_en: My sister, it's CAC.
Text_ortho: My sister, na CAC.

Text_en: CAC?
Text_ortho: Cac?

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: You've left Pathfinders?
Text_ortho: You don comot for Pathfinders?

Text_en: Hm, mtschew, I've left.
Text_ortho: Hm mtschew I don comot jor.

Text_en: I go to CAC now.
Text_ortho: Dey go CAC now.

Text_en: How is the church?
Text_ortho: Eyah how di church now?

Text_en: Ah, we thank God.
Text_ortho: Ah we thank God.

Text_en: Hope that they preach well?
Text_ortho: Hope sey de dey preach well?

Text_en: Yes, they preach well.
Text_ortho: Ehn de dey preach well.

Text_en: Do you have any program?
Text_ortho: Una get any programme?

Text_en: As in any upcoming program?
Text_ortho: As in any upcoming programme?

Text_en: Uh... we have one on the third... the third uh... Friday of the month.
Text_ortho: Hm we get eh third, di third eh Friday, third Friday of di month.

Text_en: Eh.
Text_ortho: Eh.

Text_en: We are having a night vigil.
Text_ortho: We dey get night vigil.

Text_en: Okay, a night vigil?
Text_ortho: Okay night vigil?

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehn!

Text_en: Hope the vigil is exciting.
Text_ortho: Hope sey di night vigil dey hot well, well.

Text_en: Ah, my sister, it is no joke.
Text_ortho: Ah my sister, no be small tin!

Text_en: If you come, you will see.
Text_ortho: If you come, you come see.

Text_en: I'll try.
Text_ortho: I go try hm.

Text_en: I will try to come.
Text_ortho: I go try come.

Text_en: Come then!
Text_ortho: Come now!

Text_en: Me too, I'll invite you to mine.
Text_ortho: Me too, I go invite you for my own o!

Text_en: No problem!
Text_ortho: No problem!

Text_en: We have a women's program.
Text_ortho: We get women programme.

Text_en: If you come, you'll enjoy it a lot.
Text_ortho: If you come, you go enjoy am well, well.

Text_en: No problem!
Text_ortho: No problem!

Text_en: Definitely!
Text_ortho: Confirm!

Text_en: I'll come.
Text_ortho: I go come.

Text_en: They'll teach you lots of things. How to take care of your home. How to cook for your family. In fact, how to manage your home.
Text_ortho: De will teach you many tins, how to take care of your home, how to cook for your family, in fact, how to manage your home.

Text_en: Eyah!
Text_ortho: Eyah!

Text_en: And they will still teach you some things like, how to prepare some things in your house.
Text_ortho: In fact, and de will still teach you some kind tins like how to prepare some kind tins for your house.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Eyah!

Text_en: I'll come!
Text_ortho: I go come o!

Text_en: You'll enjoy it a lot.
Text_ortho: You go enjoy am well, well.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Eyah!

Text_en: I do like that type of program.
Text_ortho: I dey like dat kind programme.

Text_en: Ah, you'll enjoy it.
Text_ortho: Ah you go enjoy am.

Text_en: I will come.
Text_ortho: I go come.

Text_en: I will come.
Text_ortho: I go come.

Text_en: Let's pray for God to keep us until that day.
Text_ortho: Moh we, meh we pray meh God keep us till dat day.

Text_en: Amen, my sister.
Text_ortho: Amen o my sister!

Text_en: That's it.
Text_ortho: Na so o!

Text_en: Thank you!
Text_ortho: Thank you!

Text_en: God will help us.
Text_ortho: God go help us.

Text_en: Good morning, guys.
Text_ortho: Good morning my people.

Text_en: How are you?
Text_ortho: How una dey?

Text_en: How was your night?
Text_ortho: How your night?

Text_en: Hope you slept well.
Text_ortho: Hope sey you sleep well.

Text_en: How...
Text_ortho: How?

Text_en: My name is Charity, anyway.
Text_ortho: My name na Charity sha.

Text_en: I'm from Delta State.
Text_ortho: I from Delta State.

Text_en: I'm from Delta State, but this is where my mom and dad had me.
Text_ortho: I come from Delta State, but na here my mama, and my papa born me.

Text_en: So it's here that I... I grew up in Abuja.
Text_ortho: So na here I, I grow up for Abuja.

Text_en: And my parents, they always brought people back home.
Text_ortho: And my parents, de bin carry people home.

Text_en: They didn't take me with them when they went back home.
Text_ortho: De no dey carry me travel go home.

Text_en: I always...
Text_ortho: I dey always...

Text_en: This is where I stayed.
Text_ortho: Na here I dey.

Text_en: This is where I grew up.
Text_ortho: Na here I grow up.

Text_en: So this is where I even went to school.
Text_ortho: So na here I even go my school.

Text_en: I didn't finish, by the way, because of some kind of... I had no money.
Text_ortho: But I never finish sha, cause of some kind, no money.

Text_en: So, I am just at home.
Text_ortho: So I just dey house.

Text_en: Then I learned hairdressing.
Text_ortho: I con learn hairdressing.

Text_en: So now, I plait hair for my neighbours, and that's how I get by, how I get myself f-... get myself certain things because I don't like to disturb my mother since she doesn't have any money either.
Text_ortho: So now, I dey plait hair for my neighbours, and na dat one I take dey help mysef, take dey f-... fe-... get mysef some kind tings because I no dey like to disturb my moder because she too, she no get money.

Text_en: Everyone's working hard to get by.
Text_ortho: Everybody dey hustle.

Text_en: My dad, my father isn't here.
Text_ortho: My dad, my fader no dey here.

Text_en: He's in Benin right now, anyway.
Text_ortho: Im dey for Benin now sha.

Text_en: He works there.
Text_ortho: Na dere im dey work.

Text_en: So again, mtschew, this our, mtschew, Abuja life, it's not so easy.
Text_ortho: So and again mtschew ehn dis our mtschew Abuja life, kai e no too easy o.

Text_en: Things are difficult here now.
Text_ortho: Tings hard for here now.

Text_en: Things are difficult in Nigeria.
Text_ortho: Tings hard for Naija.

Text_en: There is no money.
Text_ortho: No money.

Text_en: People are suffering.
Text_ortho: People dey suffer.

Text_en: In fact, things are really expensive in the market.
Text_ortho: In fact, tings cost for market die.

Text_en: If you go to the market, the things you see that you would have bought last year for let's say uh... two hundred naira, now cost six hundred, seven hundred naira.
Text_ortho: If you go market, tings wey you go fit see, wey you go take, wey you go buy last year of (mah say) eh two hundred, now e don be six hundred, seven hundred.

Text_en: In fact, just to eat now, if you don't have a job, you are on your own.
Text_ortho: In fact, to even eat now, if you no dey work, you are on your own.

Text_en: You will suffer.
Text_ortho: You go suffer.

Text_en: People are hungry.
Text_ortho: Hunger dey.

Text_en: Even me I'm saying that God has helped me.
Text_ortho: Even me sef, wey I con even say God con even help me sef.

Text_en: As I was working in my salon, God helped me out.
Text_ortho: As I dey do my salon, God con help me.

Text_en: Then I was admitted.
Text_ortho: I con get admission.

Text_en: In fact, I was even crying to God, why did you get me accepted when I have no money?
Text_ortho: In fact, I con dey even cry for God sey God, why you con even give me dis admission dis time wey be sey no money?

Text_en: Uh... there is no money.
Text_ortho: Ehn no money.

Text_en: For my registration, there is no money.
Text_ortho: To do my registration, no money.

Text_en: My dad, for almost three months, almost four months now, has not been paid.
Text_ortho: My dad, for almost three month, to four month now, de never pay am.

Text_en: We're just barely getting by at home.
Text_ortho: We just dey hustle for house.

Text_en: In fact, just feeding yourself isn't easy.
Text_ortho: In fact, before we eat, e no easy.

Text_en: And now, I'm about to start university too.
Text_ortho: And now wan even resume sef.

Text_en: I don't know how my university even works.
Text_ortho: I no even know how we take even do my school.

Text_en: I was just praying for God to open some doors for me.
Text_ortho: I just dey pray meh God open door for me.

Text_en: God should help me.
Text_ortho: Meh God help me.

Text_en: And I'm just praying for this country.
Text_ortho: And I just dey pray for dis country.

Text_en: God should just make a way for this country.
Text_ortho: Meh God just open way for dis country.

Text_en: This country should go back to the way it was before.
Text_ortho: Meh dis country go back to di way e dey before.

Text_en: Because we are tired.
Text_ortho: Because we don even tire.

Text_en: How could we be in... what we say norm-... there is no money.
Text_ortho: How we go dey for wey dey say norm-... no money.

Text_en: Nothing at all.
Text_ortho: Nothing, nothing.

Text_en: Mtschew, in fact, I'm tired of this country.
Text_ortho: Mtschew in fact, dis country ma don even tire person.

Text_en: Okay, you even opened a salon to work.
Text_ortho: Okay you even open salon sey make you dey work.

Text_en: People...
Text_ortho: People...

Text_en: No money!
Text_ortho: No money.

Text_en: People... customers will come and ask for low prices.
Text_ortho: People, customers will come, de go dey price low.

Text_en: When things in the market are expensive.
Text_ortho: And tings for market cost.

Text_en: They will ask for low prices.
Text_ortho: De go dey price low.

Text_en: Some, even if you treat them well, won't pay you.
Text_ortho: Some, if you even do dem well, de no go pay.

Text_en: What?
Text_ortho: Ehn?

Text_en: Why... why...
Text_ortho: Why, why...

Text_en: What... what are we...
Text_ortho: Wetin, wetin we dey...

Text_en: Where... where are we going in this country?
Text_ortho: Where, where dis Naija dey go for dis country?

Text_en: Where are we going?
Text_ortho: Where we dey go?

Text_en: Anyway, we just need the hand of God.
Text_ortho: We just need di hand of God sha.

Text_en: We just need God to help us, because, in fact, without God's help, we don't know where we're going.
Text_ortho: We just need meh God help us, because, in fact, if God no help us, we wonder where we dey go.

Text_en: Brothers and sisters, as you hear my voice, wherever you are, whatever you're doing, you should put God first.
Text_ortho: My broders, and my sisters wey dey hear my voice, anywhere wey una dey, anyting wey una dey do, meh una put God.

Text_en: God should come first.
Text_ortho: Meh God dey first o.

Text_en: Because God, He comes first.
Text_ortho: Because God, na im dey first.

Text_en: Without God, you're on your own, because if not, if you don't have God, you'll suffer.
Text_ortho: Without God, you are on your own because if not, if you don't have God, you go suffer.

Text_en: You'll suffer.
Text_ortho: You go suffer.

Text_en: Also, whatever you do, make sure you work hard.
Text_ortho: And anyting you dey do again, make sure you dey hardworking.

Text_en: If you work hard, you will not go hungry, you won't know hunger.
Text_ortho: If you dey hardworking, hunger no go meet you, hunger no go near you, hunger no go come where you dey.

Text_en: Well, what happened to me before, what happened to me before which I remember and can't forget, and which in fact was God... it's God, He is the one who did it, it is my school stuff... it's my school.
Text_ortho: Ehn wetin dey happen for me before, wetin don happen to me before wey I know sey kai, I no fit forget am, and in fact, na God, na God na im even do dat one be sey na my school stuff, na my school.

Text_en: Because as I was doing my hairdressing and taking the JAMB, I wasn't failing but I wasn't going to get in either.
Text_ortho: Because as I dey do dis hairdressing, and I dey write JAMB, no be sey I no dey pass am, but I no dey get admission.

Text_en: I prayed.
Text_ortho: I don pray.

Text_en: Mtschew, but in fact, it got to a time when... I just took my mind away from it saying maybe God doesn't want me to go to school again, or I'm not meant to go to school.
Text_ortho: Mtschew but in fact, e con even get time wey be sey I come, I just comot my mind, be sey maybe God no wan mah go school again, or be sey I no dey favour to go school.

Text_en: So, then the last time I sat for JAMB... the last time I wrote JAMB, I didn't get in.
Text_ortho: So now, di last time wey I write JAMB, di last time wey I write JAMB, I no get admission.

Text_en: I waited and waited.
Text_ortho: I wait, wait, wait, wait, wait.

Text_en: All the schools had started classes.
Text_ortho: For all di whole schools, de don start lectures.

Text_en: I was at home.
Text_ortho: And me, I dey house.

Text_en: Everyday, I was thinking.
Text_ortho: Everyday, I go dey tink.

Text_en: Why didn't I get in?
Text_ortho: Why me, I no get admission now?

Text_en: What is all this?
Text_ortho: Wetin be all dese tings?

Text_en: Mtschew, that was when I said well, let me just forget about it.
Text_ortho: Mtschew naim I say toh mah just kuma forget about am now.

Text_en: I even went to look for a job.
Text_ortho: Now I even go look for work.

Text_en: As I looked for a job, I was working then, the day I had worked for exactly two weeks, because everybody I had... who... everybody who promised me they would help me for my admission, they told me not to worry, not to worry
Text_ortho: As I look for work, I con dey work di day wey I complete two weeks because everybody wey I don, wey, everybody wey promise me sey de go help me for my admission, de tell me sey mah no worry, mah no worry.

Text_en: They would...
Text_ortho: De would...

Text_en: By any means, they would definitely help me.
Text_ortho: Any means, de go help me, de go help me.

Text_en: School started, lectures started, no news, nothing at all.
Text_ortho: School start, lecture start, no news, noting, noting.

Text_en: I said, well, maybe I won't get in...
Text_ortho: I say toh maybe I no go get admission dis...

Text_en: In fact, I'll forget about school.
Text_ortho: In fact, I go forget about dis school.

Text_en: I won't take the JAMB again.
Text_ortho: I no go write JAMB again.

Text_en: Let me just do my work.
Text_ortho: Mah just face work, my work.

Text_en: Let me just keep doing my work at home.
Text_ortho: Mah dey do my work for house.

Text_en: For God who loves me, I didn't know if God still liked me.
Text_ortho: For God wey like me, I no know sey God still like me.

Text_en: The day I finished two weeks at the shop I was working at, I got a call, an unexpected call from an unexpected person.
Text_ortho: Di day wey I complete two weeks for my shop where I dey do my work, na so I just receive call, unexpected call from unexpected person.

Text_en: They said "hello, is this Charity, is this Charity I am speaking to?"
Text_ortho: De say hello, na Charity dey, na Charity I dey speak to?

Text_en: I said yes.
Text_ortho: I say yes.

Text_en: They said, "please, come to the school right now, come and get your admission letter, you've been accepted."
Text_ortho: E say abeg come school now, now, now, now, now, now, come collect your admission letter, you don get admission.

Text_en: Ha, I said "me, how come?"
Text_ortho: Aha I say me, how comes?

Text_en: They said "hurry up and come, you could even start classes today, really."
Text_ortho: De say do fast, and come, you go fit even start lecture today, today sef.

Text_en: That was how I just...
Text_ortho: Na so I just...

Text_en: My boss wo..., my boss I was working with, he was just happy for me that... wow!
Text_ortho: My oga wo-... my oga wey me, and him, we dey work togeder, e just dey happy for me sey aha.

Text_en: He even gave me the transport fare saying I should go to school right away.
Text_ortho: E even give me transport, say oya go school, go school.

Text_en: When I got to school, you can't imagine the line to get the admission letter.
Text_ortho: When I go school, di place sey de dey even dey collect di admission letter sef, see queue!

Text_en: I was there wondering "How will I even get this admission letter?"
Text_ortho: I con dey eh how I go take even collect dis admission letter?

Text_en: Even if I wanted to get the admission letter, I wouldn't be able to today!
Text_ortho: If I wan even collect dis admission letter, I no fit collect am today o!

Text_en: Mtschew!
Text_ortho: Mtschew!

Text_en: But I said well, first let me go see the person who asked me to come.
Text_ortho: But I say toh mah go first, mah go di person wey call me sey mah come.

Text_en: So I went to her office.
Text_ortho: I con go her office.

Text_en: Then she said "Oh, Charity, I have been looking for your number!
Text_ortho: She con say see o Charity, I don dey look for your number since!

Text_en: Thank God you came today!
Text_ortho: Tank God sey you don come today!

Text_en: In fact, you have have been admitted.
Text_ortho: In fact, you don get admission.

Text_en: Okay, sit down in my office, sit down in this chair.
Text_ortho: Okay sit down for my office, sit down for dis chair.

Text_en: Make yourself comfortable.
Text_ortho: Make yoursef comfortable o.

Text_en: I will give you whatever you need.
Text_ortho: Anyting you want, I go give you.

Text_en: Let me go and get your admission letter for you."
Text_ortho: Mah go hustle for your admission letter for you.

Text_en: This woman just went... went to the place where they were getting the admission letters.
Text_ortho: Dis woman just go, go di place sey de dey collect admission letter.

Text_en: She did everything for me.
Text_ortho: She do everyting for me.

Text_en: Got my admission letter and brought it to me.
Text_ortho: Collect my admission letter, con give me for where I dey.

Text_en: She even got the receipt for my school fees which would have been a pain to get.
Text_ortho: Even collect receipt for my school fees wey even before even collect di receipt for dat school, you go suffer.

Text_en: You could wait in line for a week and still not get your receipt.
Text_ortho: You fit even dey for queue for one week, you no go collect receipt.

Text_en: But this woman went and got my admissions letter for me, got my receipt for me and brought them back to me like I was the president's kid.
Text_ortho: But dis woman collect my admission letter for me, collect my receipt for me, con give me for hand like sey me, I be president pikin.

Text_en: She brought them over and said "take your admission letter, take your receipt, you can go pay your school fees, you can even got to class today. Go and check your timetable, maybe you have a lecture now you can attend".
Text_ortho: She con give me sey take your admission letter, take your receipt, you fit go pay your school fees, you fit even receive lecture today, go check your timetable, maybe you fit get lecture now meh receive.

Text_en: I just said "oh, God, this God is too wonderful ah."
Text_ortho: I just say oh God, dis God is too wonderful ah.

Text_en: I don't even know how I can thank God.
Text_ortho: I no even know how I want take even tank God.

Text_en: In fact, this thing God did for me, I am not sure I could ever in my life be able to forget it.
Text_ortho: In fact, dis ting wey God do for me, I no sure sey I go fit ever for my life forget am again.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: I just...
Text_ortho: I just...

Text_en: When I just finished uh... taking my SSCE exam, so, when I finished taking my SSCE, I was there looking for a job, uh...
Text_ortho: When I just finish eh writing my SSCE, so when I finish writing my SSCE here, I dey dey look for job, dey...

Text_en: After I finished that SSCE, I was looking for some menial job to do.
Text_ortho: After I finish eh dat SSCE, dey look wheder I go get some menial job to do mtschew.

Text_en: So, I started uh...
Text_ortho: So I started eh...

Text_en: Sometimes, I joined some people working on construction sites and helped them.
Text_ortho: At times, I go too follow some people dey go site, dey do dis labourer work, dey carry help am.

Text_en: I now...
Text_ortho: I con...

Text_en: One day, I thought to myself, man.
Text_ortho: One day, I con tink for myself o mehn.

Text_en: This isn't what you do if you wanna get somewhere in life.
Text_ortho: Dis tin no be di tin wey person go carry become human being for life o.

Text_en: Because this isn't skilled labor.
Text_ortho: Because dis tin no be, no be, no be handwork.

Text_en: Then, I called one of my older brothers who was in Lagos at the time.
Text_ortho: Naim I call one of my elder broder wey dey Lagos dat time.

Text_en: I told him, "man is it good to be a skilled worker."
Text_ortho: I tell am sey oh boy, man, e dey good meh person dey get just handwork.

Text_en: Sometimes you can...
Text_ortho: At times, make...

Text_en: If someone...
Text_ortho: If somebody...

Text_en: If you're a skilled worker, you can still use that to get by if school doesn't work out.
Text_ortho: Dat handwork, if di school no work out, at least, we go carry dat one dey patch up life.

Text_en: So, he told me OK, go find somewhere you can pick up a skill.
Text_ortho: So e con tell me sey okay make I go make en-... enquiry where, any place wey I go fit learn di work.

Text_en: So, I arrived, I started going up and down the streets of Gwagwalada looking for something to do, so I could maybe learn the skills.
Text_ortho: So I reach, I start to dey waka di whole street of Gwagwalada dey find where I go make tins, wheder I go learn di work.

Text_en: So, any place I went, they would ask me for a lot of money. Wherever I went, they would ask me for a lot of money.
Text_ortho: So any place where I go, dem go call big money for me, any place where I go, de go call big money for me.

Text_en: So, I went to a place.
Text_ortho: So I come go one place.

Text_en: That's when I met the man.
Text_ortho: So naim I meet di man.

Text_en: I talked with him.
Text_ortho: I follow di man talk.

Text_en: I told him "oga, this your luck, uh... work, I like it, I want to know more about it."
Text_ortho: Tell am sey Oga, dis your luck, eh work o, I like am, I wan sabi am.

Text_en: He asked if I wanted to learn it.
Text_ortho: E say I wan sabi am?

Text_en: I said yes.
Text_ortho: I say yes.

Text_en: He said OK.
Text_ortho: E say okay.

Text_en: So what now?
Text_ortho: How we go do now?

Text_en: I told him "me, I want to learn it."
Text_ortho: I tell am sey me, I wan sabi am.

Text_en: I want to know uh... our agreement.
Text_ortho: How, I wan know e, di agreement wey e go carry.

Text_en: Uh... how much he'll take to teach me his job.
Text_ortho: Ehn how much wey e go carry teach me dis work.

Text_en: So he said "OK, no problem."
Text_ortho: E con say, okay no problem!

Text_en: He'd teach me his job for about ten thousand naira.
Text_ortho: Dat di amount wey e go carry teach me dis work, na about ten thousand naira.

Text_en: I said "OK, no problem."
Text_ortho: I say okay no problem!

Text_en: I went to call my people.
Text_ortho: I go call my people.

Text_en: "Let's sign, OK?"
Text_ortho: We sign abi?

Text_en: He said I should bring malta, or soft drinks and cookies, which I did.
Text_ortho: E say I go bring malta, or mineral and biscuit, which I give am.

Text_en: So, at the end of the day, I started learning the work.
Text_ortho: So at di end of di day, I start to dey learn di work.

Text_en: I spent a year and six months learning the job.
Text_ortho: When I learn di work, I learn di work a year, and six month.

Text_en: After I learned the job for a year and six months, I realized I'd mastered it.
Text_ortho: After I learn di work a year, and six month, I see sey I don sabi di work.

Text_en: I then called him, Oga, and said what you're gonna do now is let me go.
Text_ortho: I come call am Oga, di tin wey you go do be sey, now be sey you go free me o.

Text_en: At least, I should also be independent like you, who's feeding your own family.
Text_ortho: At least, meh me too become man of myself as you kuma become man of youself dey feed your own family.

Text_en: He said OK, no problem since the, the, my time with you has, has, has finished, he will let me go with some money.
Text_ortho: E say okay no problem, dat since de, di, my time with you don, don, don do, sey e go settle me.

Text_en: So I kept working for him for like two or three months before he let me go, so that makes a year and eight months.
Text_ortho: So I come serve am for some two, or three months before e come settle me making a year, and s-... eight months.

Text_en: Uh... so a year and uh... nine mon-, uh... ten months.
Text_ortho: Eh making a year, and eh nine mon-... eh ten months.

Text_en: So, when I se-, he let me go with some money, I started to hustle on my own, going from one site to another.
Text_ortho: So when I se-... e settle, e settle me, I start to dey hustle my own sef dey go site to site.

Text_en: Even as I was going to different sites, I thought that, man, as soon as you finished learning the job, you'd be a millionaire.
Text_ortho: Upon sey I dey go site to site, me, I tink sey mehn na when you just learn dis our work, you go don become millionaire.

Text_en: I didn't know that when you learn this work, hehe, you can forget about that!
Text_ortho: I no know sey when you learn di work sef, hehe comot sef.

Text_en: That's when you find out that no, no, no, life's no piece of cake.
Text_ortho: Na dere you go know sey dis, dis life ni, dis life no, no, no be small tin.

Text_en: So, that was how I started hustling to get by.
Text_ortho: So na so I start to dey hustle o.

Text_en: I was going from one site to the next, telling them, giving them my business card.
Text_ortho: I go go site to site dey tell dem, dey give dem my complimentary card.

Text_en: Uh... I'm an aluminum technician.
Text_ortho: Ah I be aluminium technician.

Text_en: I do this, I design these windows.
Text_ortho: I dey do dis one, I dey design dis window.

Text_en: I know how to design these windows.
Text_ortho: I sabi design dis window.

Text_en: I do this uh, uh... sliding net, case, casement, open and swing doors.
Text_ortho: I dey do dis eh eh sliding net, and, and case, casement open, and swing door.

Text_en: They'd say OK, no problem.
Text_ortho: Dem go say okay no problem!

Text_en: Life in our line of work isn't... it's not easy.
Text_ortho: Life for dis our work, no, e no dey easy o.

Text_en: So, the first time there was a contract that I got, that they...
Text_ortho: So di first time I get one contract wey I hit wey dem...

Text_en: Somebody just called me.
Text_ortho: Somebody just call me.

Text_en: It was my friend's dad.
Text_ortho: Na my friend papa.

Text_en: As he called me, thinking he would help me out, I billed him almost sixty thousand naira for a work worth a hundred thousand because I needed the money.
Text_ortho: As e call me, thinking maybe as e go help me do sometin, I charge am work say I go do di work almost sixty thousand naira for am (work wey dem dey do hundred thousand) because of hungry.

Text_en: I said "OK, give me sixty thousand naira."
Text_ortho: I say okay bring sixty thousand naira.

Text_en: Eventually, he gave me forty thousand naira.
Text_ortho: To di extend, e give me forty thousand naira.

Text_en: I bought a lot of materials.
Text_ortho: I buy material, buy material.

Text_en: Eventually, I finished the work.
Text_ortho: To di extend, I do di work.

Text_en: There was twenty thousand naira left.
Text_ortho: Remaining twenty thousand naira.

Text_en: The...
Text_ortho: Di...

Text_en: When the guy saw that I had done the work, he refused to pay up.
Text_ortho: When di man don see sey I don do di work finish, di man swallow di money.

Text_en: So, I thought about it, well.
Text_ortho: So I look am toh.

Text_en: This guy is my friend's father, you know.
Text_ortho: Dis one na my friend fader now.

Text_en: What can I do?
Text_ortho: Wetin I go do?

Text_en: I couldn't face, face him and stand up to him.
Text_ortho: I no go fit follow, follow am go di highest talk.

Text_en: I forgot about it.
Text_ortho: I look am.

Text_en: As time went on, I was still there, hustling on different sites.
Text_ortho: As time goes on, I dey dere dey hustle to site, to site, to site, to site.

Text_en: If I saw a small job to do, I took it.
Text_ortho: I go see small work, I go do.

Text_en: At times, I'd do jobs in the area, in the area, that weren't even in my field, just to put food on the table and get by in life.
Text_ortho: At times, di work wey no be my own work sef I go, I go enter am do am in area, in di area to get wetin man go put for bele, wetin man go just carry dey survive, patch up dis life.

Text_en: Because I know life isn't easy.
Text_ortho: Because I see sey dis life, e no dey easy.

Text_en: So when man... when God created huma-, man... as men, we have a lot of things to face. We have a heavy cross to bear.
Text_ortho: Hence man don, God don create man become huma-... man, we get a lot of tins to face, we get a lot of cross to carry.

Text_en: So, that's it.
Text_ortho: So na im o.

Text_en: So much that even last year, when they called me for a job, I did it.
Text_ortho: To di extend sef, even last year sef, where de call me for work, I do di work.

Text_en: When I finished the job, the guy told me there were some problems with the work I did.
Text_ortho: When I do di work finish, di man come tell me sey dat di work wey I do for am, e dey, e get some problem.

Text_en: So much that he wanted to get out of paying me.
Text_ortho: To di extend, e wan carry style swallow di money.

Text_en: I called him.
Text_ortho: I call am.

Text_en: Oga, there's no, no problem with the work.
Text_ortho: Oga, di work no do some, no get problem.

Text_en: Call uh... some aluminium technicians now, let them take a look.
Text_ortho: Call eh some aluminium technicians now meh dem view di tin.

Text_en: Eventually, he went and called some aluminium technicians behind my back.
Text_ortho: To extend sef, e go call some aluminium technician on my back.

Text_en: They told him there were no problems with the work.
Text_ortho: Con tell sey Oga, dis work no get problem.

Text_en: So later on he admitted that the work was fine.
Text_ortho: So na later e con dey confess to me sey di work no get problem.

Text_en: So later, he paid me my money.
Text_ortho: So later, e con pay me my money.

Text_en: That's the money I used to do something for myself.
Text_ortho: Na dat money I come carry do sometin for mysef.

Text_en: I put some on...
Text_ortho: Put some on...

Text_en: So that that even recently, one of my friends handed one of his sites over for me to manage.
Text_ortho: To di extend sef, even recently now sef, e get one of my friend wey don handle one of im site sef for me make I dey manage.

Text_en: So the site, I'm mana-... I'm managing it.
Text_ortho: So di site sef, I dey mana-... I dey manage di site.

Text_en: To the extent again that I've just become become the site engineer, supervising the building.
Text_ortho: To di extend sef, na me just become engineer for di site, dey supervise di building.

Text_en: And I know that, when the time comes, at least, he will give those, those aw-, ar-, ar-, windows to me.
Text_ortho: And I know sey when time come, at least, e go throw dat, dat aw-... ar-... ar-... windows for me.

Text_en: I will do them.
Text_ortho: I go do am.

Text_en: I will do them.
Text_ortho: I go do am.

Text_en: I will survive.
Text_ortho: I go survive.

Text_en: That's it.
Text_ortho: Na im.

Text_en: In this life, becoming a man isn't easy.
Text_ortho: Dis life, to become man, e no dey easy.

Text_en: So one of the interesting things about journalism is that they say, they say that even when you have issues you want to discuss, people's attitude can bring out another issue which can lead to another story entirely.
Text_ortho: So dat na some of di interesting part about journalism wey be sey as in de dey talk sey dem say even when you get issue wey you wan discuss, people attitude fit bring out anoda issue wey fit lead to anoda story entirely.

Text_en: So, okay, uh... I remember the time the Americans wanted to hold their election.
Text_ortho: So okay em I remember di time wey America be wan do election.

Text_en: That was two thousand and eight, that time they wanted...
Text_ortho: Dat na two thousand, and eight dat time wey dem go wan...

Text_en: Obama ran.
Text_ortho: Obama im contest.

Text_en: And fortunately, I was one of the journalists that went to cover what happened there.
Text_ortho: And fortunately, I be one of di journalist wey go cover wetin dey happen for dere.

Text_en: So, as I travelled, I started uh... I started to interview one, two, three people.
Text_ortho: So as I travel now, I begin, hehe I begin interview one, two, three people.

Text_en: And I noticed the issue everybody was discussing was Obama, Obama.
Text_ortho: And I notice sey di issue wey everybody dey discuss, Obama, Obama.

Text_en: The young people, that time, everybody I spoke with, (whether white, black, or Asian), everyone was talking about Obama.
Text_ortho: Di young people, dat time, eveybody wey I talk, weda na white, weda na black, weda na Asian, everybody Obama.

Text_en: But the old folks weren't interested.
Text_ortho: But di old people no dey interested.

Text_en: And I wondered why.
Text_ortho: And I bin even wonder like why?

Text_en: Why aren't you interested.
Text_ortho: Why una no dey interested?

Text_en: Because they said...
Text_ortho: Because de say...

Text_en: There was an old man I asked, he said it would... it wouldn't make any difference.
Text_ortho: E get one old man wey I bin ask, e say e go, e no go make any difference.

Text_en: That is is just normal excitement.
Text_ortho: Sey na just normal jumpy, jumpy.

Text_en: Everybody is just happy.
Text_ortho: Sey everybody just dey happy.

Text_en: That well, a new person, a black man, and all that!
Text_ortho: Sey oh new person, black man, and all dose tings!

Text_en: But at the end of the day, it's like most of the old people were just not interested.
Text_ortho: But at di end of di day, e be like sey most of di old people no just get interest.

Text_en: Because they said mstchew, we have done this kind... this kind of thing before.
Text_ortho: Cos de feel say mtschew look we don do dis kind, kind tin before.

Text_en: That's how it is.
Text_ortho: Na so e be.

Text_en: A new person will come, everybody will be shouting hey hey hosanna but when things get serious nothing will change.
Text_ortho: New person go come, everybody go dey shout hey hey hey hosanna, but when matter con be matter, everyting go remain di same.

Text_en: So, I just saw at that time, a lot of young people were interested.
Text_ortho: So I just see sey dat time, a lot of young people dey get interest.

Text_en: I went to New York, I went to uh... Texas, I went to Washington.
Text_ortho: I go New York, I go eh Texas, I go Washington.

Text_en: Most of the young people in America at that time, they wanted to vote.
Text_ortho: Most of di young people wey dey America dat time, de wan vote.

Text_en: Many of them, had never voted in their life.
Text_ortho: Many of dem, de never vote for deir life before.

Text_en: So to them, it was an interesting opportunity.
Text_ortho: So to dem, na interesting opportunity.

Text_en: It was the first time.
Text_ortho: Na di first time.

Text_en: And many of them who voted that time, did it because of the internet.
Text_ortho: And many of dem wey vote dat time, na because of internet.

Text_en: It was the internet that gi-... brin-... motivated them to vote.
Text_ortho: Na internet gi-... brin-... ginger dem make dem go vote.

Text_en: Because before, many of them, you know it was on TV, radio, everybody was talking but that time when Obama came, he started this idea of a Facebook campaign.
Text_ortho: Because before now, many of dem, you know sey na for TV, radio everybody dey talk, but Obama dat time wen e come, na im start dis idea of Facebook campaign.

Text_en: Vote for me, donate for me, support me.
Text_ortho: Vote for me, donate money, support me.

Text_en: Everybody, young people, high school students, people who are just entering university, polytechnic.
Text_ortho: Na everybody, young people, secondary school student, people wey just dey enter university, poly.

Text_en: Everybody got together.
Text_ortho: Everybody gather.

Text_en: They gave him the votes.
Text_ortho: Na dem give am di vote.

Text_en: So, it was at that time that I realized social media was a powerful tool.
Text_ortho: So na dat time I con know sey social media, na powerful tool.

Text_en: And it is one of those things that hepled the guy win the election.
Text_ortho: And na one of di tings wey help dat guy win election.

Text_en: As we can see now, everywhere we go, social media is powerful.
Text_ortho: And now, as we see now, everywhere wey we dey go now, social media dey powerful.

Text_en: Even if you look, yesterday, on social media, Facebook, the main thing everybody was talking about was DNA.
Text_ortho: Even if you, if you be observe, yesterday, for social media, Facebook, di main ting wey everybody dey talk about, na DNA.

Text_en: DNA.
Text_ortho: Dna.

Text_en: I dont know who started that discussion.
Text_ortho: A no know who start dat discussion.

Text_en: Until this morning, everybody was talking about it.
Text_ortho: But up till dis morning, everybody don dey talk about am.

Text_en: Because...
Text_ortho: Because...

Text_en: I then asked what started that discussion.
Text_ortho: I con ask okay wetin start dat discussion?

Text_en: They said it was because a guy discovered the four children he had, were not his.
Text_ortho: Dem say na because one guy con discover sey di four children wey im get no be im own.

Text_en: Those children however, had already become adults.
Text_ortho: And dose children, de don already become adult.

Text_en: So, the debate started.
Text_ortho: So di debate con start.

Text_en: Everybody!
Text_ortho: Everybody o!

Text_en: Some, some people are asking if it is good for a man to have, to go test his children?
Text_ortho: Some, some people dey ask e good make man get, go test im children?

Text_en: Should he... should he... should he confirm that those children are his?
Text_ortho: Make e, meh e, meh e be sey na im get dose children?

Text_en: Some people say it's unAfrican.
Text_ortho: Some people say na un-African.

Text_en: Don't do that kind of thing!
Text_ortho: No dey do dat kind tin!

Text_en: It is... it... it... it's not in our culture.
Text_ortho: Dat it is, e, e, e no dey our culture.

Text_en: Some people say "Why? Why can't we do it?"
Text_ortho: Some people say why, why we no fit do?

Text_en: So, social media is a very powerful tool that can make or break anybody.
Text_ortho: So, social media, na very powerful tool wey fit make, or break anybody.

Text_en: I was staying with my mother in the village.
Text_ortho: I dey stay with my moder, for village.

Text_en: So we always went to the farm.
Text_ortho: So we dey go farm.

Text_en: So we...
Text_ortho: So we dey...

Text_en: As we went to the farm, we'd been staying on the farm for a long time.
Text_ortho: As we dey go farm now, we don dey tay for farm.

Text_en: So, there's one of our brothers... one of our...
Text_ortho: So e get one of our broder, one of our...

Text_en: Because I never met my father, my father had died.
Text_ortho: Because I no meet my fader, my fader don die.

Text_en: Before I grew up, my father had died, I didn't meet him.
Text_ortho: Before I grow up, my fader don die, I no meet am.

Text_en: So there are five of us in our family.
Text_ortho: So we be five for family.

Text_en: Before I grew up, my father had died.
Text_ortho: Before I grow up, my fader don die.

Text_en: So there, one of our paternal uncles, he was the one we were helping go, go to the farm.
Text_ortho: So dere, one of our fader broder, na im we dey help dey, dey go farm.

Text_en: When we helped him with the work, he would, would pay us.
Text_ortho: If we dey help am dey work, e go dey, dey pay us money.

Text_en: So that was how we were working.
Text_ortho: So na so we dey work o.

Text_en: I was working.
Text_ortho: I con dey work.

Text_en: I was gathering money, little by little.
Text_ortho: I con dey gader small, small money.

Text_en: As we were gathering money, little by little, then we said, "well, okay, we've gathered enough money."
Text_ortho: As we dey gader small, small money now, naim we con say toh okay we don gader money reach.

Text_en: "Let's try to put..."
Text_ortho: Moh we try put...

Text_en: "If it's our older brother, let's put him in school."
Text_ortho: If na our senior broder, moh we put am for school.

Text_en: "Let him go to school."
Text_ortho: Meh dat one dey go school.

Text_en: So if we put him in school, he was not...
Text_ortho: So if we put dat one for school, dat one no dey...

Text_en: He didn't agree to go to school, he would run away from school.
Text_ortho: E no go gree go school, e go run comot for school.

Text_en: He would come back to stay home.
Text_ortho: E go con stay house.

Text_en: So, that was how my mother did, did it.
Text_ortho: So na so my moder do, do o.

Text_en: One of our maternal aunts who was in town, who was in Edo, she said we should come, we should pack our things and come meet her.
Text_ortho: One of our moder sister wey dey town, meh dey for Edo, e con say moh we con, moh we pack our tings con meet am.

Text_en: Then all of us packed and went.
Text_ortho: All of us con pack go.

Text_en: So, that woman's place was where we were staying.
Text_ortho: So na dat woman na im we con dey stay.

Text_en: So none of us were going to school.
Text_ortho: So all of us, no dey go school.

Text_en: So, for me, it was second hand clothes I was selling.
Text_ortho: So me for inside, na Okirika I dey sell for market.

Text_en: We went to sell second hand clothes, we went to carry loads.
Text_ortho: We dey go sell Okirika, we dey go pack load.

Text_en: We would pack uh... second hand clothes in the market.
Text_ortho: We go pack eh okririka for market.

Text_en: All those people who carry bags of rice, that was where we brought it in the market.
Text_ortho: All dose people wey dey carry bag of rice, na dere na im we dey go pack for market.

Text_en: So, I was saving money.
Text_ortho: So I con dey gader money.

Text_en: Then I said I should use it to go to Abuja, to start schooling.
Text_ortho: Mah con say meh I take come Abuja, mah I take come start school.

Text_en: So, as I was saving the money, my sis... our older brother, he didn't listen to anyone.
Text_ortho: So now as I dey gader di money now, dat my sis, dat our senior broder, im no dey hear word.

Text_en: He was involved in a fight.
Text_ortho: Na so fight im dey fight.

Text_en: So as he was... he went to fight, his... (I don't know where he went to fight at a party), his hand was wounded.
Text_ortho: So as e con dey, e con go dey fight, de con (I no know where e for go fight for party), de con cut im hand.

Text_en: One of his hands was wounded.
Text_ortho: De con cut one of im hand.

Text_en: So, there was only one hand he could use.
Text_ortho: So na only dat one hand na im e con take dey use.

Text_en: So, he wasn't... he wasn't able to do anything.
Text_ortho: So im no, im no con fit dey do anyting.

Text_en: He just turned into a liability.
Text_ortho: Im just con turn to liability.

Text_en: So, he was just staying in the house.
Text_ortho: So na house na im e dey stay.

Text_en: Any money we made from work, any money anybody worked for, some would go to carrying second hand clothes.
Text_ortho: Any money meh we work, any money meh anybody go work some go go carry okririka.

Text_en: We would go work and come give them there.
Text_ortho: Na dere we go work, con carry give am.

Text_en: That was how we were doing.
Text_ortho: So na so we dey do o.

Text_en: We kept going.
Text_ortho: We con dey do.

Text_en: Then I said, "well, let me get a little something together and come to Abuja, to start learning, whether a trade or in school."
Text_ortho: I con say toh make I gader small, make I come Abuja, make I con start to dey learn if na work I wan go, or na school.

Text_en: That was how we started schooling.
Text_ortho: Na so we con dey do di school.

Text_en: From there, I came here.
Text_ortho: A-... as I dey dere, I con come here.

Text_en: One of my uh... my... our cousin's brother put me in JSS One.
Text_ortho: One of my eh, my, our cousin broder con put me for JSS One.

Text_en: So I continued on.
Text_ortho: Ah na so I dey do o.

Text_en: Mstchew, the school didn't... the school didn't go well with my...
Text_ortho: Mtschew di school no, di school no enter my...

Text_en: As in, anything they taught me, I just didn't...
Text_ortho: As in, as anyting wey dem dey teach me, I no just...

Text_en: It's not school.
Text_ortho: No be school.

Text_en: I didn't... I just didn't want to go to school.
Text_ortho: I no, I no wan just go school.

Text_en: So that was how we were.
Text_ortho: So na so we dey o.

Text_en: We were there, we were getting by.
Text_ortho: We con dey, we con dey manage.

Text_en: Like if he forced me to go to school, I wouldn't go.
Text_ortho: Like if e pursue me go school, I no go go.

Text_en: So, one day, one of my friends told me that this school that they kept forcing me to go to, if I didn't want to learn, if I didn't want to go to school, I didn't have to.
Text_ortho: So one day, one of my friend con tell me sey toh dis school meh de dey pursue me dey go so, if I no learn am, if I no wan go school, no be by force.

Text_en: I should leave there and we should go work.
Text_ortho: Make I comot for dere, moh we go work.

Text_en: Then I said, "well, okay, let's go work."
Text_ortho: I con say toh okay moh we go work.

Text_en: Then we went to where they do aluminum.
Text_ortho: We con go where de for dey do dis aluminium.

Text_en: It was a shop.
Text_ortho: Na e shop.

Text_en: We went to that place.
Text_ortho: Con go dat place.

Text_en: I went to that place.
Text_ortho: I go go dat place.

Text_en: The guy... the guy had lots... the guy had almo-... about sixteen boys, and the place was really big.
Text_ortho: Di man, di man too get, di man get almo-... about sixteen boys, and di place na mighty.

Text_en: I was older than all of them, but they would be sending me to go...
Text_ortho: And I senior all of dem o, but as in de go dey send me go...

Text_en: Where they sent me to pack tools, the place was really far.
Text_ortho: Na where de dey send me go go pack tools, di place too far.

Text_en: Then I said I wasn't going to keep going.
Text_ortho: Naim I talk sey I no do again.

Text_en: So I left.
Text_ortho: Naim I comot for dere.

Text_en: So, then they took me to a tailor.
Text_ortho: So de con carry me go tailor.

Text_en: To a tailor's shop again, where I was... where I would learn tailoring.
Text_ortho: Con go tailor shop again where I dey, where I for do tailor.

Text_en: The man... it was men's clothes I wanted to learn, but he only sewed women's clothes.
Text_ortho: Di man, na man cloth I wan learn, but na only woman cloth na im e dey sew.

Text_en: So then I said, "well, I can't be sewing women's clothes."
Text_ortho: So me, I con say toh me, I no fit dey do woman cloth.

Text_en: Then I said, "well, let me leave."
Text_ortho: Naim I con say toh mah go comot.

Text_en: So, I wanted to go and learn carpentry.
Text_ortho: So I wan go learn carpenter.

Text_en: So, it was carpentry I was learning.
Text_ortho: So na carpenter na im I con dey learn.

Text_en: As I was learning carpentry, I was beginning to grasp... I was understanding little by little.
Text_ortho: As I con dey learn carpenter, I don dey sabi, I don dey sabi small, small.

Text_en: So, they called me from the village saying that my mother was sick.
Text_ortho: So de con call me for village say my moder no well.

Text_en: They called us from the village saying that our mother was sick.
Text_ortho: De con call us for village sey our moder no well.

Text_en: Then we said "well, since she's sick, what will we do?"
Text_ortho: We con say toh okay as e no well now, wetin we go do?

Text_en: Then we said "well, all the money we've saved, we should bring it to her."
Text_ortho: We con say toh all money meh we don save, meh we carry am con give am.

Text_en: So that was what we did.
Text_ortho: So na so we dey do.

Text_en: Then we hustled, got money and went to give it to her.
Text_ortho: Con dey hustle, con hustle money go give am.

Text_en: So then they, they operated on her.
Text_ortho: So de con s-... de con do operation for am.

Text_en: It was fibroid she had.
Text_ortho: Na fibroid na im de do am.

Text_en: So then they operated on her.
Text_ortho: So de con do operation for am.

Text_en: Then they... we were at home, then they...
Text_ortho: De con, we con dey house, de con...

Text_en: On Easter Sunday, it was exactly on Easter Sunday, they called us saying we should come to the village.
Text_ortho: Easter day, na on Easter day gangan na im de con call us sey moh we dey come village o.

Text_en: Our mother had died.
Text_ortho: Sey our moder don die o.

Text_en: So all of us packed our things and went to the village.
Text_ortho: Na so all of us pack oursef go village.

Text_en: Then we saw that our mother had indeed died.
Text_ortho: We con meet am say our moder don die.

Text_en: So that was it.
Text_ortho: So na so dey do.

Text_en: Before we did, mo-... there wasn't even money for the burial.
Text_ortho: Before we do, mo-... no money to even do burial sef.

Text_en: It was just...
Text_ortho: Na just...

Text_en: It was because my mother's church...
Text_ortho: Na because my moder church...

Text_en: Since she was a women's leader in their church, they did everything.
Text_ortho: As in na women leader for deir church, so na church na im even do everyting.

Text_en: They were... they were the ones who bought the coffin, they did everything.
Text_ortho: Na im, na im buy coffin, na dem do everyting.

Text_en: So that was how we left.
Text_ortho: So na so we take comot.

Text_en: As I got to town, I was working.
Text_ortho: As I con reach town, na so I con dey work o.

Text_en: The person I was working with, if I... if we went to work, I would be the one to do the work.
Text_ortho: Person meh I follow dey work, if I, if we go do work, na me go go do di work o.

Text_en: He would...
Text_ortho: Im go...

Text_en: Before I went, he would go... he would go behind me to collect the money, he would spend everything, he would say they hadn't paid him.
Text_ortho: Before I go, e go go, e go follow my back collect money, e go chop everyting, e go talk sey dem never pay am.

Text_en: If I finished the work, I would go and ask the guy.
Text_ortho: If I don finish di work, I go go ask di man.

Text_en: The guy would say he had taken the money.
Text_ortho: Di man go say im don collect di money o.

Text_en: That the... my boss had taken it.
Text_ortho: Sey di, my oga don collect.

Text_en: My boss had spent it... spent all the money.
Text_ortho: My oga don chop am, chop all di money.

Text_en: I went to meet my boss.
Text_ortho: I go meet my oga.

Text_en: My boss would... boss would say he hadn't taken the money.
Text_ortho: My oga go, oga go say im never collect di money.

Text_en: So then we'd start to argue.
Text_ortho: So we go con dey drag.

Text_en: Then I said (I haven't forgotten), "let me leave this place."
Text_ortho: Naim con say (I no forget) make I comot for dat place.

Text_en: Then I went to another shop.
Text_ortho: Naim I con come anoder shop.

Text_en: So that's where I was working.
Text_ortho: So na dere I dey work.

Text_en: The guy and I were working.
Text_ortho: Me, and di man dey work.

Text_en: The guy pays me while I work.
Text_ortho: Di man dey pay me, me, I dey work.

Text_en: The guy... me and the guy would... the guy paid me for the work I did.
Text_ortho: Di man dey, me, and di man dey, di man dey pay me di work meh I dey do.

Text_en: Then my sister said our parents' last child...
Text_ortho: So naim my sister con talk sey our last born...

Text_en: As it is, I'm a twin, that's why they named me Odion.
Text_ortho: Because I be twins, na im make I de call me Odion.

Text_en: I'm a twin.
Text_ortho: I be twins.

Text_en: My twin sister called to say well, as it was, right then, she wanted to start school.
Text_ortho: My twin sister call us sey toh as im dey so, im wan start school o.

Text_en: Saying she can't...
Text_ortho: Sey im no fit dey...

Text_en: She was...
Text_ortho: Im na...

Text_en: Because she was a woman, she wanted to go to school.
Text_ortho: Because im na woman, sey im wan go school.

Text_en: Then I said, "well, we'll put some money together for you to put you in school."
Text_ortho: Naim I con say toh we go gader money for you moh we put you for school.

Text_en: So we got some money together.
Text_ortho: So na so we con gader money o.

Text_en: We put some money together.
Text_ortho: Con gader money.

Text_en: All the work I did, if I did any job, I would save three thousand naira.
Text_ortho: All di work meh I dey do, if I do work like dis, na three thousand naira I go save.

Text_en: That was how we went on.
Text_ortho: Na so we con do, do.

Text_en: Then we put my younger sister in school.
Text_ortho: Con put my junior sister for school.

Text_en: She sat for the WAEC.
Text_ortho: Dat one write WAEC.

Text_en: As my younger sister took the WAEC, she took it, but she didn't have money to...
Text_ortho: As my junior sister write WAEC now, she don write WAEC, but e no get money to...

Text_en: She took the JAMB too, but...
Text_ortho: She take JAMB sef but...

Text_en: She passed her exams.
Text_ortho: She pass her papers.

Text_en: She scored two hundred and ninety.
Text_ortho: She get two ninety.

Text_en: That was what she scored, but there was no money to, to proceed.
Text_ortho: Na im she score, but no money to, to forward.

Text_en: That was why she...
Text_ortho: Na so she...

Text_en: That is what made her stay at home since last year.
Text_ortho: Na, na im make am dey house now since last year.

Text_en: She sat for the WAEC.
Text_ortho: Na im she write WAEC.

Text_en: She wrote the JAMB.
Text_ortho: Na im make am she take her JAMB.

Text_en: That's why she's at home now.
Text_ortho: Na im make am she dey house now.

Text_en: There's nothing to do.
Text_ortho: Notin to do sef.

Text_en: So I'm working.
Text_ortho: So I con dey work.

Text_en: I then came to X, X, X, Agwan-... Agwandodo.
Text_ortho: I con come X, X, X, Agwan-... Agwandodo.

Text_en: I was working with one guy.
Text_ortho: I con dey follow one man dey work.

Text_en: The guy and I were working at that place.
Text_ortho: Na me, and di man dey work for dat place.

Text_en: So anytime we worked, the guy would always give money; anytime we worked, the guy would give money.
Text_ortho: So anytime we work, di man go give me money, anytime work, di man go give money.

Text_en: So since I was at that place, my cousin's brother who I stayed with in Abuja behind Specialist, told me uh... as it was, he could no longer feed me.
Text_ortho: So as I con dey dat place, my bro-... my cousin broder meh I dey stay wit for Abuja for back of specialist, e con tell me sey eh as e be so ba, im no fit feed me again o.

Text_en: I should please go... I should pack my things.
Text_ortho: Sey abeg make I go do, I go do pack my tings.

Text_en: I should go back.
Text_ortho: Make I go back.

Text_en: Then I said "ah ah, why are you acting like that, you were the one who asked me to stay."
Text_ortho: Naim I con say aha why you go do like dat, na you de carry me come make I con stay.

Text_en: He said it didn't concern him.
Text_ortho: Sey noting concern am o.

Text_en: As it was, he could no longer feed me.
Text_ortho: Sey im, as e dey so, im no fit feed me again.

Text_en: Well, I said, "well, okay, let me go back to the village."
Text_ortho: Toh naim I say toh okay, sey meh I go back to village.

Text_en: Then I said, "well, okay, as it is, I don't have anybody in the village, I don't have a father, I don't have a mother, I can't just go to the village."
Text_ortho: Naim I say toh okay, as e be sey I no get anybody for village, I no get fader, I no get moder, I no just fit carry myself go village.

Text_en: I then went to s-...
Text_ortho: Naim I con go dey s-...

Text_en: There was one, one of our guards who stayed in the shop.
Text_ortho: E get one, one of our maigadi wey dey stay for shop.

Text_en: Then I went and joined the, the guy to stay in the shop.
Text_ortho: Naim I con go dey follow di, di man dey stay for shop o.

Text_en: So as I joined and was staying with the guy, it was from there, I joined him to guard.
Text_ortho: So as we dey follow di man dey stay, na dere I follow, follow di man dey guard.

Text_en: Then I saved up some money.
Text_ortho: Naim I con gader small money.

Text_en: Then I went and rented a house.
Text_ortho: I con go rent house.

Text_en: So that's where I'm staying now.
Text_ortho: Na dere na im I dey stay now.

Text_en: So, I'm even working.
Text_ortho: So na work I even dey do sef.

Text_en: Work is what brought me to this place.
Text_ortho: So na work na im carry me come dis place.

Text_en: I work for Fidelity Bank.
Text_ortho: Na work I dey work for dis Fidelity Bank.

Text_en: So that's where we're working.
Text_ortho: So na dere we for dey work.

Text_en: Then they said well okay, that place, they want to sell the land.
Text_ortho: Naim de con say toh okay dat place, de wan sell di land.

Text_en: They wanted to sell that land.
Text_ortho: Sey de wan sell dat land.

Text_en: All of us should pack and leave that place.
Text_ortho: Meh all of us pack comot for dat place.

Text_en: We should go find out where to stay.
Text_ortho: Sey meh we go find where we go stay.

Text_en: That was how they did it.
Text_ortho: Na so de do o.

Text_en: Then they had a dispute over the matter.
Text_ortho: De con drag for di matter.

Text_en: They couldn't sell the land anymore.
Text_ortho: De no con sell di land again.

Text_en: So, that's how we were still at that place working until now.
Text_ortho: So na so we take dey dat place dey work now.

Text_en: My boss had been planning to travel out.
Text_ortho: My oga now, im don dey plan to travel out.

Text_en: I knew if he travelled out, I'd be the one he'd leave in that shop.
Text_ortho: But I know sey if e travel out, na me e go leave for dat shop.

Text_en: His wife didn't agree.
Text_ortho: But im wife no gree.

Text_en: Then the wife went to bring her younger brother.
Text_ortho: Di wife con go bring im junior broder.

Text_en: The wife just brought her younger brother from the village.
Text_ortho: Di wife, e just bring her junior broder for village.

Text_en: He's the one who's staying in the shop now.
Text_ortho: Na dat one con dey stay di shop now.

Text_en: So, my boss has travelled out now.
Text_ortho: So my oga don travel now.

Text_en: He travelled out last month.
Text_ortho: E travel out last month.

Text_en: So, that's it, we're engaged in a battle.
Text_ortho: So na so we dey battle.

Text_en: Any... anything you do, it's... it's the woman who will...
Text_ortho: Any, anyting you do, na she, na di woman na im go dey...

Text_en: She's the one who will collect all the money.
Text_ortho: Na im go dey collect all di money.

Text_en: So, then I told the woman, "well, as it is, I..."
Text_ortho: So I con tell di woman sey toh as e be so, me, I...

Text_en: "Since I've finished learning the trade, let me graduate."
Text_ortho: As I don learn work finish, make I do freedom.

Text_en: "I want to leave."
Text_ortho: I wan comot.

Text_en: "I will..."
Text_ortho: Me, I go...

Text_en: The woman said I can't leave.
Text_ortho: Di woman say I no fit comot o.

Text_en: I have to... I have to work there.
Text_ortho: Sey I must, I must dey under di place.

Text_en: I then said, "what?"
Text_ortho: I con say aha.

Text_en: "What else will I be doing there?"
Text_ortho: Wetin I wan do for here again?

Text_en: "The person who was teaching me has left, and I've finished learning the work."
Text_ortho: Person wey dey teach me work don comot, and I don sabi work.

Text_en: "What do you want me to be doing there?"
Text_ortho: Wetin you want mah come here dey do?

Text_en: She said no.
Text_ortho: E say no.

Text_en: So me, I must stay.
Text_ortho: Sey me, I must stay.

Text_en: For seven years, I should...
Text_ortho: Sey until di seven year make I co-...

Text_en: Then I said, "what am I...?"
Text_ortho: Naim I say wetin I dey... ?..

Text_en: "Seven years, who will be teaching me the trade?"
Text_ortho: Seven year, who wan dey teach me work?

Text_en: "I'll be here with nobody to teach me the trade."
Text_ortho: I go con dey here, nobody dey teach me work.

Text_en: "My boss has travelled out and you're a woman."
Text_ortho: My oga don travel out, and you na woman.

Text_en: "You can't be... you can't be where I am."
Text_ortho: You no fit dey, you no fit dey where I go con dey.

Text_en: "Who do I want...?"
Text_ortho: Who I wan... ?

Text_en: "Wha-... who wants to teach me the work?"
Text_ortho: Wet-... who wan teach me di work?

Text_en: She said no.
Text_ortho: E say no.

Text_en: That me, I had to stay.
Text_ortho: Sey me, I must stay.

Text_en: Then I said, "well, ma'am, if that's so, I'm not staying anymore."
Text_ortho: Naim I say toh madam, if na so, I no stay again o.

Text_en: So I left and was doing jobs for people.
Text_ortho: Na so I take comot, con go dey do jobman for people.

Text_en: When I work, they give me two thousand naira... when I work, they give me one thousand.
Text_ortho: If I work, na two thousand de go give me, if I work, na one thousand.

Text_en: So, I was using that to feed myself and clothe myself.
Text_ortho: So I take dey feed myself, dey cloth myself.

Text_en: So that's how I, for all my life, how I'm doing.
Text_ortho: So na so me, I all waka, me take dey do.

Text_en: There's only one girl out of all of us who has gotten into school now.
Text_ortho: Na only one of girl don enter school now.

Text_en: The rest are still in the village.
Text_ortho: Di rest, de still dey village.

Text_en: So, for me, as we are, it's money I'm looking for so that I... (if I can save a little something), so that I can just help my sister so that... (if it's school that she wants to go to), so that she can go to school.
Text_ortho: So me as we dey so, na money I dey find so dat I (if I fit gader small ting), so dat I go just help my sister make (if na school dat one wan enter), meh e enter school.

Text_en: So that's how it is.
Text_ortho: So na so di matter be o.

Text_en: I just came to the shop this morning.
Text_ortho: Dis morning, I just come shop o.

Text_en: My friend said we should go eat.
Text_ortho: My friend say meh we go eat.

Text_en: I said well, myself, I don't have the money to spend on food.
Text_ortho: I say toh me, I no get money wey I go take eat.

Text_en: He said we should go.
Text_ortho: Im say make we go.

Text_en: I said this is the last two hundred naira on me, and you want us to spend it on food, right?
Text_ortho: I say na di last two hundred naira wey dey my hand, and you want make we use am go eat?

Text_en: I said he knows that business is slow.
Text_ortho: I say because im know sey work no dey.

Text_en: He said we should go eat.
Text_ortho: Im say meh we go eat.

Text_en: And so we went to eat.
Text_ortho: Na so we go eat.

Text_en: When we finished eating, he said I should take him to Wazobia Park, he wants to buy some stuff.
Text_ortho: When we eat finish, e say mah carry am go Wazobia Park, im wan go buy market.

Text_en: I said aha again, I don't have fuel for the bike.
Text_ortho: I say aha again, I no get fuel for bike.

Text_en: He said I shouldn't worry, he would buy me fuel, we will go.
Text_ortho: Im say mah no worry, im go buy fuel for me, we go go.

Text_en: We bought fuel.
Text_ortho: We buy fuel.

Text_en: And that's how we left.
Text_ortho: Na so we go.

Text_en: We went to buy the goods.
Text_ortho: We go buy di goods.

Text_en: As we were coming, this, uh, highway... we wanted to pass the highway, so a lot of bikers were there, and you had to climb.
Text_ortho: As we dey come, dis eh highway (we wan pass di highway), so okadas con plenty for dere, and you gats climb up.

Text_en: Before you climb, you have to pass through the place.
Text_ortho: Before you go climb, you go pass di place.

Text_en: I didn't know that my guy, he was sitting down, he was carrying goods.
Text_ortho: I no know sey my guy, im siddown, im carry goods.

Text_en: He was carrying goods.
Text_ortho: Im carry goods.

Text_en: I didn't know that he was not sitting properly.
Text_ortho: I no know sey im no siddown well.

Text_en: And so, I moved, I stopped, I moved, I stopped.
Text_ortho: Na so I dey move, I dey stop, I dey move, dey stop.

Text_en: When it was time to climb and keep moving, I just didn't see my guy again.
Text_ortho: When time go reach, wey I go climb up dey go, I no just see my guy again.

Text_en: I didn't know that he had fallen off and was on the ground way back, and myself, I was far away.
Text_ortho: I no know sey im don fall for ground dey for back and me, I don waka go.

Text_en: After I had crossed, so I had to turn back.
Text_ortho: Till when I don cross, naim I con turn back.

Text_en: Then I saw him carrying goods.
Text_ortho: Naim I see am carry goods.

Text_en: I, I didn't even know that anybody got off my motorbike.
Text_ortho: I, I no even know sey person don even come down for my machine o.

Text_en: I just saw him carrying goods and standing at the back.
Text_ortho: I just see am carry goods stand for back.

Text_en: So I said, "okay, well, let me turn back and meet him."
Text_ortho: So I say okay toh make I come back, con meet am.

Text_en: He said no, I should just stay where I was.
Text_ortho: Im say no mah just stay.

Text_en: That was how he went carrying the goods, he stopped another bike and was going.
Text_ortho: Na so im carry di goods dey run, stop anoder bike, con dey go.

Text_en: As if...
Text_ortho: As if...

Text_en: What did I do wrong?
Text_ortho: Where I get fault for inside?

Text_en: Did I screw up?
Text_ortho: I get any fault for dere?

Text_en: Me, I didn't know that he fell on the ground.
Text_ortho: Me, I no know sey im fall for ground now.

Text_en: And me, I...
Text_ortho: And me, I...

Text_en: And because the place was high up, he was on my back.
Text_ortho: And because di place dey up, im dey for my back.

Text_en: So he fell as I moved.
Text_ortho: So as I move, naim fall.

Text_en: People told me he had fallen.
Text_ortho: People con tell me sey im don fall.

Text_en: And I had...
Text_ortho: And I gats...

Text_en: That place is a busy place.
Text_ortho: Dat place na busy place.

Text_en: I had to be careful, so that nothing would hit my bike, or something.
Text_ortho: I gats park well wey be sey noting go hit my bike, or someting.

Text_en: That's how I turned.
Text_ortho: Na so I con turn.

Text_en: Then we met at the shop.
Text_ortho: We con meet for shop now.

Text_en: He was telling people that uh... that I, I don't know how to ride a bike.
Text_ortho: E con dey tell people sey eh, sey me, I no sabi drive machine.

Text_en: That's how it is, I ride the motorbike anyhow, he fell, etc., etc., etc.
Text_ortho: Na so I just drive di machine anyhow, im con go fall for ground, wetin, wetin, wetin.

Text_en: That's why he didn't ride my bike on the way back to the shop.
Text_ortho: Na im make I no con climb my bike come back again.

Text_en: I said well, no problem.
Text_ortho: I say toh no wahala o!

Text_en: That's how I laid the matter to rest, then I moved on.
Text_ortho: Na so I con leave am, con move ahead.

Text_en: I don't know if I did something wrong.
Text_ortho: I no know wheder I get fault for di someting wey I do.

Text_en: There's this boss of mine who trained me.
Text_ortho: De get dis my oga wey teach me work.

Text_en: So everytime myself, and another guy, we always go to his house.
Text_ortho: So everytime me, and one man, we dey always go im house.

Text_en: We used to go.
Text_ortho: We dey go.

Text_en: Like... sometimes, we would buy bottles of beer, and we would drink.
