Text_ortho: Like sometimes, we go buy beer, we go drink.

Text_en: I used to look at this guy.
Text_ortho: I dey see dis guy.

Text_en: In the morning, before he went to work, he would just come, he would buy bottles of beer, he would drink as much as he wanted, and we, we would be in his house aha.
Text_ortho: In di morning, before im go work, im go just come, im go buy beer, im go drink well, well, and we, we go dey im house aha.

Text_en: Then, I asked...
Text_ortho: Den, I con ask...

Text_en: In, in the evening, we would still be there, in his house.
Text_ortho: In, in di evening, we go still dey im house dere o.

Text_en: He would still come back.
Text_ortho: Im go still come back.

Text_en: That's how he would buy drinks.
Text_ortho: Na so e go buy drink.

Text_en: He would drink, I mean enjoy himself.
Text_ortho: E go drink, as in enjoy imsef.

Text_en: Then I was asking my guy, "ah, this guy, what kind of work does he do?"
Text_ortho: I con dey ask my guy sey ah dis guy, which work im dey do?

Text_en: So he told me that...
Text_ortho: Naim e con tell me sey...

Text_en: Because then, I didn't even know what they called car AC (Air Conditioning).
Text_ortho: Because den, I no even know wetin de dey call car AC sef.

Text_en: I only knew that cars had AC.
Text_ortho: I just know sey car get AC.

Text_en: Do you understand?
Text_ortho: Shey una understand?

Text_en: So I should have asked my...
Text_ortho: Naim I for ask my...

Text_en: Because I just completed my ND (National Diploma) then.
Text_ortho: Because den, I just finish my ND.

Text_en: But it's not that I actually finished the programme.
Text_ortho: But no be sey I even round up.

Text_en: Based on one or two issues, I only left the place over finance, and some other things.
Text_ortho: Based on one, or two issue, I just free di place because of finance, and some oder tings.

Text_en: I only left the school so I wouldn't get into the wrong hands, or something.
Text_ortho: I just leave di school so dat meh I no go meet myself for wrong hand, or someting.

Text_en: I just left the school, I came back.
Text_ortho: I just leave school, I come back.

Text_en: So I went to join the...
Text_ortho: So naim I con go join di...

Text_en: So I went to Zuba to stay with one of my friends.
Text_ortho: Naim I con go Zuba go stay wit one of my friend.

Text_en: So we started going to that guy's place.
Text_ortho: So we con dey go dat guy place.

Text_en: Now, he told me that the guy worked on car AC.
Text_ortho: Now, e con tell me sey di guy dey do car AC.

Text_en: I said, "what is car AC?"
Text_ortho: I say which one be car AC?

Text_en: He said AC for motor cars.
Text_ortho: Im say AC for motor.

Text_en: So I said, "ehen."
Text_ortho: Naim I con say ehen.

Text_en: He said...
Text_ortho: Im say...

Text_en: I said, "where is the guy's shop?"
Text_ortho: I say where di guy shop dey?

Text_en: He said it was where they sell spare parts for cars.
Text_ortho: E say e dey for motor spare part.

Text_en: I said ehn.
Text_ortho: I say ehn.

Text_en: I said okay but mstchew, that car AC... me, I'd like to get some experience in that area.
Text_ortho: I say okay but mtschew dat car AC, me, I go like get experience for dat ting.

Text_en: Because me, I am a technical person.
Text_ortho: Because me, na technical man I be.

Text_en: Because I was in the Engineering department from SS (Senior Secondary School) one to SS three.
Text_ortho: Because from my SS one, to SS three, na engineering department I dey.

Text_en: Doing Electrical Electronics.
Text_ortho: Dat is elect elect.

Text_en: You understand?
Text_ortho: Shey you understand?

Text_en: And for my... and for my ND (National Diploma), I was in Electrical Engineering.
Text_ortho: And for my, for my ND, na electrical engineering I dey too.

Text_en: So he said that t-... not at all.
Text_ortho: So im con tell me sey t-... no o.

Text_en: That mstchew... that... my friend said no.
Text_ortho: Sey mtschew dat my friend con tell me sey no o.

Text_en: That I wouldn't be able to do it because me I'm above that.
Text_ortho: Sey me, I no go fit do am because me, I don pass.

Text_en: That uh... he sees me as a big boy.
Text_ortho: Sey ah im dey see me like big boy now.

Text_en: That me, I wouldn't be able to do it.
Text_ortho: Sey me, I no go fit.

Text_en: I said, "man, in this life, you've gotta be smart
Text_ortho: I say oga, dis life, you gats see.

Text_en: I mean, you have to be loyal.
Text_ortho: As in you gats loyal.

Text_en: I mean, you have to be humble to get what you want.
Text_ortho: As in you gats bring yourself down to achieve wetin you want.

Text_en: So he told me that well, he'd go see the guy.
Text_ortho: Im con tell me sey toh, sey im go go see di guy.

Text_en: So I said okay.
Text_ortho: I con say okay.

Text_en: The next day, I went up to him and said we should go and see the guy.
Text_ortho: Di next day, I go meet am sey meh we go see di guy.

Text_en: He said he wanted to go somewhere.
Text_ortho: Im say im wan go somewhere.

Text_en: So me, I walked to the guy's house.
Text_ortho: Na so me, I waka go di guy house.

Text_en: And I said "boss..."
Text_ortho: I con tell am sey oga...

Text_en: I greeted him.
Text_ortho: I greet am.

Text_en: He said, "yes."
Text_ortho: Im say ehn.

Text_en: So we chatted since he knew me.
Text_ortho: We con greet based on sey im know me.

Text_en: He saw me around from time to time.
Text_ortho: Im dey always dey see me.

Text_en: They have even told hima about me.
Text_ortho: De don even tell am tings about me.

Text_en: Then he told me that...
Text_ortho: Im con tell me sey...

Text_en: I told him, "man, I heard you work on car AC, mstchew."
Text_ortho: I con tell am sey oga, I hear sey you dey do car AC o mtschew.

Text_en: I'm interested in that line of work since I've noticed how you're doing.
Text_ortho: I dey interested for dat work because I just see as you dey go.

Text_en: I want to get an idea.
Text_ortho: I wan get di idea.

Text_en: Then he laughed.
Text_ortho: Im con laugh.

Text_en: And he said, "hh."
Text_ortho: Im con tell me sey ah.

Text_en: But he heard that me, I'm an electrician.
Text_ortho: But im hear sey me, I be electrician.

Text_en: That I... I went attended the polytechnic.
Text_ortho: Sey I, I do ehn poly.

Text_en: I told him I attended the polytechnic but I didn't finish the program, but I n-... I need to get busy.
Text_ortho: I tell am sey I do poly, but I no round up, but I n-... I need to put myself busy.

Text_en: Daily activities and things like that, you know?
Text_ortho: Everyday activity like dat, shey you understand?

Text_en: Then he said, "well, no problem at all."
Text_ortho: Im con tell me sey toh no wahala now.

Text_en: He said well, since I... since I came on my own, he believed I could do it.
Text_ortho: Sey toh since I, since na me carry myself come, im believe sey I go fit do am.

Text_en: Since I understood technical things, he believed I could do it.
Text_ortho: Since I get idea for technical tings, sey im believe sey I go fit do am.

Text_en: I said I will.
Text_ortho: I say I go fit.

Text_en: He said okay, I should come and meet him in the shop the next day.
Text_ortho: Im say okay mah con meet am for shop di next day.

Text_en: So I went to meet him in the shop the next day.
Text_ortho: Na so I go meet am for shop di next day o.

Text_en: From that day on I went to meet him in the shop, he started observing me, he was observing my attitude.
Text_ortho: From dat day, as I go meet am for shop, im con dey observe me, dey observe my attitude.

Text_en: He was wondering if mstchew, I'd be showing him lip or whether...
Text_ortho: Im dey reason wheder mtschew I wan dey form big boy for am, or wheder...

Text_en: He would hand me errands he wasn't supposed to give me.
Text_ortho: Im go send me some kind message sef wey im no suppose send me sef.

Text_en: He would notice that I did them.
Text_ortho: Im go see me say I go do di message.

Text_en: Then one day, I just came to work.
Text_ortho: Den e get one day, I just con work.

Text_en: It's not that I got there really late.
Text_ortho: No be sey I too con late.

Text_en: He asked me to kneel down at the gate
Text_ortho: Im tell me sey mah kneel down from gate.

Text_en: And said I should crawl from there until I get inside the garage.
Text_ortho: Mah use my leg dey crawl dey come inside garage.

Text_en: So I... so I kneeled down right there
Text_ortho: Na so I, na so I kneel down for dere.

Text_en: And I started crawling towards him.
Text_ortho: Start dey use my leg dey crawl dey come.

Text_en: I was crawling towards him.
Text_ortho: Dey use my leg dey crawl dey come o.

Text_en: That was how...
Text_ortho: Naim...

Text_en: He c-...
Text_ortho: Im c-...

Text_en: Someone said "ah, Chris!"
Text_ortho: Na person con tell me sey ah Chris!

Text_en: He said they they sin-... they asked me to stand up.
Text_ortho: Sey de sin-... de con tell me mah stand up.

Text_en: When I stood up, later, later in the day, another guy in charge of mechanics said "uh, Christopher"... he said your boss shouldn't...
Text_ortho: When I con stand up, later, later in di day, naim one oder oga for mechanic con tell me sey ah Christopher, sey meh your oga ehen...

Text_en: He said I should...
Text_ortho: Tell me sey meh...

Text_en: That I shouldn't be angry about what my boss did in the morning.
Text_ortho: Sey meh I no vex for wetin my oga do me in di morning o.

Text_en: He said my boss just wanted...
Text_ortho: Sey my oga just wan...

Text_en: That was two weeks after I joined him.
Text_ortho: Dat was after two weeks, when I join am.

Text_en: He said my boss just wanted to test me.
Text_ortho: Sey my oga just wan test me.

Text_en: Maybe I'd show him an attitude.
Text_ortho: Wheder me, I go dey do big boy for am.

Text_en: Maybe I'd be stubborn.
Text_ortho: Wheder I go do strong head.

Text_en: I told him that no, I can't do that.
Text_ortho: I tell am sey no, me, I no fit do like dat now.

Text_en: Because when you wanted to get trained for something... you submitted yourself as an apprentice.
Text_ortho: Because where you wan learn someting, you carry yourself come say you wan learn someting.

Text_en: Your... you will... you have to be loyal.
Text_ortho: Your, you go, you gats dey loyal.

Text_en: You can't show attitude or say anything.
Text_ortho: You no go dey form big boy, or say anyting.

Text_en: So the next day, my boss asked me to go and bring my training fee, come with drinks and afterwards sign the apprenticeship form.
Text_ortho: Naim di next day, my oga con tell me sey meh I go bring my money, come wit my drinks, meh I con sign.

Text_en: That was how I signed the apprenticeship form and continued till I got myself a shop and started hustling here in Gwagwalada.
Text_ortho: Na so I take sign di work till I con get my shop, con dey hustle for Gwagwalada here.

Text_en: Ah, babe, how are you?
Text_ortho: Ah babe, how far?

Text_en: Um, fine.
Text_ortho: Hm fine o.

Text_en: How are you?
Text_ortho: How you dey?

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: Ahah, what you're doing like this, you're just locking up as if nothing is happening.
Text_ortho: Aha dis one wey you dey do like dis, wey you just dey lock up like sey nothing dey happen!

Text_en: Aren't you in Nigeria?
Text_ortho: You no dey Naija so?

Text_en: I'm fine, I'm fine.
Text_ortho: I dey o, I dey o!

Text_en: I'm just coming from the road where I saw like small small, small, small children who, as in who are in secondary school, who were like eight years old, they'll be in JSS3.
Text_ortho: Na road I just dey come from o wey I just see as in small, small, small children wey, as in wey dey for secondary school, wey be like as in eight years go dey JSS three.

Text_en: Ahah!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehn!

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: I just don't know what's happening to this country or if it's all over the world this thing happened.
Text_ortho: I no just know wetin dey happen to dis country, weda na di whole world di thing happen.

Text_en: I just don't know what's happening to this country.
Text_ortho: I no just know wetin dey happen to dis country.

Text_en: Ah, man, but what you're saying is like...
Text_ortho: Ah omo but dis one wey you dey yarn like sey...

Text_en: I don't know.
Text_ortho: I no know.

Text_en: I'm telling you.
Text_ortho: I dey tell you.

Text_en: Aren't you Nigerian?
Text_ortho: Eh no be Naija person?

Text_en: Before that, at the time when we were uh... uh... when we were with our parents, our mother and father, a'ah then, it was old mo-... mo-... mo-... mo-... mothers that were, that were even in primary school.
Text_ortho: Before dat, di time wey we dey, eh eh wey we, our parents, our mama, and papa, a'ah den, na old ma, ma, ma, ma, mama na dem, na dem even dey primary school.

Text_en: Well!
Text_ortho: Toh!

Text_en: Uhuh.
Text_ortho: Ehn.

Text_en: You mean mom and dad, our mothers, our mothers!
Text_ortho: You mean pupsy dem, and maale dem, maale dem!

Text_en: Not even secondary school.
Text_ortho: No be even secondary school.

Text_en: Haha.
Text_ortho: Haha.

Text_en: I remember when I was little, when I was little.
Text_ortho: I remember di time wey I dey small, di time wey I dey small.

Text_en: What happened?
Text_ortho: Wetin happen?

Text_en: Because I was good at school!
Text_ortho: Ehe because I know book well, well o.

Text_en: From primary four (I was still seven at the time), one day, then my father just... my father just came to the school.
Text_ortho: From primary four (dat time, I even still dey seven years), one day, naim my papa just, my papa just come school.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: My uh... teacher met him, told him that... uh... that I, I... I'm good at school, I'm very good, that he should buy the uh... uh... uh... (what's it called again?) Common Entrance Examination, that I will pass.
Text_ortho: My ehn teacher come meet am, come tell am sey, eh sey I, I, I know book, I know book well, well, sey make e buy eh eh eh (wetin dem dey call am again) Common Entrance Examination, sey I go pass am.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: Since I was good at school, he went to buy it.
Text_ortho: With, because I know book, e come go buy am.

Text_en: I passed the exam, I went to school, oh boy!
Text_ortho: I pass di exam, I enter shool, o boy!

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: If you see suffering...
Text_ortho: If you see suffering...

Text_en: You have a high level.
Text_ortho: Your own level high o.

Text_en: My own father doesn't behave like that.
Text_ortho: My own pupsy no dey do like dat.

Text_en: Hm!
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: Oh boy, forget it!
Text_ortho: Oh boy forget!

Text_en: That's what I'm saying.
Text_ortho: Na wetin I dey tell you.

Text_en: You're not supposed to be too young when you go into Secondary School now.
Text_ortho: You no suppose small when you go dey enter secondary school now.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: I said I... I didn't even know how to take care of myself.
Text_ortho: I say I, I no even know how to take care of myself.

Text_en: Ha!
Text_ortho: Ha!

Text_en: Anytime we had visiting day, my mama would cry because at the time, I didn't know how to take care of myself.
Text_ortho: Anytime wey we dey get visiting day, my mama go come dey cry because dat time, I no know how to take care of mysef.

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: Hm!
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: Those people they call uh... mtchew, uh... school mothers... school mothers, yes that's what they call them.
Text_ortho: Dose people wey de dey call er mstchew er school mothers, school mothers, yeah na wetin de dey call dem.

Text_en: Uh, ma... mom... mom... school moms.
Text_ortho: Eh ma, mile, mile for school now.

Text_en: Eh, okay.
Text_ortho: Eh okay.

Text_en: Yes now.
Text_ortho: Ehen now.

Text_en: The lady, she ate all my provisions.
Text_ortho: Di lady, she chop all my provision.

Text_en: It was no small thing!
Text_ortho: No be small thing o.

Text_en: My milk, everything.
Text_ortho: My milk, everything.

Text_en: Shoot!
Text_ortho: Shoo!

Text_en: I wasn't even staying in the hostel.
Text_ortho: I no come dey even dey stay for hostel.

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: After we read at night for homework, I slept in class.
Text_ortho: After we read in di night for prep, na class I go sleep.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: Haha.
Text_ortho: Haha.

Text_en: I would carry my uniform like that to class.
Text_ortho: I go carry my uniform like dat dey go class.

Text_en: I wasn't able to take a shower.
Text_ortho: I no go fit bath.

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehn!

Text_en: So you stayed in a boarding house.
Text_ortho: So you bin stay for boarders sef.

Text_en: I stayed in a boarding house.
Text_ortho: I stay for boarding house.

Text_en: That's what I'm saying.
Text_ortho: Na where I dey talk.

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: All these children shouldn't, as in, think that they want to go fast.
Text_ortho: All dis children, meh dem no dey as in think sey dem wan go fast, fast.

Text_en: At least, everything should be gradual.
Text_ortho: At least, make everything dey step by step.

Text_en: How to manage?
Text_ortho: How manage?

Text_en: But it is not people's fault like that now.
Text_ortho: But no be people fault like dat now.

Text_en: It's because of...
Text_ortho: Na because of...

Text_en: Isn't it... aren't they... isn't it... isn't it our fault? Isn't it our fault?
Text_ortho: No be, no be dem, no be, no be our fault, no be our fault?

Text_en: Let me tell you something, for you to know a thing or two.
Text_ortho: Make I tell you something make you sabi small.

Text_en: They are spoiling Nigeria, they are spoiling this country.
Text_ortho: De dey spoil Nigeria, de dey spoil dis country.

Text_en: I'm telling you!
Text_ortho: I dey tell you!

Text_en: Everybody, everything has to go step by step.
Text_ortho: Everybody, everything has to go step by step.

Text_en: See...
Text_ortho: See...

Text_en: It's not all about being hasty.
Text_ortho: No be sey you go dey do gragra.

Text_en: Look at money! They want to be hasty about it, you want to be impatient about it.
Text_ortho: See money, dem wan do am gragra, you wan do impatience.

Text_en: If it's on the road, everybody wants to go fast; if it's e-... e-... exa-... e-... examination, everybody wants to get something quick.
Text_ortho: If na road, everybody wan go fast, fast, if na e-... e-... exa-... e-... examination, everybody wan do gragra get something.

Text_en: If it's uh...
Text_ortho: If na eh...

Text_en: Everything is...
Text_ortho: Everything na...

Text_en: What is life?
Text_ortho: Wetin dey life?

Text_en: Nigerians, we just don't have patience at all.
Text_ortho: Nigerians, we no just get patience at all.

Text_en: I am telling you!
Text_ortho: I dey tell you!

Text_en: But what do you think about it?
Text_ortho: Or how you think am?

Text_en: So, babe, I will tell you the truth.
Text_ortho: So babe, I go tell you true.

Text_en: Leave the matter for Mathias.
Text_ortho: Make you leave matter for Mathias.

Text_en: Eh, it's not what you're saying.
Text_ortho: Ehn no be dat one wey you dey yarn.

Text_en: It's not that...
Text_ortho: No be sey...

Text_en: You see, let... let me tell you in case you don't know.
Text_ortho: You see, mah, make I tell you wetin dey in case you no know.

Text_en: The thing is spoiling us, it's spoiling us, I'm telling you.
Text_ortho: Di thing dey spoil us, e dey spoil us, I dey tell you.

Text_en: See, Nigeria's challenge, it is...
Text_ortho: See, Naija challenge, e dey...

Text_en: That one is too much.
Text_ortho: Dat one dey too much.

Text_en: Ha!
Text_ortho: Ha!

Text_en: Eh, it is too much.
Text_ortho: Ehn e dey too much.

Text_en: But the thing is that Nigeria makes people smart.
Text_ortho: But di thing be sey Naija dey make person get brain.

Text_en: If you're not smart, you'll get smart quick.
Text_ortho: If you no get brain, you go begin get am shaperly.

Text_en: That's how Nigeria is for us.
Text_ortho: Na so Naija be for you o.

Text_en: Let me tell you!
Text_ortho: Mah I tell you!

Text_en: What makes people act like that is that they need to just try to, for them to try to meet up to certain things.
Text_ortho: Wetin dey make people dey do like dat be sey de need to just try to, meh, meh de don try to you know fit meet up for certain things.

Text_en: If you don't run it, if you don't run the package like that uh... you will just... you will crash there.
Text_ortho: If you no run am, if you don't run di package like dat eh, you go just, you go crash for dere.

Text_en: You'll even see a ki-... kid who doesn't even know how to speak will be in the nursery... in the nursery class.
Text_ortho: You go even see pi-... pikin wey no even know how to speak go dey nursery, nursery class.

Text_en: What now?
Text_ortho: For wetin now?

Text_en: Come on!
Text_ortho: Haba!

Text_en: That's how it is now.
Text_ortho: Na so now.

Text_en: For what?
Text_ortho: For wetin?

Text_en: That is how it is, but... be... but... but let me tell you.
Text_ortho: Na, na so di thing be, but be-... but before, make I tell you.

Text_en: We're always rushing things in Nigeria.
Text_ortho: We too dey rush something for Nigeria.

Text_en: I'm telling you.
Text_ortho: I dey tell you.

Text_en: We are rushing too much.
Text_ortho: We too dey rush something.

Text_en: It's not good, it's not good.
Text_ortho: E no good, e no good.

Text_en: Ah, but we will... we need to rush it now.
Text_ortho: Ah but we go, we need to rush am now.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: We are not supposed to be rushing things.
Text_ortho: We no suppose rush things.

Text_en: That's why the white people themselves are lying... are afraid of us.
Text_ortho: Na im make di Oyinbo demsef dey lie, de dey fear us.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: That's why they are afraid of us.
Text_ortho: Na im make dem dey fear us.

Text_en: Even if we stay on the road, you will see traffic lights.
Text_ortho: Ah even if we stay for road, you go see traffic light.

Text_en: Where are you r-...?
Text_ortho: Where you dey r-... ?

Text_en: It's not like you're rushing anywhere.
Text_ortho: No be sey you dey rush go anywhere.

Text_en: You'll just want to speed away.
Text_ortho: You go just wan rush go.

Text_en: If the police come to handle you now, they'll be saying "please, I don't have any money, what..."
Text_ortho: If police con come now, con handle you now, de go dey say abeg I no get money, wetin... ?

Text_en: I don't have any, I don't have any, I don't have any, but you're the one who doesn't, who doesn't have any patience in this country.
Text_ortho: I no get, I no get, I no get, but na you be person wey no just, no, no just get patience for dis countrty.

Text_en: I am telling you!
Text_ortho: I dey tell you!

Text_en: Which, which police?
Text_ortho: Which, which police?

Text_en: It's no good, it's no good.
Text_ortho: E no good, e no good.

Text_en: Which of the police are you talking about?
Text_ortho: Which of di police you dey yarn sef?

Text_en: Is it this kind of police that we have here that you're talking about?
Text_ortho: Na dis kind police wey we get for here na im you dey yarn?

Text_en: Which police?
Text_ortho: Which police?

Text_en: But now, you know that sometimes, some... most of these police, they are doing all these, uh... uh... uh... road uh... transport work, all of them.
Text_ortho: But now you know sey sometimes, some, most of dis police, de don dey do all dis eh eh eh eh road, eh transport work ehn all of dem.

Text_en: They are doing something.
Text_ortho: De dey do something.

Text_en: They have...
Text_ortho: De don dey...

Text_en: Some... some... some of them are good of course, some of them are good.
Text_ortho: Some, some, some of dem good sha, some of dem good!

Text_en: Do you want to say they are already adjusting?
Text_ortho: You wan tell me sey de don dey adjust?

Text_en: Please don't let me spoil my country.
Text_ortho: Abeg make I no just spoil my country.

Text_en: Some of them are good, some of them are good, some of them are good.
Text_ortho: Some of dem good, some of dem good, some of dem good.

Text_en: But just the ones I met now, they are fucked up.
Text_ortho: But just di ones wey me I don meet now, na fuck up o.

Text_en: I'm telling the truth.
Text_ortho: I dey tell di truth.

Text_en: That one does not...
Text_ortho: Dat one no...

Text_en: In Nigeria here, everything uh... even those Adigo police that you are talking about, they are the ones that hurt you the most.
Text_ortho: If for Naija here, everything ehn, even dat Adigo police wey you dey talk about, na dem dey do you pass sef.

Text_en: Sometimes, you wonder.
Text_ortho: Sometimes, you go dey wonder.

Text_en: They say the police are your friend.
Text_ortho: De say police be your friend, be your friend.

Text_en: What kind of friend?
Text_ortho: Which kind friend?

Text_en: You know that there is uh... there is a... a saying which goes "a hungry man is an angry man."
Text_ortho: You know sey e dey, eh e get one, one eh talk wey dem talk sey eh a hungry man is an angry man.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Okay!

Text_en: Maybe Buhari doesn't want to pay their salaries now.
Text_ortho: Maybe Buhari no wan pay deir, deir salary now.

Text_en: If they stand in the road, their eyes are red and you just provoke them,  they will take what they want to, slap you, break your car.
Text_ortho: If dem stand for road, deir eyes red, and you just provoke dem, dem go carry wetin de wan to, slap you, break your motor.

Text_en: Aha, that's it.
Text_ortho: Aha na im.

Text_en: People won't just stand on the road and be doing all those things without anything to feed on and everything now!
Text_ortho: Person no go just stand for road dey do all dose things, and dem no go get wetin to dey chop, and everything now!

Text_en: It's no good now!
Text_ortho: E no good now!

Text_en: Okay it's... it's... it's... it's now you are beginning to... to improve and say what I want to hear.
Text_ortho: Okay now na, na, na, na now you tanda dey talk, to talk better wey I wan hear.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: No, no, no!
Text_ortho: No, no, no!

Text_en: Even...
Text_ortho: Even...

Text_en: It's not what you were saying before.
Text_ortho: No be di one wey you dey talk since o.

Text_en: What you're saying now, that's better.
Text_ortho: Di one wey you don dey talk now, na im be di better.

Text_en: It's going... it's... it's going in the direction of what I'm saying.
Text_ortho: E don dey flow, e don dey, e don dey flow for di place wey I dey yarn.

Text_en: Even uh... uh... uh... uh... uh... teachers, they won't pay them.
Text_ortho: Even for eh eh eh eh eh teachers, dem no go wan pay.

Text_en: If anybody wants to respect any profession anywhere at all, it's teachers they are supposed to... as in just give, as in uh... Gbosa, as in more than a hundred Gbosa.
Text_ortho: If anybody, dem wan respect, any profession for any, anywhere, na teachers de suppose to as in just give as in hm gbosa, as in more than hundred gbosa.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: They're the ones they're supposed to rate more.
Text_ortho: Na dem be suppose dey rate pass.

Text_en: Okay.
Text_ortho: Okay.

Text_en: They're supposed to respect them more now.
Text_ortho: De suppose to respect dem pass now.

Text_en: Okay, me I become a doctor, you, you become a lawyer, this person becomes an engineer, who is the person who trained us?
Text_ortho: Okay me, I become doctor, you, you become lawyer, dis person become engineer, who be di person wey train us?

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Okay!

Text_en: Hm!
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: Is it not a teacher?
Text_ortho: No be teacher?

Text_en: They're the ones they're supposed to pay more now, but you'll go to schools, teachers will be earning uh... even less than the money they give uh... youth corpers.
Text_ortho: Na dem de suppose to pay pass now, but you go go schools, teachers go dey get eh even less dan di money wey de even dey give eh youth corpers.

Text_en: Why now?
Text_ortho: For why now?

Text_en: Come on!
Text_ortho: Haba!

Text_en: It's no good, it's no good.
Text_ortho: E no good, e no good.

Text_en: Eh, babe!
Text_ortho: Eh babe!

Text_en: They are supposed to res-... respect these teachers.
Text_ortho: Dem suppose to res-... respect dis teachers.

Text_en: Babe, let me...
Text_ortho: Babe, make I...

Text_en: If they can't respect teachers, you should give them a better salary, give them a better house.
Text_ortho: If dem no fit respect teachers, you give dem a better salary, you give dem better house.

Text_en: Will they give it to police or any other workers?
Text_ortho: Na police, or any oda workers de go dey give?

Text_en: Hm!
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: I don't know why Nigerians don't just want to change!
Text_ortho: I no know why Nigerians no wan just change o!

Text_en: You know that Nigeria...
Text_ortho: You know sey Naija...

Text_en: And they'll be saying "change begins with you and me."
Text_ortho: And dem go dey talk sey change begins wit, begins with you, and me.

Text_en: Where?
Text_ortho: For where?

Text_en: They say charity begins at home.
Text_ortho: Dem say charity begins for house.

Text_en: What kind of charity?
Text_ortho: Which kind charity?

Text_en: X forget all those things!
Text_ortho: X forget all dose things o!

Text_en: Me, I've started my charity!
Text_ortho: Me, I don start my charity o!

Text_en: My charity has begun at home since I was born.
Text_ortho: My charity don begin for house since wey dem born me.

Text_en: I'm doing my charity work, I'm doing it.
Text_ortho: I dey do my charity work, I dey do am.

Text_en: If it means giving peo-... people uh... this thing... if it means respecting people, I'm doing my charity work.
Text_ortho: If na to give pe-... people eh dis thing, if na to respect people, I dey do my charity work.

Text_en: But, let Buhari do his own charity and he'll change for us.
Text_ortho: But make Buhari do im charity, and im change for our own body!

Text_en: Let the Governor and all of them do our charity work in our life now, please!
Text_ortho: Make di governor, and all of dem do our charity work for our life now abeg!

Text_en: Leave that thing!
Text_ortho: Leave dat thing!

Text_en: That... that... that... that change that they are talking about is not for everybody.
Text_ortho: Dat, dat, dat, dat change wey dem dey talk, no be for everybody o!

Text_en: The change they're talking about now is that everything is increasing.
Text_ortho: Di change wey de dey talk now be sey everything don dey increase.

Text_en: That change...
Text_ortho: Dat change...

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: The thing is that salaries are going down and what we're buying is increasing.
Text_ortho: Di thing be sey salary don dey decrease, and di thing wey we come dey buy con dey increase.

Text_en: Okay.
Text_ortho: Okay.

Text_en: Increasing!
Text_ortho: Increase!

Text_en: Nothing is difficult for her.
Text_ortho: Nothing wey dey hard for her.

Text_en: I dunno.
Text_ortho: I no know.

Text_en: Haha!
Text_ortho: Haha!

Text_en: I'm just tired.
Text_ortho: I just tire o.

Text_en: You know that I've been laughing when people talk about this change, change, change in things.
Text_ortho: You know sey I be dey laugh when people dey talk about di change, change, change of a thing.

Text_en: I was telling my mom that...
Text_ortho: I be dey tell my mile sey...

Text_en: My father kept saying "ah! This change is for real, Jonathan..."
Text_ortho: My pupsy den con dey dey yarn sey, ah sey ah dis change na for real o, sey Jonathan...

Text_en: That was one of the first changes that happened.
Text_ortho: Dat one na di first change wey happen.

Text_en: They want Jonathan to step down, they are tired of Jonathan, Jonathan is a corrupt man.
Text_ortho: Dem wan make Jonathan comot, sey de don tire for Jonathan, sey Jonathan na corruption man.

Text_en: I told them no!
Text_ortho: I tell dem sey no!

Text_en: They did not ask.
Text_ortho: De no come ask.

Text_en: When they were talking about the change, they did not ask "what kind of change?"
Text_ortho: When de dey talk about di change, de no ask sey which kind of change?

Text_en: You know, change has a positive side.
Text_ortho: You know, change get positive one.

Text_en: There is good change, and there is useless change.
Text_ortho: E get better change, e get yeye change.

Text_en: Not all change is good.
Text_ortho: No be every change be better change o!

Text_en: That was how they said they wanted change.
Text_ortho: Naim de con dey say de wan change.

Text_en: I said okay!
Text_ortho: I say ah!

Text_en: I was just looking at them.
Text_ortho: I just dey look dem.

Text_en: I said, you should all go.
Text_ortho: I say oya moh una go now!

Text_en: Today, here they are!
Text_ortho: Na today de dey.

Text_en: They're the ones complaining.
Text_ortho: Na dem dey follow dey complain.

Text_en: My old... my old... my mom, she just cries everyday.
Text_ortho: My, my old, my mile eh, e just dey cry everyday.

Text_en: I laughed at her.
Text_ortho: I dey laugh am.

Text_en: My brother, please let us just relax!
Text_ortho: My brother, abeg make we just relax!

Text_en: I said they should go and sit down!
Text_ortho: I say make dem go sit down!

Text_en: That is a Nigerian issue, please!
Text_ortho: Na Naija matter be dat abeg.

Text_en: It's God... it's God... it's God... it's God who will take control.
Text_ortho: Na God, na God, na God, na God go take control.

Text_en: Uh, Nigerian matters.
Text_ortho: Eh Naija matters.

Text_en: That's... that's what we've been talking about.
Text_ortho: Na wetin, na wetin we don dey talk since.

Text_en: God will take control.
Text_ortho: God go take control.

Text_en: It won't get finished, will it?
Text_ortho: E no go finish ehn?

Text_en: Well, brother, as a Warri boy, the thing is that this country (the way I see it), this country does not hav-... it doesn't have a good future just, just because of the way things are, anyways.
Text_ortho: Well, bros, as a Warri boy now, di ting be sey di country (di way I dey see am), di country no ge-... e no get any better future for front because di way ting just dey, ting just dey anyhow.

Text_en: Because normally, they do... they do promise us this will happen, that it will happen, but all of us have been waiting, nothing is happening.
Text_ortho: Because normally, de dey, de dey promise us sey dis one go happen, dis one go happen, but all of us don dey wait, noting dey happen.

Text_en: Take my family for example: I remember last time when they said that they wanted to pay uh... old pensioners something.
Text_ortho: I fit use my own family as example be sey I remember last time wey de bin call sey de want pay ehn old pensioner someting.

Text_en: Almost...
Text_ortho: Almost...

Text_en: This was almost four or five years ago.
Text_ortho: Dis one na almost four, to five years now.

Text_en: We've been waiting.
Text_ortho: We don dey wait.

Text_en: Nothing is happening.
Text_ortho: Noting dey happen.

Text_en: And most of the things about the coun-... the economy, they say things will get better, things will get better, but the thing is... everything is just going from bad to worse, like a grease fire.
Text_ortho: And most of di ting wey di coun-... di economy dey talk sef, de say tings go better, tings go better, but di ting, everyting just dey go from bad to worst, from fry pan to fire.

Text_en: But anyhow, any which way we... all of us... the thing is, Nigerians, we are hardworkers.
Text_ortho: But any which way sha, we, all of us, di ting be sey Nigerians, na hard workers we be.

Text_en: For instance, recently, in my area, they just did some demolition, and some people were impacted.
Text_ortho: Like recently now, for my area, de just do demolition, and some people just suffer.

Text_en: They didn't even warn anybody saying "we are coming, move your things."
Text_ortho: De no even warn anybody sey we dey come, moh una pack una tings.

Text_en: They just came and pulled everything down, different houses, including people's shops, their cars.
Text_ortho: De just con carry everyting down, different houses, even people shop, deir motor.

Text_en: The man who was driving the bulldozer just buried everything.
Text_ortho: Di man wey dey drive di demolition motor just carry everyting put underground.

Text_en: Some people even died just yesterday.
Text_ortho: Some people sef even die yesterday sef.

Text_en: So the thing is, we Nigerians who own this country, they are treating us like we're foreigners in our own land where my mother gave birth to me, and my... my... it's here that my father comes from.
Text_ortho: So di ting be sey we, Nigerians wey get dis country, de dey treat us like sey we be foreigner for our own country where my mama born me, and my, my, na here my papa comot from.

Text_en: It's like I'm a foreigner.
Text_ortho: E go be like sey na foreigner I be.

Text_en: It's like I... I smuggled myself into the country, but actually, it's my country, it's me, it's my...
Text_ortho: E be like sey na, I, I smuggle mysef enter di country, but meanwhile, na me get country, na me be my...

Text_en: I'm a citizen.
Text_ortho: I be citizen.

Text_en: The government should seriously stop all these promises of theirs, they should try to work out something for us uh... the origi-... or, or, uh... ordinary Nigerians so that we can get our hands on basic things.
Text_ortho: So serious one be sey make government stop all dese deir promises, meh dem try work out someting for us, di origi-... or, or, ehn ordinary Nigerians so dat make small tings tay dey reach our hands.

Text_en: Because if a guy does a bad thing, they will say he's a thief, but if a guy hustles, they will bring us back to square one.
Text_ortho: Because if person do bad ting now, de go say person don thief, but if person hustle, de go dey bring us go back to square one.

Text_en: So, at least, the government should try to do something somehow.
Text_ortho: So at least, make government try do someting any which way.

Text_en: But for me anyway, what I... I would not like the government to do... the government should try a little... they should create a few opportunities for people.
Text_ortho: Ehn for me sha, wetin me, I go not like government make do sey make government try small, make dem create small, small opportunities for people.

Text_en: At least, even if it is...
Text_ortho: At least, even if na...

Text_en: Because the time when...
Text_ortho: Because di time wey...

Text_en: I heard the time Buhari said he wanted to get into government, he said he will be giving every graduate five... five thousand, or some amount of money that they would use to start a business.
Text_ortho: I hear sey di time wey Buhari say e wan enter government, im talk sey im go dey give every graduate five, five k, or some amount of money wey go take start business.

Text_en: So, that kind of thing would make sense to help the country move forward a little.
Text_ortho: So dat kind ting go make sense so dat di country go move forward small.

Text_en: Because as they say, an idle man is the devil's workshop.
Text_ortho: Because everybody dey say idle man is a devil's workshop.

Text_en: A person who stays in one place, he will be thinking of how to steal, or how to kidnap a person, and that's what we don't want.
Text_ortho: Person wey sit down one place now, e go dey tink of how to take thief, or how to take kidnap person, and na wetin wesef no want.

Text_en: So the government should try to take, put some money into the economy so people can put food on the table.
Text_ortho: So make government try take, put some revenue inside make person take see food chop.

Text_en: Because sometimes, even some families, die of hunger.
Text_ortho: Because sometime, some family sef, na hungry dey kill dem.

Text_en: And they say they want the country to be fine, to be better, but the government is not doing anything.
Text_ortho: And de say de wan make di country fine meh better, but, di government no dey do anyting.

Text_en: Instead, all you hear is this one stole this, that one...
Text_ortho: Instead, you go dey hear sey dis one thief, dis one...

Text_en: This one says he wants to return this one, that one did that.
Text_ortho: Dis one say e wan return dis one, dis one do dis one.

Text_en: But we are the ones who... we are the ones who suffer more, the ones at the bottom.
Text_ortho: But na we wey dey, na we dey suffer am pass, we wey dey underground.

Text_en: So the government should make an effort.
Text_ortho: So make government try.

Text_en: That's why we voted them in.
Text_ortho: Dat'S why we vote dem in.

Text_en: They are supposed to protect us.
Text_ortho: De suppose dey protect us.

Text_en: They should try to cover us.
Text_ortho: Make dem try cover us up.

Text_en: They should arrange little... some little things for us.
Text_ortho: Make dem put small, some small tings for us.

Text_en: Even if it's just giving us a little money, to start a business, or do something.
Text_ortho: Even if na to give us small money, moh take start business, or do someting.

Text_en: It will make more sense than having people do things by themselves.
Text_ortho: E for make sense dan dis one wey people go dey do tings by demsef.

Text_en: In the end, they will still come and take it from the ground.
Text_ortho: At di end, de go still con come comot am from ground.

Text_en: Well, the problem I faced when I was little was when uh... my mother was fired the time I was in school.
Text_ortho: Ehn di incident wey I be face when I small na when ehn de bin sack my mama from work di time wey I dey school.

Text_en: Because my mother worked hard, made a little money, sent me abroad to go learn a little something.
Text_ortho: Because my mama bin hustle small money send me abroad now go learn small ting.

Text_en: So, that was how...
Text_ortho: So naim dey con...

Text_en: My mother then told me that they had dropped them from the worklist.
Text_ortho: My moder con call me sey de don drop dem from work o.

Text_en: That they were looking for younger people, they were in need of new people.
Text_ortho: Sey de dey find fresh blood, de dey wan new people.

Text_en: So, then they sacked the old ones without giving them anything.
Text_ortho: So de con sack di old one witout giving dem anyting.

Text_en: They just dropped them like that.
Text_ortho: De just drop dem like dat.

Text_en: That there was no more money in it.
Text_ortho: Sey money never come dis one.

Text_en: That was even before Goodluck got into power.
Text_ortho: Dat was even before Goodluck enter power o.

Text_en: Right up to now, we are still waiting.
Text_ortho: Even till now sef, we still dey wait.

Text_en: They are saying they will be calling.
Text_ortho: De dey say de go dey call.

Text_en: Every, every time they call, they say they want to collect names.
Text_ortho: Every, everytime de call, de talk sey de wan collect names.

Text_en: So-, even some of her colleagues, some have even died.
Text_ortho: So-... sotay some of her colleagues sef, some don even die.

Text_en: Others don't even know...
Text_ortho: Some no even know...

Text_en: We don't even know where some of the others are.
Text_ortho: We no even know where some dey.

Text_en: So, the thing is, many of us Nigerians have suffered to bring this country to where it is.
Text_ortho: So di ting be sey many of us, Nigerians don suffer to make dis country go where e go.

Text_en: The thing is that none of us is, is, is ev..., none of us is...
Text_ortho: Wetin be sey none of us dey, dey, dey ev-... none of us dey...

Text_en: The government is just looking.
Text_ortho: Government dey look.

Text_en: Uh... now in some countries like London for instance, they pay senior citizens.
Text_ortho: Ah for some countries now (like London now), de dey pay old citizens.

Text_en: People who have been in the country a long time, they give them a small allowance because they know they can't work like before.
Text_ortho: People wey don stay di country well, well, de dey give dem small allowances because de know sey de no fit too hustle like dat.

Text_en: So if the government can, even if it is not an allowance, they should pay people what they owe them.
Text_ortho: So if government go fit, even if no be allowances, make dem pay people wetin de owe dem.

Text_en: Like their fees, and money they are supposed to give them.
Text_ortho: Like deir fees, and money wey de suppose to give dem.

Text_en: Pensions, that will do.
Text_ortho: Pension money, dat ting go do.

Text_en: It will go a long way because most people, that is what they depend on.
Text_ortho: E go go long way because most people, na wetin de dey depend on.

Text_en: So, that's what I'm just begging the government to try to do.
Text_ortho: So na just wetin I just dey beg government meh dem try do be dat.

Text_en: The government should try to come up with a little something because we, we are suffering a lot.
Text_ortho: Make government try hustle out small ting because we sef, we dey suffer well, well.

Text_en: We are the ones who suffer more.
Text_ortho: Na we dey face am pass.

Text_en: If anything gets more expensive (fuel, or whatever else), it's the poor who suffer, because the rich have more money.
Text_ortho: If anyting increase (di fuel increase, or oders increase), na di poor man dey suffer am because rich man get money pass us.

Text_en: Because in Nigeria, it's like the poor are becoming poorer, and the rich, they are getting richer.
Text_ortho: Because for Nigeria, e be like sey na di poor ones dey get poor pass, and di rich ones, na im e con get money pass.

Text_en: Because it's like everything is getting worse.
Text_ortho: Because e be like sey everyting just dey go from bad to worst.

Text_en: So, the government should make an effort.
Text_ortho: So make government don try.

Text_en: Because I am not the only one, many of my mates too.
Text_ortho: Because no be only me, many of my mate too sef.

Text_en: Yesterday, for instance, one of my friends who stays in the same area as me, a bulldozer came to get rid of the shop where his mother sells food.
Text_ortho: Like yesterday, one of my friend wey we dey stay for di same area, bulldozer come con scatter di shop wey im mama take dey sell food.

Text_en: And that's how they get by.
Text_ortho: And na from dere de dey chop.

Text_en: It just scattered the food, including the cooler and the fridge too.
Text_ortho: Just scatter di food, even scatter plus cooler, and di fridge join.

Text_en: And after, they will say "we are one Nigeria."
Text_ortho: And after, de go say we are one Nigeria.

Text_en: So, that kind of thing makes no sense anymore.
Text_ortho: So dat kind ting no make sense now.

Text_en: Even if they want to move a person from where he is, they will first warn him to leave.
Text_ortho: Even if de wan comot person from where e dey, de go first warn am first meh e comot.

Text_en: Not that they will just come and do anything because they have power.
Text_ortho: No be sey de will just come con dey do anyhow because de get power.

Text_en: Because now in Nigeria, it's like the poor don't have any rights.
Text_ortho: Because now for Nigeria, e be like sey poor people no get right.

Text_en: And it doesn't make sense because all of us are one Nigeria.
Text_ortho: And e no make sense because all of us na one Nigeria.

Text_en: So, they should have made a little effort just to settle people.
Text_ortho: So de for don try small ting just tay arrange person.

Text_en: But don't make... don't make poor people... don't make people turn to crime now, and start to do what makes no sense.
Text_ortho: But meh, meh poor people, meh people no con turn to di side of crime now, con dey do wetin e no make sense now.

Text_en: So, that is just what I am begging of the government: let them be useful.
Text_ortho: So na wetin I just dey beg di government meh dem don dey useful.

Text_en: They should not just sit there talking about the twenty thirteen budget when it's twenty seventeen.
Text_ortho: Make dem not just sit down dere dey talk about twenty thirteen budget when we dey twenty seventeen.

Text_en: They should move forward little by little.
Text_ortho: Make de dey take di future small, small.

Text_en: They should not take it too far.
Text_ortho: Make dem no dey take am too far.

Text_en: Please, because we are the ones who suffer the most.
Text_ortho: Because na we dey suffer am pass abeg.

Text_en: This story I wanna tell now is about my own life experience.
Text_ortho: Dis story wen I wan give now, na about my own life experience.

Text_en: My mother and father are...
Text_ortho: My papa, and mama dey...

Text_en: They are from Etsako in Edo State, in Nigeria, where they had me.
Text_ortho: Dem na from Etsako in Edo State for inside Nigeria wey dem give birth to me.

Text_en: They gave birth to me, but they didn't just have me.
Text_ortho: As dem give birth to me, no be me alone dem give birth to o.

Text_en: There are eight of us.
Text_ortho: We be eight in number.

Text_en: We were six boys, and two girls.
Text_ortho: We con be six boys, and two girls.

Text_en: In the process, as you get older, life, it is full of different challenges.
Text_ortho: In process, as person dey grow for life, di life, e full of different challenges sha o.

Text_en: Though it's God who helps us all through.
Text_ortho: Though na God na im dey see us through.

Text_en: When we were growing up, as young children, when our parents gave... when they gave birth to us, we were strong, and healthy, and we were growing up well.
Text_ortho: When we dey grow up, as young children, our parents give us, give birth to us strong, and healthy, and we dey grow up well.

Text_en: We played outside, played when coming back to the house, went to school, came back home.
Text_ortho: Play go outside, play come house, go school, come back.

Text_en: One fateful day, then when I turned seven, I was going to school, we had started writing our final exam to go to the next class.
Text_ortho: One fateful day, den when I don reach seven years, wen I take go school we don dey write our final exam to go to di next class.

Text_en: I was in primary two then, ready to go to primary three.
Text_ortho: I dey primary two then to go to primary three.

Text_en: I didn't finish my exam.
Text_ortho: I no finish my exam.

Text_en: It was from there, I got sick and had to come back to the house.
Text_ortho: Na dere I for con sick come house.

Text_en: Then they rushed me back to the house.
Text_ortho: De con rush me come house.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: When my mother saw me, she said no, this one is not the one (Though my father had travelled, he was not around...)... she said this is not a case of self medication.
Text_ortho: When my mama con see how my body be, say no, dis one no be di one (though my papa travel, e no dey around), sey no be di one wen e go take put me for house dey do self medication.

Text_en: Then she swung into action.
Text_ortho: She con swing into action.

Text_en: With her nextdoor neighbour, they took me to a specialist hospital.
Text_ortho: With her oder neighbour, de con carry me go specialist hospital.

Text_en: When we got there, they said "no, uh... this one needs to be admitted straight away."
Text_ortho: When we reach dere, de say no ah dis one na admission straight o.

Text_en: Then they placed me on admission.
Text_ortho: De con put me for admission.

Text_en: Then they did a series of surgical operations, even before my father came back from his journey.
Text_ortho: Con do series of operation even before my papa con come from journey.

Text_en: As he came back from his journey, he said his body gave him signs, so he came back.
Text_ortho: As im come from journey say body give am sign, naim come back.

Text_en: Then he knew that uh... I was hospitalized.
Text_ortho: Con really see sey ah me dey on admission.

Text_en: Then we really tried everything, it was a battle for almost a year in that specialist...
Text_ortho: We con try o, battle o for almost a year for dat specialist.

Text_en: Then when they wanted to do renovation, they transferred me to UBTH.
Text_ortho: When de wan con do renovation, de con refer me to UBTH.

Text_en: They said no, I should go to UBTH.
Text_ortho: Sey no o, make I con go UBTH!

Text_en: So I was in UBTH.
Text_ortho: So I con dey UBTH.

Text_en: UBTH also placed me on admission, they did a series of surgical operations on my body.
Text_ortho: Ubth con still put me on admission, con do series of operation for my body.

Text_en: Then...
Text_ortho: Con...

Text_en: Well, they did a good job.
Text_ortho: De try sha.

Text_en: They brought me back to life.
Text_ortho: Sey de fit revive me back to life.

Text_en: At the end of the day, even on my sick bed, I was not even praying to live because the pain I was enduring at that time was too much, I was in an awful situation.
Text_ortho: At di end of di day, even me on my sick bed, I no even dey pray to even live because di pain wen I dey pass through at dat time dey too much, dey terribly bad.

Text_en: So we tried, tried, tried everything.
Text_ortho: So we try, try, try.

Text_en: Even the hospital could not make headway.
Text_ortho: Even di hospital no fit make headway.

Text_en: Then they said, okay, let's try native medicine.
Text_ortho: De con say okay make we try native.

Text_en: Then my parents took me to the villages, all sorts of villages.
Text_ortho: My parents con carry me go villages, different, different villages.

Text_en: One guy would bring his own medicine.
Text_ortho: Dis one go bring im own medicine.

Text_en: Another would would say, "ah, it's this.
Text_ortho: Dis one go say ah na dis one.

Text_en: Someone who had this disease took this one... it's this one... it cured him at the time."
Text_ortho: Person wey e sick dis one, na dis one e take cure am one time.

Text_en: They did all sorts of things.
Text_ortho: Dem do different types of things.

Text_en: Some would say no.
Text_ortho: Some go say no o.

Text_en: You should do a sacrifice.
Text_ortho: Na to do sacrifice.

Text_en: Do all the sacrifice for...
Text_ortho: Do all di sacrifice for...

Text_en: All these ones I am telling you now, it took us seven years.
Text_ortho: All dis one I dey tell you so, e con take over seven years.

Text_en: So even my parents got tired.
Text_ortho: So even my parents con tire.

Text_en: Even my father got tired.
Text_ortho: My papa sef con tire.

Text_en: He then realised the truth.
Text_ortho: E con see as di matter be.

Text_en: He said, this one is... it's either I live, or I go to the other side.
Text_ortho: E say dis one na, is either I live, or I go di oder side of the world.

Text_en: Then he said he could not continue anymore.
Text_ortho: E con say e no fit anymore.

Text_en: Then he moved me from the village to town, and said that whatever happens, we will accept it.
Text_ortho: Con move me from village come town say anything wey happen, we go take am like dat.

Text_en: Glory be to God!
Text_ortho: To God be di glory!

Text_en: October... (but I cannot remember the exact year now) October... (just after seven years)... a... October second, it was that day [eng that I found my healing eng].
Text_ortho: October (but I no go fit remember di exact year now), October (when e just be seven years), October second, na dat day na im I found my healing.

Text_en: And this time, I went back to the church.
Text_ortho: And dis time, I con come back to di church.

Text_en: I will say that for this one, my life is a miracle.
Text_ortho: I go say for dis one, my life na miracle.

Text_en: You know, I didn't get healed at the herbalist's.
Text_ortho: You know, I no find my healing for di herbalist place.

Text_en: I did not get healed at the hospital where I went.
Text_ortho: I no find my healings for di hospital wen I go.

Text_en: It was in the church, when we came back to the church, where we were born, which... which is the Roman Catholic Church, it was there I found my miracle, I found my healing.
Text_ortho: Na church wen we con come back to di church wen dem born us put which, wen be di Roman Catholic Church na dere me con find my miracle wen I con take find my healing.

Text_en: This dish, the dish I want to teach you all how to cook, is egusi.
Text_ortho: Dis soup, di soup wey I wan teach una how to cook, na egusi soup.

Text_en: The way to cook egusi is to take out your egusi seeds, and grind them.
Text_ortho: How dey take dey cook egusi soup be sey you go bring out your egusi, you go grind am.

Text_en: Mstchew.
Text_ortho: Mtschew!

Text_en: If you finish grinding, you can use...
Text_ortho: If you grind am finish, you fit use...

Text_en: Some use a grinding stone to grind it, some use me- uh... a grinding machine to grind it, some use a blender to grind it.
Text_ortho: Some dey use grinding stone grind am, some dey use me-... eh grinding machine grind am, some dey use blender dey grind am.

Text_en: However you do it, the esugi is smooth.
Text_ortho: Anyone wey you provided, di egusi smooth.

Text_en: When it is smooth... it has turned to powder, you put it into a bowl, you put it into a plastic bowl.
Text_ortho: If e don smooth, don turn powder, you turn am put inside bowl, you put am inside rubber.

Text_en: You put it into a plastic bowl.
Text_ortho: You turn am put inside rubber.

Text_en: Once you've put it in the plastic bowl, you add a little water, you stir it.
Text_ortho: When you don put am inside di rubber, you add small water, you turn am.

Text_en: You can add chilli peppers.
Text_ortho: You fit put pepper inside.

Text_en: Once you've added your peppers, slice your onions and put them inside.
Text_ortho: You put pepper inside, slice your onions put inside.

Text_en: Some like to fry it while others don't.
Text_ortho: Some of dem dey like to fry am while some people no dey like.

Text_en: Some like to fry it, others don't.
Text_ortho: Some dey like to fry, some no dey like to fry am.

Text_en: But I want to tell you the one that th-... you...
Text_ortho: But I wan tell you di one wey de, you...

Text_en: Uh... it is the fried one I want to tell you about now.
Text_ortho: Ehn na di frying aspect own na im I wan tell you so.

Text_en: For the fried version, as you put it into the bowl, you turn it and that's it.
Text_ortho: Di frying aspect be sey as you put am inside bowl, you turn am finish.

Text_en: You put the uh... onions inside the ma-... uh... inside the egusi.
Text_ortho: You put di eh onions inside di ma-... eh inside di egusi.

Text_en: You turn, eh you..., you put the..., uh... sliced onions into it.
Text_ortho: You turn, eh you, you put di, eh slice onions put.

Text_en: You stir it well.
Text_ortho: You stir am finish.

Text_en: Once you have finished stirring it, you put it into the hot oil.
Text_ortho: After you don stir am finish, you turn am put inside di hot oil.

Text_en: But you don't wait for the oil to bleach before you put everything inside.
Text_ortho: But you no go wait meh di oil bleach before you turn everything put.

Text_en: When you have finished putting it inside, inside the ho-, uh... hot oil, you then keep stirring it so that it will not burn.
Text_ortho: When you don turn am inside, put inside di ho-... eh hot oil, you con still dey turn am so that e no go burn.

Text_en: You keep stirring it until uh... the egusi has changed colour.
Text_ortho: You go still dey turn am, dey turn until eh egusi don change colour.

Text_en: Once it has changed colour inside that pot, it has changed colour a little, you see the cu-... the co-... uh... difference in colour, then, you add water.
Text_ortho: Once e don change colour inside dat pot, e don change colour small, you don see di cu-... di co-... eh difference in colour finish, den, you go con add water.

Text_en: If it's meat stock, if it's meat stock, you add... you pour it inside.
Text_ortho: If na meat water, if na meat water, you add, you pour am inside.

Text_en: Once you've poured the meat stock inside the, the... inside the dish, you stir it a little.
Text_ortho: Once you don pour di meat water inside di, di, inside di soup, you go con turn am small.

Text_en: Leave it to boil.
Text_ortho: Leave am make e boil.

Text_en: But before it boils, you have put all your maggi, your salt, your crayfish.
Text_ortho: But before e go boil, you go don put all your maggi, your salt, your crayfish.

Text_en: If it's locust bean cake you have, you stir it into the dish.
Text_ortho: If na dawadawa you get, you turn am put.

Text_en: Once you have finished putting it in, and it has finished boiling, then you add your meat.
Text_ortho: Once you don put am finish, e don boil finish, den you put your meat.

Text_en: If the meat is not soft yet, you add it when you put all your ingredients so that everything boils together.
Text_ortho: If di meat never soft, you put am dat period wey be sey you dey put all your ingredients so dat everyting go boil together.

Text_en: Once everything has boiled together, everything has finished boiling, then you add...
Text_ortho: Once everything don boil together, everything don boil finish, before you go con add.

Text_en: If it's bitter leaf that you have, that you want to put inside, you add it; if it's pumpkin leaf that you want to put inside, add it.
Text_ortho: If na bitter leaf you get o, you wan put inside, you put, if na pumpkin leaf you wan put inside, you put inside.

Text_en: Then, add salt.
Text_ortho: Den, you put salt.

Text_en: Then leave it to boil.
Text_ortho: Den you leave am make e boil.

Text_en: If it has boiled very well, it has boiled very very well, as you see that it has boiled very very well, taste it.
Text_ortho: If e don boil well, e don boil well, well, as you see am say e dey boil well, well, you taste am.

Text_en: If the taste st-... if the taste ni-... it doesn't taste how you want, add more again.
Text_ortho: If di taste st-... if di taste ni, e no meet up to di taste wey you want, you still add.

Text_en: If it's the salt that is not sufficient yet, add a little more salt.
Text_ortho: If na salt never dey am, you add small salt join am.

Text_en: Then when it has finished boiling, bring it down.
Text_ortho: Den when e don boil finish, you bring am down.

Text_en: If it's garri you wanna have with it, uh... that you want to eat it with, use garri.
Text_ortho: If na garri you wan use eat, eh you wan use take am, use garri.

Text_en: If uh... It's eba, use eba.
Text_ortho: If eh dat's eba, you use eba.

Text_en: If it's mashed yam that you want to use, use mashed yam.
Text_ortho: If na pounded yam you wan use, you use pounded yam.

Text_en: If it's semo, use semo, or amala.
Text_ortho: If na semo, you use semo, or amala.

Text_en: Any one, any food you want to eat it with, it's... you can use it to eat it.
Text_ortho: Anyone, any food wey you wan use eat am, na you fit use am eat.

Text_en: The dish that I like to cook, is, it's banga.
Text_ortho: Di soup wey I like to cook, na im be banga soup.

Text_en: Because banga is natural oil.
Text_ortho: Because banga na natural oil.

Text_en: That's what banga is.
Text_ortho: Na im dey banga.

Text_en: To cook a dish of banga, you need to extract the oil and keep it.
Text_ortho: To cook banga soup, you go fit remove oil keep for inside.

Text_en: If you want to use the oil, you can use it.
Text_ortho: If you wan use di oil, go let you use!

Text_en: And banga is a dish that's good for the body.
Text_ortho: And banga na soup wey be sey e good for body.

Text_en: Even our doctors nowadays, they are encouraging us to cook it.
Text_ortho: Even our doctors nowadays, dem dey encourage us make we dey cook am.

Text_en: So, I will teach you how to cook banga.
Text_ortho: So I go teach una di method to take cook di banga.

Text_en: One you have b-, bought your banga at the market, make sure that you wash it very well.
Text_ortho: Once you don b-... buy your banga for market, make sure sey you wash am very well.

Text_en: Or maybe it's from your backyard you pick it.
Text_ortho: Or maybe na your backyard you for cut am.

Text_en: Make sure that you wash it very well.
Text_ortho: Make sure sey you wash am very well.

Text_en: Put it into a pot.
Text_ortho: You put am for pot.

Text_en: It's done...
Text_ortho: E done.

Text_en: If the banga is done, you will smell the aroma that tells you it's done.
Text_ortho: If di banga don done, you self go dey hear di aroma sey di thing don done.

Text_en: Once it is done, after twenty or twenty five minutes, you remove it.
Text_ortho: Once e don done, for twenty, or twenty five minutes, you go remove am.

Text_en: You pound it in a mortar.
Text_ortho: You go pound am for mortar.

Text_en: When you pound it in a mortar, make sure that all the husk, the edges, eh the back shell which you have pounded, is all smooth.
Text_ortho: When you pound am for mortar, you go make sure sey all di kanda, di edge, eh di back shell wey you pound, all smooth.

Text_en: Because if it's not smooth, the oil doesn't come out very well.
Text_ortho: Because if e no smooth, di oil no go come out very well.

Text_en: Once it's done, after twenty or twenty five minutes, you remove it.
Text_ortho: But if e smooth, you go fit get your oil, and di flavour wey you dey find for inside.

Text_en: So once you've pounded it very well in a mortar, then you filter it with hot water.
Text_ortho: So once you don pound am very well for mortar, den you go filter am with hot water.

Text_en: Some, they say they dont want it to be too watery.
Text_ortho: Some, de go say de no want make di thing too dey watery.

Text_en: But by the time you have used enough water to filter it well, that is when the thing comes out well.
Text_ortho: But by di time wey you go use enough water take filter am well, na im di thing go come out well.

Text_en: Ehen!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: But banga really takes uh... time to cook!
Text_ortho: Dough banga soup dey take eh time o.

Text_en: Now if you're using firewood, you see that yes, it is quick.
Text_ortho: If na fire wood now, you go know sey yes e go quick.

Text_en: The dish gets thick fast.
Text_ortho: Di soup go quick thick.

Text_en: But if it's a gas cooker, if it's a stove, be ready to use enough gas, and enough kerosene.
Text_ortho: But if na gas, if na stove, go ready to use enough gas, and enough kerosine.

Text_en: But that doesnt mean anything.
Text_ortho: But dat one no mean.

Text_en: To get the typical result, it... that's what matters.
Text_ortho: For us to arrive at our normal result, na, na im make am.

Text_en: Because if you dont use hot water to rinse it well, the banga will still stick to the kernel, and that is, is a waste.
Text_ortho: Because if you no use hot water take rinse am well, di banga go still follow di kernel comot, and dat one na, na waste.

Text_en: So you need to use hot water to wash it well.
Text_ortho: So you need to use hot water take wash am well.

Text_en: You should take your time.
Text_ortho: You go take your time.

Text_en: So if it's meat you want to cook it with, if it's fresh fish, if it's... if it's ponmo, it is good because even before the ponmo is cooked the preparation will have thickened.
Text_ortho: So if na meat you wan use take cook am, if na fresh fish, if na, if na ponmo, e go even good because before ponmo go even done for fire, di soup go don thick.

Text_en: But if it's meat, it's still good.
Text_ortho: But if na meat, e still good.

Text_en: If it's fresh fish, make sure that the ban-... the soup has thickened up a little before you add your fresh fish.
Text_ortho: If na fresh fish, you go know sey di ban-... di soup go don thick small before you put your fresh fish.

Text_en: We know that our fresh fish is... it's not tough.
Text_ortho: Shey we know sey our fresh fish na, e no get power.

Text_en: In less than five or ten minutes, it is done.
Text_ortho: Under five, or ten minutes, e don done.

Text_en: So any of those uh... uh... meats we want to use, we use them.
Text_ortho: So anyone wey we wan use inside all dis eh eh meat, we go use am.

Text_en: Use them to... use them to cook the dish so it's thick.
Text_ortho: Take do, eh take cook di soup so dat di thing go dey thick.

Text_en: Then if it's starch you want to eat it with, if it's semo... but banga, starch is what goes well with it, so it tastes good.
Text_ortho: Den if na starch you wan take eat am o if na semo o but according to banga soup sha, na starch na im go wit am so dat e go dey well.

Text_en: Some say they dont like starch.
Text_ortho: Some go say de no like starch.

Text_en: The way they stir it like it's... it's liquid.
Text_ortho: Di way dem dey turn am wey be sey e dey, e dey draw.

Text_en: But me, I want to tell you that if you stir that starch, if you add salt, if you put it on the plate, it will be very very easy to serve.
Text_ortho: But me, I wan tell una sey if una dey turn dat starch, if una put salt, if you dey cut am for plate, e go dey very, very easy to cut.

Text_en: Now those who say they don't eat salt, (it doesnt mean that you dont eat salt, but at least, if it's only a pinch of salt, you put some inside) turn the starch with it so that you can eat.
Text_ortho: Now those wey be sey dem go say dem no dey eat salt (e no mean sey you no dey eat salt, but at least, if na pinch of salt, you go put am inside) take turn di starch so dat e go let you eat.

Text_en: To train a child in fashion design, first we interview them to see how much they know.
Text_ortho: To train pikin for fashion, we go first interview di person to know where e go school reach.

Text_en: Why do we interview them?
Text_ortho: Why we dey interview am?

Text_en: So that us seamstresses, we'll know where to start with the person.
Text_ortho: Make we wey we be di sewing mistress, meh we know where we for start with dat person.

Text_en: Because if they're schooled, a small job is what we'll do with them.
Text_ortho: Because if na who go school, na small work na im we go do follow di person.

Text_en: But if they're not schooled, we'll start from scratch.
Text_ortho: But if e no go school, na im be sey we go start from di grassroot.

Text_en: For someone schooled, pedalling the machine won't be hard.
Text_ortho: Because who go school, to pedal machine, e no go hard am.

Text_en: Because that's the first process.
Text_ortho: Because dat one na di first process.

Text_en: We will teach them to pedal.
Text_ortho: We go teach am to pedal.

Text_en: And this pedalling now, it goes in two directions.
Text_ortho: And dis pedaling of machine now, na two ways.

Text_en: We pedal forward, we pedal backward.
Text_ortho: We go pedal go front, we go pedal go back.

Text_en: Backwards isn't easy at all.
Text_ortho: Dat back own no be am at all.

Text_en: It breaks needles.
Text_ortho: Dat one dey break needle.

Text_en: But if you're pedalling forward, you will know that yes, you're on the line.
Text_ortho: But if you dey pedal go front, you go know sey yes you dey di line.

Text_en: And with someone who's educated you know, you will know that yes, it's forward they're pedalling.
Text_ortho: And who go school now, you go know sey yes na front im dey pedal come.

Text_en: But someone who did not go to school, they'll just be pedalling for pedalling's sake.
Text_ortho: But who no go school, e go just dey pedal for pedaling sake.

Text_en: But if you look at it, you'll know they're pedalling backwards.
Text_ortho: But if you look am, you go know sey na back na im dey pedal go.

Text_en: And the way they're pedalling backwards, it won't sew.
Text_ortho: And dat back wey im dey pedal go, e no go fit sew.

Text_en: But if they're pedalling forward, it's fine.
Text_ortho: But if e dey pedal come front, you go know sey yes, na make up.

Text_en: For someone who is schooled, pedalling won't be hard for them.
Text_ortho: Person be sey im go school, to pedal, e no go hard am.

Text_en: But if they didn't go to school, us seamstresses, we'll need to take time to sit down on the machine.
Text_ortho: But if e no go school, we wey be sewing mistress, we go need to take time to sit down for machine.

Text_en: As we are pedalling, they'll be watching our legs.
Text_ortho: As we dey pedal, e go dey look our leg.

Text_en: They'll know we're pedalling forward.
Text_ortho: E go know sey na front na im we dey pedal go.

Text_en: But for someone schooled, we don't need to do all this for them.
Text_ortho: But who go school, we no need all dose process for am.

Text_en: We'll just give 'em a machine and say 'here you go, pedal!'
Text_ortho: Na just to give am one machine say take, dey pedal!

Text_en: And if you give them a machine, we will need to remove the needle.
Text_ortho: And if you give am one machine, we go need to remove di needle.

Text_en: Why we remove the needle that's there is so it won't crack, because if we dont remove the needle, if it cracks and we put in thread and are sewing, our sewing... our stitchings will not be fine at all.
Text_ortho: Why we dey remove di needle wey dey be sey so dat e no go crack dat needle because if we no remove di needle, if e crack dat needle we put thread we dey sew, our sewing, our stitching no go fine at all.

Text_en: This is why we take out the needle.
Text_ortho: Na im make us dey remove di needle.

Text_en: But for someone who happens to have gone to school, if they're pedalling forward, we just do a bit of work on them.
Text_ortho: But person wey be sey e go school, e dey pedal come front, na small work na im we go do for dat person body.

Text_en: We'll just take that pedalling work...
Text_ortho: We just take dat pedaling work.

Text_en: Just, if they're someone really, really smart, we, uh... teaching them the pedalling work... takes maybe a week.
Text_ortho: Just, if na person wey clever well, well, we, eh to teach am pedaling work, maybe a week.

Text_en: But someone who is not schooled, uh... after a month we'll still be teaching them to pedal.
Text_ortho: But who no go school, eh a month, we go still dey teach am how to pedal.

Text_en: Like with a kid who's just starting to grow, you'll be teaching him how to eat uh... solid food.
Text_ortho: Be like pikin wey newly dey grow, dey teach am how to eat ehn solid food.

Text_en: Not milk, not custard anymore.
Text_ortho: No be milk, no be custard again.

Text_en: So let's see...
Text_ortho: So meh we see...

Text_en: That's what makes us ask for someone's level of education before we know how to get into the details with them on our fashion design work.
Text_ortho: Na im make us dey ask di level wey di person go school reach before we know how to go in detail wid am for dis our fashion work.

Text_en: But if they know how to pedal, that means that we will give them cement paper, or brown paper, we will thread the needle so they can sew with a needle.
Text_ortho: But if e don sabi pedal now, na be sey we go give am cement paper, or brown paper, we go put am for needle meh e take dey sew wid needle.

Text_en: If they're sewing in a straight line, you know that if you give them cloth as a sample, they will be able to sew straight.
Text_ortho: If e dey sew straight, you go know sey if you give am cloth as sample, e go fit sew straight.

Text_en: But if they don't sew straight, you'll know that if you give them cloth, or pieces, that they should sew on it, they won't be able to sew very well.
Text_ortho: But if e no sew straight, you go know sey if you give am cloth, or pieces sey make e take sew, e no go fit sew well.

Text_en: So, that's the thing.
Text_ortho: So na im be di thing.

Text_en: Ladies, good afternoon!
Text_ortho: My women, una good afternoon o.

Text_en: I hope you have a safe delivery.
Text_ortho: I wish una safe delivery.

Text_en: I want to talk to you about immunization.
Text_ortho: I want talk to una about immunisation.

Text_en: Don't get angry.
Text_ortho: Meh una no vex o.

Text_en: I will take some of your time.
Text_ortho: I go take part of una time.

Text_en: I want to tell you about immunization because there are women here.
Text_ortho: I wan tell una about immunisation because some women dey here.

Text_en: It's in the village, that's where they are.
Text_ortho: Na village na im dem dey.

Text_en: They will go to the farm.
Text_ortho: De go go farm.

Text_en: They dont know what they call immunization.
Text_ortho: De no know wetin dem dey call immunisation.

Text_en: But it's good we let you know what immunization is.
Text_ortho: But e good make we let una know wetin be immunisation.

Text_en: Immunization is when you give birth to a child, you take it to the hospital, to be given an injection.
Text_ortho: Immunisation na when you born pikin, you carry am go hospital, go give am injection.

Text_en: If we look at our world nowadays, if you have a baby and you fail to get it vaccinated (for instance, BCG is the first one you will take), if you fail to get it a BCG shot, another person will not be able to carry it, apart from you alone.
Text_ortho: If we will look our world wey we dey nowadays, if you born pikin, you never give am immunisation (like BCG now, na im be di first one wey you go first take), if you never give am BCG, anoder person no go fit carry am apart from only you.

Text_en: But if you get it BCG, everyone else will be able to carry it.
Text_ortho: But if you don give am BCG now, every other person go fit still carry am.

Text_en: That's the first one you'll give it right after birth.
Text_ortho: Dat one na di first one wey you first give am just after you born am finish.

Text_en: Then, there's another one that will be given again a month later.
Text_ortho: Den e still get di one wey de still give her again after one month.

Text_en: After a month, they will give it in its hand.
Text_ortho: If e don complete one month, you go give am for im hand.

Text_en: That one, it will be given to it in its hand.
Text_ortho: Dat one you go give am for hand so.

Text_en: If any sicknesses come, the child will be able to resist them.
Text_ortho: If any sickness dey come, di pikin go fit withstand am.

Text_en: Because all this immunization we're talking about, if we dont get it for our children, thats what makes some people give birth and say that after a while the child died.
Text_ortho: Because all dis immunisation wey we dey talk so, if we no give our pikin, na im make am some go born, dem go say after some time, di pikin die.

Text_en: They dont know what killed the child.
Text_ortho: Dem no know wetin kill di pikin.

Text_en: All these ones, that is what is...
Text_ortho: All dis one, na im be wetin dey...

Text_en: All this is what makes us say it's good to get our children vaccinated.
Text_ortho: Na all dis na im be wetin make us say e good make we immunise our pikin.

Text_en: If we look at this immunization, children get vaccinated before they are nine months... one year.
Text_ortho: If we look dis immunisation, pikin dey take immunisation go reach nine months, a year.

Text_en: Even uh... this uh... polio which is getting around which makes a child... you will give birth to a child and it won't walk on time!
Text_ortho: Even ehn dis ehn polio wey e dey waka wey be sey pikin go you go born pikin, e no go quick waka!

Text_en: You will give birth to a child, and he'll look like an imbecile.
Text_ortho: You go born pikin, e go be like imbecile.

Text_en: It's the advantage of...
Text_ortho: Na advantage of...

Text_en: When you immunize... immunize our children, all these diseases won't get close to your child.
