Text_ortho: When you go immunize, immunize our pikin, all dese sickness no go near dat pikin.

Text_en: That's what I want to tell you all.
Text_ortho: Na wetin I wan tell una be dat.

Text_en: Thank you.
Text_ortho: Una do well.

Text_en: Good afternoon, my countrymen!
Text_ortho: My country people, una good afternoon!

Text_en: This is the one o'clock news coming to you from Bronze FM, one O one point five in Benin City.
Text_ortho: Dis one na tori for one o'clock wey dey reach una from Bronze FM, one O one dot five for Benin City.

Text_en: And this is Allen Ujewa, bringing you the news.
Text_ortho: And na me, Allen Ujewa wan give una di tori.

Text_en: Edo State Government has told bus drivers to park first at Oba Akenzua Cultural Centre so that the passengers won't suffer.
Text_ortho: Edo State Government don tell bus drivers to dey park first for Oba Akenzua Cultural Centre so dat people wey dey enter motor no go dey suffer.

Text_en: At the time the Chief of Staff, Oga Taiwo Akerele, was speaking to journalists in Robota Hall, saying that the government knows people are walking long distances to board busses.
Text_ortho: Di time di chief of staff, Oga Taiwo Akerele dey talk to tori people for Robota Hall, e con talk sey government know sey people dey trek long distance o before de fit take bus.

Text_en: But he then said that they have been doing everything to create permanent bus stops.
Text_ortho: But e con talk sey dem don dey do everything to create permanent bus stop.

Text_en: The Curator in the National Museum in Edo State, Mr Theophillus Omogbai, told the Federal and State Governments to rearrange the museums in the country to make sure that they can meet world standards to help boost tourism in the country.
Text_ortho: Di curator for National Museum for Edo State, Oga Theophilus Omogbai don tell Federal and State Government to rearrange museum for di country to see sey e fit meet world standard so dat e go boost di tourism for di country.

Text_en: Mr Omogbai said this while he was talking to Radio Nigeria during this year's International Museum Day, which was held on the eighteenth of May.
Text_ortho: Oga Omogbai talk dis one di time e dey talk to Radio Nigeria for dis year International Museum Day wey dem do for May eighteenth.

Text_en: Mr Omogbai said that Nigerian people don't visit museums.
Text_ortho: Oga Omogbai wey con fit talk sey people for Nigeria, dem no dey patronise museum o.

Text_en: That's what is causing the poor economic situation of the tourism sector in Nigeria, unlike other countries.
Text_ortho: Sey na wetin be sey dey cause di poor economic matter for tourism sector for Nigeria unlike other countries.

Text_en: The National President of the Nigerian Union of Women Journalists (NAWOJ), Comrade Ifeyinwa Omowole, called on women to be at the forefront in the socioeconomic development of the country.
Text_ortho: National President Nigerian Union of Women Journalists, NAWOJ, Comrade Ifeyinwa Omowole, e don call on women to dey di forefront for di socioeconomic development of di country.

Text_en: Comrade Omowole said this during the programme called Newsmaker on Bronze FM in Benin.
Text_ortho: Comrade Omowole talk dis one for di programme wey dem dey call Newsmaker for Bronze FM for Benin.

Text_en: On this matter, she said that no nation will develop without women getting involved in the country.
Text_ortho: On top dis matter, she con talk sey no nation go develop without women no dey involve for di country.

Text_en: A seventy four year old man, Mr Habibu Ogiator, who was kidnapped when he was going to his farm in Etsako East Local Government Area, has been released.
Text_ortho: One seventy four year old man, Oga Habibu Ogiator wey dem be gbab hide di time e dey go farm for Etsako East Local Government Area, dem don release am.

Text_en: According to Mr Ogiator, he said (at the time he was telling this story), he then said that he had been in the custody of these people who kidnapped him for two days before they released him at last.
Text_ortho: According to Oga Ogiator, e say (di time e dey talk dis story), e con talk sey e be dey di hand of dis people wey kpaki am hide for two days before dem con free am last, last.

Text_en: He then hailed the people of Ujendu Community for the way they handled the matter, which made them release him.
Text_ortho: E con still hail di kins men of Ujendu community for di way dem take handle di matter o wey come make dem fit release am.

Text_en: And he then used the opportunity to beg the police and other security personnel to improve the security in the area.
Text_ortho: And e con use di opportunity take beg police people dem, and oder security people sey make dem abeg improve for security matter for di area.

Text_en: My countrymen, this is where the one o'clock news will end, coming to you from Bronze FM, one O one point five in Benin City.
Text_ortho: My country people, na here tori for one o'clock reach, and e reach una from Bronze FM, one o one dot five for Benin City.

Text_en: My name is Allen Ujewa.
Text_ortho: My name na Allen Ujewa.

Text_en: Good afternoon.
Text_ortho: Una good afternoon!

Text_en: There was this woman, she had three boys.
Text_ortho: E get dis woman, e get three boys.

Text_en: So, she cooked porridge.
Text_ortho: So e con cook porridge.

Text_en: Then she asked them if they'd eat it.
Text_ortho: She con ask whether dem go eat.

Text_en: They said no.
Text_ortho: De say no.

Text_en: Then she left and went to the market.
Text_ortho: Con comot, con go market.

Text_en: As she came back, the last born had already gone and eaten everything.
Text_ortho: As e come back, di last born don already go dere, don go eat everyting.

Text_en: Then he put plenty of sand and water.
Text_ortho: Con put sandsand, con put water.

Text_en: The woman came back and asked them, "who ate the food?"
Text_ortho: Di woman con come back, con ask dem who eat di food?

Text_en: Then they said it wasn't them, it wasn't them.
Text_ortho: Dem con say no be dem, no be dem.

Text_en: Then he told her that it was the last born, he was the one who went to the kitchen and he forgot his cap.
Text_ortho: E con tell am sey but na di last born na im come kitchen say e forget e cap.

Text_en: Then she said, "let's go swim in the river."
Text_ortho: Con den say am meh de go river, go swim.

Text_en: When they got there, the first one sang, "if I'm the one who ate this food, if I'm the one who ate this food, Kpangolo must swallow me, the fish must swallow me."
Text_ortho: When de con reach there, di first one con sing if na me eat dis food, if na me eat dis food, Kpangolo must to swallow me, fish must to swallow me.

Text_en: Ehen.
Text_ortho: Ehen.

Text_en: Then he crossed, nothing swallowed him.
Text_ortho: Naim con cross, noting swallow.

Text_en: The second one.
Text_ortho: Di second one.

Text_en: "If I'm the one who ate this food, if I'm the one who ate this food, Kpangolo must swallow me, the fish must swallow me."
Text_ortho: If na me eat dis food, if na me eat dis food, Kpangolo must to swallow me, fish must to swallow me.

Text_en: Ehn, nothing.
Text_ortho: Ehn nothing.

Text_en: Then it was the last one's turn.
Text_ortho: E con reach di last one.

Text_en: He sang, "if I'm the one, who ate this..."
Text_ortho: E con sing if na me eat dis...

Text_en: "Speak up!"
Text_ortho: Talk loud!

Text_en: "If I'm the one who ate this food, if I'm..."
Text_ortho: If na me eat dis food, if na...

Text_en: "Speak up, let them hear you!"
Text_ortho: Talk loud, make de hear you!

Text_en: "If I'm the one who ate this soup, Kpangolo must swallow me, the fish..."
Text_ortho: If na me eat dis soup, Kpangolo must to swallow me, fish...

Text_en: He didnt even finish singing.
Text_ortho: E never even sing am finish.

Text_en: A fish just swallowed him like that.
Text_ortho: Na so fish just swallow am.

Text_en: This woman, she had three children.
Text_ortho: Dis woman, e get three children.

Text_en: So, she cooked porridge.
Text_ortho: So e con cook porridge.

Text_en: Then she asked them if they'd eat it.
Text_ortho: E con ask dem sey eida dem go eat.

Text_en: They said no.
Text_ortho: De say no sey dem no eat.

Text_en: So she said "I want to go to the market" and then she went to the market.
Text_ortho: So as she con talk sey I wan go market, she con go market.

Text_en: Before she came back, the last born had already gone into the kitchen and eaten the food.
Text_ortho: Before e come back, di last born don already enter kitchen, don go eat di food.

Text_en: So the mother asked, "who ate this food?"
Text_ortho: So Mama con ask who eat dis food?

Text_en: Then they said it wasn't them, it wasn't them.
Text_ortho: De say no be dem, no be dem.

Text_en: Then, their mother said, "let's go swim in the river."
Text_ortho: Deir mama con talk sey oya moh we go river, go swim.

Text_en: Then they went to the river, and they swam.
Text_ortho: Con go river, de con swim.

Text_en: Then the first child sang "if I'm the one who ate this food, if I'm the one who ate this food, Kpangolo must swallow me, the fish must swallow me."
Text_ortho: Di first born con sing if na me eat dis food, if na me eat dis food, Kpangolo must to swallow me, fish must to swallow me.

Text_en: Ehen!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: Ehen, he crossed the river.
Text_ortho: Ehen e con cross di river.

Text_en: Nothing swallowed him.
Text_ortho: Noting swallow am.

Text_en: The second child.
Text_ortho: Second born.

Text_en: "If I'm the one who ate this food, if I'm the one who ate this food, Kpangolo must swallow me, the fish must swallow me."
Text_ortho: If na me eat dis food, if na me eat dis food, Kpangolo must to swallow me, fish must to swallow me.

Text_en: He crossed like that.
Text_ortho: Naim e con cross.

Text_en: Nothing.
Text_ortho: Noting.

Text_en: Then, it was the last one's turn.
Text_ortho: E con reach di last born.

Text_en: "If I'm the one who ate this food, if I'm the one who ate this food, Kpangolo..."
Text_ortho: If na me eat dis food, if na me eat dis food, Kpangolo...

Text_en: "Speak up, we can't hear you."
Text_ortho: Talk loud, we no dey hear you.

Text_en: "If I'm the one who ate this food, if..."
Text_ortho: If na me eat dis food, if...

Text_en: "Speak up!"
Text_ortho: Talk loud!

Text_en: "If I'm the one who ate this food, if I'm the one who ate this food, Kpangolo must swallow me, the fish must swallow me."
Text_ortho: If na me eat dis food, if na me eat dis food, Kpangolo must to swallow me, fish must to swallow me.

Text_en: He didn't even finish singing.
Text_ortho: E never even sing am finish.

Text_en: A fish just came out like that and swallowed him.
Text_ortho: Na so fish just come outside, fish con swallow.

Text_en: The clever girl, who was smarter than the king.
Text_ortho: Clever girl wey get sense pass di king.

Text_en: There was this, uh...
Text_ortho: Dere was dis eh...

Text_en: The, this girl was in this village.
Text_ortho: Di, dis girl dey dis village.

Text_en: The father was proud of her for being clever, she is well read, she is clever.
Text_ortho: Papa dey proud of her sey im pikin, e dey clever, im pikin know book, im dey clever.

Text_en: The father was proud of her.
Text_ortho: Papa dey proud of her.

Text_en: So, the king told him...
Text_ortho: So di king con tell am...

Text_en: Uh, so the king heard about it.
Text_ortho: Eh king con dey hear am.

Text_en: So he was, so he was hearing that the man...
Text_ortho: Con dey, con dey hear di man sey...

Text_en: The man was was saying that the child was proud, the child was very wise.
Text_ortho: Di man dey talk sey im pikin dey proud, pikin get sense well, well.

Text_en: The child was clever.
Text_ortho: Sey pikin clever.

Text_en: So the king asked the man to come one day.
Text_ortho: King con call di man come one day.

Text_en: He told him, "I hear you're saying that your child is clever. Ge-, get, she's got more sense than than anyone."
Text_ortho: Con tell am sey I dey hear you dey talk sey your pikin dey clever, ge-... get, e get sense pass everybody.

Text_en: The man said, "yes."
Text_ortho: Di man con talk say yes.

Text_en: He said she is very clever.
Text_ortho: Sey e clever well, well.

Text_en: So the King said, "okay, since you said your daughter is clever, take these eggs."
Text_ortho: Naim di king con talk sey okay since you say your daughter clever, carry dis egg.

Text_en: "The eggs, if no one breaks them with their hands, will they hatch by themselves?"
Text_ortho: Shey egg, mey dem no use hand break, e go fit hatch by itself?

Text_en: "Will a chicken hatch?"
Text_ortho: Chicken go come outside?

Text_en: They said, "yes."
Text_ortho: De say yes.

Text_en: Then he said, "now, take them home to your child."
Text_ortho: Con talk sey oya carry am go give your pikin for house.

Text_en: "Tell your child that she should hatch these eggs. Let the chicks come out."
Text_ortho: Tell your pikin sey make e hatch dis egg, make di chicks come outside.

Text_en: He said that if she cannot do it, if the child cannot do it, then, they will kill, they will beat the man to death.
Text_ortho: E say if e no fit do am, if di pikin no fit do am, den, de go kill, de go beat di man till death.

Text_en: So the man said, "uhuh!"
Text_ortho: Di man con talk sey ehen.

Text_en: So the man left.
Text_ortho: Di man con go.

Text_en: As he got home, he told the child, "listen to what the King said."
Text_ortho: As e reach house, con tell pikin sey see wetin di king talk o.

Text_en: He said, "if you can't do it, they will beat me to death."
Text_ortho: E say if you no fit do am, sey de go beat me till death.

Text_en: Then the girl told him, "papa, don't worry. Go into the house. Go to sleep."
Text_ortho: Naim di girl con tell am sey papa, no worry, go inside house, go sleep.

Text_en: As...
Text_ortho: As...

Text_en: "Go into the house. Go to sleep."
Text_ortho: Go inside house, go sleep.

Text_en: "Don't worry."
Text_ortho: No worry.

Text_en: "Tomorrow, you... I will give you the answer."
Text_ortho: Tomorrow, you, I go tell you your answer.

Text_en: Papa then said, "uhuh!"
Text_ortho: Papa con talk sey ehen.

Text_en: So the father went to sleep.
Text_ortho: Papa con go sleep.

Text_en: Mor-... the next day, the girl told her father that he should carry this bag of beans, boiled beans, that they'd cooked.
Text_ortho: Mor-... di next day, di girl con tell papa sey meh e carry dis bag of beans, boiled beans, di one wey de don cook.

Text_en: He should take it and hide it at someone's place.
Text_ortho: Meh e carry am go hide for someone place.

Text_en: Let him shout.
Text_ortho: Meh e dey shout.

Text_en: Let me dig this br-... let me... let me plant these beans.
Text_ortho: Meh I dig dis br-... make I, make I plant dis beans.

Text_en: Let them produce more.
Text_ortho: Make e grow anoder one o.

Text_en: These boiled beans, let me plant them.
Text_ortho: Dis boiled beans, make I plant am.

Text_en: Let them produce more.
Text_ortho: Meh e grow anoder one o.

Text_en: Then the King went to see him.
Text_ortho: Den di king go, go con see am.

Text_en: The girl said "okay."
Text_ortho: Di girl con talk sey okay.

Text_en: So, as the man carried the beans out, he then went to meet-..., as he got to where the King goes to rest, when he saw the king coming, he said "If I plant these boiled beans, they'll produce even more."
Text_ortho: So as di man con carry di beans comot con go meet, con go di place where di king for dey rest, as e just see di king just dey come, e con talk sey if I plant dis boiled beans, make e give me anoder one o.

Text_en: "If I plant these boiled beans, they'll give me even more."
Text_ortho: If I plant dis boiled beans, make e give me anoder one o.

Text_en: So the king saw him.
Text_ortho: Naim di king con see am.

Text_en: So he said to him, "how do you...?"
Text_ortho: Con talk sey how you?..

Text_en: "Are you out of your mind?"
Text_ortho: You get sense?

Text_en: "How can you say let... how can you think that these cooked beans will produce some more?"
Text_ortho: How you take say ma-... how you take tink sey make dis beans wey de don cook take grow anoder one wey e never cook?

Text_en: He said... so he said, "since the eggs which have already been boiled will hatch chicks, the beans that have already been cooked will be able to, uh... will be able to produce more."
Text_ortho: E say, e con talk sey since di egg wey de don ready boil go fit hatch chick come outside, e go fit hatch chick come outside, den beans wey de don cook go fit, ah e go fit grow anoder one come outside.

Text_en: Then the King looked at the man's face closely.
Text_ortho: Naim di king con look di man face well, well.

Text_en: Then he said, "this is the man who was given that egg."
Text_ortho: Con talk say dis man sey na im give dat egg.

Text_en: So he said "indeed, the child is clever."
Text_ortho: Con talk sey indeed, di pikin dey clever.

Text_en: Then he said "okay."
Text_ortho: Con talk sey okay o.

Text_en: Then he took the...
Text_ortho: Con carry di...

Text_en: Then he said...
Text_ortho: E con say...

Text_en: Okay. Then he took the man to the pala-... uh... palace.
Text_ortho: Okay con carry di man go pala-... eh palace.

Text_en: The man, he then told the man that he should take uh... this thing... pots, a lot of pots.
Text_ortho: Di man, e con tell di man sey meh di man carry ehm dis ting, pot, many pot.

Text_en: He said he should take them to his house.
Text_ortho: Sey meh he carry am go house.

Text_en: He said not to have her fetch water with them.
Text_ortho: Sey meh pikin no go river o, meh pikin no go fetch water, sey meh e no fetch water put.

Text_en: But have f-... the man fetch water with the pots and bring it to him.
Text_ortho: But meh f-... di man fetch water put for inside di pot come.

Text_en: But the girl should not go to the river and carry them.
Text_ortho: But meh de no, make di girl no go river carry am.

Text_en: He said if he cannot do it, they will beat him.
Text_ortho: E say if e no fit do am, sey de go beat di man.

Text_en: He will die.
Text_ortho: Di man go die.

Text_en: The man got home.
Text_ortho: Di man con reach house.

Text_en: So he told the child "this what the King said."
Text_ortho: Di man con tell pikin sey see wetin di king talk eh!

Text_en: So the child told him, "go inside. Go to sleep. Get some rest."
Text_ortho: Pikin con tell am sey go inside house, go sleep, meh you rest!

Text_en: "Don't worry."
Text_ortho: No worry!

Text_en: "Tomorrow, I will give you the answer."
Text_ortho: Tomorrow, I will give you answer.

Text_en: He then said "okay."
Text_ortho: Con talk sey okay.

Text_en: The next day, as the gm-, the man wanted to go to the palace, the child told him, "this pot that the king gave you, tell him it's leaking."
Text_ortho: Di next day, as di gm-... di man wan go palace, di pikin con tell am sey dis pot wey di king give you so, tell am sey e dey leak.

Text_en: "The pot has a hole in the bottom."
Text_ortho: Di pot get hole for under.

Text_en: "Tell him that it's leaking."
Text_ortho: Tell am sey e dey leak.

Text_en: "Take it and bring it back to the..."
Text_ortho: Take carry am go back to di...

Text_en: "Go and tell the King."
Text_ortho: Meh you go tell di king like dat.

Text_en: So he went to tell the King.
Text_ortho: E con go tell di king.

Text_en: So the King said, "ah! This daughter of yours is very wise."
Text_ortho: Di king con talk sey ah dis your pikin wise well, well o.

Text_en: Then he said, "your daughter's the one I'll marry."
Text_ortho: Con talk sey na your pikin I go marry.

Text_en: He then said "is that so?"
Text_ortho: Con talk sey ehen.

Text_en: Then he said, okay, let him go to the house to tell the child what the King said.
Text_ortho: Con say okay meh e go house, go tell pikin wetin di king talk.

Text_en: As he got home, he went and told the child, "listen to what the King said. "
Text_ortho: As e reach house, con go tell pikin sey see wetin di king talk o.

Text_en: He said, "it's you he's going to marry."
Text_ortho: E say na you e go marry.

Text_en: The girl didn't want to be... marry him.
Text_ortho: Di girl no wan be, marry am.

Text_en: She then said, "ah! Let me marry him." Then she'll be the queen of the land.
Text_ortho: Con talk sey ah make I marry am, den e go be di queen of di land.

Text_en: Then he said, "okay."
Text_ortho: Con talk sey okay.

Text_en: As the girl got to the palace, she told the king that if she, maybe if she does something the king does not like in the palace, if the king sends her away, she will take what is special to her in the palace.
Text_ortho: As di girl reach palace, con tell di king sey if e maybe, if e do wetin di king no like for di palace, if di king con pursue am, e go carry wetin dey special to am for di palace.

Text_en: The king then said okay, he understood.
Text_ortho: Di king con talk sey okay sey e hear.

Text_en: So then he married the girl.
Text_ortho: So e con marry di girl.

Text_en: Then they got married.
Text_ortho: De con do marriage.

Text_en: Then he married the girl.
Text_ortho: E con marry di girl.

Text_en: So the king started buying her all these fine clothes, jewelry.
Text_ortho: So di king con dey buy her all dis fine, fine clothes, jewelries.

Text_en: The girl started wearing them.
Text_ortho: Di girl con dey wear am.

Text_en: Every day, she would take almost an hour to put on her makeup and get dressed.
Text_ortho: Everyday, e go dey use almost an hour take dey make up, take dey wear clothes.

Text_en: So the King got angry.
Text_ortho: So di king con vex.

Text_en: One day, when they wanted to travel, the girl started putting on her clothes and makeup.
Text_ortho: When de wan travel one day, di girl con dey make up, con dey wear cloth.

Text_en: So the King got angry.
Text_ortho: Di king con vex.

Text_en: Then he told her, "you don't even have time for your husband."
Text_ortho: Con tell am sey you no even get time for your husband.

Text_en: "All you really have time for is jewelry and all the things I'm buying you."
Text_ortho: Na so, so eh jewelries, and everyting I dey buy for you na im dey get time for.

Text_en: So the girl told him he shouldn't be angry.
Text_ortho: Di girl con tell am sey make e no vex.

Text_en: Then he said he would stay married to the girl, and she should pack her things.
Text_ortho: E con talk sey e no go marry di girl again, sey meh di girl pack im tings.

Text_en: The girl should go now.
Text_ortho: Meh di girl dey go now, now, now.

Text_en: She said she's not going anywhere.
Text_ortho: Sey im no dey go any place again.

Text_en: He said she should go to her father's house.
Text_ortho: Sey meh di girl dey go im papa house.

Text_en: Then the girl said okay.
Text_ortho: Naim di girl con talk sey okay o.

Text_en: That... she told the man that anything that she is... that is close to her... anything that is precious to her, is... I will take with me.
Text_ortho: Sey e tell di man sey anyting mey dey, mey dey close to her, anyting mey dey precious to her, na I go carry comot o.

Text_en: The man said, 'uhuh! Let her take it. Let her get going."
Text_ortho: Di man say ehn meh e carry am, meh e dey go.

Text_en: The girl then said okay, please let her spend just this one night in his house. She said the next day, she will go.
Text_ortho: Di girl con talk sey okay sey abeg make e just spend only dis one night for im house, sey di next day, e go go.

Text_en: The King then said okay.
Text_ortho: Di king con talk sey okay.

Text_en: So the next day, in the night, the girl put some sleeping pills in the King's drink.
Text_ortho: So di next day when in di night of it, di girl con put sleeping medicine for di king drink.

Text_en: The King drank it.
Text_ortho: Di king con drink am.

Text_en: Then he went to sleep.
Text_ortho: E con sleep.

Text_en: While he was sleeping, she told his body guards that they should carry him to her father's house. She said he should carry him to her father's house.
Text_ortho: As e sleep, e con tell im bodyguard sey make di bodyguards carry am go im papa house, sey make e carry am go im papa house.

Text_en: So the body guards carried him to her father's house.
Text_ortho: Di bodyguards con carry am go im papa house.

Text_en: Then the girl went to meet him.
Text_ortho: Di girl con go meet am.

Text_en: The next morning, as the man woke up, he found himself somewhere else.
Text_ortho: Di next morning, as di man wake up, con see himsef for anoder place.

Text_en: Then he asked, "ah! Where are my... where is my palace? Where are my guards? Everybody?"
Text_ortho: Con ask sey ah where are my, where is my palace, where are my guards, everybody?

Text_en: Then the girl said, "didn't you say I should go to my hub-... my husband, my father's house?"
Text_ortho: Naim di girl con tell am sey shey you say make I go my hub-... my husband, my papa house?

Text_en: "So I went to my father's house."
Text_ortho: So I go my papa house.

Text_en: "I told you that anything that is precious to me, I will take with me."
Text_ortho: I dey tell you sey anyting wey dey precious to me, na im I go carry.

Text_en: So, then she said, "so it's you who is precious to me. You're the one who made me bring you here."
Text_ortho: So e con talk sey so na you dey precious to me, so na you make me carry you come here.

Text_en: So the king said, "wow!"
Text_ortho: Di king con talk sey wow.

Text_en: He said, "you indeed, you are a very... a cl-... you are cle-... you are a clever girl."
Text_ortho: See you indeed, you are a very, a c-... you are cle-... you are a clever girl.

Text_en: He then said, "thank you."
Text_ortho: Con talk sey tank you.

Text_en: My name is Ibrahim Salomi.
Text_ortho: My name na Ibrahim Salomi.

Text_en: What I want to tell you about is how egusi is prepared.
Text_ortho: Di ting wey I want talk about na how de dey take prepare egusi soup.

Text_en: First of all,you will grind your egusi depending on how much you want to make.
Text_ortho: First of all, you go grind your melon, depending on di quantity weh you want prepare.

Text_en: After you've ground the egusi, you will pound pepper and keep it on the side.
Text_ortho: After you don grind di melon, you pound pepper keep.

Text_en: You will get everyt-... all your ingredients ready so that the dish will be easy to prepare.
Text_ortho: You go make everyt-... all your ingredients ready so dat di soup go dey easy to prepare.

Text_en: After you've ground your pepper, uh... you slice your vegetables.
Text_ortho: After you don grind your pepper eh, you slice your vegetable.

Text_en: Maybe, if you want to use ugwu, it's either ugwu, or bitter leaf, but mostly, as for me, I like to use uh... pumpkin leaf (that is ugwu) to prepare my egusi.
Text_ortho: Maybe if you want use ugu, it's eider ugu, or bitter leaf, but mostly, me, I dey like use eh pumpkin leaf (dat is ugu) to prepare my melon soup.

Text_en: Then after I've sliced the ugwu, then, I wash my meat, my okporoko (that is dry f-... uh... stockfish), and then my dryfish.
Text_ortho: Den after I don slice di ugu, den, I wash my meat, my okporoko (dat is dry f-... eh stockfish), and den my dry fish.

Text_en: I wash everything together.
Text_ortho: I wash everyting togeder.

Text_en: Then I... I steam it with the meat
Text_ortho: Den I, I steam am with di meat.

Text_en: Then I add some seasoning like Maggi cubes, salt, and onion.
Text_ortho: Den I add some seasoning like Maggi cube, salt, and onion.

Text_en: After it's steamed thoroughly, I take it down.
Text_ortho: After di ting don steam well, well, I carry am down.

Text_en: Then, I put the oil in my pot.
Text_ortho: Den, I con pour di oil inside my pot.

Text_en: As I put the oil into my pot, I like to fry my egusi.
Text_ortho: As I pour oil inside my pot, me, I dey like fry my melon.

Text_en: It has this kind of taste it gives me.
Text_ortho: E get di kind taste wey e dey give me.

Text_en: Then I put the egusi in the oil and fry it well to my taste.
Text_ortho: Den I go con pour di melon inside di oil, fry am well to my taste.

Text_en: After I've... after I've fried the egusi, then I'll put in the meat and the fish, and stockfish I have already seasoned.
Text_ortho: After I don, after I don fry di melon, den I go con pour dat meat, and di fish, and stockfish wey I don already season.

Text_en: Then I'll put it into the egusi.
Text_ortho: I go con pour am inside di melon.

Text_en: I'll leave it on the fire to boil for about ten minutes.
Text_ortho: I go leave am on top of di fire to boil like ten minutes.

Text_en: After it has boiled properly, I'll put in the pumpkin leaves I've washed thoroughly.
Text_ortho: After e don boil well, den I go con pour di pumpkin leaf wey I don wash well, well.

Text_en: Then I'll put the pumpkin leaves into it.
Text_ortho: Con pour di pumpkin leaf inside.

Text_en: I'll leave it in the pot... on the fire, for it to steam like... it should cook for about ten more minutes.
Text_ortho: I go leave am for pot, for fire meh e steam like, meh e cook like more ten minutes.

Text_en: Then my egusi dish is ready.
Text_ortho: Den my egusi soup is ready.

Text_en: After I've taken it down, then I'll decide whether I want to eat it with akpu, pounded yam, or garri.
Text_ortho: After I don carry am down, I go con decide wheda na akpu, or na pounded yam, or na garri I want take chop am.

Text_en: Then, you can enjoy it with your akpu, garri,or pounded yam, whatever you want, but me personally, I am in my place, my hometown, Kogi State.
Text_ortho: Den, you fit still enjoy am with your akpu, garri, or pounded yam, anyone of your choice, but me, personally, I dey for my place, my home town, Kogi State.

Text_en: So, as I was coming back now, I got off the bus.
Text_ortho: So as I dey come back now, I con come down from bus.

Text_en: Then this one criminal picked my pocket and took my purse.
Text_ortho: Naim one criminal like dat con do me pick pocket, con comot my purse.

Text_en: He thought there was money in it.
Text_ortho: E tink sey money dey inside.

Text_en: Meanwhile, I had my school ID card, and just my ATM card, in the purse.
Text_ortho: Meanwhile, na my school ID card, and just my ATM card na im dey di purse.

Text_en: So when I realized, I turned back and said quickly "hey, give me my purse!"
Text_ortho: So when I con discover, I con turn back sey oya give me my purse.

Text_en: Immediately, he was... afraid, so he gave me the purse back.
Text_ortho: Immediately e con, con fear, con give me di purse back.

Text_en: So, that was how he and I walked away.
Text_ortho: So na so o me, and am take waka o.

Text_en: He can't steal from me because I've been around the block.
Text_ortho: E no fit thief me because me sef, I be agboro.

Text_en: That is how the story ends.
Text_ortho: Na so di story take end o.

Text_en: Uh, the day...
Text_ortho: Eh di day...

Text_en: I want to talk about uh, the... how I spent my Christmas last year.
Text_ortho: I want talk about em di, how I spend my Christmas last year.

Text_en: Well, it was nice.
Text_ortho: E sweet sha.

Text_en: Me, I dont kno-... I dont know how to go out at Christmas.
Text_ortho: Me ma, I no sab-... I no sabi go out for Christmas.

Text_en: Every Christmas, I like staying at home.
Text_ortho: Every Christmas, I dey like stay for home.

Text_en: It was my sister who started it.
Text_ortho: Na my sister wey cause am.

Text_en: Even she, she didn't know how to go out at Christmas.
Text_ortho: She ma sef, she no sabi go out in Christmas.

Text_en: What would she do?
Text_ortho: Wetin she go do?

Text_en: On the twenty fifth, we would cook.
Text_ortho: Twenty fifth, we go cook.

Text_en: After cooking, we would eat.
Text_ortho: After cooking, we go eat.

Text_en: After eating, we would stay at home, watch movies, drink, do whatever.
Text_ortho: After eating, we go stay for home, watch film, drink, do everyting.

Text_en: But this last Christmas, my cousin said no.
Text_ortho: But dis last Christmas, my cousin say no.

Text_en: She said I needed to relax and go out.
Text_ortho: Sey I must cool, and go out.

Text_en: I told her okay.
Text_ortho: I tell am sey okay.

Text_en: She said I should go and get ready.
Text_ortho: She say meh I go prepare.

Text_en: I finished getting ready.
Text_ortho: I con prepare finish.

Text_en: I was just putting on makeup.
Text_ortho: I just dey draw makeup o.

Text_en: The first time I ever wore makeup was that last Christmas.
Text_ortho: Na di first time wey I wear makeup be dat last Christmas.

Text_en: So she told me I should sit down.
Text_ortho: So she con tell me sey mey I siddown.

Text_en: Then she applied my makeup, ha!
Text_ortho: She con do me makeup ha.

Text_en: I was no longer myself.
Text_ortho: I no be myself again.

Text_en: I didnt even...
Text_ortho: I no even...

Text_en: Even the picture I snapped myself, the picture, I dont...
Text_ortho: Even di picture wey I snap ma sef, di picture, I no...

Text_en: Uh... If I look at the picture, always think that I can't be that good looking girl.
Text_ortho: Eh if I see di picture, I no say na me fine reach dat one.

Text_en: So, we got going.
Text_ortho: So, we con begin go.

Text_en: I asked her, "where are we going?"
Text_ortho: I tell am sey where we dey go?

Text_en: She told me I should get on the bus first, and we'd go.
Text_ortho: She tell me sey mey I enter bus first, we go go.

Text_en: I told her okay.
Text_ortho: I tell am sey okay.

Text_en: Then we got to the bus.
Text_ortho: We con reach bus.

Text_en: She snapped pictures.
Text_ortho: She con snap picture o.

Text_en: Then she told me...
Text_ortho: She con tell me...

Text_en: She posted them on Instagram.
Text_ortho: She con post am for Instagram.

Text_en: Then she said, "my cousin who never goes out, thank God I took her out today."
Text_ortho: Con say my cousin wey no dey go out, tank God sey I carry am go out today.

Text_en: Hah!
Text_ortho: Heh!

Text_en: Then I asked, "what will I do?"
Text_ortho: Con tell wetin I go do?

Text_en: She said I wasn't going to do anything.
Text_ortho: Sey I no go do anyting.

Text_en: So I relaxed.
Text_ortho: I con relax.

Text_en: So, we went.
Text_ortho: So, we con go.

Text_en: We went to Ogui Road.
Text_ortho: We con go Ogui Road.

Text_en: I didnt know it was New Berries which is... or there was a place like that.
Text_ortho: I no know sey na New Berries wey dey, abi na dat place dey.

Text_en: That was the first time I went to New Berries.
Text_ortho: Na first time wey I dey go New Berries be dat.

Text_en: So we reached Ogui, then stopped and walked to New Berries.
Text_ortho: So we con reach Ogui, con stop, trek go New Berries.

Text_en: When we got there, there was a lot of people because it was Christmas.
Text_ortho: When we reach, people plenty now because sey na Christmas.

Text_en: So there were so many people.
Text_ortho: So de go plenty.

Text_en: They were looking for...
Text_ortho: De dey find...

Text_en: They were selling tickets.
Text_ortho: De dey sell ticket.

Text_en: So we went to buy tickets, bought tickets before going.
Text_ortho: So we go buy ticket, buy ticket come.

Text_en: But, well, it was fine.
Text_ortho: But e fine sha.

Text_en: Because I wasnt going alone.
Text_ortho: Because no be only me go.

Text_en: I was with one of my sisters, and uh, that cousin of mine.
Text_ortho: I go with one of my sister sef, and eh dat my cousin.

Text_en: We ate and ate and ate.
Text_ortho: We eat, eat, eat.

Text_en: So we met people, they bought us food, and then bought us drinks.
Text_ortho: So we con meet person, de con buy us food, con buy us drink.

Text_en: We exchanged numbers, did everything.
Text_ortho: We exchange number, do everyting.

Text_en: We ju-, we just went home around... around... like after eight, before nine.
Text_ortho: We ju, we just went home around, around, like after eight, to nine.

Text_en: That's when we left New Berries.
Text_ortho: Na im wey we comot for New Berries.

Text_en: Then they said they wanted to do a video chat on the road.
Text_ortho: De con say de want do video chatting for road.

Text_en: They took my phone and were snapping pictures, shouting in the street, "merry Christmas, merry Christmas."
Text_ortho: De con carry my phone dey snap picture, dey shout for road sey na merry Christmas, merry Christmas.

Text_en: Then I told them, "stop that!"
Text_ortho: Con tell am sey mey una stop di ting wey una dey do.

Text_en: You're embarassing me while I'm following you.
Text_ortho: Sey una dey disgrace me mysef wey follow una.

Text_en: So we hopped on a bus.
Text_ortho: So we con enter bus.

Text_en: We waited for the bus mstchew, for about thirty minutes before we saw one, then we started heading home.
Text_ortho: We wait for bus mtschew like about thirty minutes before we con see bus, we con begin go home.

Text_en: They got to another bus stop, then they started doing this thing.

Text_en: Then I told them "please, I'm really sleepy, let them... let's go now."

Text_en: Then we left first, got home.
Text_ortho: Den we con go first, con reach home.

Text_en: That was how we took...
Text_ortho: Na so we take...

Text_en: Uh, uh... well, that was how I celebrated Christmas.
Text_ortho: Eh eh na so I take do di Christmas sha.

Text_en: It was very nice.
Text_ortho: E dey very sweet.

Text_en: Man, eh!
Text_ortho: Nna eh.

Text_en: Things are happening!

Text_en: Look how my sister and I just woke up yesterday morning.
Text_ortho: See as me, and my sister just wake up yesterday morning.

Text_en: Normally, if we keep you waiting... if we wake up now, it's to pray and head to work.
Text_ortho: Normally if we stand you, if we wake up now, na to pray, start to dey go to work.

Text_en: So as we woke up, we started hearing this noise outside.
Text_ortho: So as we just wake up o, we con dey hear noise outside.

Text_en: Noise everywhere.
Text_ortho: Noise everywhere.

Text_en: I started wondering and said, "sis, we haven't prayed! Come back here, and let's sit down and pray to God first."

Text_en: Then she came back.

Text_en: Then she knelt down.

Text_en: We prayed to our God.

Text_en: As we finished praying, we opened the door to go outside.

Text_en: There were these two girls staying in the compound, mstchew!

Text_en: Oh boy am I tired of this public yard in Enugu.

Text_en: We met Amaka and Ogo, who are staying in our compound.

Text_en: It was a fight.

Text_en: Early that morning, I said to myself, "hah, girls, girls these days!"

Text_en: Instead of thinking about something better this morning, it was about the fighting this early morning.

Text_en: Do you mean to tell me that if you were at your mother's house, that's... that's how you'd be fighting every morning?

Text_en: So, we asked them.

Text_en: As it happens, it'd been taking place since last year, which is when the... Amaka moved into the compound.

Text_en: I was tired and said, "sis, I will talk to this pers-, to these girls when I come back from the house."

Text_en: So as I came back in the evening now, I have nothing to do because I know, even in my own house, even when I used to stay with my parents, if anything happened, I don't talk when others are talking.

Text_en: It's when I come back, when it's convienient for me, that I'll call them, talk to them.

Text_en: So in the evening, as soon as I came back from ho-... from work now, I went into Amaka's room and told her, "in the next thirty minutes, I want to see you in my room."
Text_ortho: So in di evening, as I con come back from ho-... from work now, I con enter Amaka room, tell Amaka sey in di next thirty minutes, I want to see you in my room.

Text_en: Then I told Ogo the same thing.

Text_en: So in the next thirty minutes, the two of them came into my room.

Text_en: So I sat them down.
Text_ortho: Na so I sit dem down.

Text_en: As a girl, as a fellow girl which is what I am to them, I sat them down to talk, talk to them, talk some sense into them, and told them, "girls, look, imagine, at this age of ours now, we're not supposed to be doing this kind of thing because it's disgrace for us."
Text_ortho: As a girl, as deir fellow girls wey I be now, I con sit dem down talk, talk to dem, talk sense into dem, tell dem sey girls, see o, imagine, at dis our age now, we no suppose dey do dis kind ting o because na disgrace to us.

Text_en: We, we are not supposed to do this type of thing at all.
Text_ortho: We, we no suppose to dey do dis type of a ting at all, at all.

Text_en: At this age, we're supposed to be talking, be thinking of how to handle our own family in the future.

Text_en: So, but I don't expect this kind of thing from them.

Text_en: He told me there was a new job that had just come up.

Text_en: So I asked him, "what will the work be like?"

Text_en: He told me that its uh... work in a bush bar.

Text_en: Life for me as a child was a bit hard.
Text_ortho: Life for me as small pikin dey hard small o.

Text_en: In fact, I really suffered.
Text_ortho: In fact, I suffer no be small.

Text_en: And the reason is that my mother died early.
Text_ortho: And di thing wey cause am be sey my mama quick die.

Text_en: I am the last child in my family.
Text_ortho: Na me be di last born for my family.

Text_en: So, I have three older siblings.
Text_ortho: So I get three elder ones.

Text_en: So, since my mother has died s-, died, all the things a mother... a mother provides for a child, my mother was not there to provide for me.
Text_ortho: So as my mama don die s-... con die so, all di things wey mama, mama dey provide for pikin, my mama no dey to provide for me.

Text_en: So, I was just managing to go to school.
Text_ortho: So I just dey manage go school.

Text_en: As hard as things were, I paid attention to my studies.
Text_ortho: As I con manage go school reach, I put mind for book.

Text_en: Because I didn't want the suffering to last for long. So I was serious with my schooling.
Text_ortho: Because I no wan make di suffer make e too long so I dey serious for my academics.

Text_en: Anything we were taught, I would pay attention.
Text_ortho: Anyting wey de teach us, I go put mind.

Text_en: And another thing that helped me was the fact that all those things we were supposed to take to school, like books, textbooks, pens, pencils... me, I did not have much of all that stuff.
Text_ortho: And anoder ting wey con still help me be sey di tings wey be sey we suppose carry go school like book, like textbook, biro, pencil, me, no too dey get all dose ones.

Text_en: So the method I used was that my friends whose mothers were rich, whose parents were rich, do bring those things to school, so I would help them with their assignments.
Text_ortho: So di sense wey I con dey use be sey my friends wey be sey deir mama dey rich, deir parents dey rich, de dey carry all those tings come school, me go con help dem do deir assignment.

Text_en: I would explain the things they do not understand to them, so that they would give me one of those things for me to use.
Text_ortho: Di ting wey dem no sabi, I go explain to dem so dat de go fit give me one of dose tings wey I go use.

Text_en: I did not know that as I was doing these things, my teacher was paying attention.
Text_ortho: I no know sey as I dey do all dis ones so, my teacher dey study me.

Text_en: He was looking at me.
Text_ortho: E dey look me.

Text_en: He then noticed that this person who... ah, ah!, as it so happens, she's the only one who doesn't have things, she, she, she... her uniform looks like rags, she doesn't have books, she doesn't bring food to school, and she still does better than the others.
Text_ortho: E con see sey dis person wey be sey ah ah, as e be sey na only im no dey get, e, e, e uniform be like rag, books, e no dey gree get, food, e no dey bring come school, na im con still dey do better pass oda people.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: So, I was amazed to notice after a while that he would call me and give me food to eat.
Text_ortho: So I con dey wonder sey small time now, e go con call me, give me food chop.

Text_en: He would give me some money.
Text_ortho: E go give me small money.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: I didn't know he was paying attention to me as I was helping those people.

Text_en: So, he developed a special kindness for me.
Text_ortho: So e con get special likeness for me.

Text_en: So much that, sometimes, even things I didn't understand... he would call me aside, and explain to me.

Text_en: So, all this made me get serious about my studies.
Text_ortho: So all dis ones con make me dey serious with my book.

Text_en: I paid serious attention to it.
Text_ortho: I con dey put mind well, well.

Text_en: Then everyone noticed me in school.

Text_en: Then it started helping my performance.

Text_en: I'm the one who ended up being at the top of the class.

Text_en: That's how it went on, from primary one until I got to primary four.
Text_ortho: Na so I do o from primary one reach primary four.

Text_en: As God would help me, I took the common entrance examination in primary four.
Text_ortho: As God wan help me so, I do common entrance from primary four.

Text_en: Then, I was given a scholarship.
Text_ortho: De con give me scholarship.

Text_en: That was how I got into secondary school.
Text_ortho: Na so I take enter secondary school.

Text_en: As I was about to enter into secondary school, my mother's younger sister who stays in Lagos said she wanted to help my father.
Text_ortho: As I wan enter secondary school so, my mama younger sister wey dey stay Lagos, e con come sey ah e wan help my papa.

Text_en: She said I should come with her to stay in Lagos.
Text_ortho: Sey make I con follow am go dey stay Lagos.

Text_en: I was very excited.
Text_ortho: My belle sweet me.

Text_en: I thought, "ah, at least I won't suffer anymore like I am now."
Text_ortho: I tink sey ah at least I no go suffer as I take dey suffer again.

Text_en: So, I followed her to Lagos.
Text_ortho: Naim I con follow am go Lagos.

Text_en: I didn't know the hardship would be twice as bad in Lagos.
Text_ortho: I no know sey na double suffer I go go suffer for Lagos.

Text_en: So, I... I got to Lagos.
Text_ortho: So I can, I con reach Lagos.

Text_en: So all the work in the house would be done by me.
Text_ortho: So all di work wey dey house, na me go do am.

Text_en: I would be the one not to go to school as early as everyone else.
Text_ortho: Na me no go go school early as my mate take dey go.

Text_en: I would be the one to wash the dishes.
Text_ortho: Na me go wash plate.

Text_en: I would be the one who didn't get to go to bed early.
Text_ortho: Na me no go quick sleep for house.

Text_en: I would still be in the kitchen at ten o'clock, cooking.
Text_ortho: Ten o'clock, I still dey kitchen dey cook.

Text_en: That's how it was.
Text_ortho: Na so I take dey do.

Text_en: It was so painful to me.
Text_ortho: Di ting go dey pain me.

Text_en: I would be crying.
Text_ortho: I go dey cry.

Text_en: But I didn't know that I didn't have the choice.
Text_ortho: But I no know sey I no get option.

Text_en: It was... let me just put s-... more effort into the work I was doing.
Text_ortho: Na make I just put s-... more effort for di work wey I dey do.

Text_en: That was how I was just doing it.
Text_ortho: Na so I just dey do am o.

Text_en: At school, I started using the same methods I used in primary school.
Text_ortho: For school, di sense wey I use for primary school, I con still dey use am.

Text_en: There was someone I liked at my school, a teacher.
Text_ortho: E con get one person wey I like for my school, one teacher.

Text_en: I liked the way the teacher used to dress.
Text_ortho: I like as di teacher take dey dress.

Text_en: The teacher was staying around my house.
Text_ortho: Di teacher con dey stay near my house.

Text_en: So one day, the teacher and I boarded the same bus.
Text_ortho: So e get one day wey me, wit dat teacher enter bus.

Text_en: The teacher asked me, uh... if I was staying with my mother.
Text_ortho: E con ask me sey ah ah, wheda na my mama I dey follow dey stay.

Text_en: She said she noticed that everybody comes to school early but I would be the one to come to school late.
Text_ortho: Sey e see sey when everybody come school early, na me go late come.

Text_en: And she used to see me fully dressed by six o'clock.
Text_ortho: And e be dey see me say by six o'clock, I don dress.

Text_en: I would have started walking on the streets.
Text_ortho: I don dey waka for road.

Text_en: I told my teacher, "well, she's not my mom".
Text_ortho: I con tell am sey well, no be my ma-... mama o.

Text_en: I said she's my mom's younger sister.
Text_ortho: Sey na my mama younger sister.

Text_en: I said if I wake up early, she would ask me to go to the shop first, to go and carry things, arrange things, before I went to school.
Text_ortho: Dat if I wake up early, she go tell me sey make I first go shop, go carry tings, arrange tings before I con come school.

Text_en: So that's it, that one, that made me arrive late.
Text_ortho: So na e, dat one dey make me come late.

Text_en: Then my teacher told me not to worry.
Text_ortho: Naim e con talk to me sey make I no worry.

Text_en: She said that's how it was.
Text_ortho: Sey na so e dey be.

Text_en: She said the only thing that will make all this suffer... suffering come to an end would be putting more efforts into my studies.
Text_ortho: Sey di only ting wey go make all dose suffer, suffering quick finish, na make I put more effort for my study.

Text_en: So I carried on.
Text_ortho: Na so I con still dey do.

Text_en: What the woman told me was stuck in my mind.
Text_ortho: Dat ting wey dat woman con tell me con enter my head.

Text_en: It made me cry a bit, but she said I shouldn't worry.
Text_ortho: Dough e be make me cry small o, e con say make I no cry.

Text_en: She consoled me.
Text_ortho: E pet me.

Text_en: She said I shouldn't worry.
Text_ortho: E con say make I no worry.

Text_en: She said I should just keep doing all these things... but I should be praying.
Text_ortho: Sey make I just dey do all di things o, but make I dey pray.

Text_en: And I should also pay attention to my studies.
Text_ortho: And make I still face my studies.

Text_en: I did as she said.
Text_ortho: Na so I con dey do o.

Text_en: I did...
Text_ortho: I do.

Text_en: I took my exams; I finished secondary school; I took the WAEC exam.
Text_ortho: I write, I finish secondary school, I write WAEC.

Text_en: I didn't do very well on the WAEC.
Text_ortho: I be no make my WAEC once o.

Text_en: I got four credits.
Text_ortho: I get four credit.

Text_en: Ah! It was as if uh... I dunno.
Text_ortho: Ah e con be like sey hm I no know.

Text_en: I lost hope a bit about my chances of taking the WAEC again.
Text_ortho: I con lose hope small sey wheda I go fit write anoder WAEC.

Text_en: During those holidays after sitting for the WAEC, I registered for some extra classes.
Text_ortho: Dose holiday wey we dey after writing WAEC so, I con go enroll for one lesson.

Text_en: Now these... some of the friends I made at the centre told me they had some se-... young people at home, would I mind teaching them?
Text_ortho: Na dis, di friends wey I con make for dere, de con tell me sey de get some se-... younger, younger ones for house, wheda I go fit dey teach dem lesson.

Text_en: Then, I said no problems.
Text_ortho: Naim I con say no problem now!

Text_en: I said I could do it.
Text_ortho: Sey I go fit do am.

Text_en: That's how I started teaching them at home and saving some money.
Text_ortho: Naim I begin dey do small, small lesson dey put money togeda.

Text_en: Then I sat for the JAMB.
Text_ortho: I con write JAMB.

Text_en: I sat for the first JAMB.
Text_ortho: I write di first JAMB.

Text_en: I didn't do very well.
Text_ortho: I no still make am.

Text_en: It was Law I wanted to study but I didn't get in.
Text_ortho: Na law I be wan go study o, but I no get admission.

Text_en: I still didn't get discouraged.
Text_ortho: I no still con get discouraged.

Text_en: Then, I sat for the JAMB a second time.
Text_ortho: Naim I con write JAMB di second time.

Text_en: And by the luck of God, I passed.
Text_ortho: As God wan do am so, I con pass.

Text_en: So I got into a higher institution.
Text_ortho: Naim I con enter higher institution.

Text_en: When I was in the higher institution, there were some people I liked and saw at my school.
Text_ortho: When I dey higher institution, e get some people wey I be like, I be dey see for my school.

Text_en: There was a woman uh... the woman, there was this way everybody respected her.
Text_ortho: E get one woman eh, di woman, e get as everybody dey respect am.

Text_en: She spoke really good English.
Text_ortho: E get as e dey speak big, big English.

Text_en: In fact, anywhere she went, people followed her.
Text_ortho: In fact anywhere wey e go, na everybody go dey follow am.

Text_en: They would be saying, "yes ma... yes ma."
Text_ortho: De go dey tell am yes ma, yes ma.

Text_en: I was looking at her uh... why is everybody following this woman? Why is it this woman is standing up?
Text_ortho: I con dey look am say ah why e be sey na dis woman na im everybody dey follow, why e be sey dis woman stand up?

Text_en: Even if men stood up to greet her... everybody would be saying, "yes ma, yes ma."
Text_ortho: Even men, if de go stand up greet am now, everybody go dey do yes ma, yes ma.

Text_en: Everybody would be rushing to carry her bag.
Text_ortho: Everybody go dey rush to, for carry her bag.

Text_en: Everybody would be opening the door for her.
Text_ortho: Na so everybody go dey open door for her.

Text_en: I was suprised.
Text_ortho: I con say ah!

Text_en: They said it's because she's educated.
Text_ortho: Dey con say na because she go school.

Text_en: They said she had the highest qualifications.
Text_ortho: Sey na she go school pass.

Text_en: So I said, "so, if I also become as educated as her, that's how they will respect me."
Text_ortho: I con say so if me sef go school like dis, na so de go dey respect me.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: Then I said, "okay, if it was this woman's level of education that made everybody..."
Text_ortho: I con say OK if na school dis woman go reach, (wey be sey) everybody...

Text_en: In fact, if you saw the car she was riding at the time... her car was the nicest in the school.
Text_ortho: In fact if you see di car wey e dey ride, na only im get di best car for dat school.

Text_en: Then I said, "if it really was her level of education that took her this far, if I also get to this level, everyone will respect me too."
Text_ortho: I con say to say na school e go, so if me sef go school reach dis level, na so everybody go dey respect me.

Text_en: That made me study more.
Text_ortho: Dat one con make me still read more.

Text_en: Since no one respected me, everyone would abuse me, I was the one doing... I was the one working last in the house, I was the one doing the worst chores, I was the one going to bed last, so I said, "okay, if I put more efforts into my studies, everyone... the impression they have about me will change."
Text_ortho: As e be sey de no get respect for me, sey everybody dey abuse me, na me dey do di, na me de dey see finish for house o, na me dey do di worst work, na me dey sleep late, I con say okay so if I put more efforts for my academics, everybody, di impression wey de get about me, sey de go still change am.

Text_en: That's why I put in more effort.
Text_ortho: Na im con make me put more effort.

Text_en: I became very serious with my studies.
Text_ortho: I con dey serious wit my studies.

Text_en: Then I said, "okay, if... after this first degree... if this woman has a PhD, I will also get a PhD."
Text_ortho: Naim I con say OK if, after dis first degree, if na PhD dis woman get, me sef go get PhD.

Text_en: If she has more than a PhD, I will get more than a PhD.
Text_ortho: If e get more than PhD, I go get more than PhD.

Text_en: Then I became serious.
Text_ortho: Naim I con take serious.

Text_en: I did more.
Text_ortho: I con do.

Text_en: I continued to do more.
Text_ortho: Naim I con do o.

Text_en: I did more and more and more.
Text_ortho: I do, I do, I do.

Text_en: I passed my exams.
Text_ortho: I pass, I pass.

Text_en: I got good grades.
Text_ortho: I con still make good grade.

Text_en: I went for Youth Service.
Text_ortho: I go service.

Text_en: At some points during the Service Corps, you know, I...
Text_ortho: When I go service reach so, you know sey I...

Text_en: As it is with women, no matter what your level of education is, you must get married.
Text_ortho: As woman be, no how, no how wey you go go school reach, you must to marry.

Text_en: If you don't get married, it becomes a problem.
Text_ortho: If you no marry, na anoda wahala.

Text_en: So, I got married.
Text_ortho: Naim I con marry o.

Text_en: It wasn't easy to continue, but God...
Text_ortho: E be no dey easy to continue o but God...

Text_en: By God's grace, my husband is like if God put his love for me into his mind.
Text_ortho: As God wan take do am so, my husband con be like person wey be sey God put my love for im mind.

Text_en: So I told him, "uh... my husband, there is something I want to do, please."
Text_ortho: Naim I con tell am sey ah husband, a beg o, e get wetin I wan do.

Text_en: "My dream is to be well educated."
Text_ortho: Sey my dream, na to go school well, well o.

Text_en: "And I haven't reached the level I planned to get to."
Text_ortho: Sey I never even reach where I wan reach for life.

Text_en: Then he said, "no problem."
Text_ortho: E con say no problem!

Text_en: He said whatever makes me happy will make him happy.
Text_ortho: Sey anything wey go make me happy, na im go make am happy.

Text_en: So, if it's to... if I want to go to school, that won't be a problem.
Text_ortho: So if to, na, na school I wan go, no wahala.

Text_en: So, he supported me.
Text_ortho: Naim e con support me.

Text_en: Then I came in for a Masters program.
Text_ortho: Naim I con come for masters.

Text_en: As soon as I came in for the Masters program, I realized...
Text_ortho: As I con come for masters, sey I con see sey...

Text_en: Me who thought I would be the oldest person, then I realised there were people even older than me, old women who were around my mother's age, they were co-... they were... we were in the same class.
Text_ortho: Me wey I bin tink sey I be di oldest person, naim I con see sey ah people wey even old pass me, old mama wey be sey dem be my mama age mate, de con co-... de dey, we dey di same class.

Text_en: People who were almost my dad's age, they were in the same class.
Text_ortho: People wey be sey de don nearly reach my papa age, de dey di same class.

Text_en: And as we were there, that's how (as I was reading), they were... some of them were even doing better than me.
Text_ortho: And as we dey do so, na so (a-... as me dey read) de dey, some of dem, de even dey read pass me.

Text_en: One day as we were talking, uh... I heard them say uh... after the Masters program, they will go on and get a PhD.
Text_ortho: E con get one day wey we con dey talk, ah I con still hear dem say ah after dis masters, de go still get PhD.

Text_en: I said uh... if as old as you all are, you still want to get a PhD, and I am still a child compared to you all, I should also get a PhD.
Text_ortho: I con say ah if as una old reach, una still wan get PhD, me wey I con be small pikin for una side, me sef must get dis PhD.

Text_en: And all the people that were our lecturers were very young, that is they were my age.
Text_ortho: And all di people wey be sey con be our lecturer, na small, small pikin wey be sey we be age mate.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: One person, one wo-...
Text_ortho: One person, one wo-...

Text_en: There was a woman, who came to class, they said she was a professor.
Text_ortho: E get one woman, she go come class, de say she be professor.

Text_en: I said Professor!
Text_ortho: I say professor!

Text_en: When did this woman start school?
Text_ortho: Which time dis woman take start school?

Text_en: They said "it's the same..."
Text_ortho: De say na di same...

Text_en: I said, "oh, if this woman is a professor, I will also be a profe-... will be a professor."
Text_ortho: I say oh if dis woman be professor sef, me sef be profe-... will be professor.

Text_en: So, I finished the Masters program.
Text_ortho: Naim I con still do masters finish.

Text_en: As I finished the Masters program, God helped me.
Text_ortho: As I do masters finish, God wan do am.

Text_en: I got a PhD grade.
Text_ortho: I make PhD grade.

Text_en: Then I said, "okay Boss, I have finished this program but we won't stop here. I still want to keep going."
Text_ortho: I con say OK oga, I don do dis one finish o, but we no go stop for here o, I still wan continue.

Text_en: He said, "no problem now."
Text_ortho: E say no wahala now!

Text_en: If that's what I want, that's what he wants.
Text_ortho: Sey if na so I wan, e sef wan am.

Text_en: Whatever I want in life, he will support me.
Text_ortho: Sey anywhere where I wan reach for life, e go support me.

Text_en: That was how I came to collect the form and started this PhD we're running now.
Text_ortho: Naim I con still take come, collect form, start dis PhD wey we dey so.

Text_en: So, I pray that when we finish this program, God will provide a job.
Text_ortho: So now my prayer be sey when we do finish, meh God provide job o.

Text_en: May God make us happy.
Text_ortho: Meh God make us happy.

Text_en: This one, they call it Igue Festival.
Text_ortho: Dat one, de dey call am Igue Festival.

Text_en: Igue Festival is what they call it.
Text_ortho: Na Igue Festival de dey call am.

Text_en: So, it's the Edo people.
Text_ortho: So na di Edo people dem.

Text_en: They're the ones who do this festival.
Text_ortho: Na dem de do dat festival.

Text_en: It's towards the end of the year, after Christmas, between Christmas and the New Year, around the twenty seventh, twenty eighth of December.
Text_ortho: Na towards di end of di year, after Christmas, between Christmas, and New Year, dat kind, twenty seven twenty eight of December.

Text_en: Uh... thats when they do the festival.
Text_ortho: Ehen na dat time de dey do di festival.

Text_en: So, all the Edo people who have moved to different places, everybody will head back home.
Text_ortho: So all Edo people wey don travel go different, different, different places, everybody go con travel come back.

Text_en: This festival, they do it to thank the gods of Edo land for all the good things they've done, for the good harvest, for bringing the people peace, giving the people good health, you know.
Text_ortho: Dat festival, de dey use am take dey tank di gods of Edo land for all di good tin wey de don do, for good harvest, for sey de give di people peace, de give di people good health you know.

Text_en: So they have to do that festival every year, to thank the gods.
Text_ortho: So de must do dat festival every year to tank di gods.

Text_en: So, many things happen before the festival.
Text_ortho: So many, many tins dey happen before di festival.

Text_en: Ah, a lot of preparation goes into it.
Text_ortho: Ah many, many preparation.

Text_en: It's no small thing.
Text_ortho: No be small o.

Text_en: Everybody will go to the market, buy food, fill the house with food.
Text_ortho: Everybody go go market, buy food, full house.

Text_en: Rice.
Text_ortho: Rice.

Text_en: Goat.
Text_ortho: Goat.

Text_en: In fact, it's goats we slaughter for that festival.
Text_ortho: Infact na goat na im we dey kill for dat festival.

Text_en: Yes now!
Text_ortho: Yes now!

Text_en: For that one, mostly, it's the children who eat rice.
Text_ortho: Dat one, na children mostly go eat rice.

Text_en: But the main food is pounded yam.
Text_ortho: But di main food na pounded yam.

Text_en: Pounded yam, and egusi soup.
Text_ortho: Pounded yam, and egusi soup.

Text_en: A hot, hot one.
Text_ortho: Hot, hot one o.

Text_en: Ah, pounded yam, that's the main food.
Text_ortho: Ah pounded yam, na im be di main, di main.

Text_en: So, before the festival, everybody will start to cook.
Text_ortho: So before di festival, everybody go begin prepare.

Text_en: People whose house, has... all the paint has fallen off, we paint our houses again.
Text_ortho: Dose wey deir house don, all di paint don spoil, we con paint our house again.

Text_en: Then we'll wash everywhere in the house, uh... clean up the whole place.
Text_ortho: Go con wash everywhere inside di house, eh clean up di whole place.

Text_en: It'll be spotless everywhere.
Text_ortho: Everywhere go dey shine.

Text_en: Then we'll buy new clothes, and new shoes for the kids.
Text_ortho: Den we go buy new clothes, and new shoe for children.

Text_en: Even if the adults couldn't buy anything so far, they'll buy for the children.
Text_ortho: Even if adult no fit buy, so far, we go buy for children.

Text_en: Then, before the day of the festival or so, there is a particular leaf.
Text_ortho: Den before di day of di festival like dis, e get one leaf.

Text_en: That leaf uh... where it is in the bush, in fact, only God who knows where that leaf is.
Text_ortho: Dat leaf eh, for where e dey inside bush, in fact, na only God know where dat leaf dey.

Text_en: There are some people who go far, far inso... into the bush.
Text_ortho: E get di people wey dey go far, far inso-... into di bush.

Text_en: They call the leaf Ewere leaf.
Text_ortho: De dey call di leaf Ewere leaf.

Text_en: That leaf... that leaf, they say it represents peace.
Text_ortho: Dat leaf, dat leaf, de say e signify peace.

Text_en: So the uh... Benin people consider it a leaf that represents peace... which shows peace.
Text_ortho: So di eh Benin people dey look am sey na leaf wey signify peace, wey dey show peace.

Text_en: So they will go and pluck that leaf, cut it into very small pieces, put it into a calabash, pour water on it.
Text_ortho: So de go go pluck dat leaf come, con cut am into small, small, small, small pieces, con pack am put for inside calabash, pour water inside di leaf.

Text_en: Then, the Oba of Benin will pray on top of that calabash.
Text_ortho: Den di Oba of Benin go con pray on top of dat calabash.

Text_en: So on the day... the, the, the... early in the morning of that festival, even before we wake up, around four or five, so peo-... some people will carry the leaf around the whole of Benin from house to house.
Text_ortho: So on di day, di, di, di, di early morning of dat festival, before we go even wake up sef, dat kind four, five, so peo-... some people go con carry di leaf enter di whole of Benin from house, to house.

Text_en: Any house, any compound which they get to like this uh... they will start knocking.
Text_ortho: Any house, any compound wey de reach like dis eh, de go begin dey knock.

Text_en: If there is a gate, they will start knocking on the gate.
Text_ortho: If de get gate, de go begin dey knock di gate.

Text_en: They will be singing as they come.
Text_ortho: De go dey sing dey come o.

Text_en: There will be a band playing.
Text_ortho: De go dey play band.

Text_en: Let me sing the song for you.
Text_ortho: Make I sing di sing for you.

Text_en: Ah! I like that song!
Text_ortho: Ah I like dat sing eh.

Text_en: When I was a little kid, ah! That song was great.
Text_ortho: When I be small pikin, ah dat sing dey trip.

Text_en: I'll tell you.
Text_ortho: I go tell you.

Text_en: Wait first!
Text_ortho: Wait first!

Text_en: Just listen first!
Text_ortho: Just dey listen first!

Text_en: Thats how they'll be singing it when they're coming.
Text_ortho: Na so de go dey sing am dey come.

Text_en: Once you hear that song uh... no matter how deep you're sleeping, or how you dream, you just have to wake up.
Text_ortho: Once you hear dat sing eh, e no get how di sleep deep, or how di dream be eh, you go must wake up.

Text_en: You will open the gate for them.
Text_ortho: You go open di gate for dem.

Text_en: They say, "ah, Ewere is coming!"
Text_ortho: De say ah Ewere dey come o!

Text_en: "Open the gate to..."
Text_ortho: Make you open gate for...

Text_en: "Open your door to Ewere."
Text_ortho: Make you open your door for Ewere.

Text_en: You know that that the Ewere leaf is, is peace.
Text_ortho: You know sey dat Ewere leaf na, na peace.

Text_en: Thats what it means.
Text_ortho: Na im e mean.

Text_en: So you must open up.
Text_ortho: So make you open.

Text_en: Peace is coming to your house!
Text_ortho: Peace dey come your house o.

Text_en: Open up, let peace come in!
Text_ortho: Make you open, make peace enter.

Text_en: So they sing, praising the god of peace.
Text_ortho: So de dey sing, dey praise di God of peace.

Text_en: So as you open your door to let them in, it's like you accept peace, and you accept the God of peace, and peace will be in your house.
Text_ortho: So as you open your door meh de enter so, e be sey you accept peace, and you accept di God of peace, and peace go dey your house.

Text_en: So for the following year, you have already settled your peace.
Text_ortho: So for di following year so you don ready settle your peace.

Text_en: So everybody will quickly open their door.
Text_ortho: So everybody go quick dey open door.

Text_en: They will come inside, start sprinkling the water from the leaf.
Text_ortho: De go come inside, begin sprinkle di water di leaf.

Text_en: So you'll be trying to make sure that at least one drop of the water touches your body.
Text_ortho: Na so you go dey hustle make at least one drop of di water touch your body.

Text_en: You will bring out all the children.
Text_ortho: You go dey carry all di children come.

Text_en: They will be sprinkling the water.
Text_ortho: De go dey sprinkle di water.

Text_en: The leaf, everybody will (even if you got only one)... will hang it on their door where all the evil spirits will see it.
Text_ortho: Di leaf, everybody go (even if na one you see), go hang am for your door where all di evil spirit go dey see am.

Text_en: So when they come and see the Ewere leaf like this, they will run away saying, "guys, this house is a no go area!"
Text_ortho: So when de come, de see di Ewere leaf like dis, de go run comot say mehn dis house na no go area o.

Text_en: Different... different people, will carry ca-...
Text_ortho: Different, different people now, de go carry ca-...

Text_en: You know that Benin is big, right?
Text_ortho: You know sey Benin big now?

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: There are different... different areas, yeah.
Text_ortho: Different, different area ehen.

Text_en: So, maybe people from the palace or... they will come, they will be spreading the thing.
Text_ortho: So maybe people from di palace or, de go come, de go dey spread di thing.

Text_en: So it is very interesting.
Text_ortho: So e dey very interesting.

Text_en: That one is in the very early morning of the day of the festival.
Text_ortho: Dat one na di very early morning of di day of di festival.

Text_en: Then there are some rituals which the Oba will perform in the palace, you know, by noon... in the afternoon.
Text_ortho: Den e get some rituals wey Oba go perform for palace (you know) by noon time, by afternoon time.

Text_en: So, everybody will start slaughtering their goats.
Text_ortho: So everybody go con begin kill deir goat.

Text_en: They have some kinds of incantations, some kinds of thing they will do.
Text_ortho: E get some kind incantation, some kind ting wey de go do.

Text_en: They start slaughtering the goats, then they begin pounding yam.
Text_ortho: Begin kill di goat, den begin pound pounded yam.

Text_en: They will then begin serving the food.
Text_ortho: De go con begin serve food.

Text_en: That one, to me, is the sweetest part.
Text_ortho: Na dat one dey sweet me pass.

Text_en: They start serving the food, taking some to relatives, giving some to friends, neighbors.
Text_ortho: Con begin serve food, carry go give relations, go give friends, neighbours.

Text_en: And you know, when we were young, any child who brings food to your house like that, you must give him money.
Text_ortho: And you know, dat time wey we small, any pikin wey carry food come your house like dat, you go must give am money.

Text_en: So we really liked doing it because the number if houses you take food to, you will...
Text_ortho: So we dey like to do dat one well, well because di number of house wey you carry food go you go...

Text_en: It means that the amount of money you'll collect that day won't be small.
Text_ortho: Na im be sey, di money wey you go collect dat day no be small.

Text_en: So, there will be plenty of food.
Text_ortho: So food go berekete.

Text_en: We will eat really well.
Text_ortho: We go chop well, well.

Text_en: And relatives who have come from different places, you know, will be around.
Text_ortho: And relations wey come from different, different places (you know), de go dey around.

Text_en: The music will be loud.
Text_ortho: Music, e go dey blow.

Text_en: We will be dancing, you know.
Text_ortho: We go dey dance you know.

Text_en: It is very interesting.
Text_ortho: E dey dey very interesting.

Text_en: Then the Oba of Benin will, will address the people, those who went to the palace.
Text_ortho: Den di Oba of Benin go, go address di people dose wey go palace o.

Text_en: He will address them, you know.
Text_ortho: Go address dem you know.

Text_en: He will tell the people how to... how we should behave, even the kinds of things we will do so that uh... the gods will not get angry with us.
Text_ortho: Tell di people how to, how we go take behave, even di kind tins wey we go do so dat eh di gods no go dey angry with us.

Text_en: You know, all those kinds of things.
Text_ortho: You know, all dose kind things.

Text_en: That period uh... no markets will be open!
Text_ortho: Dat period eh, no market go open o.

Text_en: Nobody will... nobody will...
Text_ortho: Nobody go, nobody go...

Text_en: In fact, its even against the law to open the market, to sell a single thing.
Text_ortho: In fact, na even against di law sef sey you go go open market, sey you dey sell one thing.

Text_en: All shops, everywhere, will close down, yes, so that it wants to... you want to respect the gods during that period.
Text_ortho: All shops, everywhere, e go close down yes so dat e want to, you want respect di gods for dat period eh.

Text_en: But these days now ah, the Church has been preaching against all those kinds of things o.
Text_ortho: But dese days now ah, Church don dey preach against all dose kind tins o.

Text_en: Uhuh.
Text_ortho: Ehen.

Text_en: The Church has been preaching against it.
Text_ortho: Church don dey preach against.

Text_en: They say all those kinds of things are... are rituals, are the Devil.
Text_ortho: De say all dose kind tins na, na ritual, na Devil.

Text_en: People use all those kinds of things to worship him.
Text_ortho: Na im people dey use all dose kind tin dey serve.

Text_en: So as people are becoming Christians now, the festival doesn't carry as much weight as before.
Text_ortho: So as people don dey become Christian now, so di festival no dey carry like dat again.

Text_en: But they are still doing it!
Text_ortho: But de still dey do am o.

Text_en: They are still doing it.
Text_ortho: De still dey do am.

Text_en: Every year, they have to do it.
Text_ortho: Every year, de must do am.

Text_en: So that's how the festival is, very, very, very interesting.
Text_ortho: So na so di festival be very, very, very interesting.

Text_en: Ah if, if you... if, if, if you want to witness it uh... around the twenty seventh, twenty eighth, just come to Benin.
Text_ortho: Ah if, if you, if, if, if you want witness am eh, during dat kind twenty seven twenty eight, just come Benin.

Text_en: Come and see the festival.
Text_ortho: Make you con see festival.

Text_en: Very interesting.
Text_ortho: Very interesting.

Text_en: Even the masquerades, they are coming out.
Text_ortho: Masquerade sef, de dey come outside.

Text_en: Hey now!
Text_ortho: Eh now!

Text_en: You will... you can come now, no problem.
Text_ortho: You go, you fit come now, no problem.

Text_en: Masquerades will come out.
Text_ortho: Masquerade go come outside.

Text_en: Ah they will be dancing.
Text_ortho: Ah de go dey dance.

Text_en: But women dont get close to masquerades!
Text_ortho: But women no dey near masquerade o.

Text_en: They sure don't!
Text_ortho: No o.

Text_en: If you get close to masquerades in Benin lands, as a woman, they could flog you.
Text_ortho: If you near masquerade for Benin lands, as a woman, de fit flog you.

Text_en: So it's taboo for women to go.
Text_ortho: So na taboo for woman to go.

Text_en: So it's from a distance that... that women look at them.
Text_ortho: So na from distance na im, na im women dey look dem.

Text_en: Uhuh, but men can get close to them.
Text_ortho: Ehen but men fit go near dem.

Text_en: Because they see those uh... masquerades as uh... the representatives...
Text_ortho: So because de dey see dose eh masquerade as eh di representative...

Text_en: They see them as spirits.
Text_ortho: De dey see dem as spirit.

Text_en: They see them as the god... the spirits which the gods sent to bless us.
Text_ortho: Eh de see dem as di god, di spirit wey di gods send come con take bless us.

Text_en: So we can't just go near them.
Text_ortho: So we no fit just go near dem.

Text_en: Ah, they respect them very well.
Text_ortho: Ah de respect dem well, well.

Text_en: So once the masquerades dance out like that, you will see how people throw money at them.
Text_ortho: So once di masquerade dance come out like dat, you go see people go dey throw money give dem.

Text_en: They throw money at them.
Text_ortho: De trow money give dem.

Text_en: As they are throwing money at them, as if they are asking for prayers, they are asking for blessings.
Text_ortho: As de dey throw money give dem so, e be sey de dey ask for prayer, de dey ask for blessing.

Text_en: Things have been so hard that if a man and a woman like each other and say to each other "we'll get married tomorrow. You will be faithful to me alone. Don't be faithful to another person.", it's a lie!
Text_ortho: Tings don so hard sotay if man, and woman like each oda, con tell each oda sey we go marry tomorrow o, na only me you go dey follow o, no follow anoda person o, na lie!

Text_en: It doesn't work like that.
Text_ortho: E no dey work like dat.

Text_en: That agreement we had, one of us will go and break it.
Text_ortho: Dat agreement wey me and you get so, one of us go go back go scatter am now.

Text_en: Uh... I know the question you're asking.
Text_ortho: Ehen me, na now me know di question wey you dey ask.

Text_en: What you want to know is why they will go and ruin it.
Text_ortho: Now wetin you want know be dat sey why de go con go scatter am?

Text_en: Good.
Text_ortho: Good.

Text_en: You see uh... on this first point, let me be the first to talk.
Text_ortho: You see ehn first place wey we dey so, make I first talk man own.

Text_en: Why will men cheat on women?
Text_ortho: Why man go dey go dey cheat on women?

Text_en: You see, men, as they are, they have too many bad friends.
Text_ortho: You see men, as you dey see dem so, de too dey get bad, bad friends.

Text_en: I am not talking about you.
Text_ortho: I no dey talk to una.

Text_en: And the friends, they're so en-... he-... they lead them astray.
Text_ortho: And di friends dem so ehn, e, dem dey mislead dem.

Text_en: So those ones, even the pastors you see around, who go to church, yeah, are not left out.
Text_ortho: So dose ones, even pastor wey you dey see so, wey dey go church so, some yeah dey dere.
