Text_en: Yes indeed!
Text_ortho: Yes o!

Text_en: When they meet and talk privately, one pastor will tell the other uh... you know we are humans, so God understands.
Text_ortho: When dem don go meet demself dey talk for back, one pastor go tell di oda one sey hm you know sey we be human being, so God dey understand.

Text_en: Then you who's never done it, would think it's true. It's not a big deal. It is a minor sin.
Text_ortho: Den you wey never do am before, you go con look am sey na true sha, no be big ting, na small sin.

Text_en: So, they influence each other.
Text_ortho: So dem dey influence each oda.

Text_en: That's what makes...
Text_ortho: Na im dey make...

Text_en: That's what I've seen.
Text_ortho: Hm na wetin me, I see o!

Text_en: Men cheat because the circle of friends they follow around, they don't see it as a big deal if you're not faithful to one woman.
Text_ortho: Men dey cheat because sey di circle of friends wey dem dey follow dey waka, de no see am as big deal sey you no stay with one woman.

Text_en: In fact, it'll look like you're stupid.
Text_ortho: In fact, e go be like sey you stupid sef.

Text_en: In this generation of ours now, being with only one woman, you don't have shortcuts (They call it shortcuts! Yes!), if you don't have shortcuts, what will you be like?
Text_ortho: For di kind generation wey we dey now, sey you dey follow only one woman, you no get shortcut (de dey call am shortcut, hm), sey you no get shortcut, you go be like wetin?

Text_en: Are you Jesus?
Text_ortho: You be Jesus?

Text_en: That's how they are.
Text_ortho: Na so de dey...

Text_en: And it's what I see.
Text_ortho: And na wetin me dey see o!

Text_en: Yes.
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: So, they are...
Text_ortho: So de dey...

Text_en: The cheating that is going on now, uh... from men's side, it's the type of friends they have, they are the ones teaching them how to cheat.
Text_ortho: Di cheating wey dey go on so now ehn, from men side, na di kind friends wey dem get na im dey teach dem how to cheat.

Text_en: And I really mean it, so much that those who go to church are not left out.
Text_ortho: And I mean am sotay reach sey even dose wen dey go church.

Text_en: If you don't have good friends, you will go to church (you know) and you will still cheat.
Text_ortho: If you no still get better friend, you go still go church (you know), you go still cheat.

Text_en: Yes mtschew, man, are you open? Do you understand?
Text_ortho: Hm mtschew dis my broda, you, you open, you sabi so?

Text_en: Do you get around?
Text_ortho: You dey waka?

Text_en: If you don't go around, it's as if you're not aware of the things going on around you.
Text_ortho: You no dey waka, e be like sey you no dey see road!

Text_en: You don't go out!
Text_ortho: You no dey see road.

Text_en: Go out!
Text_ortho: Meh dey see road o!

Text_en: Men cheat everywhere.
Text_ortho: Men dey cheat up and down.

Text_en: Women also cheat but men cheat more.
Text_ortho: Women dey cheat o, but na men own plenty pass.

Text_en: And I'm telling you the reason why they cheat.
Text_ortho: And I dey tell you di reasons why dem dey cheat.

Text_en: Uh?
Text_ortho: Hm?

Text_en: This is because their friends encourage them.
Text_ortho: Because sey deir friends dey encourage dem.

Text_en: They don't have friends who will tell them that it's very bad.
Text_ortho: De no get friends wen go tell dem sey e dey very bad.

Text_en: In fact, their friends will make it look like you don't know what's up if you don't cheat.
Text_ortho: In fact deir friends go make am look like sey you no know what's up if you no dey cheat.

Text_en: How can you just say you will be faithful to only one woman?
Text_ortho: How you go just say only one woman, na im you go just dey follow?

Text_en: That is a big problem that makes cheating happen in relationships.
Text_ortho: Dat na big problem wey dey make cheating dey, dey happen for relationship.

Text_en: Then, the other thing that happens is that the women themselves are bad.
Text_ortho: Den di oda one wey con dey happen be sey women sef, dem bad.

Text_en: We are the ones working against ourselves.
Text_ortho: Na we dey do ourselves.

Text_en: If not, if a man asks the secretary out, and the secretary knows that a lady comes to see her boss, it means you know this boss has a wife.
Text_ortho: If not, if man con meet secretary, and secretary know sey madam dey always come see oga, e mean sey you know sey dis oga get wife.

Text_en: How come, when the boss started flirting with you, when he started asking you out, you also agreed?
Text_ortho: How come when oga con begin dey cut eye for you, con begin dey toast you, you sef, you gree?

Text_en: You are not supposed to agree.
Text_ortho: You no suppose to gree so.

Text_en: So, apart from the fact that men are not focused (That's how we say it in pidgin. They're not focused. They don't have good friends.), we women, we're bad too.
Text_ortho: Apart from sey men, deir eye no done (na so we dey talk am for Pidgin o, deir eye no done, dem no get better friend), we, women sef, we bad.

Text_en: We are working against ourselves.
Text_ortho: We dey do oursefs.

Text_en: This is because if you said no, the man would walk away.
Text_ortho: Because if you say you no gree, di man go go.

Text_en: But if you give in, yes, the show begins.
Text_ortho: But if you gree, ehen parade don start.

Text_en: Yes.
Text_ortho: Yes o!

Text_en: You call it a business, but I call it a show.
Text_ortho: Na you call am business, na parade I call am.

Text_en: Yes.
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: Then, you see this cheating we are talking about uh... mtshew, our culture is bad.
Text_ortho: Den, you see dis cheating wey we dey talk so ehn mtschew, culture dey bad.

Text_en: In this Nigeria we're in, if I am going out with your brother and your brother cheats on me, if I report him to you, you know what you will tell me now.
Text_ortho: For dis Nigeria wey me and you dey so, if I dey go out with your brother, your brother cheat, I con report am give you, you know wetin you go tell me now.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ha!

Text_en: You'll ask me if he was circumcised for my sake alone.
Text_ortho: You go tell me sey weda na because of only me dem circumcise am?

Text_en: A woman once said to a girl, "why do you say he should not flirt with another woman?"
Text_ortho: One woman don tell one girl like dat sey why you'll say make e no follow anoda woman?

Text_en: "Is it because of you alone I circumcised my child?"
Text_ortho: Na because of only you I circumcise my pikin?

Text_en: So, culture itself does not help in this matter at all.
Text_ortho: So culture sef e no help matter at all.

Text_en: You will go and report to the mother and the mother will ask you, "why? Let my child taste!"
Text_ortho: You go go report give mama, mama go tell you sey why, make my pikin taste!

Text_en: "Tasting" they call it.
Text_ortho: Or na taste dem dey call am o!

Text_en: Let him taste other women.
Text_ortho: Make e taste oda women.

Text_en: Yes, that is it!
Text_ortho: Hm na so!

Text_en: Then you see this issue of cheating, I am talking about the men's.
Text_ortho: Den you see dis cheating, na men own I dey talk o!

Text_en: Women's own uh... is more serious.
Text_ortho: Women own eh, e plenty.

Text_en: Yes.
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: Then you see this cheating men indulge in, some women have money.
Text_ortho: Den you see dis cheating wey men dey cheat so, some women get money.

Text_en: They use it to catch men like this.
Text_ortho: De dey take am catch men like dis.

Text_en: They will buy them.
Text_ortho: Dem go buy dem.

Text_en: But a man who you know is married, whose wife is managing, when he tells you he wants to celebrate his birthday, you will go and buy him an iPad, and the, all those other big things you give as gifts.
Text_ortho: But man wey you know sey don marry, im wife dey manage, when e tell you sey e want do birthday, you go go buy am Ipad, and di, all dose big, big tings wey you take am do gifts.

Text_en: The greedy man then will begin to say madam, thank...
Text_ortho: Di long throat man now go con begin dey say madam thank...

Text_en: Madam, Madam will soon become your name.
Text_ortho: Madam, madam go soon start to become your name.

Text_en: Then he'll start calling you by your name.
Text_ortho: E go con start to dey call you your name.

Text_en: Uh... Titi uh... thank you for yesterday.
Text_ortho: Eh Titi, eh thank you for dat yesterday.

Text_en: From there, bad things start happening.
Text_ortho: From dere, bad, bad tings dey happen.

Text_en: So, because men are greedy, they're looking for better places.
Text_ortho: So because of sey men greedy, de dey find where sweet.

Text_en: The wife at home can't buy them an iPad for their birthday.
Text_ortho: Di wife for house no dey fit buy dem Ipad during birthday.

Text_en: The rich women who know how to start making men sleep with them, if they like you, they will start buying nice things for you.
Text_ortho: Rich, rich women wey dey find how dem go just take begin dey make men sleep wit dem, if dem see you say dem like you, de go begin buy big, big ting dey give you.

Text_en: So indiscipline.
Text_ortho: So indiscipline!

Text_en: I call that indiscipline.
Text_ortho: I call dat one indiscipline.

Text_en: Apart from greed on the part of the man, it's indiscipline.
Text_ortho: Apart from greed on di part of di man, na indiscipline.

Text_en: Good.
Text_ortho: Good!

Text_en: Then, personally and finally, the women in the house, the wives at home, they are making some men cheat.
Text_ortho: Den my own o, finally o, di women for house, di wife for house, de dey make some men dey cheat.

Text_en: We know ourselves.
Text_ortho: We know oursefs.

Text_en: Some men, as they are, they cannot control their body.
Text_ortho: Some men, as you dey see dem so, dem no dey fit keep body.

Text_en: They like their body to touch other bodies.
Text_ortho: Dem dey like make body dey touch body.

Text_en: But you see, some women, uh... there is that time when we say we have a headache, we are not well, we did this, we did that.
Text_ortho: But you see some of us, women, hm na dat time we go talk sey we get headache, we no well, we do dis, we do dat.

Text_en: Ah!
Text_ortho: Ah!

Text_en: Wherever a man will come, he will come.
Text_ortho: Where man go come, e go come.

Text_en: You, you will be the only one to open your mouth and ask, "please, is sex a kind of food?"
Text_ortho: You, only you go con open your mouth, tell am sey abeg sex na food?

Text_en: Lea-... leave me... leave me... leave me... leave me alone.
Text_ortho: Le-... leave me, leave me, leave me, leave me alone.

Text_en: Is that not so?
Text_ortho: No be so.

Text_en: Men will just go and cheat on you!
Text_ortho: Di man go go cheat o!

Text_en: So, we women at home, we are the wives, uh... we contribute to why men cheat.
Text_ortho: So we, di women wey dey house, wey be di wives eh, hm we dey contribute to why men dey cheat.

Text_en: And some wo-... some women are dirty!
Text_ortho: And some of wo-... some women sef dirty!

Text_en: Oh!
Text_ortho: Heh!

Text_en: Mtshew oh Jesus!
Text_ortho: Mtschew oh Jesus!

Text_en: You...
Text_ortho: You...

Text_en: A man whose secretary uses deodarants, perfumes and some other sweet... long-lasting and sweet-smelling things... you have been in the house all day and you have not even brushed your teeth.
Text_ortho: Man wey im secretary for house dey use deodorants, dey use perfume, dey use swe-... strong, sweet, sweet, sweet, sweet smelling tings, you, you dey house since morning, you never even brush mouth.

Text_en: Let alone take a shower.
Text_ortho: Amawe to bath.

Text_en: When your man comes home, do you expect him to give in to you?
Text_ortho: When di man go come house, you go con expect sey na you wan enter im...

Text_en: If you see the skimpy skirts these young girls wear nowadays uh... they are witches!
Text_ortho: If you see di short, short skirt wey dis children dey wear nowadays ehn, dem be witch o!

Text_en: Those girls... Ah! They are real witches.
Text_ortho: Dose girls, ah hm dem be better witch.

Text_en: But if the woman in the house could try not to be too fat!
Text_ortho: But if di woman for house sef try, no fat full everywhere!

Text_en: Package!
Text_ortho: Package!

Text_en: They call it packaging.
Text_ortho: Dem dey call am package.

Text_en: Package yourself well.
Text_ortho: Package yourself well!

Text_en: Uh... I am not... hehe!
Text_ortho: Ehn no I no dey humhum!

Text_en: Package yourself well.
Text_ortho: Package yourself well!

Text_en: Some men even like women to be full-figured.
Text_ortho: Some men dey even like make women get body.

Text_en: They call women like that 'grab something women'.
Text_ortho: Dem dey call dose kind women grab someting women.

Text_en: Ah, let me grab some!
Text_ortho: Ah mah I grab someting!

Text_en: Yes, so, the woman should try to be...
Text_ortho: Yes so di woman go try make she...

Text_en: If you are full-figured, pack it well.
Text_ortho: If you get body, dey package am well!

Text_en: Your man will like it.
Text_ortho: Di man go dey like am.

Text_en: Then, as for women, why do they cheat?
Text_ortho: Den on di part of di women, why dem dey cheat?

Text_en: Uh...
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: You know women uh... as you are seeing them over there hey!
Text_ortho: You see women ehn, as you dey see dem dere so ehn, hai!

Text_en: Hm!
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: How shall I put it?
Text_ortho: How I wan take talk am o?

Text_en: They are not satisfied with little things.
Text_ortho: Small ting no dey reach dem!

Text_en: Since our university days, this my husband has never bought me a phone.
Text_ortho: Since we go university together, dis my husband, e never buy me phone one day.

Text_en: It's a cheap phone.
Text_ortho: Na kpalasa phone.

Text_en: Meanwhile, this friend of mine, her husband bought her this and that.
Text_ortho: Meanwhile, dat my friend, im husband buy am dis, e buy am dat.

Text_en: It... it gets them worried.
Text_ortho: E dey, dey, e dey worry deir brain.

Text_en: Their brain doesn't... it doesn't get tuned to the right place.
Text_ortho: Deir brain no dey, e no dey twist for right place.

Text_en: Yes, that's greed!
Text_ortho: En na greed.

Text_en: I said it.
Text_ortho: I talk am.

Text_en: Women are very greedy.
Text_ortho: Greed dey worry women well, well.

Text_en: You can also call it indiscipline.
Text_ortho: You go still call am indiscipline.

Text_en: You can still call it...
Text_ortho: You go still call am...

Text_en: How can I even put it?
Text_ortho: How I wan take even describe am?

Text_en: So, such women uh... at any available opportunity, they sure will cheat on the man.
Text_ortho: So dose kind women ehn, small opportunity like dis, dem go cheat on di man o!

Text_en: Even if you are married to her, or you're still dating, they will cheat on their man.
Text_ortho: Wheda you don marry am for house sef, or una still dey date, de go cheat on di man.

Text_en: Do you understand me, man?
Text_ortho: You dey understand me so my broda?

Text_en: Then, you see those women over there, don't you?
Text_ortho: Den you see women wey you dey see dere so ehn?

Text_en: Hum!
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: Men, as they are, uh... we call them predators.
Text_ortho: Men, as dem be so ehn, we dey call dem predators.

Text_en: Predators.
Text_ortho: Predators!

Text_en: They will...
Text_ortho: Dem go...

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes o!

Text_en: Once they see a woman they like, they will move heaven and earth.
Text_ortho: Once de don see woman wey dem like like dis, de fit turn di heaven, and earth upside down.

Text_en: They must... they must get that woman.
Text_ortho: Must, de must get dat woman, de must get dat woman.

Text_en: So it will take the grace of God for a wo-... wo-... a woman that a man will tell, "I must get you" like this, it will take the grace of God for her not to fall.
Text_ortho: So e go take di grace of God for wo-... wo-... woman wey man talk sey I must get you like dis, e go take di grace of God make you no fall.

Text_en: Because...
Text_ortho: Because...

Text_en: Eh, what?
Text_ortho: Eh wetin?

Text_en: Am I talking to you?
Text_ortho: I dey talk to you?

Text_en: So, because the man, uh... He will study you, study everything.
Text_ortho: So because dat man, ehen e go study you, study everyting.

Text_en: Your...
Text_ortho: Your...

Text_en: He will understand what you suffer from, what you need.
Text_ortho: E go understand wetin you dey suffer, wetin you dey lack.

Text_en: Then he'll start giving you those things
Text_ortho: E go con begin dey give you.

Text_en: May God catch you!
Text_ortho: Meh God come catch you!

Text_en: If your husband starts misbehaving or if he is not serious, you will just fall.
Text_ortho: Your husband for house sef, e come dey misbehave, or na one kind yeye man, you go just fall.

Text_en: There are a lot of things I dont like about a lot of people.
Text_ortho: E get many tings wen I no dey like for many people body.

Text_en: But to tell you this kind of thing that...
Text_ortho: But to tell you dis kind of tings sey...

Text_en: Except if I want to call the person by name.
Text_ortho: Except I wan call di person name.

Text_en: But it's not good for someone to call a person by name.
Text_ortho: But e no good make person dey call person name.

Text_en: So I will tell you a story.
Text_ortho: So I go tell you one story.

Text_en: This story, they told me when I was in primary school.
Text_ortho: Dis story, de tell me when I dey primary school.

Text_en: And they told me the story in Pidgin.
Text_ortho: And na Pidgin de take tell me di story.

Text_en: And I will try to remember everything that happened in the story as the guy said it.
Text_ortho: And I go try remember everyting wey happen for di story as di guy take talk am.

Text_en: But that guy, he knows how to tell stories really well.
Text_ortho: But dat guy, e sabi talk story well, well.

Text_en: That guy, I admired him when we were in primary school at that time.
Text_ortho: Dat guy, I dey admire am when we dey primary school dat time.

Text_en: He said he wanted to tell us a story, and all of us should listen.
Text_ortho: Im say e wan tell us one story, make all of us listen.

Text_en: Then he started.
Text_ortho: Naim e con start.

Text_en: He said, "story, story."
Text_ortho: E con say story, story.

Text_en: Then we said, "story."
Text_ortho: We con say story!

Text_en: "Story, story."
Text_ortho: Story, story!

Text_en: "Story."
Text_ortho: Story.

Text_en: He said that the name of the story that he wanted to tell was "The story of Alaska Pepper."
Text_ortho: E say di title of di story wen e wan tell us, na di story of Alaska Pepper.

Text_en: Aha, so who is this Alaska Pepper?
Text_ortho: Aha who be dis Alaska Pepper?

Text_en: Why did he have a name like Alaska Pepper?
Text_ortho: Why e get name like Alaska Pepper?

Text_en: "Pepper" is even in the name.
Text_ortho: Pepper even dey di name.

Text_en: He told us to listen, keep quiet, and let him tell us this story.
Text_ortho: E say make we listen, meh we keep quiet, make e tell us dis story.

Text_en: Alaska Pepper was a little boy.
Text_ortho: Sey Alaska Pepper na one small boy.

Text_en: Nobody liked Alaska Pepper in the place where they were staying.
Text_ortho: Nobody like Alaska Pepper for di area where de dey stay.

Text_en: In that area, Alaska Pepper was always causing trouble.
Text_ortho: For dat area, Alaska Pepper dey always dey cause trouble.

Text_en: If anything went wrong, you would call Alaska Pepper's name.
Text_ortho: Anyting wey de do bad, you go call Alaska Pepper name inside.

Text_en: If you saw a pot on the ground, a pot that was dirty, a pot that was dented, you knew it was Alaska Pepper's fault.
Text_ortho: If you see pot for ground, pot wey e moko, pot wey e don dent, you know sey na Alaska Pepper na im cause am.

Text_en: If you saw a pot that was broken, you knew it was Alaska Pepper.
Text_ortho: If you see pot wey e break, you go know sey na Alaska Pepper cause am.

Text_en: Anywhere trouble was passing through, that's the kind of place Alaska Pepper was heading.
Text_ortho: Anywhere trouble dey waka follow, na dat kind place na im Alaska Pepper dey go.

Text_en: So people did not like him.
Text_ortho: So people no con like am.

Text_en: So Alaska Pepper was always doing, doing things that people didn't like in the community.
Text_ortho: So Alaska Pepper dey always do, do tings wey people no dey like for dat community.

Text_en: But Alaska Pepper was one kind of person that people didn't like.
Text_ortho: But Alaska Pepper, na one kind person wey e be sey people no like.

Text_en: But there were things that were... that were going on in Alap-... Alaska Pepper's mind.
Text_ortho: But e get some kind tings wey dey, wey e dey work for inside Alap-... Alaska Pepper mind.

Text_en: So in that town where they were, there were days which were... they were calling their market days.
Text_ortho: So for dat town where de dey, e get di days wey e dey, de dey call deir market days.

Text_en: Women, everybody in different villages, would bring their different things.
Text_ortho: Women, everybody for different, different village, de go carry deir different, different tings.

Text_en: Cassava, pepper, garri, uh... different things, they would carry them on their heads.
Text_ortho: Cassava, pepper, garri, ehn different tings, de go carry am put for head.

Text_en: They would go to this one market.
Text_ortho: De go go one market.

Text_en: That market is Agbadu Market.
Text_ortho: Dat market, na Agbadu Market.

Text_en: Before they would get there, some would cross Ikpoba, Ikpoba River... before they would reach it.
Text_ortho: Before de go reach dere, some will cross Ikpoba, Ikpoba River before de go reach dere.

Text_en: Some people were coming from another place which they called Enyan.
Text_ortho: Some people dey come from anoda place wey de dey call Enyan.

Text_en: From different places, they would gather in that market.
Text_ortho: For different, different place, go come gada for dat market.

Text_en: So, there was a period when the market would start in the morning.
Text_ortho: So e get one period wey di market go start in di morning.

Text_en: It's in the evening people would leave to go there.
Text_ortho: Na evening na im people go take comot dere.

Text_en: Because people went there on foot in those days.
Text_ortho: Because people dey use leg dose days dey travel go di place.

Text_en: They would leave the house early in the morning, and once they reached the place, they would display all the things they had brought.
Text_ortho: De go comot early morning for house, and once de don reach dere, den de go con shade all di tings wey de carry come.

Text_en: Then people would stay and start buying.
Text_ortho: Den people con stay, con start to dey buy.

Text_en: So, it's in that kind of place, that's where Alaska Pepper, (that kind of a place where that market was, A... Agbadu) that's where Alaska Pepper grew up.
Text_ortho: So na dat kind place na im Alaska Pepper (dat kind place where dat market dey, Agbadu), na im Alaska Pepper for grow.

Text_en: Then, they knew that Alaska Pepper was not a good kid.
Text_ortho: Na im de know sey Alaska Pepper no be better pikin.

Text_en: That it was bad things and bad people that Alaska Pepper was following.
Text_ortho: Sey na bad, bad tings, and bad, bad boys na im Alaska Pepper dey follow.

Text_en: So something happened then.
Text_ortho: So e get one ting wey e con happen.

Text_en: Nobody knew how to... to call... to call the thing.
Text_ortho: Nobody know wetin call, to call, to call di ting.

Text_en: One kind of a monster was just coming out from the bush.
Text_ortho: One kind ojuju just dey come out from inside bush.

Text_en: Because at that time, it was like they wanted to do one big festival in Benin.
Text_ortho: Because dat period, e be like sey de wan con do one big festival for Benin.

Text_en: So people were really coming to the market.
Text_ortho: So people con dey really dey come market.

Text_en: Children were following their moms and dads to the market.
Text_ortho: Children dey follow deir papa, and deir mama dey come market.

Text_en: So at that time, the monster would just come out from the bush.
Text_ortho: So dis kind period, di ojuju go just come out from bush.

Text_en: It would see a child, it would take it away.
Text_ortho: E go see pikin, e go carry am.

Text_en: Aha! People were wondering: three people went to the market, only two came back.
Text_ortho: Aha people con dey wonder sey three people go market, only two go come back.

Text_en: Another uh... another four people...
Text_ortho: Anoda, ehn anoda, four people...

Text_en: Two women would go, maybe one person, no, only she would come back.
Text_ortho: Two women go go, maybe one person, no, na im go come back.

Text_en: They took the story to the palace.
Text_ortho: De con dey carry di story dey go palace.

Text_en: They took it everywhere.
Text_ortho: De carry am go everywhere o.

Text_en: Come and see what's happening!
Text_ortho: Con see wetin dey happen o!

Text_en: It's like something is happening to us whenever we go to the market.
Text_ortho: E be like sey someting dey happen to us anytime wey we go market.

Text_en: When we go to the market, someone will not come back.
Text_ortho: When we go market, one person no go come back.

Text_en: Then the, the king said he had heard about the matter, he would do something.
Text_ortho: Naim di, di king con say im don hear di matter, im go do someting.

Text_en: So the king told everybody to come.
Text_ortho: So di king con call everybody come.

Text_en: All the elders, then he told them, you see what our people are complaining about. The market is a place where they can't go anymore.
Text_ortho: All di elders, con tell dem sey una see wetin our people dey complain sey market no dey let de go again.

Text_en: Because now it's like... because the thing is happening very often, they are not going to the market, they... like they used to.
Text_ortho: Because e con be like sey because di ting con dey happen well, well, de no con dey go market X, like de dey go market before.

Text_en: So some people were staying at home.
Text_ortho: So some people con dey go house.

Text_en: When the market day came, they would look for something else to do with their goods.
Text_ortho: When dat market day reach, de go find how de go do deir tings.

Text_en: Some people, their goods started to rot in the field.
Text_ortho: Some people, deir tings con dey rotten for farm.

Text_en: They were not taking them to the market.
Text_ortho: De no con dey carry am go market.

Text_en: So the king said he knew what to do.
Text_ortho: So naim di king con talk sey e know wetin e go do.

Text_en: Then he said all his best uh... his best uh... soldiers, should go to the market.
Text_ortho: E con say make all im best eh, im best eh soldiers, make de go di market.

Text_en: So soldiers should go to the market.
Text_ortho: So soldiers go con go di market.

Text_en: They should be waiting for the animal to come out.
Text_ortho: De go con dey wait make di animal come.

Text_en: So when the animal comes out, when the animal sees that they are soldiers, it won't see all those people, at once, it will go away.
Text_ortho: So as di animal go come, when di animal go see sey na soldier, e no see all dose people, e go first dey go.

Text_en: So when the animal saw that it was all soldiers that were coming, it... the animal caught one.
Text_ortho: When animal con see sey na soldier, soldier dey come, animal con, di animal con catch one.

Text_en: When they started shooting at the... ehen... the animal with their bows and arrows (the monster which had come out)...
Text_ortho: When de go shoot di, ehen di animal bow, and arrow, di ojuju wey dey come out...

Text_en: I have started calling it an animal now.
Text_ortho: A don dey call am animal now.

Text_en: I will tell you why I am calling it an animal.
Text_ortho: I go tell you why I dey call am animal.

Text_en: Because nobody could describe it.
Text_ortho: Because nobody fit describe am.

Text_en: Because its head, it was like a cow's head; its leg, it had a tail like a monkey's; its hand, it was like that..., it was like that of a human being; its body, it was like... it was as if it was a pig's body.
Text_ortho: Because im head, e be like cow head, im leg, e get tail like monkey, im hand, e be like sey na e be like human being hand, im body, e be like, be like sey na pig body.

Text_en: So, the only way you could describe it is that the animal is a monster.
Text_ortho: So di only way wey you fit take describe am na sey di animal na ojuju.

Text_en: So, the monster was catching people at that time.
Text_ortho: So di ojuju dey catch people dat time.

Text_en: So, when the soldiers the king sent wanted to shoot (who sent him), sent... wanted to shoot the thing with their bows and arrows, they would not go in.
Text_ortho: So when di soldiers wey di king send wan shoot, who send am, send wan shoot di ting bow, and arrow, di ting no go enter.

Text_en: They would fall away.
Text_ortho: E go fall troway.

Text_en: So nobody could kill it.
Text_ortho: So nobody fit kill am.

Text_en: So once it had caught somebody, the thing would carry them into the bush.
Text_ortho: So once e catch one, di ting go carry di person enter bush.

Text_en: So some people went to consult with native doctors.
Text_ortho: So some people con go meet native doctor.

Text_en: They prepared a strong traditional medicine that we call jazz.
Text_ortho: De con do strong medin wetin we dey call jazz.

Text_en: So they prepared it, and then put it into their gun.
Text_ortho: So de go con do am, con put am for deir gun.

Text_en: They shot the thing, it would not go in; the bullet would fall to the ground.
Text_ortho: De go shoot di ting, di ting no go enter, di bullet go fall for ground.

Text_en: So, when that kind of thing started happening, people started to run, they started trying all kinds of different methods.
Text_ortho: So when dat kind ting con dey happen, people go con dey run, de con dey try different, different method.

Text_en: Some people would use a cutlass.
Text_ortho: Some people go use cutlass.

Text_en: They would sharpen both sides of the cutlass, stab at the thing.
Text_ortho: De go sharp di two side of di cutlass, chook di ting.

Text_en: They would stab at it, the thing would not... it wouldn't go in.
Text_ortho: De go chook am put, di ting no go, e no go enter.

Text_en: They said what kind of thing is this?
Text_ortho: De say which kind ting be dis?

Text_en: So then the king called everybody back, and said, "see... that time, he had sent only his soldiers, but now, anybody... if you are a hunter, whatever you are, you should try."
Text_ortho: So naim di king con call everybody back, con say see o, dat time, im be send only im soldier, sey now, anybody, if you be hunter, anyting wey you be, meh you try!

Text_en: If you can kill... if you can kill this... kill this animal... see the... see the big thing he will do for you.
Text_ortho: If you fit kill, if you fit kill dis, kill dis animal, sey see di, see di big ting wey e go do for you.

Text_en: So he told them that a very big piece of land, plus one of his... his children, a... his daughter, that's what he would give them.
Text_ortho: So e con tell de sey one kind big land, plus one of im, im pikin, im daughter, na im go carry give di person.

Text_en: So then they said, "okay."
Text_ortho: So naim de con say okay.

Text_en: So then lots of different people, they formed different groups.
Text_ortho: So naim different, different people, de con form different group.

Text_en: Some were hunters, some soldiers, some uh... some, area boys.
Text_ortho: Some hunter group, some soldier group, some, eh some area boys group.

Text_en: All of them got together.
Text_ortho: All of dem con form.

Text_en: Even Alaska Pepper also had the ambition of killing this uh... monster which nobody could kill.
Text_ortho: Even Alaska Pepper too, con get ambition say im too go fit kill dis eh, dis ojuju wey nobody don fit kill.

Text_en: So, since the thing was only coming out on market days, everybody was ready.
Text_ortho: So because di ting dey only come out for market day, so everybody con ready.

Text_en: They went looking for this animal.
Text_ortho: De con go look for dis animal.

Text_en: They were looking for it.
Text_ortho: De con look for am.

Text_en: Some went to the bush, some to the road, some to the back of the market.
Text_ortho: Some con pass bush, some con pass road, some pass back of market.

Text_en: They were looking for the animal.
Text_ortho: De con dey look for di animal.

Text_en: When the time came for the animal to come out, it came out.
Text_ortho: When time con reach when di animal dey come out, e con come out.

Text_en: Everybody was trying different things, trying and trying different things.
Text_ortho: Everybody con dey try different tings, try, try different tings.

Text_en: It didn't work.
Text_ortho: E no work.

Text_en: The animal still took the one it wanted to carry into the bush.
Text_ortho: Di animal con still carry di one wey e wan carry enter bush.

Text_en: So every day, people were staying outside.
Text_ortho: So everyday people con dey stay outside.

Text_en: Different groups (soldiers, hunters), were everywhere, waiting for this animal, doing their best.
Text_ortho: Different group (soldier, hunter dem), con dey everywhere dey wait for dis animal, dey try.

Text_en: Ak-... as I said before, some prepared some traditional medicine.
Text_ortho: Ak-... as I talk before, some do medin.

Text_en: Some had tied a red cloth around their head, some had tied a red uh... this thing on their...
Text_ortho: Some don tie red cloth for head, some don tie red eh dis ting for deir...

Text_en: Some had dipped uh... this thing of theirs in poison.
Text_ortho: Some don dip eh deir dis ting for poison.

Text_en: Some lit a big fire and put them in.
Text_ortho: Some con make big fire come put.

Text_en: They said maybe the thing's skin is really dry.
Text_ortho: De say maybe di ting skin, e too dry.

Text_en: Then they made... they sharpened their arrows very well.
Text_ortho: De con make, con sharp deir arrow well, well.

Text_en: They put them in the fire, and left them there so they would be hot, so that anytime the animal came out, they would use their red hot arrows to shoot it with.
Text_ortho: De con dey put am for fire, de con leave am dere make e dey hot so dat anytime wey di animal come out, de go con use dat deir hot, hot arrow take shoot am.

Text_en: So they tried different methods.
Text_ortho: So de try different method.

Text_en: So early one morning, Alaska Pepper came to do something in the house.
Text_ortho: So e get one early morning wey Alaska Pepper con do someting for house.

Text_en: They were... they were looking for him.
Text_ortho: De con, de con dey look for am.

Text_en: Then he ran away from the house.
Text_ortho: Im con run comot for house.

Text_en: So as he got going, he put some stones in his pocket, and the slingshot he had, he put it in his pocket.
Text_ortho: So as im con dey go, im con carry some stone put for pocket, and di catapult wey e get, im con put am for pocket.

Text_en: So he was going.
Text_ortho: So im con dey go.

Text_en: As he got to this place, (which was... because anytime they were looking for him after he did something bad, he would run there and played near the river), so, it was... as he was running to that place to go and play, he ran into the animal on the road.
Text_ortho: As im con reach one place (wey be sey because anytime wey de dey look for am when e don do someting bad, e go run go dere go dey play for near river), so na as im con dey run dey go dat place sey make im go play na im con jam di animal for road.

Text_en: As he ran into it, he looked at it, the animal looked at him.
Text_ortho: As e jam am, e con look am, di animal look am.

Text_en: He wanted to start running away.
Text_ortho: Im want begin run.

Text_en: He said, aha, if he ran back to that side, the trouble he had started, they would punish him for that.
Text_ortho: E say aha if e run go dat side, di trouble wey e don cause, de go punish am put for dat one.

Text_en: That was how he looked at this animal, then he remembered that some stones and a slingshot were in his pocket.
Text_ortho: Naim con look dis animal, con remember sey stone, and catapult dey im pocket.

Text_en: He took the first one, he shot it.
Text_ortho: E con carry di first one, e con shoot am.

Text_en: It hit his chin, it fell on the ground.
Text_ortho: Di ting meet his chin, e fall for ground.

Text_en: So the thing came nearer.
Text_ortho: So di ting con dress nearer.

Text_en: Then he grabbed another stone, shot it, it hit the thing in the eye.
Text_ortho: Im con pick anoda stone, con shoot di ting, di ting con meet di ting for eye.

Text_en: The thing shook.
Text_ortho: Di ting con shake.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: So Alaska Pepper put his hand into his pocket, and pulled out the third stone.
Text_ortho: So na Alaska Pepper con chook im hand for pocket, con bring di third stone.

Text_en: He shot it in the mouth.
Text_ortho: E con shoot am for near mouth.

Text_en: It swallowed it.
Text_ortho: Di ting swallow di ting.

Text_en: Alaska Pepper was happy.
Text_ortho: Alaska Pepper con dey happy.

Text_en: Then he put his hand into his pocket again, and pulled out another one.
Text_ortho: E con chook hand for pocket again, e con bring anoda one.

Text_en: He shot it, and then the animal started shaking.
Text_ortho: E shoot di ting, di animal con dey shake.

Text_en: He put his hand in his pocket again, pulled out a stone (the fifth one) and shot it.
Text_ortho: E put hand for pocket again, bring stone (di number five one), shoot am.

Text_en: The animal started walking, it walked like it was drunk, it was staggering.
Text_ortho: Di animal con waka, waka like sey e don drink, con dey stagger.

Text_en: The animal even had a swagger.
Text_ortho: Di animal con even get swagger.

Text_en: While it was coming to get Alaska Pepper, Alaska Pepper pulled out stone number six.
Text_ortho: So as e dey waka dey go catch Alaska Pepper, so na Alaska Pepper bring di stone number six.

Text_en: He shot at the animal.
Text_ortho: Con shoot di animal.

Text_en: Then the animal stood still, it looked at Alaska Pepper.
Text_ortho: Di animal con stand for one place, e con look Alaska Pepper.

Text_en: As it tried to catch him, Alaska Pepper just shot the last stone at it.
Text_ortho: As e say make e catch am, na Alaska Pepper shoot am di last stone.

Text_en: The last stone.
Text_ortho: Di last stone.

Text_en: Stone number seven.
Text_ortho: Stone di number seven.

Text_en: As he shot the last stone at the animal, the animal looked at Alaska Pepper, and it just fell.
Text_ortho: As e shoot di animal di last stone, naim di animal look Alaska Pepper, just con fall.

Text_en: That was how the animal died.
Text_ortho: Na so di animal con take die.

Text_en: So Alaska Pepper said what is he going to do now, a... now that he'd killed this animal?
Text_ortho: So Alaska Pepper, con say wetin e go do now, now wey e don kill dis animal?

Text_en: He got scared.
Text_ortho: Fear con dey catch am.

Text_en: Then he took out a small knife.
Text_ortho: E con carry one small knife.

Text_en: There was a small knife that we used to make back in those days, that kind of knife.
Text_ortho: E get small, small knife wey we dey do dose days dat kind knife.

Text_en: Before using uh... one kind of thing, we would sharpen it on the ground.
Text_ortho: When we go use eh one kind ting, we go con sharp am for ground.

Text_en: Uhuh, that kind of knife.
Text_ortho: Ehen dat kind knife.

Text_en: He then managed... he used it to cut off the animal's tail.
Text_ortho: Con manage, con take cut di animal tail.

Text_en: He put it somewhere.
Text_ortho: E con put am somewhere.

Text_en: Then he cut off the... one of the legs and took it.
Text_ortho: E con cut di, one of di leg, e con carry am.

Text_en: He cut off one of its ears, and he took all of them.
Text_ortho: Con cut one of im ear, e con carry all of dem.

Text_en: He then carried it to that place where he used to play, and he left it there; he forgot about it.
Text_ortho: E con go carry am go dat place where e dey play, con leave am for dere, con forget.

Text_en: Then he played, played, played, played and played.
Text_ortho: E con play, play, play, play, play.

Text_en: When it was time, it was evening time when he realized that dinner would be ready at home, then he ran.
Text_ortho: When time con reach, evening con reach wey e know sey food don ready for house, naim e con run.

Text_en: He ran to the house.
Text_ortho: E con run go house.

Text_en: So he was on the road when he heard mom's voice saying, "where has this child gone to?"
Text_ortho: So e dey road when e hear mama voice say where dis pikin go?

Text_en: So he ran.
Text_ortho: So naim e con run.

Text_en: By that time, they had...
Text_ortho: By dat time, de don...

Text_en: People had forgotten... had forgotten what was happening.
Text_ortho: People don forget, con forget wetin dey happen.

Text_en: So that was how Alaska Pepper went, he had forgotten what he had done.
Text_ortho: So na Alaska Pepper con go, e don forget wetin e do.

Text_en: He had gone to sleep.
Text_ortho: Don go sleep.

Text_en: The next day, as people were going to the river, they saw the animal on the ground.
Text_ortho: Di next day, as people con dey go river, naim de con see dis animal for ground.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: Then some people ran to tell the king.
Text_ortho: Naim some people con run con go tell king.

Text_en: "Come and see!"
Text_ortho: Sey con see o!

Text_en: This animal that'd been haunting us for so long, this animal which was spoiling our market, which was stealing our people, the animal had died.
Text_ortho: Dis animal wey don dey shake us since, dis animal wey dey scatter our market, wey dey tief our people, di animal don die.

Text_en: So they looked there... went to look at it.
Text_ortho: Naim de con look dere, con go look am.

Text_en: They saw that the animal truly had died.
Text_ortho: De con see am say true, true, di animal don die.

Text_en: So they said, "aha, who killed this animal?"
Text_ortho: Naim de say aha who kill dis animal?

Text_en: Then they looked at it, one leg was missing.
Text_ortho: De con look am, one leg dey miss.

Text_en: They looked at it, and they saw that one tail was missing.
Text_ortho: Con look am, con see sey one tail dey miss.

Text_en: They looked at it, and they saw that one ear was missing.
Text_ortho: Con look am, con see sey one ear dey miss.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: So they told the king.
Text_ortho: Naim de con tell di king.

Text_en: So the king said, "who could do this kind of thing?"
Text_ortho: Di king con say ehen which person fit do dis kind ting?

Text_en: Then the king said, "okay, the person who killed this animal should come and show himself."
Text_ortho: Naim di king con say okay sey make di person wey kill dis animal, make e come show imsef.

Text_en: "He should come and tell the king that he's the one who killed it."
Text_ortho: Meh e con tell di king sey na im kill am.

Text_en: "If you come, you should bring all those different parts of the animal which you... which you killed, which you cut off."
Text_ortho: Sey if you dey come, meh you bring all dose different, different parts of di animal wey you, wey you kill, wey you cut comot.

Text_en: "Those things are what'll show its you who killed it."
Text_ortho: Sey na dose tings na im go show sey na you kill am.

Text_en: So some people went to the market.
Text_ortho: Naim some people con go market.

Text_en: Some bought a cow and cut off the leg.
Text_ortho: Some con buy cow, con cut di leg.

Text_en: Some bought a goat.
Text_ortho: Some con buy goat.

Text_en: They came, they brought it to where they put the animal in the palace.
Text_ortho: De go come, de go come where de carry di animal put for palace.

Text_en: They came, they measured it, they said, "no, this isn't the one."
Text_ortho: De go come, de go con measure am, de go say no dis one no be am!

Text_en: They brought another one, they said, "this isn't the one."
Text_ortho: De go carry dis one, de go say dis one no be am.

Text_en: That was how they did it.
Text_ortho: Na so de con do am o.

Text_en: Everyone went there.
Text_ortho: Everybody con go.

Text_en: They didn't find the person who killed the animal.
Text_ortho: De no con see di person wey kill dat animal.

Text_en: So when Alaska Pepper woke up, he went to play, and he saw people gathered in the palace, standing outside, they were doing something, he saw that some people were bringing cow legs.
Text_ortho: So when Alaska Pepper con wake up, con dey play, con see people gader for palace, dey stay for outside, de dey do someting, e dey see sey some people carry cow leg.

Text_en: So he asked another boy, "what are they doing over there?"
Text_ortho: So e con ask one oda boy sey wetin de dey do for dat place?

Text_en: So the boy said, "haven't you heard?"
Text_ortho: Naim di boy say you never hear?

Text_en: "That monster that was taking our people away, they've killed it."
Text_ortho: Dat ojuju wey e dey carry our people, de don kill am.

Text_en: Some people were bringing different things.
Text_ortho: Sey some people dey carry different tings.

Text_en: Then they measured them, they still could not find the real person who had killed the animal.
Text_ortho: De con measure am, de never still see di real person wey kill di animal.

Text_en: That was when Alaska Pepper remembered that all those different things he had cut off from the animal, he had kept them in the bush.
Text_ortho: Na dat time na im Alaska Pepper con remember sey all dose different tings wey e comot from di animal, im keep am inside bush.

Text_en: So he didn't say anything.
Text_ortho: So e no con talk anyting.

Text_en: Then he ran home, he went to take a bag, he ran to the place and he packed everything.
Text_ortho: E con run go house, con go carry bag, con run go di place, con pack everyting.

Text_en: So, when everybody left the palace, he was the only one left there.
Text_ortho: So when everybody con comot for palace, only im con dey.

Text_en: He didn't know a chief was there, guarding the place.
Text_ortho: E no know sey one chief dey inside dat place dey guard di place.

Text_en: He was just in a corner.
Text_ortho: E just dey one corner.

Text_en: So, Alaska Pepper went there.
Text_ortho: So Alaska Pepper con go dere.

Text_en: He brought the thing there.
Text_ortho: E con carry di ting come out.

Text_en: As he threw it to the ground, he put it there.
Text_ortho: As e troway am for ground, e con dey put am.

Text_en: He put down the ear, he put down the tail.
Text_ortho: E con put di ear, e con put di tail.

Text_en: Then the man jumped out.
Text_ortho: Naim di man just jump come outside.

Text_en: Ala-... Alaska Pepper was shocked.
Text_ortho: Ala-... Alaska Pepper just shock.

Text_en: He wanted to run away.
Text_ortho: E be wan run.

Text_en: Then the man said come, come, come, come, come, come.
Text_ortho: Naim di man say come, come, come, come, come, come.

Text_en: He then took him to gi-... meet the king, and he said, "look at him, look at the boy who killed the animal, look at the different parts he cut off the animal!"
Text_ortho: E con carry am go gi-... meet di king, con say see am, see di boy wey kill di animal, see di different parts wey e cut from di animal!

Text_en: Then he king said everybody should come.
Text_ortho: Naim di king con say make everybody come o!

Text_en: Look at the person who did this, this big thing for this village.
Text_ortho: Sey see di person wey e do dis, dis big ting for dis village.

Text_en: It was this sm-... this boy, who killed this animal.
Text_ortho: Na dis sm-... dis boy na im kill dis animal.

Text_en: Now everybody, all the young people who were in the community, a... who were in that village, all of them rushed out.
Text_ortho: Na everybody, all di young people wey de dey di community, wey de dey dat village, all of dem con rush come out.

Text_en: They carried Alaska Pepper up, they were hailing Alaska Pepper, they danced round the village.
Text_ortho: De con carry Alaska Pepper up, de con dey hail Alaska Pepper, de con dey dance round di village.

Text_en: That was how, that story of that boy became uh... a story they are still telling today in that vilage, of how Alaska Pepper saved them.
Text_ortho: Na so dat story of dat boy con take become eh story wey de dey talk till today for dat village, how Alaska Pepper take save dem.

Text_en: This is the little story I said I should tell you.
Text_ortho: Na dis small story na im I say make I tell you.

Text_en: You should know that the kind of people you say are no good today, tomorrow, they could become the kind of person who, they would... who will be doing a lot of good things tomorrow.
Text_ortho: Make you take know sey di kind people wey you talk sey mtschew dis person no good, today, tomorrow, e fit become di kind person wey e go, wey good, good ting go dey follow.

Text_en: So if you dont mind uh... that's where I would take my story... that's where I would end my story.
Text_ortho: So if you no mind eh, na dere I go carry my story, na dere I go knock my story reach.

Text_en: In the barracks here, in the mornings, when I wake up, I give my kid a bath and put food on the stove.
Text_ortho: For inside barrack here, in di morning, if I wake up, I go bath my pikin, I go put food for fire.

Text_en: Because it's every month that they... that they pay in the... that they pay the soldiers.

Text_en: You know I'm a soldier's wife.

Text_en: When the month ends, they come and pay me.

Text_en: After... and sometimes, when I go further inside the barracks, (they do hairdressing in the Mami Market), I go and have my hair done in the Mami Market... in the uh... Mami Market, a place where soldiers' wives sell things.

Text_ortho: I go go do my hair for inside mami.

Text_en: And when the month... uh... when the month ends, if we want to go... if we want to go and collect mo-... if we want to go and buy food for the house, we go to this place, we go to Bodija, a market over there.
Text_ortho: And if month, ehn if month end, if we wan go, if we wan go collect mo-... if we wan go buy food for house, we go go dis thing, we go go Bodija, one market dere.

Text_en: We go there, we go to buy things, for the house.
Text_ortho: We go go dere, we go go buy something, for house.

Text_en: We go to buy things, we go to buy food in... from the market.
Text_ortho: We go go buy something, we go go buy foodstuff for, from market.

Text_en: We...
Text_ortho: We dey...

Text_en: We go through the bush.
Text_ortho: We dey even follow bush.

Text_en: There's a shortcut.
Text_ortho: Shortcut dey.

Text_en: We cut through the bush.
Text_ortho: We go follow bush.

Text_en: If you dont want to go through (because the transport fare to go out from... from here to Bodija, I spend seventy naira leave the barracks) you will spend another seventy naira, or fifty naira to get to Bodija.
Text_ortho: If you no wan follow (because transport to go outside from, for here to go Bodija, I go use seventy naira con go outside barrack), you go use anoda seventy naira, abi fifty naira go Bodija.

Text_en: So it d-... it's easy for us.
Text_ortho: So e d-... e dey easy for us.

Text_en: We just cut through the bush here.
Text_ortho: We go just follow shortcut inside bush here.

Text_en: We just cross the express way, we just spend thirty naira.
Text_ortho: We just cross dis express, go just enter thirty naira.

Text_en: And we are in Bodija.
Text_ortho: We don enter inside Bodija.

Text_en: So that's how we are.
Text_ortho: So na so we dey.

Text_en: We're...
Text_ortho: We are...

Text_en: We always have electricity too.
Text_ortho: We dey always get light too.

Text_en: We always have electricity here in the barracks as well.
Text_ortho: Light dey always dey inside barrack here.

Text_en: If... except these last few days now when the rain... when the wind was very strong, so our electricity got messed up.
Text_ortho: If, except dis few days now wey rain, wey breeze blow well, well, so our light spoil.

Text_en: We dont have electricity at the moment.
Text_ortho: We no get light.

Text_en: So we always have electricity.
Text_ortho: So we dey always get light.

Text_en: And we dont have any water in these barracks at all.
Text_ortho: And water no dey dis barrack at all.

Text_en: The lack of water is a problem for us.
Text_ortho: We dey suffer for water.

Text_en: The only time we have full water supply is in the rainy season.
Text_ortho: Di only time wey we dey get water well, well, if na rainy season.

Text_en: When the rain falls, everyone puts their drums outside, but if it doesn't rain, we dont... we always face water shortages.
Text_ortho: If rain don fall, everybody go put im drum outside, but if rain no fall, we no dey, we dey always suffer for water.

Text_en: Our tank, they made tanks for us here because it's g-... uh... group by group.
Text_ortho: Our tank, dem do tank for us here because na g-... ehn group by group.

Text_en: There's MP, there's Sergeant uh... S, and T, there's the Medical.
Text_ortho: Mp dey, Sergeant ehn, S, and T dey, Medical dey.

Text_en: They have their borehole, but here, ours, our new... our commandant, he refused to have it repaired for us.
Text_ortho: Dem get deir bore, but our own here, our new, our commandant, e no gree repair am for us.

Text_en: He ruined it.
Text_ortho: E spoil am.

Text_en: And we go fetch water from the other block.
Text_ortho: And we go fetch water for di oder block.

Text_en: But they refuse.
Text_ortho: Dem no gree.

Text_en: They say they dont want us to fetch water from our... from their place.
Text_ortho: De say de no wan moh fetch water for our, for deir place.

Text_en: We should go to our place.
Text_ortho: Sey moh dey go our place.

Text_en: So since then, we've been suffering from, from a lack of water.
Text_ortho: So since den, we suffer for, for water.

Text_en: We look and look for water, but we don't find any.
Text_ortho: We go find water, find water, no go see.

Text_en: We're always suffering water shortages.
Text_ortho: We dey always suffer for water.

Text_en: And again, their lifestyles in the barracks here, it, it's is just easy.
Text_ortho: And again, deir life for inside barrack here, e, e just dey easy.

Text_en: Let's not talk.
Text_ortho: Moh no talk.

Text_en: It's...
Text_ortho: E dey...

Text_en: B-... but I prefer the time when I was still there in Ondo State.
Text_ortho: B-... but I prefer di time wen I still dey Ondo State dere.

Text_en: Over there, everything is okay.
Text_ortho: Dat place, everything dey okay.

Text_en: There's water, there's everything, there are marketplaces.
Text_ortho: Water dey, everything dey, market dey.

Text_en: But when they said that a person, by all means, will go to her husband's house, will go to her husband's house, that you need to stay with your husband because a soldier should not be left like that, the person comes here.
Text_ortho: But when dem talk sey person now, by force by fire, you go go your husband house, go go husband house, you need to stay with your husband because dem no fit leave soldier man like dat, person come here.

Text_en: But that place, I still prefer that place.
Text_ortho: But dat place, I still prefer dat place.

Text_en: Let me stay in that place.
Text_ortho: Make I stay for dat place.

Text_en: But as life is going on now...!
Text_ortho: But as life dey goes on now!

Text_en: I'm going to a Redeem Church.
Text_ortho: I dey go Redeem Church.

Text_en: My church here is past this Ojurin side there, inside the barracks here.
Text_ortho: My church here na after dis Ojurin side dere for inside barrack here.

Text_en: Redeem is where I'm going.
Text_ortho: Na Redeem I dey go.

Text_en: I go there.
Text_ortho: I dey go dere.

Text_en: We're...
Text_ortho: We dey...

Text_en: On Monday, I go to...
Text_ortho: Monday, I go go...

Text_en: On Sunday, they start the programme at nine o'clock.
Text_ortho: On Sunday, na nine clock de start programme.

Text_en: They finish at twelve.
Text_ortho: De go finish twelve.

Text_en: Because of uh... maybe all the people who are at work, so they can attend the programme, they start at nine o'clock.
Text_ortho: Because of sey ehn maybe all di people wey dey go duty, meh dem fit meet programme, na nine o'clock de dey start.

Text_en: And there's Bible Study, there's Digging Deep.
Text_ortho: And Bible study dey, deep dey.

Text_en: We go to...
Text_ortho: We go go...

Text_en: Sometimes, once a month, they always have the night vigil sessions.
Text_ortho: Sometimes, once in a month, de will always get night vigil.

Text_en: They attend night vigil programs because they dont want too much noise in the barracks.
Text_ortho: De attend night vigil because of sey dem no wan too much noise for, inside barrack.

Text_en: So that's why their program is like that.
Text_ortho: So dat is why de dey do deir programme like dat.

Text_en: Having another child, that's the only challenge I have.
Text_ortho: Born anoda one, na only dat one na im I still get for hand.

Text_en: But all the children around me, they are still my children.
Text_ortho: But all di children around me, na still my pikin na im de, dem be.

Text_en: My people, I welcome you all to this Sunday service.
Text_ortho: My people, I welcome una to dis Sunday o.

Text_en: As it is, you all know that we are already in the season of Lent.
Text_ortho: As e be so, una see sey we don enter di season of Lent.

Text_en: And the season of Lent, as discussed on Ash Wednesday, is the season of preparation for the glorious passion of our Lord.
Text_ortho: And di season of Lent, as we talk for Ash Wednesday, na di season of preparation for di glorious passion of our Lord.

Text_en: On Ash Wednesday, we told you that this period is the time of fasting, it's the time of alms-giving, it's the time of prayer.
Text_ortho: On Ash Wednesday, we tell una sey dis time na time of fasting, na time of alms giving, na time of prayer.

Text_en: Those are the three pillars of Lent.
Text_ortho: Dose na di three pillars of Lent.

Text_en: And as we did to you on Ash Wednesday, you all received ashes on your foreheads.
Text_ortho: And as we do for una for Ash Wednesday so, una receive ashes for forehead.

Text_en: The ashes are to show you that you are mourning for sin.
Text_ortho: Di ashes na to show una sey una dey mourn for sin o.

Text_en: It doesn't mean that you put the ashes on your forehead to start fighting.
Text_ortho: No be sey una put di ashes for forehead begin dey fight.

Text_en: And that's why Prophet Joel told us that we should rend our hearts, not our garments.
Text_ortho: And na so Prophet Joel tell us sey make we render our hearts not our garments.

Text_en: And if we take a good look at today's reading, you will realize that the temptations will be much greater than usual in this time of Lent.
Text_ortho: And if we look the reading today so, you go see sey temptation go even plenty for dis time of Lent well, well.

Text_en: If you take a look at Jesus, He went into the desert.
Text_ortho: If we look Jesus, e go desert.

Text_en: He fasted for forty days and forty nights.
Text_ortho: E fasted for forty days, for forty nights.

Text_en: Thereafter, He faced temptations.
Text_ortho: E faced temptation after.

Text_en: That is to show us what Hebrews four fifteen told us.
Text_ortho: Dat na to show us wetin Hebrew four fifteen tell us.

Text_en: Jesus was tempted like us.
Text_ortho: Sey Jesus, dem tempt am like us.

Text_en: But in His own case, He did not sin.
Text_ortho: But im own, e no sin.

Text_en: Because it's not true that it is bad to be tempted.
Text_ortho: Because no be sey e bad make person dey tempted.

Text_en: All of us will face temptations.
Text_ortho: All of us go face temptation.

Text_en: The bad part is when you fall into the temptation.
Text_ortho: Di bad side na when you fall into di temptation.

Text_en: And God has a way of giving us grace.
Text_ortho: And e get di way wey God take dey give us grace o.

Text_en: God gives us power to overcome our temptations.
Text_ortho: God dey give us power make we take overcome our temptation.

Text_en: But it depends on us, whether we want to use the power or we don't want to use the power.
Text_ortho: E con depend on us whether we wan use di power, or we no wan use di power.

Text_en: But the power is available.
Text_ortho: But di power dey.

Text_en: Because God will not expose us to temptations which are above our capacity.
Text_ortho: Because God no go give us temptation wey go pass our power.

Text_en: He exposes us to temptations which we will have the capacity to overcome.
Text_ortho: Dey give us di temptation wey be sey we go fit get di power to overcome.

Text_en: If we take a good look at Jesus, Satan tempted him in three areas.
Text_ortho: If we look Jesus so, Satan tempt am for three areas.

Text_en: He tempted Him with pleasure, he tempted him with power, he tempted him with money.
Text_ortho: E tempt am for pleasure, e tempt am for power, e tempt am for money.

Text_en: Who doesn't like pleasure?
Text_ortho: Who no like pleasure?

Text_en: Everybody likes pleasure.
Text_ortho: Everybody like pleasure so now.

Text_en: It you look at uh... Eve...
Text_ortho: If you look ehm, if...

Text_en: When Satan tempted her, Satan told her that if you pick the fruit, that the fruit will be sweet.
Text_ortho: When Satan tempt her, Satan tell am sey if you pluck di fruit, sey di fruit go sweet.

Text_en: He said that Eve will become like God.
Text_ortho: Sey Eve go be like God.

Text_en: She will be able to know what is good, she will be able to know what is evil.
Text_ortho: E go fit know wetin good, e go fit know wetin evil.

Text_en: Who doesn't want to be like God?
Text_ortho: Who no wan be like God?

Text_en: Eve looked at the fruit, like this.
Text_ortho: Eve look di fruit like dis.

Text_en: As she looked at it, she said... she said "it's good."
Text_ortho: As e look am, e say, e say e sweet.

Text_en: She noticed that the thing is pleasurable.
Text_ortho: See sey di ting dey pleasurable.

Text_en: She ate it.
Text_ortho: E chop am.

Text_en: That's hunger now, it's an issue of hunger.
Text_ortho: Na hunger now, na hunger issue.

Text_en: The same Satan came to Jesus.
Text_ortho: Di same Satan con meet Jesus.

Text_en: He said, "you have been fasting for days, you need to turn stone into bread now, so that you can eat."
Text_ortho: E say you don dey fast since, you need to turn stone to bread now, make you fit chop.

Text_en: Who doesn't want to eat?
Text_ortho: Who no wan chop food?

Text_en: But Jesus told him.
Text_ortho: But Jesus tell am.

Text_en: He said, "get thee behind me, Satan."
Text_ortho: E say get behind me Satan.

Text_en: Is that not so?
Text_ortho: No be so?

Text_en: Part of the temptations you face is an issue of hunger.
Text_ortho: Part of di temptation wey una dey face na issue of hunger now.

Text_en: You are hungry.
Text_ortho: You dey hungry.

Text_en: You can do anything to get food.
Text_ortho: You fit do anyting for food.

Text_en: But Jesus said you should not do just about anything to get food.
Text_ortho: But Jesus say make you no do anyting for food.

Text_en: He said you will be able to tell Satan "get thee behind me, God is more powerful than you are."
Text_ortho: E say you go fit tell Satan sey get behind me, sey God get power pass you.

Text_en: Now, let's go to the issue of power.
Text_ortho: Den make we go di issue of power.

Text_en: Who doesn't like power?
Text_ortho: Who no like power?

Text_en: Everybody likes power.
Text_ortho: Everybody like power.

Text_en: The husband wants to have power over the wife, the wife wants to have power over the husband.
Text_ortho: Husband want get power over di wife, wife want get power over di husband.

Text_en: Is that not what we hear on the news these days?
Text_ortho: No be wetin we dey hear for news today?

Text_en: People kill for power, people do so many things for power.
Text_ortho: People dey kill for power, people dey do so many tings for power.

Text_en: Did a woman not stab her husband the other day?
Text_ortho: No be one woman stab her husband di oder day so?

Text_en: She said that the husband was not good enough.
Text_ortho: Sey di husband no dey do well, well.

Text_en: Everybody wants power now.
Text_ortho: Everybody wan power now.

Text_en: And Satan knows that Jesus, as a human being, wanted power.
Text_ortho: And Satan even know sey Jesus as human being wan power.

Text_en: He told him.
Text_ortho: E tell am.

Text_en: He said, "climb the mountain, jump down."
Text_ortho: E say climb di mountain so, jump down.

Text_en: "You will be able to show everyone that you are powerful if you can jump down from that high mountain."
Text_ortho: You go fit show everybody sey you get power if you fit jump down from dat high mountain.

Text_en: But Jesus told him the same thing.
Text_ortho: But Jesus tell am di same ting.

Text_en: He said, "get thee behind me, Satan. You shall not tempt the Lord, your God."
Text_ortho: E said get behind me Satan, you shall not tempt di Lord, your God.

Text_en: So you also have power to tell Satan that he should get behind you.
Text_ortho: So you sef get power to tell Satan sey make e get behind you.

Text_en: If the whole issue of... let's say power, comes up, you want to be powerful.
Text_ortho: If the whole issue of say power come, you wan get power.

Text_en: You want to show that you are in charge.
Text_ortho: You wan dey show sey na you dey dere.

Text_en: Nobody is totally in charge.
Text_ortho: Nobody dey dere now.

Text_en: Only God is in total control.
Text_ortho: Na only God dey.

Text_en: So the best thing is to calm down.
Text_ortho: So di best ting na sey make you calm down.

Text_en: Let everybody humble him.
Text_ortho: Meh everybody humble himsef.

Text_en: Let everyone calm down totally.
Text_ortho: Meh everybody pele well, well.

Text_en: If you calm down totally, and you are humble, God will give you the power you need.
Text_ortho: If you calm down well, well, and you humble, God go give you di power wey you need.

Text_en: And then, we move to the third one, money issues.
Text_ortho: And den we go to di third one money issue.

Text_en: Everyone wants money these days, everybody does anything for money.
Text_ortho: Everybody, na im want money dese days, everybody, na im dey do anyting for money.

Text_en: Children kill mothers, mothers kill their children.
Text_ortho: Pikin dey kill mama, mama dey kill pikin.

Text_en: All because they want money.
Text_ortho: All because e want money.

Text_en: Everybody wants money.
Text_ortho: Everybody want money now.

Text_en: But even Satan tempted Jesus over money issues.
Text_ortho: But even Satan tempt Jesus on top money issue.

Text_en: He showed Him all the glory.
Text_ortho: E show am all di glory.

Text_en: He showed Him all the wealth.
Text_ortho: E show am all di wealth.

Text_en: He said all this was available.
Text_ortho: E say dis one dey.

Text_en: Better things are available if you'll just bow... just bow to me.
Text_ortho: Better dey if you fit just bow, just bow to me.

Text_en: Once you bow to me, you will take possession of all the money.
Text_ortho: Once you bow to me, so you go get all di money.

Text_en: What do we all bow to nowadays?
Text_ortho: Wetin all of us dey bow to now?

Text_en: We bow to different people.
Text_ortho: We dey bow to different people.

Text_en: We bow to people who lie to us, we bow to traditionalists, we bow to different people, all because we want money.
Text_ortho: We dey bow to people wey dey lie to us, we dey bow to traditionalists, we dey bow to different people, all, because we want money.

Text_en: But Jesus is telling us.
Text_ortho: But Jesus dey tell us.

Text_en: He said you don't need to bow to people, bow to God alone!
Text_ortho: E say you no need to dey bow to people, bow to only God!

Text_en: God will provide what you need.
Text_ortho: God go provide wetin you need.

Text_en: That's what Jesus wants us to do.
Text_ortho: Na wetin Jesus want make we do.

Text_en: So we all need to learn that nobody is free from temptation.
Text_ortho: So we all need to learn sey nobody free from temptation.

Text_en: And the fact is that it is not a sin to be tempted by the Devil!
Text_ortho: And di fact na sey no be sin sey Devil tempt you o!

Text_en: It's not a sin at all because the Devil tempted Jesus.
Text_ortho: No be sin at all because Devil tempt Jesus sef.

Text_en: The only instance where it is considered sin is when you fall into the temptation.
Text_ortho: Di only where wey sin dey na when you fall into di temptation.

Text_en: So do not worry.
Text_ortho: So make una no worry.

Text_en: Go on facing temptation.
Text_ortho: Make una dey face temptation.

Text_en: In fact, you will face many more during this period.
Text_ortho: Una go face more even dis time well, well.

Text_en: Because this period is a very serious one.
Text_ortho: Because dis time na very, very serious time.

Text_en: It's a time to deprive yourself of so many things.
Text_ortho: Na time to deprive yoursef of so many tings.

Text_en: A time to say, this thing... I will not do it again.
Text_ortho: Time wey you go say dis ting, I no go do am again.

Text_en: All the bad things I did before, I do them no more.
Text_ortho: All di bad, bad tings wey I dey do before, I do dem no more.

Text_en: Because Jesus came to change us.
Text_ortho: Because Jesus come to con change us.

Text_en: And another good thing about this period is that it is a season of mercy.
Text_ortho: And anoder good ting for dis period na sey na season of mercy o.

Text_en: God forgives all our sins.
Text_ortho: God dey forgive all our sins.

Text_en: No sin is too big for Him to forgive.
Text_ortho: No sin wey too big for am to forgive.

Text_en: That's why He said (in what Paul said in First Corinthians) "where sin abounds, grace abounds even more."
Text_ortho: Na why e say (for wetin Paul talk for first Corinthians) sey where sin abound, grace abounds even all di more.

Text_en: Where there is sin grace is abundant, even all the more.
Text_ortho: Where sin dey, grace, e plenty even all di more.

Text_en: So there's no sin that God cannot forgive.
Text_ortho: So no sin wey God no fit forgive.

Text_en: The important thing is that you tell Him the sin.
Text_ortho: Di major ting na sey make una tell am di sin.

Text_en: Tell Him your sins and let me tell Him my sins.
Text_ortho: Tell am your sin, make I tell am my sin.

Text_en: If you hide your sins, there's nothing Jesus cannot see.
Text_ortho: If you hide your sin, noting wey Jesus no fit see.

Text_en: So if you tell Him your sins, He will forgive you.
Text_ortho: So if you tell am your sin, e go forgive you.

Text_en: He will blot it all out.
Text_ortho: E go remove everyting comot.

Text_en: You know, if you look at it very well, a man, uh... Mahatma Ghandi, said it.
Text_ortho: You know, if you look am well, well, one man, ehm Mahatma Ghandi talk am.

Text_en: He said one day, he stole his father's bracelets.
Text_ortho: E say one day, e steal im papa bracelets.

Text_en: Immediately after he stole them, the father started looking for the bracelets.
Text_ortho: As e steal di ting like dis, naim im papa dey look for di bracelet.

Text_en: As his father was looking for them, he didn't know what to tell the father.
Text_ortho: As im papa dey look for the ting, e no know wetin to tell im papa again.

Text_en: Then he... one day, he wrote it on a piece of paper.
Text_ortho: E come one day, e con write am for inside paper.

Text_en: He told the father "I stole your bracelet."
Text_ortho: Tell di papa sey na me steal your bracelet.

Text_en: If you were the father, and your child showed you that kind of thing after you'd gone through the trouble of searching for it, what will you do to him?
Text_ortho: If na you be di papa so, and your pikin show you dat kind ting after you don suffer dey find di ting, wetin you go do am?

Text_en: You will want to slap him.
Text_ortho: You go wan slap am.

Text_en: But as the father received the paper, he read it and he smiled.
Text_ortho: But as e papa receive di paper read di ting, e just smile.

Text_en: He just laughed at Mahatma Ghandi.
Text_ortho: E just laugh to Mahatma Ghandi.

Text_en: Mahatma Ghandi was shocked and said "a'ah, why is father laughing at me?"
Text_ortho: Mahatma Ghandi con shock say aha why papa dey laugh give me now?

Text_en: The father tore up the paper, then he hugged the boy and he said to him, "I have forgiven you, don't worry".
Text_ortho: Di papa con tear di paper, e con hug di boy, e con tell am sey I don forgive you, no worry.

Text_en: From that day uh... Mahatma Ghandi loved his father deeply because he wasn't expecting what the father did.
Text_ortho: From dat day eh, Mahatma Ghandi love im papa no be small because e no expect wetin di papa do.

Text_en: Jesus does the same thing for all of us.
Text_ortho: Di same ting wey Jesus dey do for all of us.

Text_en: All we need to do is to tell Him all our sins.
Text_ortho: All we need to do na make we tell am di sin.

Text_en: He will tear everything off.
Text_ortho: E go tear everyting comot.

Text_en: And He will love us more, and we will even be worthy of hugging Him so tight because He is God.
Text_ortho: And e go love us di more, and we go even fit hug am well, well because na im be God.

Text_en: He is not a man.
Text_ortho: E no be man.

Text_en: It's a man who may not forgive.
Text_ortho: Na man fit no forgive o.

Text_en: Man may not forgive.
Text_ortho: Man fit no forgive.

Text_en: That's why they say, "to err is human, to forgive is divine."
Text_ortho: Na why de say to err is human, to forgive is divine.

Text_en: Man may not forgive at all but God forgives all sins.
Text_ortho: Man fit no forgive at all, but God dey forgive all di sin.

Text_en: What we need to do is to tell Him.
Text_ortho: Wetin we need do na to tell am.

Text_en: So this season is the best time, the best time for all of us.
Text_ortho: So dis season na di best time o di best time for all of us.

Text_en: Let's come back to Jesus.
Text_ortho: Make we come back to Jesus.

Text_en: If we have sinned before now, let's not sin again.
Text_ortho: If we don sin before, make we no sin again.

Text_en: That's why we are in the season of Lent.
Text_ortho: Na why we dey di season of Lent.

Text_en: And that's the main reason we told ourselves on that Ash Wednesday "remember that you are dust, and to dust you shall return."
Text_ortho: And na di main reason wey we tell ourselves on dat Ash Wednesday sey remember dat you are dust, and to dust you shall return.

Text_en: It's dust we are made of.
Text_ortho: Na dust na im dem form us from.

Text_en: The basic difference between us and those things fine artists do is that God breathed life into us, but those things... nobody can put life into them.
Text_ortho: Di basic difference between us, and dose tings wey fine artist dey do na sey God breathe life into us, but dose tings, nobody fit put life into dem.

Text_en: But God loves us so much.
Text_ortho: But God so much love us.

Text_en: When He finished forming us, He brought life into us.
Text_ortho: After e form us finish, e bring life into us.

Text_en: And we are going back to that same dust.
Text_ortho: And we dey go back to dat same dust.

Text_en: So that's it for today.
Text_ortho: So na so e be today o.

Text_en: That's how it is today.
Text_ortho: Na so e be today.

Text_en: Let us all do well.
Text_ortho: Make all of us dey do well.

Text_en: Let's journey through this season beautifully and we will discover that the mercy of God will be upon us.
Text_ortho: Make we journey through dis season well, well and we go see sey di mercy of God go dey upon us.

Text_en: And His life will remove every darkness which is upon us because we all have one form of darkness or the other.
Text_ortho: And im light go remove every darkness wey dey our body because all of us get one form of darkness, or di oda.

Text_en: So I appreciate you all for coming because if you don't show up, what will we do?
Text_ortho: So I tank una o as una come so because if una no come, wetin we go do?

Text_en: The church will just be empty.
Text_ortho: Church go just empty now.

Text_en: So as you all came here and as we are offering this eucharistic sacrifice, we pray that God will accept our sacrifice.
Text_ortho: So as una come so, and as we dey do dis Eucharistic sacrifice, we pray make God accept our sacrifice o.

Text_en: We pray that God will have mercy on us, forgive us, and He should remove all our sins through Christ, our Lord, amen.
Text_ortho: We pray meh God have mercy on us, make e forgive us, and make e remove all our sins trough Christ, our Lord, amen.

Text_en: Well, the very first story I have for today is the one I'm talking about.
Text_ortho: Toh di very first story wey dey my hand for today, na im dey yarn o.

Text_en: What is it?
Text_ortho: Sey wetin?

Text_en: It's here, it's in the open!
Text_ortho: E don land o, e don show o!

Text_en: They told you it was on the way, right?
Text_ortho: Shebi dem tell you sey e dey come?

Text_en: You thought they were lying again?
Text_ortho: You tink sey na lie dem dey lie again?

Text_en: But this one's not a lie.
Text_ortho: But dis one no be lie.

Text_en: Baba has come, Daddy has arrived, Father hurry up... hurray.
Text_ortho: Baba have come, Daddy have arrive, Papa tete oyoyo!

Text_en: They said President Muhammadu Buhari, Yusuf's father, Sara's father, Alimo's father, Aisha's husband, he has resumed work today.
Text_ortho: Dem say President Muhammadu Buhari, Baba Yusuf, Baba Sara, Baba Alimo, Oko Aisha, e don enter work again today o.

Text_en: That's why the Nigeria Labor Congress, another outspoken group... they have started setting targets for the President on what he's supposed to focus on.
Text_ortho: Dat na why Nigeria Labour Congress, anoda group wey get mouth, de don con dey set a target for di Presido o on wetin e suppose focus upon.

Text_en: They said (apart from the NLC [Nigeria Labor Congress], the organisations and people who are speaking on different interviews in the Punch, including the Northern Elders Council, the Pan Yoruba Sociopolitical Group, Afenifere and Doctor Junaidu Muhammed), they advised the President to focus on the economy.
Text_ortho: Dem say apart from di NLC, organisations, and people wey be sey dem dey yarn for different interviews in di Punch including di Northern Elder Council, di Pan Yoruba Sociopolitical Group, Afenifere, and Doctor Junaidu Muhammed, dem dey advice di Presido o make e focus on top di economy.

Text_en: So all the mishap befalling the people, all the poverty choking them up like a bow tie (which means they cannot travel abroad for medical treatment), they will be able to improve it.
Text_ortho: So all di ozigi wey dey shele to di people, all di poverty wey dey kolobi dem like bow tie (wey be sey dem no fit travel abroad for medical treatment), dem go fit improve am.

Text_en: The President arrived Nigeria on Friday after he spent forty nine days on a long, undisturbed medical vacation in Lagos... in London, sorry.
