Text_ortho: Di Presido land for Naija on Friday after forty nine days wey e take do medical vacation ologborangandan for Lagos, for London sorry.

Text_en: They said while he was addressing members of the Federal Executive Council, following his arrival, Buhari was saying that he would rest throughout the week, and he would resume work today.
Text_ortho: De say while e dey address members of di Federal Executive Council after e land, Buhari dey yarn o sey e go rest throughout di week, and e go resume work today.

Text_en: The NLC has called on Pa Buhari.
Text_ortho: Di NLC don hala on top Baba Buhari o.

Text_en: He should focus on the challenges which are facing the country, especially our economy which has turned upside down.
Text_ortho: Make e focus on top di challenges wey dey face di country, especially our economy wey don turn edede.

Text_en: The General Secretary of the NLC, Doctor Pisa Osoesan, was the one saying that the Government should tackle the problem of the economy so that they will be able to bring us out of this ridiculous situation which the whites call a recession.
Text_ortho: Di General Secretary for di NLC, Doctor Pisa Osoesan, na im e dey yarn o sey di Government, mey dem tackle di problem of di economy so dem go fit comot us for inside dis yeye okwakwa wey Oyibo dey call recession.

Text_en: He was saying that it is important for the government to implement politics which... a policy which will reduce our suffering, which means the suffering which is t-... which d-... which is suffocating Nigerians.
Text_ortho: Im con dey yarn o sey e dey important for di Government make dem do politics wey, policy wey go reduce wetin we dey suffer wey be sey suffer head wey dey t-... wey d-... wey dey kolobi Naija people.

Text_en: Osoesan was even telling them to quickly, quickly...
Text_ortho: Osoesan con even dey call sey make dem sharperly, sharperly...

Text_en: They should go and arrange the Tripartite Committee, which is to say the "Igbimo Elenumeta" [Three Man Committee].
Text_ortho: Mey dem go arrange di Tripartite Committee, dat is to say Igbimo Elenumeta.

Text_en: Which means they will be the ones to sit down and rearrange the minimum wage, the fifty six thousand they said they wanted to be earning to...
Text_ortho: Wey be sey na dem go sit down wey go rearrange di minimal wage, di fifty six thousand wey dem say dem wan dey collect sey to...

Text_en: Will it ever happen?
Text_ortho: Shey e go happen?

Text_en: Are you... are you God?
Text_ortho: Are you, are you God?

Text_en: How do you know that the fifty six thousand won't be possible?
Text_ortho: How you take know sey fifty six thousand no go possible?

Text_en: He was saying that they continued to delay the constitution of the Wage Committee.
Text_ortho: Im dey yarn sey de continue delay for di constitution of di Wage Committee.

Text_en: He said they will not compromise again.
Text_ortho: E say dem no go gree again o.

Text_en: And the Labour Congress, what will they do?
Text_ortho: Labour nko, dem go do wetin?

Text_en: They will be angry.
Text_ortho: Dem go vex.

Text_en: And if they're angry, the Federal Government won't like it.
Text_ortho: And when dem vex, Federal Government no go like am.

Text_en: Well, all of us in Lagelu, and all of us in Nigeria, that's why we say, "kaabo, se daadaa lo de, a ti reti re". [welcome, did you arrive safely? We have been expecting you.]
Text_ortho: Toh all of us for Lagelu, and all of us for Naija, na why we say kaabo, se daadaa lo de, a ti reti re.

Text_en: The President has arrived.
Text_ortho: Presido don show o.

Text_en: Tell everybody to beware of how they behave from now on.
Text_ortho: Tell everybody sey make dem sabi how dem go dey behave now.

Text_en: Simply because... you said what now?
Text_ortho: Simply because sey wetin?

Text_en: Baba, he has arrived, Daddy, he has come.
Text_ortho: Baba, e don come, Daddy, e have come.

Text_en: This is still Lagelu, ninety six point seven.
Text_ortho: Na still Lagelu ninety six point seven na im be dis.

Text_en: Not ninety six point three any longer!
Text_ortho: No be ninety six point three again o!

Text_en: Don't have it be like it's a fake you're enjoying; go on our Facebook page, Lagelu FM, ninety six point seven, go and watch it.
Text_ortho: Make e no con be like sey na fake una dey enjoy, make una go on top our Facebook page Lagelu FM ninety six point seven, make una go watch am.

Text_en: It is live, and direct.
Text_ortho: Live, and direct ni.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes o!

Text_en: We are streaming it live.
Text_ortho: We dey stream am live.

Text_en: You say you want to see my face, you want to see what I look like.
Text_ortho: You say you wan see my face, you wan see wetin I be like?

Text_en: Or is it that you don't know me?
Text_ortho: Abi you never know me before?

Text_en: Go on our Facebook page, Lagelu FM, ninety six point seven.
Text_ortho: Make una go on top our Facebook page, Lagelu FM ninety six point seven.

Text_en: Go and watch it live, and direct as I am speaking now, now, now, now, now, now, now, now.
Text_ortho: Make una go watch am live, and direct as I dey talk now, now, now, now, now, now, now, now.

Text_en: They are showing me on Facebook.
Text_ortho: Dem dey show me for Facebook.

Text_en: Away from that, they said President Muhammadu Buhari... he has extended it again (the tenure of the Permanent Secretary for the Ministry of Education, Dr Jamaila Suara) for another year.
Text_ortho: Away from dat, dem say President Muhammadu Buhari, e don extend am again o (di tenure of di Permanent Secretary for di Ministry of Education, Dr Jamaila Suara) for anoda one year.

Text_en: It's true.
Text_ortho: Na so...

Text_en: The Minister for Education, Mr Adamu Adamu, that was how he announced it.
Text_ortho: Di Minister for Education, Mr Adamu Adamu na so e polongo.

Text_en: This will be the second time that Suara's tenure will be extended, which means what?
Text_ortho: Dis one, na im go be di second time o wey den go extend Suara who be sey wetin?

Text_en: Her tenure was supposed to have expired in February twenty sixteen when Mama turned sixty years old.
Text_ortho: Im tenure suppose don expire since February twenty sixteen when Mama turn sixty years old.

Text_en: They said she got a presidential extension.
Text_ortho: De say she got a presidential extension o.

Text_en: Mama should not retire before when?
Text_ortho: Sey mey Mama never retire up till wetin?

Text_en: February twenty seventeen.
Text_ortho: February twenty seventeen.

Text_en: As that one has ended, they said that even that one, it has caused what?
Text_ortho: As dat one don con still finish, de say dat one sef, e don cause wetin?

Text_en: It has created issues in the Federal Civil Service such that people have started asking themselves what kind of a thing this is.
Text_ortho: E don cause howuhowu for inside di Federal Civil Service wey people don dey talk to demsef sey which kind tin be dis?

Text_en: Who is she?
Text_ortho: Who kind be di tins?

Text_en: Won't she resign? Won't she go home so she can go and rest?
Text_ortho: She no go resign ni, she no go go house ni, make she go rest now.

Text_en: They said Mama still got a second extension, according to the Minister.
Text_ortho: Dem say mama don still get a second extension according to di minister.

Text_en: I say, "a'ah what is happening?"
Text_ortho: I say a'ah wetin dey shele?

Text_en: "Aren't we abiding by the laws any longer in this country?"
Text_ortho: No be law we dey follow again for dis country?

Text_en: If you ask me, who will I ask?
Text_ortho: If you ask me, na who I go ask?

Text_en: Will you keep quiet?
Text_ortho: Will you keep quiet?

Text_en: This one is still on the way.
Text_ortho: Dis one, na im dey come o.

Text_en: While the House of Representatives Committee on Basic Education are questioning Suara on how the Mama managed to stay in service despite the fact that she is over sixty, and that was in twenty sixteen, the committee which is chaired by a member of the APC [All Progressives Congress], Mr Zakari Muhammed said that for two weeks, they have been looking for evidence, (eri maa je mi nso) [credible proof of evidence] that it was the President who gave the approval that Mama should remain in office despite the fact that she is above the age that should be in office.
Text_ortho: While di House of Representative Committee ontop Basic Education dem dey torchlight Suara on how di Mama take dey for service despite di fact sey she don pass sixty, and dat one na twenty sixteen o, di committee wey dem sit down on top by a member of di APC, Mr Zakari Muhammed, dem say two weeks ago na im dem dey talk sey dem dey find evidence (eri maaje mi nso) sey, na Presido na im sama approval give am say, make Mama still dey for office despite di fact sey, she don over di age wey suppose take dey office.

Text_en: But in fairness, the Permanent Secretary, they said she refused to meet the Committee.
Text_ortho: But sha o, di Permanent Secretary, dem say she no gree go for di Committee.

Text_en: Laila ilahlah.
Text_ortho: Sey laila ilahlah.

Text_en: Now, what is this?
Text_ortho: Now which kind tin be dis?

Text_en: Is this confidence?
Text_ortho: Shey dis one na confidence?

Text_en: Or is this disrespect?
Text_ortho: Abi dis one na disrespect?

Text_en: This is insurbordination.
Text_ortho: Afojudi re e.

Text_en: They say, "aifinipeni, aifeeyanpeeyan, tii m'ara oko san Bante wo'lu." [Yoruba proverb which depicts insurbordination or disrespect].
Text_ortho: De say aifinipeni aifeeyanpeeyan tii mara oko san bante wolu.

Text_en: The disrespect which makes a bushman enter where?
Text_ortho: Disrespect wey dey make bushman, make e enter wetin?

Text_en: Enter into town with ordinary boxers.
Text_ortho: Make e enter town with ordinary boxers.

Text_en: While the Committee was waiting for the evidence of the presidential approval, the Minister wrote to the Lawmakers.
Text_ortho: While di committee dey wait for di evidence of di presidential approval, di minister write di law makers o.

Text_en: Let them say that Buhar, he is the one who has given Mama another what?
Text_ortho: Make e dey yarn sey Buhari, na im don sama Mama anoda wetin?

Text_en: Another extension in one year.
Text_ortho: Anoda second extension for one year.

Text_en: The letter which The Punch collected from Abuja on Sunday, which was dated March seven... it has a reference number, which they mentioned.
Text_ortho: Di letter wey di Punch collect for Abuja on Sunday wey dem date March seven, e get reference number wey dem write.

Text_en: The Minister was saying that although they said the President has approved in principle, the formal letter of approval has not been given yet to Mama by the Head of Service of the Federation, Mrs Winifred Oyo Ita.
Text_ortho: Di minister dey yarn o sey aldough dem say di Presido don approve in principle, but sha di formal letter of approval, dem never carry am go give di Mama o by di Head of Service of di Federation, Mrs Winifred Oyo Ita.

Text_en: Ladies and gentlemen, what does that tell us?
Text_ortho: Ladies, and gentlemen, wetin dat one dey tell us?

Text_en: They say all animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than the others.
Text_ortho: Dem say all animals are equal, but sha o some animals are more equal dan oders.

Text_en: It is true that some people of (something like) sixty, they will not even get close to sixty years old before they chase them away.
Text_ortho: Shebi some people by (sometin wetin) sixty years old sef no go reach before dem pursue dem.

Text_en: Mama has clocked sixty one, she is going to sixty two now.
Text_ortho: Mama don go sixty one, e don dey go sixty two now o.

Text_en: They said they should leave her again.
Text_ortho: Dem say make dem leave am again.

Text_en: (This is happening) under this very government, Olorun ma wa saanu wa [God, come have mercy on us].
Text_ortho: Under dis government naa ni olorun ma wa saanu wa.

Text_en: What's happening to us?
Text_ortho: Na which one we dey?

Text_en: I don't understand.
Text_ortho: I no understand o.

Text_en: But anyway, well, Mama is enjoying it, saying, "he who is not worthy of a favor calls it forbidden."
Text_ortho: But sha, Mama sha, dey enjoy dey say eni ifa o to si ni pee laraamu.

Text_en: If you were Mama, or if Mama were your mother, would you complain?
Text_ortho: If na you be Mama, abi di Mama na your mama, sey you go complain?

Text_en: It is serious, Nigeria!
Text_ortho: Naija, nawa o!

Text_en: Only God will save us.
Text_ortho: Na God go save us.

Text_en: Ladies and gentlemen, the Yoruba people have an adage which says, "to ba kowaju si o, ko o ta; to ba keyin si o, ko o ta; to ba ku iwo nikan, ko o tun ero ara re pa." [Meaning: Take charge of every situation; be in control at all times]
Text_ortho: Ladies and gentlemen, Yoruba people go talk am for one adage won ni to ba kowaju si o ko ta to ba keyin si o ko ta to ba kun iwo nikan ko tun ero ara re pa.

Text_en: That means, if a situation challenges you from the front, give it your full attention and overcome it.
Text_ortho: That is to say if di tin face you, dem say make you shoot am o.

Text_en: If the challenge is from behind, equally give it your attention and overcome it; but when you are left all alone, with the situation still lurking somewhere, ladies and gentlemen, apply wisdom!
Text_ortho: If e back you, make you shoot am, but when be sey na only you, and am dey, ladies, and gentlemen, make you use your brain o!

Text_en: They are talking about the whistle blowing policy... engage in gossip and make money.
Text_ortho: Dem dey talk sey whistle blowing policy, make una con dey do ofofo dey collect money.

Text_en: But, well, before you engage in gossip in order to collect money, think about it deeply
Text_ortho: But sha o, before you do ofofo to collect money, reason am well, well o.

Text_en: Because here's a man, he engaged in gossip and now he's in trouble, courtesy of he himself, but they are fighting on his behalf.
Text_ortho: Because sey one man now, e don do ofofo, e don enter gbege for himsef, by himsef o, but sha dem dey fight for am o.

Text_en: The Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project, SERAP... they have sent an open letter to the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Geoffrey Onyeama Godfrey.
Text_ortho: Di Socioeconomic Right, and Accountability Project, SERAP, dem don send one kind open letter to di Minister of Foreign Affairs, Geoffrey Onyeama Godfrey.

Text_en: What are they saying to Godfrey?
Text_ortho: Wetin dem dey tell Godfrey?

Text_en: They said they should make sure that the workers who were sacked on account of whistle blowing [gossip]... (he went to report that they were fraudulent, they were into malpractices of all sorts, they were involved in corrupt practices in the uh.. ministry)... were reinstated.
Text_ortho: Dem say make dem make sure sey di workers wey dem sack on top sey e do ofofo (e go talk sey, dem dey do jibiti, dem dey do mago, mago, dem dey do makaruru for inside eh ministry), make dem give am im work back o.

Text_en: They said one Intia Thompson, is the one who was sacked through a post on the Directorate of Technical Cooperation for Africa's Notice Board.
Text_ortho: Dem say one Intia Thompson, na im dem sack through a post on top di Directorate of Technical Cooperation for Africa's Notice Board.

Text_en: What did Thompson do?
Text_ortho: Ki ni Thompson se?

Text_en: What did Thompson do?
Text_ortho: Wetin Thompson do?

Text_en: Thompson gossiped?
Text_ortho: Thompson don do ofofo o?

Text_en: He said they engage in fraud, tricks... fraud of two hundred and twenty nine thousand dollars in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
Text_ortho: Sey dem dey do jibiti, wayo, fraud of two hundred, and twenty nine thousand dollars for di Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

Text_en: They deceived people in a letter which was dated March ten, twenty seventeen.
Text_ortho: Dem dupe people for one letter wey dem date March ten twenty seventeen.

Text_en: They are demanding that Oyama act swiftly.
Text_ortho: Dem dey ask Oyama o to act sharperly, sharperly.

Text_en: He should comply with the whistle blowing policy of the government of President Muhammadu Buhari, and the international standards which say that anyone who gossips under the whistle blower... against what they call harassment [idunkokomoni - harassment] they will not do what?
Text_ortho: Make e comply with di whistle blowing policy of dem government of President Muhammadu Buhari, and international standard wey dey talk sey anybody wey dey do ofofo under di whistle blower against wetin dem dey call harassment, idunkokomoni, dem no go do wetin?

Text_en: They will not threaten them; they will not intimidate them.
Text_ortho: Dem no go threaten am, dem no go intimidate am o.

Text_en: He will just blow the whistle, and he will collect money, and he will go.
Text_ortho: E go just do di ofofo, and e go collect money, and e go go.

Text_en: Don't they say that every profession has its hazards?
Text_ortho: Shebi dem dey talk sey na every work e get im own hazard.

Text_en: If you want to be a whistle blower, one of the hazards of your own profession is that they will harrass you, they will intimidate you, in fact they can kill you if God is not on your side.
Text_ortho: If you want be whistle blower, one of di hazard of your own profession be sey dem go harass you, dem go intimidate you, dem fit even kill you if God no dey your side.

Text_en: SERAP, in a letter which was signed by the Deputy Director, Timothy Adewale, was saying how did they sack Thompson?
Text_ortho: Serap, for one letter wey dem sign by dem Deputy Director Timothy Adewale, dey yarn o sey how dem take sack Thompson?

Text_en: The Ministry will appear to say they're hiding information concerning the fraud.
Text_ortho: Di Ministry go appear o to say rua, say dem dey hide information ni ontop di jibiti.

Text_en: They insist because the public has the right to know what is going on, how the money disappeared.
Text_ortho: Why dem dey insist be sey public dem get di right o, to know wetin dey shele, how di money matter, how e take waka.

Text_en: Well, SERAP has been saying that Thompson should be called back.
Text_ortho: Toh SERAP sha don dey talk sey make dem carry Thompson back o.

Text_en: Or else Aijebe...
Text_ortho: Or else Aijebe...

Text_en: They said what?
Text_ortho: Dem say wetin?

Text_en: The issue, it will take a new turn.
Text_ortho: Di matter, e go be as e get, e go get as e be.

Text_en: Lord have mercy.
Text_ortho: Oloun sanu wa.

Text_en: Ladies and gentlement, I won't say you should not do what... you should not blow the whistle.
Text_ortho: Ladies, and gentlemen, I no go say make you no do wetin, make you no blow whistle o.

Text_en: Blow the whistle because if you blow the whistle, you will become a millionaire, but if your whistle fails or you get caught before the people who were supposed to hear the whistle... you get caught... may God have mercy on you.
Text_ortho: Blow whistle because sey if you blow whistle, you go turn millionaire, but sha o if your whistle no con loud, abi dem catch you before di people wey de suppose hear di whistle dem catch you, oloun sanu e o.

Text_en: That means what?
Text_ortho: Dat means sey wetin?

Text_en: Only you, for yourself, by yourself and your family, will get into trouble.
Text_ortho: Na only you for yoursef, by yoursef, and your family na im go enter trouble.

Text_en: God have mercy on us.
Text_ortho: Oloun sanu wa.

Text_en: Well, I have left that kind of story.
Text_ortho: Toh I don comot from all dose kind tory.

Text_en: I am in the 'wonders shall never end corner', the one they call what?
Text_ortho: I don enter pekele, pekele arugbo jegbese, di one wey dem dey call wetin?

Text_en: Stories from the women's angle.
Text_ortho: Woman angle story.

Text_en: God have mercy on us.
Text_ortho: Olorun ma saanu wa.

Text_en: What is this, what did I see?
Text_ortho: Wetin be dis, wetin I see?

Text_en: God have mercy on me again.
Text_ortho: Olorun maa tun saanu mi ke.

Text_en: There's nothing much to do about it.
Text_ortho: Dis matter, e be as e get, e get as e be o.

Text_en: It's not true that you employ a person so that they can become someone in life, but when the one you employ kills you, what do we do?
Text_ortho: Sebi na person dey employ person make im too con become better person for life, but when person wey you con employ con kill you nkor, wetin we go do?

Text_en: How do we handle this?
Text_ortho: Ki ni ka ti seyi si?

Text_en: It was said that a man in a restaurant in the Awoyaya area of Ibeju Lekki in Lagos State, has been arrested by oro-... operatives of the Lagos State Command because the man robbed his Mistress, one Paulina Paul.
Text_ortho: Dem say one sales man for one restaurant for Awoyaya Ibeju Lekki for Lagos State, dem don catch am o by oro-... operatives of di Lagos State Command on top sey di guy rob im oga, one Paulina Paul.

Text_en: The suspect, a twenty two year old Stephen Otuyi... the guy is said to have joined hands with... he connived, he collaborated with one Ibrahim Muhammad, and others who happened to have stole away.
Text_ortho: Di suspect, twenty two years old Stephen Otuyi, dem say di guy nko, e go ledi apo po, e go connive go do collabo with one Ibrahim Muhammad, and oders wey be sey dem don run o.

Text_en: They harrassed the woman in her house which is in Olomide Idiala Street, Oria-... Oribanwuwa Phase Two in Ibeju Lekki.
Text_ortho: Dem go harass di woman for her house wey dey for Olomide Idiala street Oria-... Oribanwuwa phase two for Ibeju Lekki.

Text_en: We heard that Otuyi owns the restaurant.
Text_ortho: We hear o sey Otuyi, na im get di restaurant.

Text_en: The reporter also heard that the gang stole her phone.
Text_ortho: Report man too hear sey di gang dem thief her phone o.

Text_en: They stole her jewellery and clothes among other things, which means that her money, if it's taken to the market, will be like... about uh... two million naira.
Text_ortho: Dem thief her jewellery, and clothes among other tings wey be sey im money, if dem carry am go market, dey go like about eh two million naira.

Text_en: Shout.
Text_ortho: E pariwo.

Text_en: Allah.
Text_ortho: Pe Allahu.

Text_en: A whopping sum of two million naira, what did the woman do to them?
Text_ortho: Two million naira (tan yan, yan) wetin di woman do for dem?

Text_en: What did she do to them?
Text_ortho: Wetin e do for dem?

Text_en: Aunty Sola Alison sang about it.
Text_ortho: Shebi Auntie Sola Alison don take am sing.

Text_en: That's just to say that if there's no accomplice, if you don't have an informant in the house, it is said that the enemy coming from outside cannot succeed.
Text_ortho: Dat is to say if dere is no accomplice, if you no get anybody for inside di house, de say di enemy wey dey come from outside, e no get wetin e fit do o.

Text_en: But it's actually this employee who gathered people to rob his Mistress, who pays his salary.
Text_ortho: But sha o dis person wey de employ, na im gangan, na im gather people wey dem con rob im oga wey dey pay im salary.

Text_en: Shout Allah akbar.
Text_ortho: E pariwo pe Allah akbar.

Text_en: God have mercy on us.
Text_ortho: Olorun sanu wa.

Text_en: Father God should do what?
Text_ortho: Baba God, make e dey do wetin?

Text_en: He should save us.
Text_ortho: Make e dey save us ni o.

Text_en: Just a twenty two year old suspect... twenty two years old, what was he looking for?
Text_ortho: Twenty two years old suspect pere, twenty two years old, wetin e dey find?

Text_en: It was said that Paul started working in the restaurant sometimes in January, twenty seventeen.
Text_ortho: De say Paul start to dey work for di restaurant o sometimes in January twenty seventeen.

Text_en: And he was sacked after one week.
Text_ortho: And after one week, dem sack am o.

Text_en: After he lost the job, on the last day, he asked for the payment of his salary which is about three thousand five hundred, but the woman was telling him that she didn't have cash on her, so he would have to come back.
Text_ortho: After di work don close, on di last day, e say make dem pay am im money wey be sey na like three thousand five hundred, but di woman dey tell am sey e go come back ni, money no dey for ground o.

Text_en: Around ten pm on January twenty one, the guy went to threaten his Mistress in the restaurant
Text_ortho: Around ten p.m. on January twenty one o, naim di guy go di restaurant, go threaten im oga o.

Text_en: That if you refuse to pay my money right now, now, now, now, now, trouble looms.
Text_ortho: Sey if you no pay my money now, now, now, now, now, gbado, gbado a gbowo agbado lowo.

Text_en: That's just to say that you will regret your actions.
Text_ortho: Dat is to say you go regret yourself o.

Text_en: On January twenty two, at about two thirty am, they robbed the house, they entered Paul's house with a gun and cutlass.
Text_ortho: On January twenty two, about two thirty a.m., de rob house, de enter Paul house with gun, and cutlass.

Text_en: It's been said that "If something enters with a gun, with bullets... Mister, lie flat".
Text_ortho: Won ni tawon Kini Kan ba wole pelu ibon, pelu bullet ogbeni dubule.

Text_en: That was how they entered with a sinister looking cutlass [ada Lam/Lam's cutlass], and they took away her property, including a Toyota Matrix car.
Text_ortho: Na so dem take enter o with ada Lamu, and dem carry away her property including a Toyota Matrix car.

Text_en: They said the incident has been reported to the police.
Text_ortho: Dem say di incident, dem report am to di police o.

Text_en: That was what led to Otuyi and Muhammed's arrest.
Text_ortho: Na so dem take catch Otuyi, and Muhammed.

Text_en: But they guy insists that he doesn't know anything about the case.
Text_ortho: But di guy still dey talk sey e no know anytin about di matter o.

Text_en: That he was just threatening her.
Text_ortho: Sey e just dey threaten.

Text_en: Just an empty threat.
Text_ortho: Ni o, ni o, enu lasan ni.

Text_en: Just talk.
Text_ortho: Na just mouth.

Text_en: Talk is cheap.
Text_ortho: Ofe lohun.

Text_en: I was just saying things, I don't know anything, I don't have anything.
Text_ortho: I just dey make mouth, I no sabi anything, I no get anything.

Text_en: But you know it's possible that this guy doesn't know anything indeed.
Text_ortho: But you know sey dis guy fit no know anytin sha.

Text_en: God have mercy on us.
Text_ortho: Olorun sanu wa.

Text_en: Ladies and gentlemen, don't talk when you are angry.
Text_ortho: Ladies, and gentlemen, if you dey vex, no talk.

Text_en: Did you hear him?
Text_ortho: Shey you don dey hear am?

Text_en: This guy's mouth got him into trouble.
Text_ortho: Dis guy now, e mouth don put am for trouble o.

Text_en: He said, "I was working with the lady as a Sale's Representative, in her restaurant."
Text_ortho: E say I dey work with madam as a sale representatives for her restaurant o.

Text_en: "She was paying me fifteen thousand naira per month, and two hundred naira for transportation every day."
Text_ortho: She dey pay me fifteen thousand naira per month, and two hundred naira for transportation every day.

Text_en: "I only worked for a week."
Text_ortho: I only work for one week o.

Text_en: "I left because the second Sale's Representative, Justina, was telling the lady that I was not treating her well."
Text_ortho: I left because sey di second sales representative, Justina dey tell madam sey I no dey treat am well.

Text_en: "I just gave her some advice."
Text_ortho: I advise her o.

Text_en: "So she could get into the habit of saving money on a daily basis if she's planning to go back to Akwa Ibom, her home."
Text_ortho: Meh e dey save money on a daily basis if you wan go back to Akwa Ibom where she for come o.

Text_en: "She reported to the lady that I was encouraging her to steal money."
Text_ortho: She go tell madam sey I dey advise her make she dey thief money.

Text_en: What!
Text_ortho: Ewo!

Text_en: It's a long story but the guy has been taken away.
Text_ortho: Di matter sha, e long, but sha de sha don carry di guy go sha o.

Text_en: The Magistrate presiding over the case, Mrs O. A. Amhohia, has granted him bail at the amount of five hundred thousand naira.
Text_ortho: Di presiding magistrate on top di matter, Mrs O.A. Amhohia, e con grant am bail in di sum of five hundred thousand naira.

Text_en: Shout "Allah."
Text_ortho: E pariwo pe Allahu.

Text_en: Where will the person fighting for the payment of three thousand five hundred naira get five hundred thousand naira from?
Text_ortho: Where im go see five hundred thousand naira person wey dey fight for three five?

Text_en: Both of us are warrantors of the same money.
Text_ortho: We two sureties each o for di same money.

Text_en: Then she adjourned the case till April twenty eight, twenty seventeen.
Text_ortho: E con adjourn di matter till April twenty eight twenty seventeen.

Text_en: Well, Father God will help him; He will set him free; he will be able to escape.
Text_ortho: Toh Baba God, e go help am, e go free am, e go fit comot.

Text_en: For what?
Text_ortho: On top wetin?

Text_en: On the level of e pele parile, parile, on the program today, a dishonest, fraudulent, deceitful, scam expert and thief, whose name is Eze Udoh, it's been reported that he has been arrested by men of the Umuahia Central Police in Abia State because the guy withdrew the sum of one million, forty nine thousand, five hundred and forty five naira from his victim's account.
Text_ortho: Ontop di level (e pele parile, parile), ontop di programme for today, one magomago, jibiti, wayo, 419, jaguda pali wey e name na Eze Udoh, dem say dem don catch am o by men of di Umuahia Central Police for Abia State on top sey di guy go withdraw di sum of one million forty nine thousand five hundred, and forty five naira from im victim account o.

Text_en: A policeman was saying what?
Text_ortho: A policeman, na im dey yarn sey wetin?

Text_en: They have been searching for the suspect since a complaint was lodged by the victim, Mister Oka Monday, that the suspect stole his ATM card, and he collected all the money in his account.
Text_ortho: De don dey find di suspect when dem go complain by di victim, Mister Oka Monday wey be sey di suspect, e thief im ATM card o, and e collect all di money from im account.

Text_en: According to the source, the victim who is from Amachara Umukpara, a satellite town close to the capital city, Umuahia, was making an attempt to withdraw some money from an ATM which is attached to the Commercial Bank in Umuahia when the suspect said he would help him because the network was bad.
Text_ortho: According to di source, di victim wey come from Amachara Umukpara, a satellite town wey dey near di Capital City Umuahia, e dey make attempt o to withdraw some money from one ATM ni wey dem attach to Commercial Bank for Umuahia when di suspect e say e go help am because sey network dey fail.

Text_en: We heard that when the attempt to withdraw the money failed, the suspect had already memorised the victim's secret pin, he advised him to follow him to a nearby bank where the transaction will be easier.
Text_ortho: We hear sey after attempt to withdraw di money, e fail, di suspect, e don memorise di victim secret pin card o, advise am to follow am to a nearby bank where dem go for do am easier o.

Text_en: Eh, what?
Text_ortho: En sey wetin?

Text_en: What happened when they got there? He just... did he, he end up doing what he wanted to do?
Text_ortho: When dem con reach di place nko, e sha, shey, e sha do wetin e go do?

Text_en: Well, he ran away with the... he ran away with the ATM card.
Text_ortho: E sha run away with di, e sha run away with di ATM.

Text_en: I don't understand that.
Text_ortho: Dat one too, I no understand o.

Text_en: Why would you give a stranger your ATM card and your pin too?
Text_ortho: Why you go just carry your ATM give stranger give am your pin?

Text_en: It was said that... what happened after that... he just started getting different alerts... debit alerts and the like.
Text_ortho: Dem say after dat one nko, e just dey get plenty, plenty alert ni o, debit alert pe ah aye o.

Text_en: All his money was collected.
Text_ortho: Dem don collect money finish.

Text_en: God have mercy on us.
Text_ortho: Olorun ma saanu wa.

Text_en: They are watching us closely.
Text_ortho: Dem police us hard o.

Text_en: The security operatives started searching for the suspect following the intelligence report they gathered.
Text_ortho: Sey security operative dey start to dey search for di suspect following intelligence wey dem gather o.

Text_en: And their efforts later paid off when the suspect was caught.
Text_ortho: And di tin con later pay off when di suspect, dem catch am.

Text_en: He pointed out that while searching the suspect's house, they found thirteen different ATM cards belonging to different victims.
Text_ortho: E point out to sey during im search for di suspect house, thirteen different ATM card wey belong to different victims, na im dem see o.

Text_en: The State Commissioner of Police, [hau] the overall boss [hau], Mr Adeleye Oyebade, confirmed the arrest of the suspect.
Text_ortho: Di state oga patapata of police, shugaban kasa, kasa, Mr Adeleye Oyebade, e confirm di arrest of di suspect o.

Text_en: He said he has confessed to the crime.
Text_ortho: Sey e don confess witch.

Text_en: He said he's the one stealing people's pins and their ATM cards.
Text_ortho: E say na im be di one wey dey chop people pin, and deir ATM card.

Text_en: Well, we thank God that he's been apprehended.
Text_ortho: But sha o, we sha thank God sey God don catch am.

Text_en: If you are listening to me and you also steal people's ATM cards, by the grace of Allah, by the grace of Jesus, you will be caught at your next attempt.
Text_ortho: If you dey listen to me, and you too you dey tief people ATM card, di next one wey you go go, dem go catch you insha Allah insha Jesus.

Text_en: Ladies and gentlemen, that's as far as we can go today on the programme, "Naija Na Wa O", we'll come your way again tomorrow by the grace of Allah, by the grace of Jesus.
Text_ortho: Ladies, and gentlemen, na so di matter go reach for today on top di programme Naija Na Wa O to come back your way again tomorrow insha Allah insha Jesus.

Text_en: This is Lagelu, ninety six point seven.
Text_ortho: Lagelu re ninety six point seven.

Text_en: No longer on ninety six point three.
Text_ortho: No more ninety six point three o.

Text_en: We've done what?
Text_ortho: We don do wetin?

Text_en: We've moved to a higher ground, just to serve you better.
Text_ortho: We don port to higher ground just to serve you better naa ni.

Text_en: I will not leave the air today until I say a happy birthday to our Mommy, Mrs Kikelomo Orimolade, Mama Ilu, Mommy Ayodeji.
Text_ortho: I no go go on top di air programme today until I say happy birthday to our mummy, Mrs Kikelomo Orimolade, Mama Ilu, Mummy Ayodeji.

Text_en: Talking of what?
Text_ortho: Talking of wetin?

Text_en: Illusions.
Text_ortho: Illusions.

Text_en: I say "Happy Birthday, Mommy!"
Text_ortho: I say mummy, happy birthday!

Text_en: Two hundred years is like a year to you.
Text_ortho: To you, two hundred years is a one year.

Text_en: Two hundred years is like a year.
Text_ortho: Igba odun odun Kan ni.

Text_en: Long life and prosperity!
Text_ortho: Long life and prosperity!

Text_en: Happy birthday to you!
Text_ortho: Happy birthday to you!

Text_en: Ladies and gentlement, until tomorrow when I will come your way again, I'm still your buddie, your brother and man on the radio.
Text_ortho: Ladies, and gentlemen, till tomorrow when I go come your way again, na still me be your personal person, your brother man on di radio.

Text_en: A.K.A. Afuda Samuel is the full name, but you can simply call me Afuda Babba Agbalagba [Afuda the elderly one].
Text_ortho: Aka Afuda Samuel is di full name, but you simply call me Afuda Babba Agbalagba.

Text_en: I sit on the ground, I am bending over, I am rolling on the ground, begging you to please take good care of yourselves, for my sake, simply because I love you all to the bone.
Text_ortho: I sit down for ground, dey bend for ground, dey roll for ground, dey beg you to please take a wonderful care of yourself for me simply because I love you all to di bone.

Text_en: Bye for now.
Text_ortho: Bye for now.

Text_en: Here's the news, which Afoda Samuel is about to read.
Text_ortho: Na di news be dis wey Afoda Samuel wan read.

Text_en: First, let me tell you the highlights from the news.
Text_ortho: First, make I yarn you di koko wey dey for inside di tori.

Text_en: The Senate President has gone to inspect some power plants in Berlin.
Text_ortho: Senate Presido don go inspect some power plant wey dey for Berlin.

Text_en: The FRSC has caught six hundred and fifty seven people for failing to install speed limiting devices in their vehicles.
Text_ortho: Frsc don catch six hundred, and fifty seven people on top sey dem no put speed limiting machine for inside dem vehicle.

Text_en: A woman has been arrested in South Africa over a baby that was kidnapped.
Text_ortho: Dem don catch one woman for South Africa on top baby wey dem kidnap.

Text_en: Sunshine Queens, they are ready for the new Nigeria Women Premier League Season which is about to start.
Text_ortho: Sunshine Queen, dem don ready for di new Nigeria women Premier League season wey wan start.

Text_en: Now, let's tell you the news in full.
Text_ortho: Now, make we yarn you di full tori.

Text_en: How to handle the law on... how they generate power, transmission and how they distribute it, can be the best thing which can be done to solve the current electricity problem facing the country.
Text_ortho: How to take handle law on how dem take dey generate power transmission, and how dem take dey distribute am, e be di best thing wey dem fit do o to solve di current electricity problem wey dey shele for di country.

Text_en: In an interview with the Project Leader, Warner Fortwiter, he said that Nigeria... they will still benefit from the plan to switch to renew-... build energy... from electricity generation.
Text_ortho: For one interview with di project leader, Warner Fortwiter, im dey yarn sey Nigeria, dem go still benefit o from sey dem wan switch to renew build energy from electricity generation.

Text_en: Let's listen to him.
Text_ortho: Make we hear as e talk am.

Text_en: The Senate President, Bukola Saraki, says this while on a tour with others to an energy self sufficient village located in Germany.
Text_ortho: Di Senate Presido, Bukola Saraki, na im dey yarn dis one when e do one kind tour wey dem follow am do for one energy self-sufficient village wey dey for Germany.

Text_en: He said the National Assembly must rework the law which will allow communities to generate energy, and allow people to use their brain, and involve people in the private sector as well.
Text_ortho: E say di National Assembly, dem gats to rearrange di law o wey go allow communities make dem fit dey generate energy, and to allow people make dem dey use deir brain, and to even involve people wey be sey dem be private business.

Text_en: Let us hear as the President says it.
Text_ortho: XXXXX

Text_en: The Lake Chad Basin Commission, LCBC, have identified that the kinds of issues known as insurgency and climate change are the major problems facing effective groundwater management in the basin.
Text_ortho: Di Lake Chad Basin Commission, LCBC, na im don identify o sey na dis kind ozigi wey dem dey call insurgency, and climate change na dem be di major gbege wey be sey e dey follow effective groundwater management for di basin.

Text_en: In Abuja, their Technical Director, Doctor Mana Bubakari, says that the situation has become complicated by the growth of people... the number of people which keeps increasing in the region due to the many people who have been forced to leave their homes.
Text_ortho: Dem technical director, Doctor Mana Bubakari, na im dey yarn for Abuja sey di situation, na im don pakaso by di growth of people, number of people wey be sey e dey increase for di region following as people wey war don pursue comot for deir house, as dem dey plenty for dere.

Text_en: He said there are almost nine million people whose livelihoods depend on the lake staying in the region.
Text_ortho: E say na like nine million people who be sey how dem take dey live deir life, e dey depend on top di lake na dem dey stay for di region.

Text_en: Their commission is a kind of intergovernmental organization that oversees water and other natural resources, and how they are used in the basin.
Text_ortho: Dem commission na one kind intergovernmental organisation wey be sey na dem dey oversee water, and oder natural resources, and how dem take dey use am for inside di basin.

Text_en: The eight member government was chosen because they are close to Lake Chad.
Text_ortho: Di eight member government, na dem just choose o sey, because sey dem dey close to Lake Chad.

Text_en: They are Cameroon, Chad, Niger, Nigeria, Algeria, the Central African Republic, Libya and Sudan.
Text_ortho: Dem be Cameroon, Chad, Niger, Nigeria, Algeria, plus including di Central African Republic, Libya, and Sudan.

Text_en: The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board, JAMB, has said that they will start selling the twenty seventeen UTME (Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination) form on March twentieth.
Text_ortho: Di Joint Admission, and Matriculation Board, JAMB don yarn o sey dem go start to dey sell twenty seventeen UTME form on March twenty.

Text_en: The Chief spokesman for JAMB, Doctor Fabian Benjamin, said this today in Abuja.
Text_ortho: Di oga for JAMB talk, talk, Doctor Fabian Benjamin, na im dey yarn dis one today for Abuja.

Text_en: Doctor Benjamin said that the date was fixed for the twenty-fourth of January following the agreement they made on the harmonization of the examination timetable in a meeting with other examination bodies.
Text_ortho: Doctor Benjamin yarn sey di date, na im dem fix o following one kind agreement wey all of dem take together for di harmonisation of di examination timetable for one meeting with oder examination body for di twenty-fourth of January.

Text_en: JAMB said recently that they will arrange an optional mock exam which anyone interested can sit for before the twenty seventeen UTME [Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination].
Text_ortho: Jamb, recently, na im dey yarn sey dem go arrange one kind optional mock examination wey anybody wey like am fit do before di twenty seventeen UTME.

Text_en: According to what the board said, what they want to do with the mock exam is to allow candidates to have a feel for what the examination... what it will look like.
Text_ortho: According to wetin di board yarn, wetin dem wan take do di mock examination na to allow candidate mey dem feel o wetin di examination, wetin e go be like.

Text_en: They said candidates can choose whether or not they want to take the mock examination.
Text_ortho: Dem say candidates, dem fit choose o wheda dem wan do di mock examination, abi dem no dey do.

Text_en: The Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC, in Anambra has said that they have arrested no fewer than six hundred and fifty seven motorists who have not installed the speed limiting device in their vehicles in February.
Text_ortho: Di Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC for Anambra don yarn sey dem don catch like six hundred and fifty seven people wey dey drive car on top sey dem never put di speed limiting device for inside deir car in February.

Text_en: Speaking on the subject, Area Commander, Mister Sunday Ajayi, said that while one hundred and seven people were caught by a kind of mobile court, one hundred and two of them were deemed guilty and have been handed punishments.
Text_ortho: Di oga for di area, Mister Sunday Ajayi, na im dey yarn dis one for one interview wen he dey yarn sey one hundred and seven people, na im dem catch by one kind mobile court, and one hundred and two of dem o, na im dem see sey deir hand no pure wey dem sama punishment.

Text_en: According to him, fifty one of them were guilty of non-installation of the device while others were involved in other offences including passing through roads they were not supposed to.
Text_ortho: According to him, fifty one of di people, na im de gats to do with sey dem no put di device while oders na due to oder offences including sey dem dey pass different ways wey be sey dem no suppose pass.

Text_en: They were speeding too much, which the whites call overspeeding.
Text_ortho: Dem too dey run wey Oyibo dey call overspeeding.

Text_en: They were overloading or driving recklessly.
Text_ortho: Dem dey overload, and dem dey drive very, very dangerously.

Text_en: He said we have X to drive home with road users, people who operate different kinds of cars [fleet operators].
Text_ortho: E say we don X able to drive home with road users, people wey be sey dem dey operate different kind of cars.

Text_en: On Nigerian roads today, you cannot drive in any way without installing the device we asked you to install.
Text_ortho: Sey for Nigerian road today, una no fit dey drive anyhow without sey una put di device wey we say make una put.

Text_en: This is still the six PM news on Lagelu, ninety-six point seven FM.
Text_ortho: Na still di six p.m. news be dis on top Lagelu, ninety-six point seven FM.

Text_en: Still from this news bulletin, a woman has been arrested for the kidnapping of a baby in South Africa.
Text_ortho: Still for inside dis tori, de don catch one mama on top baby wey dem kidnap for South Africa.

Text_en: Sunshine Queens, they are ready for the New Nigeria Women Premier League Season.
Text_ortho: Sunshine Queens dem don ready for New Nigeria Women Premier League season.

Text_en: We will take a short break now.
Text_ortho: We go take a chikini break now.

Text_en: When we come back, we will read you more news.
Text_ortho: When we show back we go yarn una more tori.

Text_en: Don't leave!
Text_ortho: Make una never waka.

Text_en: The love God has for everyone made Him send His only child so that whoever believes in Him will not perish but have everlasting life.
Text_ortho: Na di likeness wey God get for everybody na im make am send im only pikin so dat anybody wey believe am no go die, but go get life boku.

Text_en: God did not send His Child to the world in order to condemn us, but to save us.
Text_ortho: God no send im pikin to come world come condemn we, but so dat e go save we.

Text_en: Today, Jesus has over one billion followers, and even more.
Text_ortho: Today, Jesus get pass one billion followers, and even more.

Text_en: The story is from the Book of Luke.
Text_ortho: Na di Book of Luke na im di tory dey come.

Text_en: I am writing you this book, Theophilus, to tell you the way everything happened so that you will know the main things, right from the birth of Jesus Christ, when Mary and Joseph went to register their names, when Caesar Augustus was the King of Rome, and Herod was the King of Judea.
Text_ortho: I dey write you dis book Theophilus to tell you di way everytin take happen so dat you go know di main tings right from di birth of Jesus Christ when Mary and Joseph go put down name when Caesar Augustus be di king for Rome, and Herod be di king for Judea.

Text_en: Mary and Joseph were the parents of Jesus.
Text_ortho: Mary, and Joseph, na im be di parents of Jesus.

Text_en: An angel appeared to Mary, he told her that she will give birth to a boy who will be the savior of the world, as a virgin.
Text_ortho: One angel appear to Mary tell am sey she go born bomboy wey go be di saviour of the world as Mary no know man.

Text_en: Jesus started growing and he was wise.
Text_ortho: Jesus begin grow dey get sense.

Text_en: In fact, he was sitting among professors and in fact, doctors were there too, and he was lecturing them.
Text_ortho: Even sef, dey siddon for where professors, and doctors sef dem dey, dey lecture dem.

Text_en: As he began preaching the good news, some people started following his line of thought, saying he was speaking the truth.
Text_ortho: As e begin preach di good news, some people begin reason wit am sey na di truth e dey yarn.

Text_en: Jesus overcame temptations from the devil on three occassions, when he was fasting for forty days and forty nights.
Text_ortho: Jesus overcome temptation from di Devil three times as e dey fast for forty days, and forty night.

Text_en: He had his baptism with John the Baptist as John the Baptist told the people "there is someone ahead of me, who is greater than me, who will baptise you with water, and fire, I cannot even take his sandals off."
Text_ortho: E do baptism wit John the Baptist as John di Baptist tell di people sey person dey before me wey big pass me wey go baptise una wit water, and fire, I no fit even comot im sandal sef.

Text_en: As Jesus was preaching, he started coming in contact with his followers.
Text_ortho: As Jesus dey preach, e begin meet im followers dem.

Text_en: He was greeting them one after the other.
Text_ortho: E begin greet dem one after di oder.

Text_en: Peter, whom he called Simon; Andrew; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew; James; Thaddeus; Simon the Zealot; and Judas Iscariot who betrayed Jesus.
Text_ortho: Peter wey im call Simon, Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew, Thomas, Matthew, James, Thaddeus, Simon di Zealot, and Judas Iscariot wey betray Jesus.

Text_en: They started going around, spreading the good news.
Text_ortho: Dem begin waka dey spread di good news.

Text_en: They were spreading it to all the corners of the earth.
Text_ortho: Dem dey spread am reach all di corners of di earth.

Text_en: And they were preaching that God's kindgom has come, everyone should repent.
Text_ortho: And de dey preach sey God kindgom don show, make everybody dem repent.

Text_en: And so people started giving their lives to God, and they repented for their sins.
Text_ortho: Na so people come dey give deir life to God, and dey repent from deir sins.

Text_en: Then on a particular night, it was the last supper, Jesus sent his disciples to go get all they will eat and drink for the last supper.
Text_ortho: E come reach one night, come reach last super, Jesus come send im disciple say make dem go bring everyting wey dem go chop, wey de go drink for di last supper.

Text_en: So they left.
Text_ortho: Naim de come comot.

Text_en: Go into town!
Text_ortho: Enter town!

Text_en: When you got there, you'll see a guy carrying a bucket of water.
Text_ortho: When you reach, you go sight one guy wey carry bucket of water.

Text_en: Talk to him!
Text_ortho: Follow am rub mind!

Text_en: Go into his house.
Text_ortho: Una waka go im cabal.

Text_en: Tell him there are thirteen of us.
Text_ortho: Tell am sey we be thirteen.

Text_en: Then ask, "what's a good place for us to stay?"
Text_ortho: Come ask sey where go make sense wey we fit lodge?

Text_en: He'll show you a room, it's upstairs, it's very neat.
Text_ortho: E go show you one room, e dey upstairs, e neat no be small.

Text_en: Prepare it.
Text_ortho: Make una arrange am.

Text_en: That's where we'll stay.
Text_ortho: Na dere we go crash.

Text_en: God!
Text_ortho: God!

Text_en: You are a very good God.
Text_ortho: Na better God you be.

Text_en: You are the King of the world.
Text_ortho: Na you be di king of di world.

Text_en: You're the One who makes things happen, and You're the One who makes trees bear fruit.
Text_ortho: Na you dey make tings happen, and na still you dey make tree bring fruit.

Text_en: Here is my body.
Text_ortho: Na my body be dis.

Text_en: Take it, divide it.
Text_ortho: Take am, make una divide am.

Text_en: Do this in remembrance of me.
Text_ortho: Make una dey do dis one take dey remember me.

Text_en: God!
Text_ortho: God!

Text_en: You are a good God.
Text_ortho: Na better God you be.

Text_en: I really appreciate You.
Text_ortho: I tank you no be small.

Text_en: You are the King of the world.
Text_ortho: Na you be di king of di world.

Text_en: You are the One who makes trees bear fruit.
Text_ortho: Na you dey make tree bring fruit.

Text_en: Take it, share it.
Text_ortho: Take am, make una share am.

Text_en: This is my blood.
Text_ortho: Na my blood be dis.

Text_en: I have been waiting for this day to eat this Passover before the Son of Man suffers.
Text_ortho: I don dey wait for dis day to follow una chow dis Passover before man pikin suffer.

Text_en: I tell you that I will not eat until you have known what this food means in the Kingdom of God, and until what God said has come to pass.
Text_ortho: I tell una sey I no go chop until una don know wetin dis food mean for di kingdom of God, and until di ting wey God yarn don happen.

Text_en: Did you hear me?
Text_ortho: Una hear me so?

Text_en: This is the covenant.
Text_ortho: Dis one na di covenant.

Text_en: It is my body, and my blood, that I pour for you.
Text_ortho: Na my body, and my blood na im I pour for una so.

Text_en: But I tell you, the person who will kill me, who will even betray me, is here with us as we eat on this table.
Text_ortho: But I tell una di person wey go kill me, wey go even fall my hand sef dey here with us as we dey chow for dis table so.

Text_en: And God will deal with the person.
Text_ortho: And na God go trap di person down.

Text_en: The greatest among you must be as a small child, and the master must be as the servant.
Text_ortho: A big person for una must do like small pikin, and di oga must do like boy, boy.

Text_en: Who is the greatest?
Text_ortho: Na who big pass?

Text_en: The one who sits to eat or he who serves?
Text_ortho: Person wey sit down chop, or person wey serve?

Text_en: It's the one who sat down, right?
Text_ortho: Na person wey sit down abi?

Text_en: But I am among you as the one who is serving, you have been with me since this trouble started.
Text_ortho: But I dey wit una like who dey serve una don dey wit me since dis trouble start.

Text_en: And as my Father has given me the authority, even so, I will pass it to you.
Text_ortho: And as my papa don give me di control, na so I go pass am give una.

Text_en: You will eat and drink at my table in the Kingdom.
Text_ortho: Una go chop, and drink for my table for di kingdom.

Text_en: And you will also sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
Text_ortho: Still come sit down for di government control di twelve tribes dem wey dey Israel.

Text_en: I greet you.
Text_ortho: I greet una.

Text_en: How are you?
Text_ortho: How body?

Text_en: Why do doubts arise in your minds?
Text_ortho: Why una come dey get double mind?

Text_en: Take a look, see my hand, and my leg!
Text_ortho: Look o, see my hand, and my leg!

Text_en: You should see that this is I, myself.
Text_ortho: Make una see sey na me be dis.

Text_en: Not a spirit.
Text_ortho: No be shere kambia.

Text_en: Touch me, and you will know!
Text_ortho: Touch me, and you go know!

Text_en: Spirits don't have flesh, or bones as I have.
Text_ortho: Spirits no dey get flesh, or bone as I get so.

Text_en: This is what I was telling you when I was still with you.
Text_ortho: Dis na di ting wey I dey tell una when I still dey wit una.

Text_en: Everything Moses wrote, and the ones which the Prophets wrote both in Psalms, and in the other books, they have come to pass.
Text_ortho: Everyting wey Moses write, plus di one wey dem prophet write both for Psalm, and for di oder books dem don dey happen.

Text_en: This is what was written.
Text_ortho: Dis na wetin dem write.

Text_en: The Saviour must, and then rise up from the grave after three days.
Text_ortho: Di saviour must suffer, and den wake up from grave after three day.

Text_en: In my name, tell the people that they should repent and say God has forgiven them, starting from Jerusalem.
Text_ortho: Wit my name, tell di people make dem change and say God don forgive dem starting from Jerusalem.

Text_en: You are witnesses of all these thigs and I bring you the promise of God, the Father.
Text_ortho: Una take eye see all dis ting, and I bring di promise wey Baba God promise una!

Text_en: You must wait in this town until power from above comes upon you.
Text_ortho: Una must wait for dis town until power from above come enter una body.

Text_en: May God bless and keep you, all the power in this world and... belongs to my Father, to enable you teach those who are in the world, and baptise them in the name of the Father, His Son, and the Holy Ghost.
Text_ortho: Meh God bless, and keep una all di power wey dey for dis world, and my Papa get am to make una teach di people wey dey di world, and baptise dem wit di name of di Papa, im Pikin, and di Holy Ghost.

Text_en: I am with you all, everytime, even until till the end of the world.
Text_ortho: I dey wit una everytime even till when dis world go end.

Text_en: People of Plateau, they have one kind of... life-... lifestyle which shows in their dress, most especially their costumes.
Text_ortho: People of Plateau, de get one kind of em lafs-... lifestyle wey dem dey carry dress most especially deir attire.

Text_en: As I have said, you know that Plateau has different ethnic... uh... different ethnic groups.
Text_ortho: As I don talk am, you know sey Plateau get different, different ethnic, eh different ethnic groups.

Text_en: They have more than twenty three ethnic groups, on the Plateau.
Text_ortho: De get more than twenty three ethnic groups on di Plateau.

Text_en: So just a local government alone has more than eight... more than ten.
Text_ortho: So just a local government alone dey get more dan eight, more dan ten.

Text_en: So, as people are different with different ethnic groups like this, you know that their style of dress will differ.
Text_ortho: So as people dey different wit different ethnic group like dis, you know sey deir type of dressing go differ.

Text_en: In my local government particularly, our traditional uh... dressing, we are... we are... we are... our old women used to carry children in the back with... goat skin.
Text_ortho: For my local government gangan, our traditional eh dressing self, we dey, we dey, we dey, our old women dey back pikin with eh goat skin.

Text_en: You know that it's our traditional way of uh, uh... carrying a baby on our backs.
Text_ortho: You know, that is our traditional way of eh eh backing a baby.

Text_en: And you know people... some wear the agbada, some wear different costumes.
Text_ortho: And you know people some dey wear agbada, some dey wear different attire.

Text_en: So we have that one here.
Text_ortho: So we get dat one for here.

Text_en: And then... uh... the delicacies, that means the food we eat in Plateau.
Text_ortho: And den, em di delicacy, na im be sey di food wey we dey chop for Plateau.

Text_en: We have different varieties.
Text_ortho: We get varieties.

Text_en: Most especially, f-... like me, I like gote.
Text_ortho: Most especially, f-... like me, I dey like gote.

Text_en: You know gote is a kind of delicacy which they prepare.
Text_ortho: You know gote na kind of delicacy weh dem dey prepare.

Text_en: At times, they use acha.
Text_ortho: At times, dem dey use acha.

Text_en: What do we...?
Text_ortho: Wetin we be... ?

Text_en: What they call hungry rice, right?
Text_ortho: Wetin de dey call hungry rice abi?

Text_en: So, they use it to make that gote.
Text_ortho: So dem dey use am make dat gote.

Text_en: It's a light food, very soft food.
Text_ortho: Na light food, very soft food.

Text_en: When you have it, you enjoy it.
Text_ortho: When you go take am, you go enjoy yourself.

Text_en: It makes you shine.
Text_ortho: E dey make you dey shine.

Text_en: So they use um... spinach to do it with uh... uh... acha.
Text_ortho: So dem dey carry em spinach dey do am wit eh eh acha.

Text_en: They use uh... they use tomatoes, and some spices to, you know, garnish it.
Text_ortho: Use some, em use tomatoes, and some spice to you know garnish am.

Text_en: Uh... actually, we have uh... different types of dance, or dances (so to speak) on the Plateau.
Text_ortho: Em, actually, we get em different types of dance, or dances so to say on di Plateau.

Text_en: And uh... there is...
Text_ortho: And em e get...

Text_en: Like in my place in Mangu Local Government, they use horns.
Text_ortho: Like for my place for Mangu Local Government, dem dey use horn.

Text_en: Some even use guinea corn, eh... um... the (what do they call it?), the stalks.
Text_ortho: Some dey use even guinea corn, eh em di (wetin de dey call am), di stalk.

Text_en: They blow it like uh... just like the horn too, animal horn.
Text_ortho: Dem dey blow am like, eh just like di horn too, animal horn.

Text_en: So, they call that one uh... Kwarak.
Text_ortho: So dem dey call dat one em kwarak.

Text_en: Some call it uh... Nari.
Text_ortho: Some dey call am em nari.

Text_en: So we have different, different uh... types of dance.
Text_ortho: So we get different, different eh type of dance.

Text_en: And uh... as the tradition is...
Text_ortho: And em as di tradition be...

Text_en: And then, about the festivals of Plateau State, we have all sorts of festivals also, uh... depending on uh... the zones.
Text_ortho: And den, as relate to di festival for Plateau, we get different, different festival also eh depending on eh di zones.

Text_en: Like the one in Pankshin, they have a festival they organize yearly.
Text_ortho: Like di one wey dey Pankshin, de get festival wey dem dey em organize yearly.

Text_en: They call it uh... pus... mus... uh... pus... mus... something like that.
Text_ortho: Dem dey call am eh pus, mus, eh pus, mus sometin like dat.

Text_en: I can't...
Text_ortho: I no fit...

Text_en: Mtschew I've... I've forgotten, but I know there's a festival they organize like that.
Text_ortho: Mtschew I don, I don forget, but I know sey e get festival wey de dey organize like dat.

Text_en: In my place, we have it.
Text_ortho: For my place, we get am.

Text_en: We call it Pus Cat.
Text_ortho: We dey call am Pus Cat.

Text_en: In Plateau here, the Berom organize it.
Text_ortho: For Plateau here, Berom dey organize.

Text_en: They call it Zem Berom.
Text_ortho: De dey call am Zem Berom.

Text_en: And so many others like that.
Text_ortho: And so many oders like dat.

Text_en: Here in Plateau State.
Text_ortho: E dey for Plateau.

Text_en: So, uh... the languages, we have so many languages here on the Plateau.
Text_ortho: So eh di languages, we get so many languages here on di Plateau.

Text_en: Uh... we have the br-... the major languages which uh... they speak in Plateau.
Text_ortho: Eh we get di br-... di major languages wey eh dem dey speak for Plateau.

Text_en: We have Berom, Tarok, Mwaghavul, Mopun, uh... Jarawa, the... you know, uh... Goemai, and so many of them.
Text_ortho: We get di Berom, di Tarok, di Mwaghavul, di Mopun, di eh Jarawa, di you know ehn Goemai, and so many of dem.

Text_en: So uh... actually, it's a place... it's a place...
Text_ortho: So ehn, actually, is a place, na place...

Text_en: Plateau is a place which uh... has different languages that people speak.
Text_ortho: Plateau na place wey ah different languages dey, people dey speak am.

Text_en: Alright.
Text_ortho: Toh.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: The thing that I want to talk about, right, is clothes.
Text_ortho: Di ting wey I want talk about ba, na di dressing o.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: Of our girls nowadays, right?
Text_ortho: Of our girls nowadays ba?

Text_en: This... uh... our girls, the way they wear their clothes, it embarrasses me so much.
Text_ortho: Dis, eh our girls, di way wey dem dey wear deir cloth, di ting dey embarrass me well, well o.

Text_en: They can't dress properly.
Text_ortho: De no fit dress o.

Text_en: They can't dress properly.
Text_ortho: De no fit dress.

Text_en: This isn't wearing clothes; it's dressing like a hooker.
Text_ortho: Dis one no be dressing, na Ashawo dressing.

Text_en: Alright.
Text_ortho: Toh.

Text_en: That's not how we used to dress.
Text_ortho: That was not how we used to dress.

Text_en: I thought it was just me who was seeing it.
Text_ortho: I tink sey na only me dey see am o.

Text_en: The whole body exposed.
Text_ortho: All body outside.

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: Even the legs, not that they have a nice shape.
Text_ortho: Di legs ma, no be sey dem get shape o.

Text_en: Ehe!
Text_ortho: Ehe!

Text_en: They don't consider whether or not it will fit them.
Text_ortho: De no dey consider weder dis ting go fit me.

Text_en: They don't consider it.
Text_ortho: De no dey consider o.

Text_en: It'll fit me or not.
Text_ortho: Fit me, or e no go fit me.

Text_en: Ehe, they will just wear anything.
Text_ortho: Ehe, de go just wear anyting.

Text_en: This one time, I saw a lady.
Text_ortho: Di oder time, I saw one lady.

Text_en: The lady was big.
Text_ortho: Di lady big o.

Text_en: Her thighs were really fat.
Text_ortho: See her thighs, very fat, fat.

Text_en: Haha, like yams.
Text_ortho: Haha like yam.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes!

Text_en: She then wore a very s-... sh-... short skirt.
Text_ortho: She con wear very s-... sh-... short skirt.

Text_en: Then at the back, she tore it.
Text_ortho: And at di back she come just tear di ting.

Text_en: As she was walking, you could see her underwear.
Text_ortho: As she dey waka, you go fit see her pant for outside o.

Text_en: No sense of dress.
Text_ortho: No dress sense.

Text_en: That day, I felt really ashamed.
Text_ortho: Dat day, shame con catch me well, well.

Text_en: I said, "what's this we're doing?"
Text_ortho: I say wetin be dis one wey we dey do?

Text_en: She's done for.
Text_ortho: She don finish herself now.

Text_en: Please, let us mothers give guidance to our daughters.
Text_ortho: Abeg o, make we moders dey talk to our daughters now.

Text_en: People have seen everything.
Text_ortho: People don see everyting.

Text_en: Alright!
Text_ortho: Toh!

Text_en: As they're leaving the house, let's talk to them so they will wear clothes like we used to before now.
Text_ortho: As dey comot from house, make we dey talk to dem so dat de will be wearing cloth like we were using before now.

Text_en: I hope that it's from the house they dressed that way.
Text_ortho: I hope sey na from house de come do dat dressing o.

Text_en: You know some of them have some sense.
Text_ortho: You know some of dem get one kind sense.

Text_en: Alright!
Text_ortho: Toh!

Text_en: Sometimes, they carry it on their backs.
Text_ortho: Sometimes, de carry am for back.

Text_en: Ehe!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: As soon as they get somewhere or their friend's place, they will change.
Text_ortho: As de go reach somewhere, or deir friends house, de change.

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: That's what they used to do, some of them.
Text_ortho: Dat'S what de use to do some of dem o.

Text_en: Okay!
Text_ortho: Okay!

Text_en: So, even the parents, they won't know.
Text_ortho: So di parents sef, de no go know.

Text_en: So, it may be that the parents don't even know.
Text_ortho: So e fit be sey di parents no know sef.

Text_en: Jesus!
Text_ortho: Jesus!

Text_en: But mine, if we see it... if I see it, I will talk.
Text_ortho: But my own o, if we see am, if I see am, I go talk.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: Whether you are my daughter, or not, I will call you.
Text_ortho: Weda you be my daughter o, or not, I go call you.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: I will say, "this way you're dressing, is it an advertisement?"
Text_ortho: I say dis dressing wey you do, na advert?

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: It's not good.
Text_ortho: E no good.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: Two!
Text_ortho: Two!

Text_en: You're showing off what's supposed to be for your husband!
Text_ortho: You don finish showing di ting wey e suppose be for your husband outside o.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes now!

Text_en: Everyone's seen it!
Text_ortho: Everybody don see am.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes!

Text_en: So what he'll have is second-hand.
Text_ortho: So na second hand im go con carry.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes!

Text_en: Even i-... if he admires it now in the house, no, he will go out again.
Text_ortho: Even i-... im admire am now for house, no he will go out again.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: No respect again; no respect again.
Text_ortho: No respect again now, no respect again.

Text_en: That's it.
Text_ortho: Dat's it.

Text_en: Ehn!
Text_ortho: Ehn!

Text_en: So me, I talk to them.
Text_ortho: So me, I dey talk to dem o.

Text_en: If they like it, let them hear; if they don't like it, it's their own problem.
Text_ortho: If de like, make dem hear, if de no like, na deir own palava.

Text_en: I've told them.
Text_ortho: I don tell dem.

Text_en: The thing that's, that's disturbing me is that when you tell them, they will say that you, you are old fashioned.
Text_ortho: Di ting wey de-... dey disturb me ba, when you tell dem, de go say you, you be old fashion.

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: That because your own time, is not uh... th-... their own time.
Text_ortho: Dat because during your own time, is not eh d-... deir own time.

Text_en: The world has changed now.
Text_ortho: World don change now.

Text_en: The things that we were using before, is not what they are using.
Text_ortho: Di tings wey we dey use before, no be im dem dey use.

Text_en: So, let's just, just leave them alone.
Text_ortho: So make we just d-... dey leave dem alone o.

Text_en: We used to use uh... wear mini skirts.
Text_ortho: We used to use eh, wear mini skirt o.

Text_en: That it is...
Text_ortho: Dat it is...

Text_en: Eh.
Text_ortho: Eh.

Text_en: But our mini skirts were very comfortable.
Text_ortho: But our mini skirts were very comfortable.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes!

Text_en: Just above the knee a bit like this.
Text_ortho: Just above di knee small like dis.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: It wo-... won't be up, up like this.
Text_ortho: E no g-... go dey up, up like dis.

Text_en: And we didn't tear them.
Text_ortho: And we no dey tear am.

Text_en: And we didn't slit it like this so you can see the underwear.
Text_ortho: And we no dey slit am like dis wey you go see pant.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: Some of them don't wear underwear.
Text_ortho: Some of dem don't wear pant tu ma fa.

Text_en: If they sit down and open their legs, you'll see the thing.
Text_ortho: If de sit down open leg, na so you go dey see di ting.

Text_en: Theirs was for... is for attraction; ours was not.
Text_ortho: Deir own was for, is for attraction, our own was not.

Text_en: It was the fashion.
Text_ortho: It was di fashion.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Toh!

Text_en: And very sensible fashion.
Text_ortho: And very sensible fashion.

Text_en: Not this kind that they are doing.
Text_ortho: No be dis kind one wey dem dey do.

Text_en: And if they see men, they'll go shaking their butts.
Text_ortho: And if dey see men, na so de go dey blow deir yansh.

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: As if they are advertising themselves to the men.
Text_ortho: As if dem dey advertise demselves to di men.

Text_en: This one, b-... the Bible does not change.
Text_ortho: Dis one o, b-... di Bible does not change o.

Text_en: It's been the same thing for a long time.
Text_ortho: Na di same ting from tay, tay.

Text_en: That's how the bible is.
Text_ortho: Na so di Bible still dey.

Text_en: If you do not dress sensibly, it said that our body is the temple of God.
Text_ortho: If you no dress sense, e don say our body na temple of God.

Text_en: And you see men, right?
Text_ortho: And you see men ba?

Text_en: If you make it useless, it's your business.
Text_ortho: If you useless am, na you sabi.

Text_en: You see men, right?
Text_ortho: You see men ba?

Text_en: As they are, right?
Text_ortho: As dem be ba?

Text_en: If they see you and you are advertising yourself, that's how they will come.
Text_ortho: If de see you, you dey advertise yourself, na so de go come o.

Text_en: Uhuh!

Text_ortho: If you con give dem, if you con give dem, na so de go go back tell deir friends sey dat one, as you dey see am ba (dey walka, walka like dis, dey advertise ba), me, I don go, I don go get my own.

Text_en: Isn't it just like f-... flies on shit?
Text_ortho: No be f-... like flies for shit?

Text_ortho: And d-... d-... dem no go marry you o.

Text_ortho: Na dem work be dat.

Text_ortho: De no go marry you.

Text_ortho: How dem go marry you?

Text_en: They'll go and look for an innocent girl.
Text_ortho: De will go and look for one innocent girl.

Text_en: That's the one they'll take as their wife.
Text_ortho: Na im de go con carry for deir wife.

Text_en: When you've become a second hand girl, when you've become a second hand girl.
Text_ortho: When you don become second hand, when you don become second hand.

Text_ortho: Very dirty!

Text_en: It even smells.
Text_ortho: Di ting dey smell sef.

Text_en: And then, they will be leaving it.
Text_ortho: And den, de will be leaving it.

Text_en: I always tell them uh...
Text_ortho: I always tell dem eh.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes!

Text_en: If they say there is a war now, how will they run?
Text_ortho: If de say war now, how will you run?

Text_en: Oho!
Text_ortho: Oh o.

Text_en: Will you be able to run?
Text_ortho: You go fit run?

Text_en: You can't run because the pants are holding your legs.
Text_ortho: You no go fit run o because di trouser dey hold dem leg.

Text_en: Eh!
Text_ortho: Eh!

Text_en: They can't take steps very well.
Text_ortho: Dem no dey fit take step well, well.

Text_en: So and then, this hair.
Text_ortho: So and den, dis hair.

Text_en: This... the thing that bothers me about boys' pants, when they wear the pants, they'll go take their hands to hold their private part in their hands and be walking like this.
Text_ortho: Dis, di ting wey dey disturb me with dis eh boys trouser sef, as de wear di trouser, na so de go carry deir hand dey hold deir private part for hand dey walka like dis.

Text_en: Ah, it's God that'll help us.
Text_ortho: Ah na God go help us o.

Text_en: Uh... because, if... like they're gonna fall...
Text_ortho: Eh because if, as if e go fall ne.

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: I said, "what is th-..."
Text_ortho: I say wetin be d-...

Text_en: Ehe!
Text_ortho: Ehen.

Text_en: They want to hold them so they won't fall off.
Text_ortho: De want hold am make e no fall.

Text_en: So they won't fall off, right?
Text_ortho: Make e no fall ba?

Text_en: So, that's how their hands will be.
Text_ortho: So na so deir hand go dey.

Text_en: So... but it's not good.
Text_ortho: So, but e no good now.

Text_en: Haha, well!
Text_ortho: Haha toh.

Text_en: It's not good.
Text_ortho: Is not good.

Text_en: It's a problem; it's a problem you are causing yourself.
Text_ortho: Na wahala, na palava you dey, you dey bring for yourself o.

Text_en: So, let's be talking.
Text_ortho: So make we dey talk o.

Text_en: Aya!
Text_ortho: Aya!

Text_en: Because if you dress well, people will see you and admire you.
Text_ortho: Because if you con dress neatly, people go see you, admire you.

Text_en: They will admire you.
Text_ortho: De go admire you.

Text_en: If you dress that way, I won't know if it's a crazy person or not.
Text_ortho: If you dress dat way, I no go know sey abi na person wey dey mad, or abi na person wey dey sane.

Text_en: Hm.
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: Hm!
Text_ortho: Hm.

Text_en: That's right!
Text_ortho: Dey correct.

Text_en: Ehe!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: So we have our problems, us parents.
Text_ortho: So we have problem o our own o parents.

Text_en: We have problems, serious problems.
Text_ortho: We have problem o, serious problem o.

Text_en: It'll get better.
Text_ortho: E go better.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Yes!

Text_en: Okay, if you want to make gote, uh... after you buy ingredients from your market, as you come back, and get home, uh... the first thing I do, I put the leaves in water, then add salt.
Text_ortho: Okay if you wan make di gote, ehn after buying dose ingredient for your market, as you come back, come reach your home, ehn di first ting wey I go do, na di leaves wey I go put for water, den put salt.

Text_en: Why should I put salt?
Text_ortho: Why should I put salt?

Text_en: I add salt to kill the germs that have infested the leaves because, on the fire, I won't leave it for long.
Text_ortho: I dey put salt make e kill di germs wey don catch dis leaves because, on fire, I no go leave am tay o.

Text_en: It's just... about five minutes.
Text_ortho: Na just about five minute.

Text_en: So as I put it in the water with some salt (because vinegar, I won't be able to get that all the time), then, I will take my bones (marrow bones, that's what we normally use because they will make it tasty), put them on the fire, add onions and then tomatos.
Text_ortho: So as I put am for water wit some salt (because vinegar, I no go fit get everytime), den, I go carry my bones, biscuit bone (dat is di one dat we normally use because e go make am sweet) put am for fire, put onions, and den tomatoes.

Text_en: If I want, sometimes, I make it without tomatos.
Text_ortho: If I want, sometime, I dey make am witout tomatoes.

Text_en: While it's boiling there, I will come and sit down, cut my garden eggs (yalo), tiny ones, to give it that bitter taste.
Text_ortho: As e dey boil dere, I go come sit down cut my garden eggs, yalo, tiny ones to give it dat bitter taste.

Text_en: As I... as I cut them, I will come and add them on top of the bones, as it is boiling on the fire.
Text_ortho: As I, as I cut am, I go con add am on top of di bones as im dey boil for fire.

Text_en: Then, I will cut my leaves.
Text_ortho: Den, I go come now cut my leaves.

Text_en: As I am cutting them (you know some of them have to stay a bit longer on the fire while some are for five minutes), I will bring it down.
Text_ortho: As I dey cut am (you know some of dem have to stay a bit longer for di fire while some, na five minutes), I don bring am down.

Text_en: Now uh... the yakuwa [red sorrel], I will put it on for... let's say ten minutes.
Text_ortho: Now eh di yakuwa, I go put am for say ten minutes.

Text_en: So as the fi-... fi-... bones are boiling, I will come and add the yakuwa [sorrel].
Text_ortho: So as di fi-... fi, bone don dey do, I go con add di yakuwa.

Text_en: That means I have added my garden egg, right?
Text_ortho: I don add my garden egg be dat bah?

Text_en: Then, it is boiling, boiling.
Text_ortho: Den, e dey boil, boil.

Text_en: I dont like the one with uh... groundnut... adding groundnuts, but some people do add it, or beans.
Text_ortho: I don't like dat of ehn groundnut, adding groundnuts, but some people dey add am, or beans.

Text_en: But mine, it's plain, I take it without groundnut.
Text_ortho: But my own, na so plain I dey take without groundnut.

Text_en: Then, I will cut the leaves, everything, keep it on the side, carry my acha.
Text_ortho: Den, I go con cut di leaves, everyting, keep for side, carry my acha.

Text_en: The acha [hungry rice], I will use a little.
Text_ortho: Di acha, na small I go fetch.

Text_en: Not a lot.
Text_ortho: No be plenty.

Text_en: Just like uh... a tin... uhuh... for four people.
Text_ortho: Just like ehn tin ehen for four people.

Text_en: Just this small tin, I will get some.
Text_ortho: Just dis small tin, I go fetch am.

Text_en: Because it has stones, I have to wash it well, using a calabash.
