Text_en: My brother, it will like if your case is different.
Text_ortho: Nna e go con be like sey your own dey different.

Text_en: But I know that this year, all those things will become a thing of the past.
Text_ortho: But I know sey dis year, all dose tings go pass.

Text_en: This year, any boy who will be travelling this year...
Text_ortho: Dis year, any boy wey dey go travel dis year...

Text_en: We're in January now.
Text_ortho: Now January, na im we dey.

Text_en: From now on till December, everyone will buy cars.
Text_ortho: From now till December, everyone go buy motor.

Text_en: In fact, before you go home, if you will be driving down, tippers... about fifty tipper loads of sand will follow you.
Text_ortho: Before you go go home sef, if dey go dey drive dey go, tipper, about fifty tippers wit sand go dey follow you.

Text_en: One trailer of uh... cement, they'll follow you so that people will know that yes, God has remembered the people they've forgotten about for many years.
Text_ortho: One trailer of eh cement dey go dey follow you so dat people go know sey yes people wey de forget for many years, God don remember dem.

Text_en: Isn't this the case for us?
Text_ortho: Sey no be our own case?

Text_en: Our case is no different.
Text_ortho: Our own case no dey different.

Text_en: And our God's reach is long enough to save us.
Text_ortho: And our God hand no dey too short to save us.

Text_en: And uh... he, he hears our cry every day.
Text_ortho: And ehn im, im dey hear our cry everyday.

Text_en: He hears our prayers every day, but I know that there is time for everybody when God blesses, blesses them... there is time for everyone when God says, "ti-... today is your day."
Text_ortho: Im dey hear our prayer everyday, but I know sey everybody get im own time wey be sey God dey dey bless am, everybody get im own time wey be sey God say ti-... today is your own day.

Text_en: The day you get your own blessings.
Text_ortho: Sey you receive your own.

Text_en: And I know that God will do it for us.
Text_ortho: And I know sey God go do am for us.

Text_en: So we won't...
Text_ortho: So we no go.

Text_en: If we are looking up to someone as the one to bless you, that means you will not get blessed.
Text_ortho: If we dey look person meh person do you, dat mean sey you no go get am.

Text_en: Rather than your brother looking to you to bless you, he will bless another person.
Text_ortho: Instead wey your broder go do for you sef, e go carry am go do for anoder person.

Text_en: Or he will ask you to go find your own blessings, since he found his own.
Text_ortho: Or e go tell you sey meh you waka go find your own, sey im ma, don find im own.

Text_en: So if you're looking up to someone to get blessings from, that means you will won't get blessed in life.
Text_ortho: So if you dey look for person now meh person do for you, dat mean sey you no go get am for life.

Text_en: So go anywhere you know that your breakthrough will come from.
Text_ortho: So anywhere wey you know sey you go put to head, you put to head o.

Text_en: And the way...
Text_ortho: And di way...

Text_en: Any strong place.
Text_ortho: Anywhere hard.

Text_en: Go there right away!
Text_ortho: Put to head now!

Text_en: Not just anywhere.
Text_ortho: No be sey anyhow head.

Text_en: Some places will lead you to death while others will lead you to victory.
Text_ortho: E get place wey you go put head sef, dat place go kill you, e get place wey you go put head kwa, dat place go favour you.

Text_en: But with the situation of things in Nigeria at present, nobody knows where to get solace.
Text_ortho: Ehn di way Nigeria be now, nobody know where im go put head.

Text_en: You dont know whether to go into politics or go into business or which person should become a bus driver, or go into business, or become an errand boy, or what exactly?
Text_ortho: You no know wheder you go put your head for politics, or make e put head for business, or moh we put head for conductor, abi na business, abi na boyi, abi na which one?

Text_en: What we've gotten ourselves into has become a problem.
Text_ortho: Di one wey we put head now don dey put our head.

Text_en: It's even killed... it's brought death to us already.
Text_ortho: Dat one wey even kill, e don already kill us.

Text_en: But we will still have a way out, and the way out will make for a good escape.
Text_ortho: But de will still remain one bar, and one bar now go still be full bar.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Hm!

Text_en: So as I speak, I have put it into God's hands for Him to settle us this year.
Text_ortho: So as I dey talk now, na God hand na im I carry am put sey God go do it for us dis year.

Text_en: And as we are talking about it today, the tenth day of January, twenty eighteen, God is... will surely keep going until the year two thousand and twenty.
Text_ortho: And as we dey talk am today wey be di tenth of January two eighteen, and na so God dey, go take carry am on till di year two thousand and twenty.

Text_en: And as we have started talking about it today, boy, it's reaching God's ears, and He is listening to us.
Text_ortho: And as we dey start today dey talk am so, boy, im dey reach God ear, and im dey hear am.

Text_en: And that's how...
Text_ortho: And na so...

Text_en: He said anything we say in Jesus' name, so be it.
Text_ortho: E say anyting wey we talk say in Jesus name, na so shall it be.

Text_en: And thats how he will mark it.
Text_ortho: And na so im go mark am.

Text_en: And as we are talking about it in this moment, we have put it into God's hands so He will do us good in Jesus' name.
Text_ortho: So as we dey talk now, we don put am for God hand say im go do well for us in Jesus name.

Text_en: Amen!
Text_ortho: Amen!

Text_en: Alright, sports fans, welcome to another wonderful morning on Sports Radio, eighty eight point nine, Brilla for real, ah... an outstanding station in the nation; a station that brings the whole country to a standstill when it comes to sports!
Text_ortho: All right, sports fans, una welcome to anoder wonderful morning for sports radio, eighty eight point nine, Brilla for real, ah one station too much for di nation, one station wen dey hold di full country to ransom for di world of sport ah.

Text_en: And I tell you, if you're not here, you're lost.
Text_ortho: And I tell you if you no go, you no know.

Text_en: Testimony time is not meant for the dead and dumb!
Text_ortho: Testimony time no be for deaf and dumb ah.

Text_en: Let me take you straight to France uh... where Paris St Germain Captain, Tiago Silva, said that what is happening to Edinson Cavani and Javier Pastore is not good for the French giants uh... as they continued to leave them on the bench uh... Cavani and Pastore were not on the squad list as Paris Saint Germain reached the Cup de La Cupa semi finals, courtesy of their two - zero victory over Famyes uh... on Wednesday, following their late return to training.
Text_ortho: Make I begin dey take you straight ah to France ah where Paris Saint Germain captain, Tiago Silva don come out talk sey di kind matter wen dey waka leave Edinson Cavani, and Javier Pastore no dey good for di French giant ah as de continue to leave dem for bench eh Cavani, and Pastore wen waka lost for di squad ah as Paris Saint Germain reach di Cup de La Cupa here semifinal courtesy of deir two zero gbege wen dem knack put Famyes dem head ah wen sele on Wednesday after di two waka lost leave party follow body as de no come back to training on time.

Text_en: And from there, let me tell you another one from France.
Text_ortho: And from dat one make I dey knack you anoder French one ah.

Text_en: From there to England, you dont need a passport, you dont need a visa.
Text_ortho: From dat one to England, you no need passport, you no need visa.

Text_en: Just follow me on my bicycle.
Text_ortho: Just follow me for my keke.

Text_en: Let me tell you that Antonio Conte has told Chelsea that it's better for them to discover how to score goals again uh... after they were held to a mid-week zero - zero draw by Everton, that was four days from the one in Norwich.
Text_ortho: Make I let you know sey Antonio Conte don tell Chelsea sey make de better come con discover how de take dey score goal again ah after de chop zero, zero draw for Everton head for di mid week wen sele four days from di one wen dem chop wit Norwich eh.

Text_en: As they play goalless ties, he has come out to say that we will not continue this way.
Text_ortho: As de play goalless draw, di man don come out talk sey we no go continue like dis.

Text_en: Are you planning to go higher by these means?
Text_ortho: Na dis leg you wan take waka travel go obodo Oyinbo?

Text_en: You need to make sure that with your playing style, you begin to score goals, otherwise, the issue will get out of hand.
Text_ortho: Una need to come make sure sey with way wey una dey play, una begin score goals, oderwise matter go leave us loss ah.

Text_en: And let me take you straight to the top stories in the world of sports.
Text_ortho: And make I take you straight to kepukepu wen dey fly for di world of sport ah.

Text_en: And let me inform you that Everton uh... has joined the race to sign Arsenal forward, Theo Walcott.
Text_ortho: And make I let you know sey Everton ah, de don join di race to sign Arsenal forward, Theo Walcott ah.

Text_en: The boy is twenty eight years old.
Text_ortho: Twenty eight years, na im di boy don be.

Text_en: The Englishman is also wanted by his former club, Southampton.
Text_ortho: Di English man dey wanted by former club, Southampton ah.

Text_en: While the Gunners are also asking for thirty million pounds uh... for the boy.
Text_ortho: Wey di Gunners also dey ask for thirty million pounds ah for di boy.

Text_en: And let me tell you that RB Leipzig in Germany uh... has informed Guinean international midfielder, Naby Keita, that he will join Liverpool this month.
Text_ortho: And make I tell you sey RB Leipzig for Germany eh don tell Guinea international midfielder, Naby Keita sey im go join Liverpool dis month ah.

Text_en: The Reds have already agreed to sign the twenty two year old in the summer at a sum of forty eight million pounds.
Text_ortho: Di Red don already agree to sign di twenty two years old for di summer for forty eight million pounds ah.

Text_en: They have stated that if they add fifteen million to twenty million pounds in January uh... the boy can leave as soon as possible.
Text_ortho: De don tell am sey for January, if de add fifteen to twenty million pounds ah, di boy fit make di waka as e dey hot ah.

Text_en: The Republic of Ireland's head coach, Martin O'Neill, is getting set to take charge of Stoke City as he is speaking with the manager who lost his job when he was sacked by an SMS telling him, "Mr Man, you have done enough."
Text_ortho: Republic of Ireland coach lala, Martin O'neill don dey set to take over Stoke City matter as e dey hold talk wit di manager wen waka loss for di job when dem sack am wit SMS tell am sey bros, di one wey you work don reach eh.

Text_en: And let me tell you the last story coming from Arsenal.
Text_ortho: And make I give you final tory wen dey come from Arsenal.

Text_en: Let me inform you that the former Arsenal Striker, Ian Wright uh... has asked Messi's agent to make sure that if the guy moves to Manchester United, he will perform very well.
Text_ortho: Make I let you know sey former Arsenal striker, Ian Wright eh don come out tell di agent ah of Messi to see sey e go do very well if di guy waka go Manchester United.

Text_en: He said Ozil who had no issues at the end of the season uh... the German international playmaker is closing on a new signing deal to let Alexis Sanchez out of Emirates Stadium.
Text_ortho: E say Ozil wen no get matter for di end of di season ah, wey di Germany international play maker dey closing on a new signing deal to allow Alexis Sanchez out of Emirate Stadium too follow join body.

Text_en: The twenty nine year old who has worked with Jose Mourinho while at Real Madrid uh... has announced that if he moves to Manchester United, he will perform very well because the kind of mentality they have uh... and the level of players uh... on top of the league uh... are different from what you get from the youngsters uh... running up and down in Arsenal's jersey.
Text_ortho: Di twenty nine year old wen don work wit Jose Mourinho for im time wen de sit down for Real Madrid ah don come out talk sey if dis boy waka go Man U, e go do very well because di kind of mentality wen dem get ah, and di level of players ah wen de press dey put on top of di League ah dey different from wetin you dey see for small children ah wen sit down dey run up and down inside Arsenal jersey.

Text_en: And let me inform you that in Spain uh... a man named Zinedine Zidane has said that his new contract does not ma-... is of no concern to him at all following his side's two matches, with a draw at home with... against the second tier side, Numancia.
Text_ortho: And make I let you know sey for Spain ah, one man wen de dey call Zinedine Zidane don come out talk sey im new contract no ma-... concern am at all, at all after im side play two, con do draw for home wit, against second tier side Numancia.

Text_en: Concerning the Copa del Rey which came up on Wednesday, Madrid settled for a five - two aggregate uh... with their first three - zero victory over the kids to ensure they got through to the next stage uh... of the competition.
Text_ortho: For di Copa del Rey wen sele on Wednesday, Madrid wen waka go for five two aggregate ah wit deir first three zero gbege wen de knack put for di small boys dem body take make sure sey de waka go di next stage ah of di competition ah.

Text_en: My people, this is where I will call it a day this wonderful morning, so don't worry.
Text_ortho: My people, na here I go hold brake dis wonderful morning make e for no loss.

Text_en: My name remains Apostle of the Comedy Kings on the microphone.
Text_ortho: My name remain Aposu over di comedy king upon di microphone ah.

Text_en: I say as things unfold this morning, stay in charge!
Text_ortho: I say as e dey be dis morning ah, hold your side well!

Text_en: If you drink, do not drive; if you drive, dont drink!
Text_ortho: If you go drink, no drive, if you go drive, no drink!

Text_en: If you really have to drink something, let it be cold and pure water.
Text_ortho: Even if you go drink someting, make e be cold, pure water.

Text_en: Thank you, my people!
Text_ortho: My people, una do o!

Text_en: Now, Radio Sapientia, ninety five point three FM, Onitsha, you are all enjoying yourselves this beautiful evening as five of the crew uncles are already seated inside.
Text_ortho: Now, Radio Sapientia, ninety five point three FM Onitsha, una just dey flex dis kajad evening as five of crew uncle don already balance inside.

Text_en: Today is Wednesday, the tenth, two thousand and eighteen, and my name is Jovia Uchena.
Text_ortho: Today na Wednesday tenth two thousand and eighteen, and my name na Jovia Uchena.

Text_en: The National Examination Council has released the two thousand and seventeen November December Senior School Certificate Examination results.
Text_ortho: National Examination Council don sama two thousand and seventeen November December Senior School Certificate examination result.

Text_en: Another one here says the Independent National Electoral Commission has brought out guidelines, and also a schedule of activities relating to the elections.
Text_ortho: Anoder one here dey yarn sey Independent National Electoral Commission don bring guidelines, and join schedule as e concern election parole.

Text_en: And they asked all the political parties to quickly go and collect forms for all elections.
Text_ortho: And de con tell all of dem political parties to kpakpakpa go collect forms for all election.

Text_en: That this should be done before August twenty fourth, two thousand and eighteen.
Text_ortho: Sey make de do am before August twenty fourth two thousand and eighteen.

Text_en: The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board has fixed February sixth as the final deadline.
Text_ortho: Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board don fix February six say na im go be last, last.

Text_en: They will sell the registration forms for this year's Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination.
Text_ortho: Dem go sell registration form for dis year Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination.

Text_en: And another report here says that the Delta State's Commissioner for Information, that is Mister Patrick Ukah, congratulates all the twenty three Chairmen of Local Government Councils.
Text_ortho: And anoder one here dey yarn sey Delta State Commissioner for Information (dat na Mister Patrick Uka) come jinger all dem twenty three chairmo.

Text_en: They just got elected in the Local Government Councils.
Text_ortho: Dem just elect for local government council.

Text_en: He said that they should not act disgracefully because the people who voted them into power have the utmost faith in them that they will try as much as possible to fulfil all the promises made during election campaigns.
Text_ortho: Sey make dem no come dey fall hand say as people wey elect dem believe dem die, sey dem go try wella do every dem dey promise during election campaign.

Text_en: And the last one here is from abroad and it's from uh... Zimbabwe.
Text_ortho: And final, final one here na from obodo Oyibo, and den na from ehn Zimbabwe.

Text_en: The Anti Corruption Agency has been probing into whether or not the former First Lady, Grace Mugabe, obtained her doctorate degree in a fraudulent manner.
Text_ortho: Anti Corruption Agency don dey torchlight everything to know wheder di before, before First Lady, Grace Mugabe don go do wayo, wayo knack doctorate.

Text_en: Remember that she was awarded an honorary doctorate just after she gained admission into the university in two thousand and fourteen.
Text_ortho: Remember sey dem sama am award PhD just months after im, im go inside university for two thousand and fourteen.

Text_en: And even before anyone can get a doctorate degree, they must have put in many years of full time research.
Text_ortho: And even as before person go get doctorate, im go do full time research for plenty years.

Text_en: And this is where I will call it a day and take a break as you continue to enjoy the programs on Radio Sapientia, ninety five point three FM, Onitsha.
Text_ortho: And na here I go close my mouth, drink small water as una dey here dey gbadun di parole on top Radio Sapientia, ninety five point three FM Onitsha.

Text_en: My people, that is today's five o' clock news flash.
Text_ortho: My people, na short, short story as e take concern five o'clock today be dat.

Text_en: This is the end of the story.
Text_ortho: I don remove for di tory.

Text_en: My name is Jovia Uchena.
Text_ortho: My name na Jovia Uchena.

Text_en: Do remember that big eyes do not guarantee good sight, nor does having a big head translate to being in control.
Text_ortho: Remember sey ogbolo eye, e no be open eye, and again, big head, e no be senior.

Text_en: Good evening.
Text_ortho: Una good evening inside dis evening.

Text_en: Who's there?
Text_ortho: Who dey dere?

Text_en: It is God.
Text_ortho: Na God.

Text_en: What!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: This is how my life is now.
Text_ortho: Na so my life be now.

Text_en: I do appreciate God.
Text_ortho: I dey appreciate God.

Text_en: God is doing wondrous things in my life.
Text_ortho: God dey do better ting for my life.

Text_en: That's it.
Text_ortho: Na so o.

Text_en: I've been here since two thousand and thirteen.
Text_ortho: Na since two thousand and thirteen wey I dey here.

Text_en: I don't have any problems.
Text_ortho: I no get any problem.

Text_en: I don't have any problem with the workers, the manager and the... those women here.
Text_ortho: I no get any problem for di workers, for di manager, for di, dose women wey dey here.

Text_en: It's that place, it's for women.
Text_ortho: Na dat place, na women.

Text_en: It's... they call it "on child dialysis", CWO.
Text_ortho: Na de call am (on child dialysis) CWO.

Text_en: That place is for high dialysis.
Text_ortho: High dialysis get dat place.

Text_en: That place isn't a hotel, it's a guesthouse.
Text_ortho: Dat place no be hotel, na guesthouse.

Text_en: You don't call it a hotel.
Text_ortho: You no dey call am hotel.

Text_en: It's a guesthouse lodging.
Text_ortho: Na guesthouse, lodging accommodation.

Text_en: Yes.
Text_ortho: Hmhm.

Text_en: If you come in here, it's for lodging or accommodation.
Text_ortho: If you come here, na lodging of accommodation.

Text_en: If it's something else that you are looking for, go look for a hotel in the GRA.
Text_ortho: If na dat place wey you go see, go see hotel now for GRA!

Text_en: When you get there, people play music, smoke marijuana, womanize and roam about.
Text_ortho: If you reach dat place, people dey play music, dey smoke igbo, dey carry woman, dey waka up, and down.

Text_en: Sometimes, you will see two guys fighting, breaking bottles everywhere.
Text_ortho: Sometime, you go see dat two boy, dem quarrel, de dey use bottle dey break everywhere.

Text_en: But if you stay in that place, it's a serene environment.
Text_ortho: But if you come dat place con lodge, dat place go dey cool.

Text_en: If he sleeps, he'll sleep well.
Text_ortho: If e sleep, sleep well.

Text_en: No one will come to knock on your door at night to steal your valuable possessions like your money or your phone.
Text_ortho: Person no go come for dis night knock for your door say make e comot, give me your money, give me your phone!

Text_en: You will not experience anything like that in that place.
Text_ortho: You no go see am for dat place.

Text_en: Even myself, I sleep outside.
Text_ortho: Even me sef, I dey sleep outside.

Text_en: I don't sleep in my room because I feel hot sensations in my body.
Text_ortho: Because I get hot blood, I no dey fit sleep for my room.

Text_en: If I sle-... le-..., if NEPA shuts the lights off, I'll come out here, instantly.
Text_ortho: If I sle-... le-... let, NEPA take light, I go run come outside.

Text_en: And then my children say "mummy, what have you gone to do outside?"
Text_ortho: Na so my children mummy, wetin you go do for di outside?

Text_en: I say, "ah, mstchew, let me have a nice sleep outside."
Text_ortho: I say ah mtschew let me sleep well for outside.

Text_en: I don't sleep in the room.
Text_ortho: I no dey sleep for room.

Text_en: That compound is nice.
Text_ortho: Dat compound dey very good.

Text_en: Anyone who complains about that place is lying.
Text_ortho: Any person wey come here say e no like dat place, na lie.

Text_en: That's a problem for some people.
Text_ortho: Na di problem some dey get now.

Text_en: You will not be laughed at if you come in here with a woman.
Text_ortho: If you carry woman come here, no go laugh you.

Text_en: Wanting her to stay with...
Text_ortho: Sey make e stay wit...

Text_en: They are friendly.
Text_ortho: De are friendly.

Text_en: Is it not true?
Text_ortho: No be true?

Text_en: If a couple comes in here, you will show them your wedding ring, show them something which will...
Text_ortho: Husbandi and wife, if una come, una go show dem di ring, go show dem someting wey go...

Text_en: The person here... you will know that this, this man, with this woman, are husband and wife, not just friends.
Text_ortho: Di person here, you go know sey na dis, na dis man, wit dis woman, na husbandi, and wife, no be friend.

Text_en: That is the problem.
Text_ortho: Dat be di problem.

Text_en: If you don't give them, he will go away.
Text_ortho: If you no give dem, e go comot.

Text_en: One day, I was at work when a girl came with a boy, and said, "auntie, look!"
Text_ortho: One day, I dey work, one girl wit one boy come, and say auntie, see!

Text_en: I greeted them.
Text_ortho: I greet dem.

Text_en: Mstchew, I greeted them.
Text_ortho: Mtschew I greet dem.

Text_en: He said he wanted to stay here.
Text_ortho: Sey e wan lodge.

Text_en: He asked about the rooms and the prices.
Text_ortho: Sey how much room I get?

Text_en: I told him I have one for five thousand.
Text_ortho: Sey I get five thousand.

Text_en: Ah the uh... the dormitory is for one, one thousand.
Text_ortho: Ah di ehn dormitory, one, one thousand.

Text_en: Some dormitories go for one five.
Text_ortho: Some dormitory, one five.

Text_en: Dormitory... some go for one eight.
Text_ortho: Dormitory, some, one eight.

Text_en: The women's side, five.
Text_ortho: Woman own, five.

Text_en: Upstairs... or it's eight.
Text_ortho: For up abi na eight.

Text_en: The girl said okay.
Text_ortho: Di girl say okay.

Text_en: She said I should go and show them the five thousand naira room.
Text_ortho: Sey make I go show dem di room wey be five thousand.

Text_en: I went to get the key.
Text_ortho: I go collect key.

Text_en: Saying something to that boy in English.
Text_ortho: Dey talk someting for dat boy for English.

Text_en: She didnt know that I heard what they said.
Text_ortho: E no know sey I dey hear dis one wey de talk.

Text_en: I didnt talk, I was looking at them.
Text_ortho: I no talk, I dey look dem.

Text_en: She said it again.
Text_ortho: E talk am again.

Text_en: She didn't speak up well enough for me to hear but since she was talking quietly, I already heard the two questions she was asking that boy.
Text_ortho: For e no talk am make e come out let me hear, but e dey talk am small, small, my ear don hear di two question wey e dey ask dat boy.

Text_en: And I told her... asked her "ah, what is she telling this boy X...?"
Text_ortho: And I don tell her, ask am (di girl) sey ah wetin e dey tell dis boy X?

Text_en: She said, hurry up and take the... I picked up the key to the four thousand naira room.
Text_ortho: Sey oya carry, I carry di room wey de give four thousand.

Text_en: I picked up the key to another one which goes for five thousand.
Text_ortho: Carry anoder one five thousand.

Text_en: Just as I was about to go out, taking the key with me, the girl said "uh... auntie, come, come back!"
Text_ortho: Just make I comot for di outside carry di key dey go, di girl say ehn auntie, come, come back!

Text_en: "Look!"
Text_ortho: See am!
We...

Text_en: "It's this boy's fault."
Text_ortho: Sey na dis boy o.

Text_en: "Yeah, he's her husband."
Text_ortho: Yeah na im husband.

Text_en: "Ah, it's a lie!"
Text_ortho: Sey ah na lie!

Text_en: "And if this boy is mad-... is married to her, or you are getting ready to get married, you will show me the, the evidence."
Text_ortho: Sey and if na dis boy be mad-... don marry her, abi una dey prepare marry, you go show me di, di evidence.

Text_en: "Or tell me why I will..."
Text_ortho: Or sey why I go...

Text_en: Okay, I was the first to ask them "ah, are you siblings with that girl?"
Text_ortho: Okay na me first ask dem sey ah na you dat girl na di same fader, di same moder?

Text_en: The girl demanded "why again, why am I asking? Why will I...?"
Text_ortho: Di girl dey sharp say why again, why I dey ask, why I go?..

Text_en: I said I'm supposed to ask.
Text_ortho: I say I suppose ask.

Text_en: It's be-... it's... it's my job.
Text_ortho: Na be-... na, na my work.

Text_en: I said, "why wouldn't I ask you?"
Text_ortho: Sey how I no go ask you?

Text_en: "Who is she?"
Text_ortho: Who e be?

Text_en: I said I asked because since she came here, I noticed that... I was looking at them closely, from uh... the leg... from the head...
Text_ortho: I say why I dey ask na since when e come here, I see dat, I dey look dem from ehn leg, from head.

Text_en: They saw me.
Text_ortho: De see me.

Text_en: She said, "ah, yes, it's your character."
Text_ortho: Im say ah yes na your character.

Text_en: That boy said, "auntie, don't say too much!"
Text_ortho: Dat boy say auntie, no talk too much!

Text_en: They said, "ah, he's a man!"
Text_ortho: E say ah na man!

Text_en: "With... well you... well... well you... you and that girl will not sleep in the same room."
Text_ortho: Wit, na dis, na, na you, wit dat girl, you no go sleep for one room.

Text_en: The boy asked why
Text_ortho: Di boy say why?

Text_en: The girl was like "okay, he won't sleep?"
Text_ortho: Di girl bah say okay e no go sleep?

Text_en: "Uh... he's her husband!"
Text_ortho: Ehn na husband!

Text_en: "Won't you let them sleep here?"
Text_ortho: No go allow dem make e sleep here?

Text_en: "Isn't this place a hotel?"
Text_ortho: Na dat place, no be hotel?

Text_en: Her husband would like her to sleep in a hotel.
Text_ortho: Na di hotel e husband go like sey make e sleep.

Text_en: He is the husband.
Text_ortho: Im na di husband.

Text_en: If he tells her now, she will not believe it.
Text_ortho: If e tell am now, e no go believe.

Text_en: She doesn't... she doesn't like Catholic kids.
Text_ortho: E no dey, e no like Catholic kids.

Text_en: Uh... she mstchew, talks about it.
Text_ortho: Ehn she, mtschew dey talk am.

Text_en: I dont know what she said that day but they said he is the husband.
Text_ortho: So I no know wetin e talk dat day, but de say na e husband.

Text_en: He won't like sleeping alone.
Text_ortho: E no go like make e sleep by imsef.

Text_en: Hasn't he noticed the important men who stay here?
Text_ortho: Still, e no see big, big man wen dey come sleep here?

Text_en: He hasn't said what exactly is on his mind.
Text_ortho: E never talk, talk someting wey e carry for mind come out.

Text_en: I dont know what's on his mind.
Text_ortho: Anyting wey e carry for mind, I no know.

Text_en: Is this boy your boyfriend?
Text_ortho: Dis boy, na your friend boy.

Text_en: I will not give you a room to sleep in.
Text_ortho: I no go give you una own make una sleep.

Text_en: Go and stay in another place.
Text_ortho: Make una go for anoder place go sleep.

Text_en: In as much time as I have spent speaking with you, that boy was talking to someone on a big phone, in Igbo.
Text_ortho: Dat time wen I dey talk una, dat boy carry big phone dey call one boy for Igbo.

Text_en: Asking them, "where are you?"
Text_ortho: Si ya eh kee ebe ino?

Text_en: "X, I am looking for an hotel where I will lodge in Igbo."
Text_ortho: X, I dey look for hotel where I go sleep for Igbo.

Text_en: "I've seen it, but I'm in that place they call Bethany."
Text_ortho: I see am, but I dey dat place wey de call Bethany.

Text_en: I dont know what that woman was saying in Igbo.
Text_ortho: I no know wetin dat woman dey talk for Igbo.

Text_en: She said that uh... the boy that uh... I am... uh... ah, ah, ah... Upper Weeka.
Text_ortho: Sey ehn di boy say ah I dey ehn ah ah ah Upper Weeka.

Text_en: So um... I dont know the particular park he called it.
Text_ortho: So ahn I no know di particular park di boy call am.

Text_en: Because, see... ah, he should go and look for a hotel in GRA.
Text_ortho: For see ah make e go look for hotel for GRA.

Text_en: Uh... he mentioned the two hotels but I dont know the particular place.
Text_ortho: Ehm e call two name for hotel, but I no know di particular place.

Text_en: Hmhm.
Text_ortho: Hmhm.

Text_en: As uh... given that I'm a strong Warri girl, being a staunch Warri chick, we like banga sauce, and starch.
Text_ortho: As eh, base on di strong Warri girl wen a be, staunch Warri babe wen a be, we dey like banga soup, and starch.

Text_en: Banga sauce and starch are our best foods.
Text_ortho: Banga soup, and starch na our correct food.

Text_en: Which means that any time you come to our neighborhood, if you have not seen banga sauce and starch in a clay pot, you need to go and ask yourself some questions.
Text_ortho: Wey be sey any time you enter inside our field like dis, if you never see banga soup, and starch inside Ewere pot, you need to go, and ask yoursef oder question.

Text_en: So today, today, I will just tell you how to prepare your banga sauce and starch.
Text_ortho: So today, today now, a go just tell you how you go take get your banga soup, and starch ready for your side.

Text_en: First and foremost, you need to get your banga [palm nuts].
Text_ortho: Number one, you need to get your banga.

Text_en: Palm nut is what they call banga, you know.
Text_ortho: Banga, na im de dey call palm nut uhm.

Text_en: It is... when you have gotten your banga ready, there are some spices which make banga sauce what it is.
Text_ortho: Na, when you get your banga, e get di spices wey dey make di banga soup be banga soup.

Text_en: And the spices, one is called irogoje, and the other is called otaiko.
Text_ortho: And dat spices, dem dey call am irogoje, anoder one, de dey call am otaiko.

Text_en: Another one is called inyanyan; another one is called peletete.
Text_ortho: Anoder one, we dey call am inyanyan, anoder one, de dey call am peletete.

Text_en: And to top it all off, you will add bitterleaf to it so that when you start eating it like that, it will go down smoothly.
Text_ortho: And to crown am all, you go put your bitterleaf inside so dat when you start to dey chop am like dat, e go just dey flow dey go.

Text_en: Okay, here's what you do!
Text_ortho: Okay now, see wetin you go do!

Text_en: Once you've bought your ingredients from the market... if you want to use fish, there's no problem with that.
Text_ortho: Once you buy your eh tins when you go market now, if na fish you wan to use o, no problem.

Text_en: In Warri, they like using fresh fish... catfish.
Text_ortho: For inside Warri, we dey like to use fresh fish, catfish.

Text_en: And the kind of catfish we use is not the kind that was raised in the pond.
Text_ortho: And di kind of catfish wey we dey use, no be di one wey be sey de don feed for pond.

Text_en: It's the kind that was caught from the river, fresh ones.
Text_ortho: Na di one wey come out from inside river, fresh one like dat.

Text_en: When we've bought it and taken it home, we will use a knife to cut off the head.
Text_ortho: When we buy am come like dat, we go knack am, take eh knife knack di head of di fish.

Text_en: Or we will put salt in into it and we will cover it.
Text_ortho: Or we go put salt inside, we go come cover am.

Text_en: When we do that, the fish will die on its own.
Text_ortho: When we put am like dat, only di fish go die on im own.

Text_en: Then what will we do?
Text_ortho: Den wetin we go do?

Text_en: We will take out the intestines.
Text_ortho: We go remove di belle.

Text_en: That's for the fish.
Text_ortho: Dat one na for di fish o.

Text_en: Now, when you get to the market and you have bought banga, otaiko, rogoje, beletere, iyanyan and bitterleaf.
Text_ortho: Now, when you reach market, you don buy your banga, you don buy your otaiko, your rogoje, your beletete, your inyanyan, your bitterleaf.

Text_en: All these things I just mentioned are spices.
Text_ortho: Now, all dese tins wen a call now so, all of dem na spices.

Text_en: What do you need to do?
Text_ortho: Wetin you need to do?

Text_en: You need to griund these spices because you won't be tossing them inside your sauce like that.
Text_ortho: You need to ground dese your spices because you no go fit carry di spices toss throw inside your soup like dat.

Text_en: So you will take your ba-... your rogoje, otaiko and iyanyan.
Text_ortho: So you go take your ba-... your rogoje, you go take your otaiko, you go take your inyanyan.

Text_en: You will put them into your blender.
Text_ortho: You go put dem inside your blender.

Text_en: If you dont have a blender, put it on a grounding stone.
Text_ortho: If you not get blender, put am inside grounding stone.

Text_en: Then grind it.
Text_ortho: Den ground am.

Text_en: Get it really smooth.
Text_ortho: Make e dey smooth well, well.

Text_en: And then put it in a corner.
Text_ortho: Den put am for corner.

Text_en: Now, another thing you will use... you will use dry pepper in this very sauce.
Text_ortho: Now, anoder tin wey you go use, you go use your dry pepper for inside dis very soup.

Text_en: Because if you use any other pepper, it may not give you that smell... that aroma it's supposed to give you.
Text_ortho: Because if you go use any oder kind of pepper, e fit no give you dat smell, dat aroma wey e suppose to give you.

Text_en: So you will use dry pepper.
Text_ortho: So you go use your dry pepper.

Text_en: Now, to get your pepper ready, you will grind your dry pepper and set it aside.
Text_ortho: Now, for your pepper now, you go ground your dry pepper too, put am for corner.

Text_en: You will use seasoning cubes because these seasoning cubes we call...
Text_ortho: You go use cube o because dis cube wey de dey call...

Text_en: Uh... I dont want to mention any names so that you will not insist on the one I mentioned.
Text_ortho: Eh, a no wan call any name now so dat you no go say na di one wen a call you go use.

Text_en: A seasoning cube is a seasoning cube.
Text_ortho: Cube na cube.

Text_en: Any kind of cube.
Text_ortho: Any kind of cube.

Text_en: You will also use seasoning cubes while preparing this food.
Text_ortho: You go use cube too for inside dis your food.

Text_en: So you will set your seasoning cubes aside.
Text_ortho: So you go put your cube for corner.

Text_en: You also need crayfish.
Text_ortho: You still need crayfish.

Text_en: What?
Text_ortho: Hm?

Text_en: But you dont need a lot of crayfish because they can overpower the sauce.
Text_ortho: But di crayfish wey you go use now, no be sey na plenty crayfish wey come overpower di smell.

Text_en: So s-... you will just use a little crayfish.
Text_ortho: So s-... shekele crayfish, na im you go just use.

Text_en: You will grind your crayfish and set it aside.
Text_ortho: You go still ground your crayfish, put for corner.

Text_en: Now, let's cook the banga sauce quickly, quickly, quickly.
Text_ortho: Now, make we cook di banga soup sharp, sharp, sharp.

Text_en: What will you do?
Text_ortho: Wetin you go do?

Text_en: You've already gotten your palm nuts, also known as banga, ready.
Text_ortho: You don get palm nut wey be your banga so.

Text_en: Put your banga on the flame.
Text_ortho: Carry your banga put for inside fire.

Text_en: Do not buy the genetically modified banga.
Text_ortho: No buy agric banga o.

Text_en: Buy the locally planted banga because the local banga will give you the good oil you want.
Text_ortho: Buy native banga because native banga go give you di correct oil wey you wan.

Text_en: The genetically modified banga will just be thick.
Text_ortho: Agric banga go only thick.

Text_en: And it will not make the sauce delicious.
Text_ortho: And e no go make di soup sweet.

Text_en: Well, buy the native banga.
Text_ortho: Toh buy native banga.

Text_en: How can you identify the native banga, in case you want to know?
Text_ortho: How you go take know native banga in case you want to know?

Text_en: Just press it with your hands, like this.
Text_ortho: Just take your hand press am like dis.

Text_en: Native banga doesn't have much flesh.
Text_ortho: Native banga no dey full.

Text_en: Once you touch it like this, it will shoot out a little, but before you will touch the genetically modified Banga in this way, it'll have already torn open and it's really fleshy.
Text_ortho: Once you just use hand touch am like dis, e go just come out small, but agric banga, before you go do am like dis sef, e don tear, and di flesh, e dey plenty well, well.

Text_en: Thats the difference between the locally grown and the genetically modified ones.
Text_ortho: Dat na di difference between native, and agric.

Text_en: But again, there's one other method.
Text_ortho: But again, anoder style dey o.

Text_en: Because your locally grown banga doesn't thicken up quickly.
Text_ortho: Because your native banga, e no dey quick dey thick.

Text_en: You will cook it for a very long time, but it will not get thick.
Text_ortho: You go cook, cook, cook, cook, cook, e no go thick.

Text_en: But if you want it to get thick fast, you can add some of the genetically modified Banga to the locally grown banga.
Text_ortho: But if you want make e quick thick, you fit get like small of your agric banga, join am wit di native banga.

Text_en: But make sure that you use more of the locally grown banga than the genetically modified one.
Text_ortho: But make sure sey your native banga, e plenty pass your agric banga.

Text_en: So now, pick up your banga and put it on the flame when I tell you to.
Text_ortho: Okay now, carry dat your banga now so wen a don tell you put for fire.

Text_en: When you have put it on the flame, within the next thirty minutes, your banga is ready.
Text_ortho: When you put am for fire, thirty minutes pakan, your banga, e don done.

Text_en: If you are cooking with charcoal, it'll be ready within twenty minutes because of the intensity of the fire.
Text_ortho: If you dey use charcoal dey cook, twenty minutes sef, because of di fire, e don done.

Text_en: Once your Banga is ready, take it off the fire just as it is and put it in a mortar.
Text_ortho: Once your banga done, carry am like dat, put am inside your mortar.

Text_en: You know that the mortar has a child [the pestle].
Text_ortho: You know sey di mortar, e get pikin.

Text_en: Yes, the mortar has a child.
Text_ortho: Ehen mortar, e get pikin.

Text_en: Put your banga in the mortar.
Text_ortho: Put your banga inside di mortar.

Text_en: Pound the banga with the child.
Text_ortho: Use di pikin, take am take beat di banga.

Text_en: Pound it very well.
Text_ortho: Knack am well, well.

Text_en: When you are done pounding, pour water into it and wash the banga with your hand; wash it very well.
Text_ortho: When you knack finish, put water inside, take your hand, wash di banga, wash am well, well.

Text_en: When you are done washing it, drain the water from the banga, put it in a pot.
Text_ortho: When you wash finish, collect di eh eh water for inside di banga, put am inside your pot.

Text_en: When you have put it into a pot, set it on your stove.
Text_ortho: When you put am inside your pot, carry am on top of your stove.

Text_en: Let it boil for ten minutes.
Text_ortho: Allow am make e boil for ten minutes.

Text_en: Once it boils for ten minutes, dont waste time at all... at all.
Text_ortho: Once e dey boil for ten minutes, no waste time at all, at all.

Text_en: That pepper that your have ground, put in your pepper.
Text_ortho: Dat your pepper wey you don ground so, turn your pepper inside.

Text_en: Take a little salt.
Text_ortho: Take small salt.

Text_en: Add the salt to it.
Text_ortho: Put your salt inside.

Text_en: That salt you will add, and the pepper, will make the oil in the banga flow to the top of that sauce.
Text_ortho: Dat your salt wey you go put, and your pepper wey you go put, e go make di oil wey dey inside your banga stand on top of dat your soup.

Text_en: Now once you have finished doing that, you will wait a little.
Text_ortho: Now once you don do dat one finish, you come wait small.

Text_en: Add the irogoje, beletete, otaiko, and uh... inyanyan which you have ground together to the pot.
Text_ortho: Carry your irogoje, your beletete, your otaiko, and eh your inyanyan wey you ground together so put dem inside your pot.

Text_en: Let them boil for another ten minutes.
Text_ortho: Allow dem make dem boil again for ten minutes.

Text_en: Afterwards, check to see if it has thickened a little, hm.
Text_ortho: After ten minutes, check am wheder e don dey thick small hm.

Text_en: If it's not thick yet, leave it.
Text_ortho: If e never thick small, still leave am.

Text_en: Then, the next thing you will do is add ground crayfish to it.
Text_ortho: Den di next tin wey you go do again, carry your ground crayfish put am inside.

Text_en: Put your salt in.
Text_ortho: Take your salt put inside.

Text_en: When you have added the salt, fish is the last thing you will add.
Text_ortho: When you put salt finish inside, na your fish e go be di last tin wey you go put.

Text_en: It's... take your fish... add your fish to it.
Text_ortho: Now, carry your fish put your fish inside.

Text_en: Let the fish bpil.
Text_ortho: Allow your fish make e dey boil.

Text_en: Then once it's done, make sure that you're careful when you stir the sauce; dont stir it just any old way.
Text_ortho: Den once e boil, make sure sey when you turn di soup, not turn am anyhow, anyhow o.

Text_en: You will stir it slowly, so that your fish will not break into pieces.
Text_ortho: You go turn dem small, small so dat your fish, e no go scatter.

Text_en: Now, once you've added that, the next thing to add is your bitterleaf.
Text_ortho: Now, when you don put dat one finish, di next tin wey you go do now na your bitterleaf.

Text_en: So get your dry bitterleaf.
Text_ortho: So carry your dry bitterleaf.

Text_en: Put your dry bitterleaf into it.
Text_ortho: Put your dry bitterleaf inside.

Text_en: When you might have put your dry bitterleaf into the sauce, do not mix it with the spoon again.
Text_ortho: When you put your dry bitterleaf inside, not put spoon again o.

Text_en: Beacause if you mix it with the spoon, it will become bitter.
Text_ortho: Because if you put spoon, di soup, e go come bitter.

Text_en: So put your dry bitterleaf into the sauce.
Text_ortho: So put your dry bitterleaf inside.

Text_en: Then let it boil for five minutes.
Text_ortho: Den allow am make e boil on im own for five minute.

Text_en: Do not put a spoon into it.
Text_ortho: No put spoon inside.

Text_en: After five minute, pick up your spoon and stir your banga sauce with it.
Text_ortho: After five minutes, carry your spoon, take am take turn your banga soup.

Text_en: Then let it continue to boil.
Text_ortho: Den still allow am make e dey boil dey go.

Text_en: Since you're using the locally grown banga, it will not get dry too quickly.
Text_ortho: Since na native banga you dey use, e no go quick dry.

Text_en: Now, the next thing you will do is... our local pot which we use in Warri.
Text_ortho: Now, di next tin wey you go do, na our local pot wey we dey use for inside Warri.

Text_en: They call it an ewere pot.
Text_ortho: De dey call am Ewere pot.

Text_en: Wow, it reminded me of my mom and dad at home.
Text_ortho: Uhm e don make me remember my mama, and my papa for house.

Text_en: Okay, you see your ewere pot, you will put your ewere pot on the stove.
Text_ortho: Okay dat your Ewere pot so, you go come carry your Ewere pot, put am on top of your stove.

Text_en: Heat the ewere pot for a very long time.
Text_ortho: Allow fire make fire beat di Ewere pot well, well.

Text_en: When it has been heated up well enough, pick up your spoon.
Text_ortho: If fire done beat am well, well, take your spoon.

Text_en: Take your banga sauce which is yet to thicken up in the pot.
Text_ortho: Take your banga soup wey be sey still light for inside pot.

Text_en: Put it into your ewere pot.
Text_ortho: Put am inside your Ewere pot.

Text_en: Put the fish into it.
Text_ortho: Carry your fish put am inside.

Text_en: Heat up the sauce right inside the ewere pot for three minutes.
Text_ortho: Allow di fire make e beat di soup inside di Ewere pot for three minutes.

Text_en: After three minutes, take your Ewere pot off the fire and set it on the floor.
Text_ortho: After three minutes, carry your Ewere pot, put am for ground.

Text_en: Then the last thing is your starch.
Text_ortho: Den di last tin, na your starch.

Text_en: Starch is our local food which we eat the banga sauce with.
Text_ortho: Starch, na our local food wey we take dey chop di banga.

Text_en: And that starch, it's made from cassava; the cassava that garri is made with.
Text_ortho: And dat starch, e dey get am from inside cassava cassava wey de take dey do gari.

Text_en: So that your starch... just put the starch in water.
Text_ortho: So dat your starch na, just put your starch inside water.

Text_en: Get your frying pan and put a little oil into it.
Text_ortho: Carry your frying pan, put small oil inside.

Text_en: When you put starch... put enough water which will give you the consistency you want, so that the starch will not be too hard or be sticky.
Text_ortho: When you put starch, put enough water wey you go take know sey dis starch, e no go strong, or di starch, e no go too dey light.

Text_en: The next thing to do is put the starch in your pot.
Text_ortho: Di next tin wey you go do, carry your starch inside your pot.

Text_en: When you have put the starch into your frying pan, then continue to turn the starch while it's on fire.
Text_ortho: When you carry your starch inside your frying pan, den continue to dey turn your starch inside di fire.

Text_en: Keep turning the starch.
Text_ortho: Dey turn your starch.

Text_en: It will take only ten minutes for the starch to stick together.
Text_ortho: E go take only ten minutes for your starch to gum body together.

Text_en: If the starch is ready, bring it down from the fire.
Text_ortho: If your starch don ready, carry your starch down.

Text_en: Get your banga sauce.
Text_ortho: Carry your banga soup.

Text_en: Then enjoy.
Text_ortho: Den enjoy yourself.

Text_en: Okay my people, good afternoon.
Text_ortho: Okay my people, una good afternoon now.

Text_en: I believe you're good and you're body is in top shape.
Text_ortho: I believe sey una dey well, and una body dey kakaraka.

Text_en: Okay, right now, at this very hour, we want to do some kinds of, you know, some quick eating and full belly issues, and uh... I will tell you some things you need to know about food.
Text_ortho: Okay right now, right now on top of dis very time wey we dey now so, we want to do some kind of you know sharp, sharp chopping, and bellefulling matter, and eh I go just tell you some tins you need to know about food.

Text_en: Uh?
Text_ortho: Hm?

Text_en: You know that you should not put every piece of food you see around you into your mouth.
Text_ortho: You know sey no be every food wey you just see dey pass you go just carry put for inside your mouth dey chop.

Text_en: Uh?
Text_ortho: Hm?

Text_en: So sometimes, when you take a look at some food, uh... ask yourself if this food I wanna eat... if the food is good for your body or not.
Text_ortho: So sometimes when you see food like dis eh, ask yoursef wheder dis food wey I want to eat, wheder di food, e good for my body, or e no good for my body.

Text_en: Now let me ask you, "when was the last time you got yourself checked?"
Text_ortho: Now make I ask you when be di last time wey be sey you check yoursef?

Text_en: I mean before you put the food into your mouth, you will first of all read about that, that food, get to know the health benefits of the food, know if the food is any good or not.
Text_ortho: Like before you carry dat food now put for your mouth, you go first of all read about dat, dat food, come know di health benefit of di food, know wheder di food good for your kind of body, or e not good for your kind of body.

Text_en: Because sometimes, you can put some food in your mouth.
Text_ortho: Because sometimes, you fit carry some kind of food now put inside dat your mouth.

Text_en: And when you are done eating, you will get an upset stomach, and that's not too good for you.
Text_ortho: When you chop am finish, you go start to dey run bele, and e no too dey good for you.

Text_en: So today on the program, right here and right now, I will tell you three things you need to know about food.
Text_ortho: So today, on top of di programme now, now, now, now, I go tell you three tins wey you need to know about food.

Text_en: Number one, you know that the way you present your food... the way you serve the food to someone can determine if the food will be eaten or not.
Text_ortho: Number one, you know sey di way you present your food, di way you carry di food take give person fit make di person chop di food, or e fit make di person not chop dat food.

Text_en: Uh?
Text_ortho: Uhm?

Text_en: So when you are presenting food to someone, at least, do it with a smile.
Text_ortho: So when you dey give person food like dis, at least, make you laugh small for your face.

Text_en: Garnish the food with, you know, with all sorts of protein and the like, so that the food will be inviting and others will love to join you in eating it.
Text_ortho: Put some kind of, you know some kind of passengers inside dat food wey go make oder people sef wan join you to share for di passengers eh food.

Text_en: Because if you put inyorominyo in your food, someone may come, look at it, and won't be able to eat it.
Text_ortho: Because when you put eh iyorominyo inside food, anoder person sef come see am, e no go fit eat am again now.

Text_en: Uhum!
Text_ortho: Uhum!

Text_en: That is number...
Text_ortho: Dat one na number...

Text_en: That is number one.
Text_ortho: Dat one na number one.

Text_en: Okay, number two.
Text_ortho: Okay number two.

Text_en: Did you know that the carrots you normally chop come in different colors?
Text_ortho: You know sey your carrot wey you dey chop so, na different, different colour na im dey for inside carrot.

Text_en: They come in white, purple and even red.
Text_ortho: You get white, you get purple, you even get red.

Text_en: In fact, sometimes, you will wonder if the one you have is a carrot or not.
Text_ortho: Sometime sef, you go dey imagine wheder dis one wey be sey you see, wheder na carrot.

Text_en: It's a carrot!
Text_ortho: Na carrot!

Text_en: It's because it's not available in Nigeria.
Text_ortho: Na because of sey e no dey for inside Naija.

Text_en: We only know that carrots are orange in color.
Text_ortho: We only know sey carrot na only orange colour.

Text_en: But they come in other colors besides orange.
Text_ortho: But no be only orange colour.

Text_en: So when you go overseas and are given a white carrot, dont be afraid because it's a carrot too.
Text_ortho: So, when you go obodo Oyinbo now, you see dem, see dem, sey de give you carrot, and di colour na white, make you no fear because na carrot be dat.

Text_en: And you know that no matter how many carrots you eat, even if you eat them all day, from... uh... the first uh... week to the last week of the three hundred and sixty five days in a year, you cannot gain more weight.
Text_ortho: And you know sey no matter how you wack carrot from morning till night for eh first eh week o go reach di last week for even three hundred, and sixty five days wey we get for dis year, you know sey you no go fat at all, at all.

Text_en: Why?
Text_ortho: Because why?

Text_en: Carrots contain no fat.
Text_ortho: Carrot, e no get anytin like fat inside.

Text_en: They contain zero percent fat.
Text_ortho: Zero percent of fat, na im dey inside.

Text_en: Number three.
Text_ortho: Number three.

Text_en: Uhum!
Text_ortho: Uhum!

Text_en: This third thing I want to tell you is really very important.
Text_ortho: Dis number three wen I wan tell you so, e dey very, very important kwa.

Text_en: When I say very important kwa... I spoke a bit of Igbo there.
Text_ortho: When I say very important kwa, I don speak small Igbo inside dat place.

Text_en: I'm not supposed to interject in Igbo.
Text_ortho: I no suppose to put Igbo.

Text_en: But it is very, very important.
Text_ortho: But e dey very, very important.

Text_en: Now, you dont ask yourself, this okra you want to cook with, what is its other name?
Text_ortho: Now, you don ask yoursef sey dis okra wey I dey use take dey cook my food, wetin be di oda name of okra?

Text_en: You dont ask yourself that.
Text_ortho: You don ask yoursef.

Text_en: This okra, apart from the fact that I grate the okra and I cook with it, what can I use this okra for again?
Text_ortho: Dis okra, apart from sey I carry okra take chop, take am take cook food, wetin again I fit use my okra for?

Text_en: If you have never asked yourself that question, I will tell you now before I go.
Text_ortho: If you never ask yoursef, I go tell you now before I comot.

Text_en: In fact, what you call okra is not really called okra.
Text_ortho: Your okra sef, de no dey call am okra o.

Text_en: It is called lady fingers, yes.
Text_ortho: Na finger ladies yes.

Text_en: You might be wondering if these are the same fingers from a woman's hand.
Text_ortho: You fit come wonder sey na di kind hand wey woman dey carry?

Text_en: Leave it that way!
Text_ortho: Leave am like dat!

Text_en: But it's lady fingers.
Text_ortho: But na finger ladies.

Text_en: So if you go abroad and you hear okra being called lady fingers, eat it because it's okra!
Text_ortho: So if you go obodo Oyibo, you hear what de call okra, finger lady, chop am because na okra!

Text_en: Then, number two.
Text_ortho: Den number two.

Text_en: With okra, instead of you cooking the okra, cooking it... cooking it... cooking it... cooking it... cooking it, I'll tell you really fast how you will process your okra, so that you can eat it without cooking it.
Text_ortho: Inside dat your okra, instead of you to dey cook di okra, cook am, cook am, cook am, cook am, cook am, I go just tell you sharp, sharp way wey you go need to arrange your okra, wey you go fit eat your okra witout you no cook am.

Text_en: See how you will process it!
Text_ortho: See as you go do am!

Text_en: You have some stew already prepared in the house.
Text_ortho: You get your stew wey you don keep for house before now.

Text_en: Okay, do you have some stew which you have already prepared?
Text_ortho: Okay you get your stew wey you don cook for house before now?

Text_en: Aha!
Text_ortho: Aha!

Text_en: If you have lady fingers, which is also called okra, in the house, instead of throwing that prepared stew away, just put it on the flame, leave it to boil a little,
Text_ortho: Dat your stew wey you don cook for house before, instead of you to carry di stew troway, and you get dis your fingerlady for house wey dey call okra so, just carry dat your stew, put am for fire, allow am make e boil small.

Text_en: You know, let it simmer.
Text_ortho: You know make e get some poto, poto, poto, poto.

Text_en: When it has boiled for some time, cut your okra into small pieces.
Text_ortho: When e boil small, carry dat your fresh okra, cut am mpempe, mpempe, small, small o.

Text_en: When you've finished cutting it, take your stew... take the fresh okra and put it in a corner of the pot of stew.
Text_ortho: When you cut am finish like dat, carry dat your soup, take dat your fresh okra, put am for corner of di soup.

Text_en: Then, what will you do?
Text_ortho: Den, wetin you go do?

Text_en: If you have powdered fufu or if it is gari or semovita/semolina, just eat the fufu with the okra.
Text_ortho: If na loi, loi you get, if na gari you get, if na semo, just use di okra, and di loi, loi lem dem togeder.

Text_en: Then, your body will be very strong.
Text_ortho: Den, your body go dey very, very kampe.

Text_en: Good afternoon!
Text_ortho: Good afternoon!

Text_en: My name is Joy Ossai.
Text_ortho: My name na Joy Ossai.

Text_en: Thank you!
Text_ortho: Thank you!

Text_en: My people, what I want to tell you about now, now uh... yes, is about the ghetto life.
Text_ortho: My people, wetin I wan tell una now, now eh ehen, na ghetto life o.

Text_en: If you've never lived in the ghetto, wow, mstchew, you are missing out.
Text_ortho: You never live for ghetto before, hm mtschew you dey miss.

Text_en: I say ghetto life is legit.
Text_ortho: I say ghetto life, na legit.

Text_en: This is the place to be.
Text_ortho: Ah na dere na im be confirm eh.

Text_en: Because that's where you'll learn other languages, uh... you'll learn slang.
Text_ortho: Because na dere wey you go learn language, eh you go learn slangs.

Text_en: I'm telling you.
Text_ortho: I dey tell you.

Text_en: As soon as you come to where they... the street guys are mixing things together uh... mstchew, you will be amazed like you're a spoiled brat.
Text_ortho: As you come where de, di niggers dey brew like dis eh, mtschew you go begin open your eye like sey you be ajebo.

Text_en: And the fact is that the spoilt brats can't mix with the ghet-... uh, the underprivileged.
Text_ortho: And one ting be sey ajebo no go fit mix with ghet-... eh kpako.

Text_en: You know that the rich ones pretend... they act like morons, they act like momma's boys.
Text_ortho: You know sey ajebo dey form, de dey form galadima, galadima, dey form mummies pet.

Text_en: The poor people dont have time for that.
Text_ortho: Kpako no get time for dat one o.

Text_en: Those of us who are poor dont have the time to act like momma's boys.
Text_ortho: We wey be kpako, we no get time to con form mummies pet.

Text_en: Who will give you the chance to act like a momma's boy?
Text_ortho: Where we wan form mummies pet for now?

Text_en: Or do you wanna act like one in front of your dad?
Text_ortho: Abi you wan form am for your papa?

Text_en: Your dad will bring you back to reality.
Text_ortho: Your papa go wake you up now.

Text_en: He'll do it with a big slap.
Text_ortho: By waking you up, na hot slap o.

Text_en: And another thing is that as you go into a ghetto, you need to be really, really, really, really, really alert so that the street guys dont make fun of you.
Text_ortho: And anoder ting wey dey dere be sey as you go ghetto, you go shine your eye well, well, well, well, well, well make niggers no use you catch fun.

Text_en: Because when they make fun of you, you'll look an moron, clueless.
Text_ortho: Because when de use you catch fun sef, you go be like sey you be galadima o, danjuma.

Text_en: It's only you and them, you'll just be clueless.
Text_ortho: Na una dere now wey you go dey look.

Text_en: So, ghetto life... the truth about ghetto life is that you will learn a lot.
Text_ortho: So, ghetto life, wetin dey for ghetto life true, true be sey ghetto life, you go learn.

Text_en: If you were brought up in the ghetto, you will learn a lot.
Text_ortho: If de bring you up for ghetto, you go learn well.

Text_en: You'll know a lot of things.
Text_ortho: You go sabi tings well, well.

Text_en: You'll be strong.
Text_ortho: You go strong.

Text_en: I say you'll understand so many things.
Text_ortho: I say you go know tings.

Text_en: Your buddies won't be able to play on your intelligence, other guys won't get to swindle you.
Text_ortho: Your fellow man no go fit chance you, your fellow man no go fit chop you.

Text_en: Because you will be one step ahead of them
Text_ortho: Because as your fellow man don talk one, you, you don talk two.

Text_en: You've already read their mind.
Text_ortho: You don know wetin im wan tell you.

Text_en: As he observes you, you are also observing him.
Text_ortho: As im observe you, you observe am.

Text_en: Another thing about the place is the bad lifestyles; all kinds of bad things.
Text_ortho: Anoder ting dere be sey bad life, bad tings dey.

Text_en: You will know the difference between good and evil.
Text_ortho: You go know wetin get bad, wetin dey good.

Text_en: The ghetto life involves of a whole lot of things.
Text_ortho: For ghetto life, tings dey.

Text_en: Everyone is struggling; you will struggle.
Text_ortho: Everybody dey struggle, you go struggle.

Text_en: If you feel that you dont have anything to eat, you will eat garri.
Text_ortho: If you feel sey you no fit chop, you go chop garri.

Text_en: You will see little boys have already gulped down some garri.
Text_ortho: You go see small boy don wack garri.

Text_en: He has drunk garri.
Text_ortho: E don drink garri.

Text_en: As soon as he drinks garri, he gets strength.
Text_ortho: As im drink garri, im get strength.

Text_en: He will dare you who who's eaten rice; you who brags that your father gives you rice and chicken.
Text_ortho: Im go face you wey you don chop rice, wey you dey say your papa dey give you rice, and chicken.

Text_en: As a fool, he'll wake you up.
Text_ortho: As a mumu, im wake you up.

Text_en: Thats no child's play.
Text_ortho: Dat one now, no be childs play.

Text_en: And as I'm saying this uh... white man, you're laughing too.
Text_ortho: And as I dey talk am now eh, Oyibo, you, you dey laugh kwa.

Text_en: Thats the proper thing to do.
Text_ortho: Na im be di legit ting.

Text_en: You, you know it too.
Text_ortho: You, you know now.

Text_en: Uhuh!
Text_ortho: Ehen.

Text_en: You're just there, watching us.
Text_ortho: Carry your hand dey put for your cheek.

Text_en: No problem!
Text_ortho: No wahm!

Text_en: It's true!
Text_ortho: Na confirm!

Text_en: So in here, we have the downtown area, it's a ghetto.
Text_ortho: So for here, e get down wey dey for here, na ghetto.

Text_en: If you go there right now uh... you will see all those guys who have had homemade gin.
Text_ortho: To go dere now ehn you go see all dose men wey don drink kaikai.

Text_en: Do you know what homemade gin is?
Text_ortho: You know wetin be kaikai?

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: A well brewed palmwine.
Text_ortho: Palmy wey de cook well.

Text_en: You will take it fresh.
Text_ortho: As de cook am, you go brew am.

Text_en: But since it rained today, you go and take a look at the men.
Text_ortho: But today wey rain fall, go see men now.

Text_en: Everyone is there, and everyone is drunk.
Text_ortho: Everybody don dey dere, and everybody don close eye.

Text_en: There's something else which, which they will take later on.
Text_ortho: E get one ting now wey, wey de go con knack.

Text_en: Which means that now, as you... now... which is on the way... you're educated people.
Text_ortho: Wey be sey now as you now wey dey come now, you be office.

Text_en: They've been watching you from a distance.
Text_ortho: From far now, de don dey hunt you.

Text_en: Hey, who's there?
Text_ortho: Heiss who goes dere?

Text_en: As they watch you, who goes there? You know, you'll be afraid at first.
Text_ortho: As de dey hunt you now (who goes dere now), you now, you go first kporo.

Text_en: Yes, as privileged people you too, now it's... you the white man, who's already afraid, first you'll uh... first you'll take a look.
Text_ortho: Ehen as ajebo wey you be now, na now you wey be Oyibo now, wey kporo, you go first eh, go first look.

Text_en: What are they saying?
Text_ortho: What are de saying?

Text_en: What are...?
Text_ortho: What are... ?

Text_en: Shh, where are you?
Text_ortho: Shh where you?

Text_en: Position!
Text_ortho: Position!

Text_en: Which one is...?
Text_ortho: Which one be... ?

Text_en: What are they saying?
Text_ortho: What are de saying eh?

Text_en: We're not taking that.
Text_ortho: We no dey for dat one.

Text_en: Since you can't speak in a way they understand, they'll corner you.
Text_ortho: As you no fit talk well, go cornerside you one side.

Text_en: Uh... first of all, what's in your pocket?
Text_ortho: Eh wetin dey your pocket first?

Text_en: Your phone of course, thats how they'll trick you into taking your phone.
Text_ortho: Your phone now, see as de go scope collect your phone.

Text_en: Ah, my brother, my man, actually, I like this phone of yours.
Text_ortho: Ah nna my man, dis your phone sef, I like am.

Text_en: What model is this?
Text_ortho: Na which make be dis one now?

Text_en: You'll say it's Infinix.
Text_ortho: Go say na Infinix.

Text_en: Let me have a look!
Text_ortho: Mey I see am now!

Text_en: As the person is looking at it, he has seen it as well.
Text_ortho: As di person dey see am now, im don look am.

Text_en: Mstchew!
Text_ortho: Mtschew!

Text_en: Saying, "oh man, this phone is nice!"
Text_ortho: Say oh boy dis phone go well o!

Text_en: "Let me make a call on it."
Text_ortho: Mey I use am make call.

Text_en: You'll give it to him so he can make a call with it.
Text_ortho: You go give am mey im use make call.

Text_en: He will say, "oh, hello, hello, hello!"
Text_ortho: Im go say oh hello, hello, hello!

Text_en: As he walks away, your phone goes with him!
Text_ortho: As im waka, your phone don waka o!

Text_en: Yes, thats it!
Text_ortho: Ehen na so!

Text_en: Thats how life is.
Text_ortho: Na im be di life be dat.

Text_en: Your phone is gone.
Text_ortho: Your phone don waka.

Text_en: And being a moron, you shout "hey, where's my phone? Where's my phone? Where's my phone?" and the next person you'll say "this person took my phone" to is a fraud, he'll tell you, "hurry up and bring some money, so I can go and get it!"
Text_ortho: And as you mumu (yeh where my phone, where my phone, where my phone), di next person wey you dey tell sey eiss dis person took my phone, (na lie) im go tell you sey oya bring money, make I go collect am!

Text_en: Ehe!
Text_ortho: Ehe!

Text_en: Since you don't know any better, you'll want to get your phone, so you'll give him some money.
Text_ortho: As eremu wey you be too, you wan collect your phone now, you go give am money.

Text_en: And as soon as you give him some money, the money...
Text_ortho: As you give am money too, di money...

Text_en: He will tell you, "now, let me go and call him!"
Text_ortho: Im go tell you sey oya wait, meh I go call am!

Text_en: He disappears too.
Text_ortho: Dat one don go be dat.

Text_en: That's life in the ghetto.
Text_ortho: Na im be di ghetto life for you.

Text_en: How did I get into the ghetto life?
Text_ortho: How I take enter ghetto life?

Text_en: Myself, I'm really stubborn.
Text_ortho: Me, I stubborn well, well o.

Text_en: Really stubborn.
Text_ortho: Stubborn well, well.

Text_en: And me, I went to a private school, but...
Text_ortho: And me, na private school wen I go but...

Text_en: While we were walking through the streets of Lagos, when we're coming back and speaking English...
Text_ortho: For dat time now wey we dey waka for di street for Lagos, if we dey come back, we dey speak grammar.

Text_en: But when you take a look at the Mechanic Village, you'll see guys smoking marijuana.
Text_ortho: But when you look mechanic village, you go see men wey dey smoke igbo.

Text_en: People smoke cigarettes, taking strong drinks.
Text_ortho: People dey smoke cigar, dey drink deir shekpe.

Text_en: Everyone's talking.
Text_ortho: Everybody talk.

Text_en: We also want to be accepted.
Text_ortho: We too, we wan feel among.

Text_en: Then, we will be looking at them.
Text_ortho: Den we go dey look dem.

Text_en: Then we, we are pretending.
Text_ortho: Den we, we dey form.

Text_en: When we're pretending, they're calling us spoiled brats.
Text_ortho: When we dey form now, de dey call us ajebo.

Text_en: And that pains us.
Text_ortho: And dat ting dey pain us.

Text_en: Imagine some kid calling you a spoiled brat out of nowhere.
Text_ortho: Imagine how small boy now wey you go see, im go call you ajebo.

Text_en: Sometimes when we want to play ball with them, they will tell you "shh, come on, get out of here!"
Text_ortho: Sometimes when we wan play ball with dem, de go tell you sey shh come on, comot here!

Text_en: We will leave.
Text_ortho: We go comot.

Text_en: Mstchew!
Text_ortho: Mtschew!

Text_en: So the thing pains me.
Text_ortho: So di ting come dey pain me.

Text_en: I say this lifestyle, I will also have a taste of it.
Text_ortho: I say dis life, me, I go experience am.

Text_en: So from there, when we come back, just as we have come back now, mstchew, I will drop my books.
Text_ortho: So from dere, when we come back, as we come back now, mtschew I go drop book.

Text_en: I will go with my... one small boy.
Text_ortho: I go follow my, one small boy.

Text_en: The son of the gateman who works there.
Text_ortho: Di gateman wey dey dere, im son.

Text_en: We will go there.
Text_ortho: We go go dere.

Text_en: When we get there, he would say, "this is my friend."
Text_ortho: As we go dere, im go say dis one na my friend o.

Text_en: As soon as he says, "he's my friend", they will say, "what is your name?"
Text_ortho: As im say na my friend, dey go say wetin be your name?

Text_en: I will tell them that my name is Uche.
Text_ortho: I go tell dem sey my name na Uche.

Text_en: We will say okay.
Text_ortho: We go say okay.

Text_en: We will be there, talking.
Text_ortho: We go dey dere, we go talk.

Text_en: From there, we will f-... head out and go to the canal to catch fish.
Text_ortho: From dere, we go f-... comot, go canal, go catch fish.

Text_en: As we go to the canal to catch fish... sometimes, we will leave the place and go under the bridge.
Text_ortho: As we go go canal, go catch fish, sometimes we go comot dere, we go go under bridge.

Text_en: When we go under the bridge, we will see...
Text_ortho: When we go under bridge, we go see...

Text_en: Sometimes, the very first day I tried marijuana there, it was Ben who told that it was marijuana; they call it fish.
Text_ortho: Sometimes, di very first day wey I taste igbo, dere na Ben even tell me sey na igbo, na fish de call am.

Text_en: I was just... my friend told me, "oh man, do you wanna eat fish?"
Text_ortho: I just dey, my friend tell me sey o boy, you wan chop fish?

Text_en: I said yes!
Text_ortho: I say yes!

Text_en: He said...
Text_ortho: Im say...

Text_en: I... first of all, I asked him "what kind of fish is that?"
Text_ortho: I, I first ask am sey which kind fish be dat?

Text_en: He said, "dried fish."
Text_ortho: Im say dry fish.

Text_en: I said, "bring it here."
Text_ortho: I say bring am now!

Text_en: I actually love dried fish.
Text_ortho: Na dry fish I dey like sef.

Text_en: So they wrapped it up and brought it to me.
Text_ortho: Naim de wrap am bring am.

Text_en: When they brought it over, I looked at it.
Text_ortho: As de bring am, I look am.

Text_en: I said, "this isn't fish!"
Text_ortho: I say dis one no be di fish now!

Text_en: He said, "what else do you want? What do you think they call fish?"
Text_ortho: E say wetin again now, wetin you tink sey de dey call fish?

Text_en: "You try it."
Text_ortho: You go taste am.

Text_en: "You have to have it because I've wrapped it already."
Text_ortho: I don wrap am be sey I don wrap am.

Text_en: And that day, as I tried it uh... my head swelled up.
Text_ortho: And dat day, as I taste am eh, my head big.

Text_en: As I was looking around, the ground... the ground... the ground seemed seven steps higher.
Text_ortho: As I dey look, di ground, di ground, di ground be like sey de don carry seven step put.

Text_en: And then my eyes teared up, my voice also changed.
Text_ortho: Na so my eye come tear, my voice come change.

Text_en: Then I was afraid.
Text_ortho: Fear con enter my body.

Text_en: As I was walking, I was staggering... I was walking and I was staggering.
Text_ortho: As I dey waka, I dey stagger, I dey waka, I dey stagger.

Text_en: They said, "oh man, this guy is gonna pass out."
Text_ortho: De say o boy dis guy go comot o.

Text_en: So they rushed to get me some garri on a plate.
Text_ortho: Naim dey rush kukuma carry garri put for eh plate give me.

Text_en: I used my hands.
Text_ortho: I carry my hand.

Text_en: I didn't even wait.
Text_ortho: I no need to even wait.

Text_en: I ate it fast, using my hands.
Text_ortho: I use hand rush am.

Text_en: I was not satisfied.
Text_ortho: Di ting no still weigh me.

Text_en: They went out to get me some coconut water.
Text_ortho: De go find coconut water give me.

Text_en: As soon as they got me the coconut water, I drank it.
Text_ortho: As de find coconut water give me, naim I drink am.

Text_en: Afterwards, I slept.
Text_ortho: After I drink am, I go sleep.

Text_en: I didnt wake up until the following morning.
Text_ortho: I no wake up until di following morning.

Text_en: And so my Aunt asked me, "eh, where were you yesterday?'
Text_ortho: Naim my aunty ask me eh where you go dat yesterday?

Text_en: Mstchew!
Text_ortho: Mtschew!

Text_en: I told her that no... that I went to play ball and I was feeling weak.
Text_ortho: I tell am sey no, sey I go play ball, my body come weak.

Text_en: She said, "but when you came back, your voice was not..."
Text_ortho: Im say but when you come back, your voice was not...

Text_en: I said, "mstchew, auntie, dont worry!"
Text_ortho: I say mtschew aunty, no worry!

Text_en: I was having a serious headache yesterday.
Text_ortho: Dat yesterday ehn headache bin dey worry me.

Text_en: She said, "are you sure?"
Text_ortho: Im say are you sure?

Text_en: I said yes!
Text_ortho: I say yes!

Text_en: She said, "but you're alright now?"
Text_ortho: Im say but you are okay now?

Text_en: I said, "yes, no worries!"
Text_ortho: I say yes, no wahm!

Text_en: She, she left.
Text_ortho: She, she comot.

Text_en: So myself, I went back there because I wanted to try that stuff again.
Text_ortho: Now me now, I come go back because me, I wan taste dat ting again.

Text_en: So I went back.
Text_ortho: Naim I con go back.

Text_en: So when I got back there, I tried it.
Text_ortho: As I con go back again, I taste am.

Text_en: It had the same effect on me.
Text_ortho: Im do me di same ting.

Text_en: I said, "no, I'm not gonna give up on this thing, I will overcome you, you won't be the one to overpower me every time."
Text_ortho: I say no, me, I no go give up dis ting, me, I go win you, no be every time you go dey win me.

Text_en: From then on, we kept trying it for a long time and we became pros.
Text_ortho: From dere, tah we con become professional.

Text_en: I started to get control over it.
Text_ortho: I con dey win am.

Text_en: As I was getting control over it, it was giving me joy in return.
Text_ortho: As I dey win am, im dey give me joy.

Text_en: It was giving me joy uh... I was enjoying it.
Text_ortho: Im dey give me joy eh, I dey enjoy am.

Text_en: Mstchew!
Text_ortho: Mtschew!

Text_en: But at a time, we realised that nothing good was coming out of the experience.
Text_ortho: But at a time, we con see sey dat ting, nothing come out.

Text_en: When you take the stuff, you will start misbehaving.
Text_ortho: Di stuff, wen you drink am now, you go go dey do misbehave.

Text_en: Doing weird things.
Text_ortho: Dey do oder tings.

Text_en: So I stopped taking it.
Text_ortho: From dere, I come stop am.

Text_en: Thank God that it happened that way.
Text_ortho: Tank God, dat one dey.

Text_en: So that brought me into the ghetto.
Text_ortho: Na im make I join ghetto life.

Text_en: Yes!
Text_ortho: Ehen!

Text_en: Absolutely!
Text_ortho: Confirm!

Text_en: Yes, good afternoon!
Text_ortho: Ehn good afternoon!

Text_en: My name is Oke Lucent Akporube.
Text_ortho: My name na Oke Lucent Akporube.

Text_en: I'm a musician; I'm a drummer, I play drums and I'm very good on drums.
Text_ortho: I be musician, I be drummer, I dey play drum, and I dey very good for di drum wey I dey play.

Text_en: And the way I... how I started... how I got to the level I am now... I had a passion for music when I was a kid.
Text_ortho: And how I take, how I take start, how I take reach di level wen I dey now, I bin get dis passion for music when I small.

Text_en: As a kid, you really dont have a reason to go to church.
Text_ortho: As children now, when you go church, you go just go church.

Text_en: You'll go there to learn what's of interest to yo... what you like... what you have your eyes on.
Text_ortho: Di one wey dey hungry you, wey you like, wey your eyes dey, na im you go go to learn.

Text_en: Then, when we were younger, my father was attending Assembly... Assemblies of God.
Text_ortho: Den, wey we small, my father dey go Assembly, Assemblies of God.

Text_en: So when we were in the church, the drummers... the instrumentalists made an announcement that if you want to learn how to play instruments... musical instruments, you should come learn it in the church!
Text_ortho: So when we go church di drummers, di instrumentalists dere, dem make announcement for church sey if you wan learn instrument, musical instrument, come church con learn!

Text_en: So we... we went to learn.
Text_ortho: So we now, we go to learn.
