Text_en: So, you know this politics in churches... all these uh... guys were choosing... they were looking forward to teaching the ones whose parents were rich.
Text_ortho: So you know dis politics for church, all dese ehn guys, dem dey choose, dem dey look di people deir parents get money to teach di children.

Text_en: So they picked all the children they wanted to teach.
Text_ortho: So de don select all di children finish.

Text_en: But me, determined at the age of four, I said I needed to play this thing by all means.
Text_ortho: But me, with determination, I say any how e be, dis thing, I must play am at di age of four.

Text_en: I'll go to church, I'll go to play.
Text_ortho: I go go church, I go go to play.

Text_en: They took the drumsticks from my hands, saying, "get out of here!"
Text_ortho: Dem go collect drum stick for my hand, say get out from here!

Text_en: "You, did your father pay?"
Text_ortho: You, your father pay money?

Text_en: All those... I said, "okay, no problem!"
Text_ortho: All dose, I say okay no wahala!

Text_en: Crying... I would go home crying, come back again and they would still chase me away.
Text_ortho: Wit cry, I go cry go house, come back again, dem go still pursue me.

Text_en: It's either they take the pedal away or they take the drumstick.
Text_ortho: Either de comot di pedal, or de collect di drumstick.

Text_en: So afterwards, when I'm ready to go play, I take the pedal I made myself and the drumsticks in my pocket.
Text_ortho: So now, if I dey go, I go carry pedal wey I do with my hand, and carry stick for my pocket.

Text_en: When I get to the church and they take their stick and their... the pedal, I'll take my own pedal, take my sticks and play gradually.
Text_ortho: When I reach church, de collect deir stick, and deir, di pedal, I go put my own pedal, carry my stick, dey play small, small, small, small, small, small.

Text_en: They would come around, listen to what I was playing and then chase me away.
Text_ortho: De go come, de go hear am again, de go pursue me again.

Text_en: I would leave the place.
Text_ortho: I go comot for dere.

Text_en: So I had to go home.
Text_ortho: So I get to go house.

Text_en: The seat... my... the chairs in my house had wooden handrests, all those old school chairs, and foam you can rest your back on.
Text_ortho: Di seat, my, di chair for my house, dem get wooden hand all dose old school chairs, and foam wen dey rest your back.

Text_en: So and my floor, if you bang it, it sounds like a bass drum.
Text_ortho: So and my floor, if you match am, e dey sound like bass drum.

Text_en: So that was where I was learning to play, with toothbrushes.
Text_ortho: So na dere I come dey learn with toothbrush.

Text_en: I practice, I practice, I practice, everyday.
Text_ortho: Everyday, I dey practise, I dey practise, I dey practise.

Text_en: So one day, the drummer did not come to church.
Text_ortho: So e get one day, di drummer no con come church.

Text_en: So they were looking for someone to play the drums.
Text_ortho: De come dey find who go play drum.

Text_en: As small as I was (at the age of... then, I had started playing, I was already six years old) so I sat on the drums and I played them that day.
Text_ortho: As I small (na at di age of, den, I don dey play, I don reach six years), na I sit down for drum, I come play dat day.

Text_en: So they were asking, "haha, whose child is that?"
Text_ortho: De come dey ask sey haha na which person pikin be dat one?

Text_en: My father came out proudly saying, "he's my son!"
Text_ortho: My father, with pride, e con come outside say na my son o!

Text_en: This person came out and said, "ah, your son did well!"
Text_ortho: Dis, de come say ah your son dey try o!

Text_en: So with that, I was just learning gradually, I was learning until I started going to play in different churches.
Text_ortho: So with dat level, I just dey learn small, small, dey learn till I con dey go different churches, go dey play.

Text_en: So by the time I was eight, I had started playing in the church.
Text_ortho: So when I reach eight years, I don begin dey play for church.

Text_en: I had started making money gradually.
Text_ortho: I don dey make small, small money.

Text_en: So I dont have the time to go telling my father that I wanted to buy this and that.
Text_ortho: So I no get time to go dey tell my father sey I wan buy dis, I wan buy dis.

Text_en: So I was assisting him.
Text_ortho: So I just dey assist am.

Text_en: Though, my family... then I understood the way things were, but at a stage, when I started... (in fact, what year was it? In nineteen ninety five), when I got into secondary school, I met a guy.
Text_ortho: Though, my family, den I understand di way things dey, but at a stage, when I con (at which year sef, nineteen ninety five), when I enter secondary school, I con meet one guy.

Text_en: The guy plays drums, he plays bass, he plays everything.
Text_ortho: Di guy dey play drum, dey play bass, dey play everything.

Text_en: I became his friend.
Text_ortho: I come just make am friend.

Text_en: We were just playing.
Text_ortho: We just dey play.

Text_en: Every time we went to his house.
Text_ortho: Everytime we go im house.

Text_en: Even the bass guitar, I play bass guitar.
Text_ortho: Even bass guitar sef, I dey play bass guitar.

Text_en: I was... I'm really good at bass guitar too.
Text_ortho: I be, I dey very good with bass guitar too.

Text_en: But when my brother started learning to play bass guitar, I had to stay off it so that he could focus on that.
Text_ortho: But as my brother come dey learn bass guitar, I get to comot hand for dere so dat make e use dat one take dey do im own.

Text_en: Then, myself, I just focused on the drums.
Text_ortho: Den, me, I just focus on di drum.

Text_en: So I was playing drums.
Text_ortho: So I con dey play.

Text_en: But there was a boy on my street I used to play with from time to time.
Text_ortho: But e get one boy wey dey my street, everytime, we dey play.

Text_en: When I'm playing drums... whenever I see a place where they're playing drums, all the kids do a service.
Text_ortho: When I dey play drum, when I see where de dey play drum all di children, de go do church.

Text_en: You know that children know how to organize church services; they will just gather together and be singing, people will be playing.
Text_ortho: You know sey children sabi do church now, dem go just gather dey sing, people go dey play.

Text_en: So myself, I'll just go, go and be playing as if uh... I'm the best.
Text_ortho: So me I go just go, go dey play as if ah na me sabi play pass.

Text_en: But this boy, we were all...
Text_ortho: But dis boy, all of us dey dey...

Text_en: You'll never see this boy coming out to show off his skills.
Text_ortho: You no go ever see dis boy come outside say e dey play anything.

Text_en: I know that this boy is a wizard on the drums.
Text_ortho: I know sey dis boy na wizard for drum.

Text_en: He has practiced really well.
Text_ortho: E don rehearse, e don tight well, well.

Text_en: One day, my church... (I was with Redeemed Christian Church then), so they said they needed a drummer in the headquarters.
Text_ortho: One day, my church (I dey Redeem den), de con say de look for drummer for headquarter.

Text_en: Before I knew it, I saw this boy playing drums.
Text_ortho: Before I know, I see dis boy dey play drum.

Text_en: When I heard the boy playing drums, I got scared.
Text_ortho: When I hear di boy dey play drum, I begin fear.

Text_en: The boy played so well, he played better than anyone in the church.
Text_ortho: Di boy so play pass, e play pass everybody for di church.

Text_en: I said uhuh, so this guy... (his name is Kevwe), I said, "so you play drums and you've been hiding your skills, no worries!"
Text_ortho: I say ehen so dis guy (e name na Kevwe)... I say so you dey play drum, you dey hide am since, so no wahala!

Text_en: Because of that boy, I decided to rehearse all night for two years... every night till I...
Text_ortho: Because of dat boy, I decide to do all night rehearsal for two years every night till I o...

Text_en: I was going to church every Monday.
Text_ortho: I dey go church every Monday.

Text_en: I'll go by ten o clock in the night.
Text_ortho: I go go by ten o'clock in di night.

Text_en: I will rehearse till four o clock in the morning.
Text_ortho: I go rehearse till four o'clock in di morning.

Text_en: Then I will come back.
Text_ortho: Den I come back.

Text_en: As soon as I get to the house, I will just do one or two things, take care of myself.
Text_ortho: As I reach house, I just do one, or two things, just arrange myself.

Text_en: I will go to school.
Text_ortho: I go go school.

Text_en: When I come back from school, I will wait a little, then I will sleep.
Text_ortho: As I come back from school, stay small, sleep.

Text_en: Then at night,I will go out for evening service.
Text_ortho: Den, for night, I go go evening service.

Text_en: As soon as the service is over, I will go home, and then go back to church.
Text_ortho: As soon as service close, I come house, go back to church again.

Text_en: Every Monday to Friday, every week (apart from Saturday and Sunday), for almost one year, that's the time I set as my target.
Text_ortho: Every Mondays to Fridays, every week (apart from Saturdays and Sundays), for dat kind one year, na im give myself.

Text_en: The next time the guy and I met... the next year, the boy realized that it was a power struggle.
Text_ortho: Di next time wey me, and di guy meet, di next year, di boy see am say power don jam power.

Text_en: He had to step down for me.
Text_ortho: Im get to relax for me.

Text_en: So he said they took him away from the headquarter church.
Text_ortho: So im say de con remove am from di headquarter church.

Text_en: And I was made the drummer.
Text_ortho: De con make me di drummer.

Text_en: I said no.
Text_ortho: I con tell dem sey no.

Text_en: It's not my style to get involved in those things, but I've been playing in the church all my life.
Text_ortho: No be my lifestyle to dey do all dose things, but, all my life, na church I don dey play.

Text_en: When I mistakenly said okay, I had a misunderstanding in my church.
Text_ortho: Di time wey I just mistakenly say okay, I come get one misunderstanding for my church.

Text_en: I said okay, let me just get... let me go and try this secular music... let me have a taste of secular music.
Text_ortho: I say okay, make I just get, meh I go try dis secular music, dis secular, meh I see as e be.

Text_en: So I said, okay, let me try this club.
Text_ortho: I con say okay meh I try dis club.

Text_en: When I tried the clubs, I played in the club for three months, at least.
Text_ortho: As I try club, I play for club for at least three months.

Text_en: In those three months, I know what I saw, where someone will smoke and blow it out on your face.
Text_ortho: Dat three months so, na me know wetin I see, where di person go smoke pour cigar for your f-... face.

Text_en: All those... and myself, I dont like all those things.
Text_ortho: All dose, and me, I no like all dose things.

Text_en: But God Himself warned me not to go play in the club again.
Text_ortho: But, God himsef come warn me seriously sey meh I no try am again go play for club.

Text_en: How did you do it?
Text_ortho: How you take do am?

Text_en: It's... it just happened that I got sick.
Text_ortho: Be sey e come be, I come fall sick.

Text_en: I couldn't do anything for almost two months.
Text_ortho: For dat kain two months, I no fit do anything.

Text_en: So when I go to church... I went back to my church and I met with my pastor, asking him not to be offended about what happened.
Text_ortho: So when I go church, come go back to my church, come go meet my pastor say make e no vex for wetin happen.

Text_en: So I have come back.
Text_ortho: So I don come back.

Text_en: That same day, I had a dream.
Text_ortho: Immediately dat day, I get one dream.

Text_en: So in the dream, I saw someone... a woman gave me tri-...
Text_ortho: So for di dream, I see somebody, one woman give me tri-...

Text_en: She gave me some...
Text_ortho: E give me some...

Text_en: I had seen the woman in a dream.
Text_ortho: I don dream see di woman.

Text_en: The woman gave me something and I took it.
Text_ortho: Di woman give me something, I collect am.

Text_en: As I was going, I didnt know that I got sick on account of that dream.
Text_ortho: As I dey go so, I no know sey dat dream, na im make me dey sick.

Text_en: So as the pastor was preaching, I got... but you can recall your dream and make sure you return anything you collected from anybody; I said, "now, I know!"
Text_ortho: So as di pastor preach I receive, but you can recall your dream, and return anything you collect from anybody, I say ehen!

Text_en: So I recalled the dream and I waited.
Text_ortho: So I con recall di dream, I wait.

Text_en: A a child, I then prayed.
Text_ortho: As small pikin, naim I come pray.

Text_en: That night, I had the dream
Text_ortho: Dat night, I see di dream.

Text_en: Then I saw the woman.
Text_ortho: I con see di woman.

Text_en: The woman had given me meat and she was already leaving.
Text_ortho: Di woman don give me meat, di woman don dey go.

Text_en: So I called her back.
Text_ortho: Naim I call am back.

Text_en: I said, "ma'am, come back for your thing, use it!"
Text_ortho: I say madam, come take your thing now, use am!

Text_en: I threw it to the woman and she caught it.
Text_ortho: Throw am give di woman, di woman catch it.

Text_en: The next... as I woke up, I started sweating.
Text_ortho: Di next, as I wake up, I begin sweat.

Text_en: Afterwards, I was fine.
Text_ortho: After dat day, I get mysef.

Text_en: So since then, till I came down to Portharcourt to start playing for the church I attend now, till now, I didn't go to play in any other church.
Text_ortho: So since den, till I con come Port-Harcourt con begin dey play for my church wey I dey now, till date, I never go any church go play.

Text_en: So if it's commitment, right, if God is... if God blesses someone for what they do, ah... well, I dont know because I am not God.
Text_ortho: So if na commitment, ehn if God dey, if God dey bless person because of wetin e dey do, ah I no know sha because I no be God.

Text_en: Because I receive God's blessings everyday, but I will... I will...
Text_ortho: Cause I dey see God blessing everyday, but I go, I go...

Text_en: What I am trying to say is that music, if you dont like music... (because personally, music is my life), if you take music away from me, then I'm finished.
Text_ortho: Ting I dey try to talk be sey music, if you no like music (because personally, music is my life), if you comot music for my life now, I don finish.

Text_en: So my life is all about music, and God.
Text_ortho: So my life is all about music, and God.

Text_en: So that is what I have... see... and that's the only thing I want to tell you.
Text_ortho: So dat is what I have, see and na only wetin I wan tell you.

Text_en: My advice to anyone who is into music is that they should do what they know will make God bless them and the people who listen to them.
Text_ortho: My advice to anybody wey dey do music, make e do di right thing wey know sey e go make God bless am, and bless people wey dey listen to am.

Text_en: Thank you!
Text_ortho: Thank you!

Text_en: Good afternoon, people listening to me!
Text_ortho: Good afternoon people wey dey listen to me!

Text_en: I want to talk to you about a man called Jesus.
Text_ortho: I want to talk to una about a man called Jesus.

Text_en: You've been hearing about him, but a lot of you dont have any relationship with him.
Text_ortho: Una don dey hear about am, but a lot of una no get any relationship wit am.

Text_en: This person whose name is Jesus was his... the one God sent.
Text_ortho: Dis person wey im name na Jesus was im di person wey God send.

Text_en: God is the One we worship, who can be likened to your father who brought you into the world.
Text_ortho: God na di person wey we dey worship, wey dey like your papa wey born you for earth.

Text_en: As your father brought you into the world, fed you, taught you and housed you, so our God in heaven is the One who sent His own son also, whose name is Jesus, to tell us that if we come to Him, we will have to come through Jesus.
Text_ortho: As your papa born you, feed you, train you, house you, na so, our God for heaven, na im bring im own son too wey im name na Jesus come tell us sey if we must come to him, we go come through dis Jesus.

Text_en: But Jesus didnt just come that way.
Text_ortho: But Jesus no just come like dat.

Text_en: According to the Bible in, in uh... John, chapter three verse three, a man named Nicodemus went to Jesus one day, and asked him, "I see the things you've been doing since you came."
Text_ortho: According to di Bible for, in, in ehm John chapter three verse three, a man name Nicodemus go meet Jesus one day, con ask Jesus sey I dey see di tings wey you dey do since you come.

Text_en: You are doing so many good things in people's lives.
Text_ortho: You dey do so, so good work for people life.

Text_en: People's lives are getting better.
Text_ortho: People life dey better.

Text_en: The one whose eyes are blind, his eyes will see; the one who cannot eat, you give food; the one who has no leg, you can make them walk.
Text_ortho: Di one wey get blind eye, im eye go see, di one wey no fit eat, you dey give am food, di one wey no get leg, you dey fit make am waka.

Text_en: I really like what you're doing.
Text_ortho: Dis ting wey you dey do, I like am so much.

Text_en: You are good at heart.
Text_ortho: Your mind, you dey good.

Text_en: You love people so much.
Text_ortho: You love people very well.

Text_en: You dont discriminate between the poor and the rich.
Text_ortho: You no dey discriminate about poor, or rich.

Text_en: You carry everybody along.
Text_ortho: Everybody, you dey carry dem along.

Text_en: I want to start doing the things you do.
Text_ortho: I want to begin to do dis kind ting wey you dey do.

Text_en: Then Jesus answered him, "yes, it is very possible for you to do what I am doing but there is a condition."
Text_ortho: Jesus con answer am sey yes it is very possible for you to do wetin I dey do, but dere is a condition.

Text_en: Then he asked Jesus, "what is the condition for me to do what you do, enjoying this privilege, enjoying this benefit?"
Text_ortho: E con ask Jesus sey wetin be di condition wey go make me dey do like you, dey enjoy dis privilege, dey enjoy dis benefit?

Text_en: So Jesus told him, "unless you are born again..." in John Chapter three, verse three.
Text_ortho: Jesus con tell am sey except you are born again, in John chapter three verse three.

Text_en: That being born again means that unless you change your lifestyle to become like me, right, to do the... to...
Text_ortho: Dat Born Again mean sey except you change your lifestyle to become like me, eh to do di, to...

Text_en: "Unless you change your lifestyle and start thinking of God, unless you leave your old ways of worshipping other idols... other things, and begin worshipping the true God who is in heaven, you will not be able to do what I do."
Text_ortho: Except you change your lifestyle, and begin dey tink of God, except you leave di old way wey you dey worship oder juju, oder tings, and begin dey worship di true God wey dey heaven, you no go fit do wetin I dey do.

Text_en: Then Nicodemus said, "aha, how will I be born again?"
Text_ortho: Nicodemus come say aha how I born again?

Text_en: "Uh... will I go back into my mother's womb so that she can give birth to me again?"
Text_ortho: Eh I go go back to my mama belle make she born me again?

Text_en: "I am... I am eighty five years old."
Text_ortho: I am, I am eighty five years.

Text_en: "I'm old now."
Text_ortho: I am old now.

Text_en: "In fact, my mother is dead."
Text_ortho: Even my mama don die.

Text_en: Jesus said no.
Text_ortho: Jesus say no.

Text_en: If you read the Bible... go and read verse six!
Text_ortho: If you read di Bible, go read verse six!

Text_en: He said no.
Text_ortho: E say no.

Text_en: That unless you are born of water, and of the Spirit, you will not be able to enter the Kingdom of God.
Text_ortho: Dat except you are born of water, and of the spirit, you will not be able to enter the kingdom of God.

Text_en: What is the Kingdom of God?
Text_ortho: What is dat kingdom of God?

Text_en: Thats the message I brought for you today.
Text_ortho: Na im be di message wey I carry come for una today.

Text_en: The Kingdom of God is what God has prepared in heaven, which we're supposed to be enjoying even here on earth, before we go to Him in heaven.
Text_ortho: Dat kingdom of God, na di ting wey God don prepare for heaven, wey we suppose dey enjoy even as we dey for earth before we go go meet am for heaven.

Text_en: In the Kingdom of God, there is no sicknesses; in the Kingdom of God, there are no diseases; in the Kingdom of God, there's no want; in the Kingdom of God, there's no poverty; in the Kingdom of God, there's only happiness, and joy.
Text_ortho: Dat kingdom of God, no sickness dey, dat kingdom of God, no disease dey, dat kingdom of God, no lack dey, dat kingdom of God, no poverty dey, dat kingdom of God, na only happiness, and Joy.

Text_en: So Jesus told Nicodemus, "unless you are born of water and of the Spirit, you cannot enter that kingdom."
Text_ortho: So Jesus con tell Nicodemus sey except you are born of the water, and of the spirit, you can not enter that kingdom.

Text_en: What was the water Jesus was talking about?
Text_ortho: Wetin be di water wey Jesus mean?

Text_en: The water means that unless you, you know the Bible, which is the word of God, then you won't understand who God is, you won't even know what God is able to do for you.
Text_ortho: Di water mean sey except you dey, you know the Bible which is the word of God, den you no go understand who God is, you no go even know wetin God fit do for you.

Text_en: So the way to enter the Kingdom of God is to be born of that water.
Text_ortho: So di way to enter di kingdom of God is to be born by dat water.

Text_en: Again, he used another phrase saying, "and of the Spirit."
Text_ortho: E now con use anoda phrase say and of the spirit.

Text_en: What is the Spirit?
Text_ortho: Wetin be di spirit?

Text_en: It means that the... in... who you really are... the body you go about in is not the real you.
Text_ortho: It means dat di inside, di real person wey be you, no be dis body wey you carry be you o.

Text_en: Your mind is not you.
Text_ortho: No be your mind be you o.

Text_en: There is a real person inside you, which is the Spirit.
Text_ortho: Dere is a real person inside of you wey be di spirit.

Text_en: And he said that unless that Spirit has also changed, you cannot enter either.
Text_ortho: And e say except dat spirit is also change, you can not also enter.

Text_en: What will change that Spirit?
Text_ortho: Wetin go change dat spirit?

Text_en: It's the word of God.
Text_ortho: Na the word of God.

Text_en: The... and how can the Spirit get changed?
Text_ortho: Di, and how can di spirit be changed?

Text_en: When you say let the word of God into your heart!
Text_ortho: When you say make dat word of God enter your heart!

Text_en: If you go back to Gen... uh... John's gospel, chapter one, verse one, the Bible says, "in the beginning was the word, and the word was with God, and the word was God."
Text_ortho: If you go back to Gen, eh John's gospel chapter one verse one, Bible say in the beginning was the word, and the word was with God, and the word was God.

Text_en: So that word which the Bible was talking about is the person Jesus.
Text_ortho: So dat word wey di Bible dey talk about, na im be di person of Jesus.

Text_en: Jesus said, "I come in the volume of..." what?
Text_ortho: Jesus say I come in the volume of what?

Text_en: The books.
Text_ortho: Di books.

Text_en: So everything you read in the Bible is about Jesus.
Text_ortho: So everyting wey you dey read for Bible, you dey read about Jesus.

Text_en: And for you to see the Kingdom Jesus was telling Nicodemus about, you must take that word into your heart.
Text_ortho: And for you to see dat kingdom wey Jesus dey tell Nicodemus, you must take dat word into your heart.

Text_en: And what is the word we are talking about?
Text_ortho: And wetin be di word wey we dey talk about?

Text_en: According to John chapter one, verse one, that word is who?
Text_ortho: According to John chapter one verse one, dat word, na im be who?

Text_en: Jesus Christ.
Text_ortho: Jesus Christ.

Text_en: Which means unless you accept Jesus into your life, you cannot see the Kingdom of God.
Text_ortho: Which means, except you accept Jesus into your life, you cannot see di kingdom of God.

Text_en: People who are now enjoying the benefits of God are living in good health, they are living in prosperity.
Text_ortho: People now wey dey enjoy di benefit of God, de dey live in good health, de dey live in prosperity.

Text_en: There is no sickness in their body, no, no lack.
Text_ortho: Dere is no sickness in deir body, no, no lack.

Text_en: God blesses them immensely.
Text_ortho: God dey bless dem yafun, yafun.

Text_en: Everything they lay their hands on prospers.
Text_ortho: Everyting de put deir hand, di ting dey go ya, ya very well.

Text_en: They da-...
Text_ortho: De da...

Text_en: They see the kindness of God; they are not sickly, visiting the hospital today, going down with arthritis tomorrow and having a headache the next day.
Text_ortho: De dey see di kindness of God, de no dey go hospital today, de no dey sick, tomorrow arthritis, dey headache next tomorrow.

Text_en: No!
Text_ortho: No!

Text_en: Everything about their life is very good.
Text_ortho: Everyting about deir life dey very good.

Text_en: It's because they have accepted Jesus into their lives.
Text_ortho: Na because de don accept Jesus into deir life.

Text_en: And Jesus said, "if you accept me into your life, Nicodemus, you will begin to experience the Kingdom of God."
Text_ortho: And Jesus say if you accept me into your life, Nicodemus, you go begin to see di kingdom of God begin to happen for you.

Text_en: And Nicodemus said, "is that so?"
Text_ortho: And Nicodemus say ehen?

Text_en: "So, is that how it is?"
Text_ortho: So na so dis ting be?

Text_en: And another thing the Kingdom of God has come to do for us is that the kingdom of God... wherever the Kingdom of God is, it is light.
Text_ortho: And anoder ting wey di kingdom of God don come to do for us is dat di kingdom of God, where di kingdom of God dey, dis is light.

Text_en: And wherever you have light, there is no what?
Text_ortho: And where light dey, dere is no what?

Text_en: Darkness.
Text_ortho: Darkness.

Text_en: So the Kingdom of God is also the light of God.
Text_ortho: So di kingdom of God is also di light of God.

Text_en: When that light comes into a dark place, what happens?
Text_ortho: When dat light come inside where darkness dey, wetin go happen?

Text_en: Darkness will disappear.
Text_ortho: Darkness go disappear.

Text_en: Just remember when NEPA [National Electric Power Authority] switches off the light in your house.
Text_ortho: Just remember when NEPA take light for your house.

Text_en: When you put on your lantern, or you light your candle, what happens?
Text_ortho: When you on your lantern, or your candle, wetin happen?

Text_en: You will see everywhere.
Text_ortho: You go see everywhere.

Text_en: Thats how the light of God is.
Text_ortho: Na so di light of God dey.

Text_en: When light comes into your life, what happens?
Text_ortho: When light come into your life, wetin go happen?

Text_en: All the things which the Devil has imposed on your body, all the disgusting things, the light of God will make all of them what?
Text_ortho: All di ting wey the Devil don put for your body, all di yama, yama, the light of God go make all of them to what?

Text_en: Disappear.
Text_ortho: Disappear.

Text_en: So the vital message for today is that the Kingdom of God, like Jesus said, is near you, but how can you access it?
Text_ortho: So di vital message for today is that the kingdom of God (like Jesus say) is near you, but how can you access it?

Text_en: How will you enter into that kingdom?
Text_ortho: How you go enter dat kingdom?

Text_en: Until you receive Jesus into your life...
Text_ortho: Until you receive Jesus into your life.

Text_en: My brother, my sister, as many of you listening to me, if Jesus has not come into your life, your life will still be in crisis.
Text_ortho: My broder, my sister, as many of una wey dey listen to me, if Jesus never come into your life, your life go still dey in crisis.

Text_en: Your life... you will still be having pains and problems here and there.
Text_ortho: Your life, you go still dey get pain, and problem here, and dere.

Text_en: But when Jesus has come in and has taken a seat, and you say, "Jesus, you are my Lord; from today, I will do whatever you say."
Text_ortho: But when Jesus don enter come sit down, you con say Jesus, you are my lord o, from today, anyting you tell me, now, I go do.

Text_en: Then from that day, you will begin to experience the glory of God in your life.
Text_ortho: Den from dat day, you go begin to see the glory of God in your life.

Text_en: You will begin to see what it means to live in the Kingdom of God.
Text_ortho: You go begin to see wetin e mean to live in the kingdom of God.

Text_en: God bless you as you accept him into your life!
Text_ortho: God bless you as you accept am into your life!

Text_en: In Jesus' name, amen!
Text_ortho: In Jesus name, amen!

Text_en: They take sports very seriously, very important, and they want Nigerians to uh... watch the matches.
Text_ortho: De take sport very serious, very important, and de wan meh Nigerians ah dey watch di match.

Text_en: Alright, as it is, the NNL [Nigeria National League] has bad news for us this morning because uh... we heard that the bus carrying NNL, Nigeria National League side, Osun United... hey, it was attacked by armed robbers... hey, they were attacked at night when they were leaving uh... Calabar for the venue of yesterday's match.
Text_ortho: Alright o, as e take be, bad tory dey inside NNL dis morning o because eh we dey hear sey di bus wey carry NNL, Nigeria National League side, Osun United, hey o di arm robbers, hey de attack dem for inside night o for when de dey travel comot eh from of course Calabar dey go yesterday venue.

Text_en: As gathered, it was along the Ore - Ondo - Akure express way.
Text_ortho: As e take be, de say along Ore Ondo Akure expressway.

Text_en: So these men who were operating in the middle of the night attacked this team.
Text_ortho: Na im dese men wey de waka for inside midnight come kpake dis team o.

Text_en: It was reported that they beat the players and their coach, they even cut uh... butchered the head of the driver with cutlass.
Text_ortho: De say de beat players, beat coach, even come cut e cutlass cut di head of driver.

Text_en: According to the story we got this morning from Osun United's spokesperson, Tunde Samshudeen, he said the bus driver is in critical condition.
Text_ortho: Hey o according by di tory paper wen be sey we get dis morning from Osun United spokesperson wey de call Tunde Samshudeen e say di bus driver now, de say na critical situation na im be im own.

Text_en: He said he's in the emergency unit uh... in the General Hospital in Ondo town.
Text_ortho: Sey im dey for emergency unit eh inside general hospital for inside Ondo.

Text_en: Most of the players were said to have sustained different degrees of injury from the attack, including the goalkeeper.
Text_ortho: Most of di players sef, de say de get injury of different degree inside di level plus including goal keeper.

Text_en: Ayo Ojo and Olabisi Olagunju said their bodies were mutilated by these armed robbers in the attack.
Text_ortho: Ayo Ojo, and Olabisi Olagunju say all of dem o, na im dese arm robbers carry take come butcher deir body ahah for inside di arm robber attack wen de suffer.

Text_en: Yes, it was reported that Osun United's coach, Rier Duke Udi, was beaten mercilessly in the attack.
Text_ortho: Yes o Osun United coach, Rier Duke Udi sef, de say de beat am wella inside di level.

Text_en: The Omoluabi guys, as they are being called, travelled in a thirty two seater bus on their way out of Calabar after they played with you-... uh, uh... Unicem Rovers in U.J Esuene Stadium.
Text_ortho: Di Omoluabi guys wey de dey call dem, yes na thirty two seater bus na im de carry dey travel comot from inside Calabar after de don play you, eh eh Unicem Rovers for UJ External Stadium.

Text_en: They lost two - zero, but they said their car had a minor problem.
Text_ortho: De lose two zero, but de say deir car get small problem.

Text_en: Thats why their journey was delayed.
Text_ortho: Na im make deir journey come delay.

Text_en: So the night fell on them while they were still in Ondo.
Text_ortho: Naim na night come catch dem for inside Ondo.

Text_en: Then these p-... bad people... these bad people doing evil things at night came into the scene.
Text_ortho: Naim dis p-... bad people, dese bad people wey dey do badness for night come enter inside di waka.

Text_en: Hey!
Text_ortho: Hey o!

Text_en: May Father God help these people, so that they get well very soon because uh... as it is currently, they need to continue with their job which is...
Text_ortho: Meh Baba God help dese people, meh de well quick, quick o because eh as e take be so, de need to continue to dey do deir trade wen be sey...

Text_en: Now football... alright, before we take our leave this morning, let me confirm that presently, Real Madrid players are really happy.
Text_ortho: Now football, alright, before we go dis morning, meh I confirmate una sey as e take be so, players of Real Madrid, na Asonto dem dey dance dis morning.

Text_en: Why?
Text_ortho: Why?

Text_en: Their president, Florentino Pieres, has confirmed that because they did well, they won... they won the Super Europa... the Super League, they won the FIFA Club World Cup, they won La Liga, and they won the Champions' League; he said he will hit each of them two million pounds.
Text_ortho: Deir presido wey de dey call Florentino Pieres don confirmate sey because of sey de do well, de win, de win Super, Europa Super League, win FIFA Club World Cup, win La Liga, win Champions' League, e say oya, sey im go slap each of dem wit two million pounds.

Text_en: Wow, so much money!
Text_ortho: Chai see money!

Text_en: Oh, on top of this money story, I have another story for you this morning which involves money.
Text_ortho: Oh ontop dat money level, na im I go kput you come dis morning because anoder money level dey.

Text_en: Manchester United... oh, this football club!
Text_ortho: Manchester United, oh dis ball club!

Text_en: Now, I know news club.
Text_ortho: Now, I sabi news club.

Text_en: Yes, as it is, they are the richest club in the whole world because they are in the top position.
Text_ortho: Yes, as e take be so, now dem be di club wen im get money pass for obodo world because according by force, na only dem sit down on top number one position on top di level.

Text_en: They made three point two seven billion dollars just this year.
Text_ortho: De get three point two seven billion hey o dollars inside dis year only.

Text_en: Wow, so much money in Manchester United!
Text_ortho: Kai, too much money Manchester United!

Text_en: This is where we draw the curtains this morning.
Text_ortho: Na here we be to come inside di waka dis morning.

Text_en: Well bring you more stories tommorow morning.
Text_ortho: Tomorrow morning, we go bring onto una.

Text_en: Meaning that, you'll get to hear everything happening in the world of sports.
Text_ortho: E come to mean sey every, inside ministry of sportology, una get to hear am.

Text_en: Most importantly, my name is Triple A.
Text_ortho: On to di behalf of di biggest one ah, my name na Triple A.

Text_en: Please, help me tell someone close to you and those ones who are far away that nobody should get lost and no one should fight any time.
Text_ortho: Abeg, help me tell somebody wey dey near you, and dose one wey im far meh people no lost, meh im quarrel for no day.

Text_en: God is in charge.
Text_ortho: Baba God dey.

Text_en: He blesses your heart!
Text_ortho: Bless your heart!

Text_en: My name is Dondeli Obi, and uh... I am from Onitsha Ukwuani in Ndokwa West Local Government Area of Delta State, here in Nigeria.
Text_ortho: My name na Dondeli Obi, and eh I come from Onitsha Ukwuani for Ndokwa West Local Government Area of Delta State here for Nigeria.

Text_en: I had my primary education in Aido Primary School, Onitsha Ukwuani, before I moved on to have my secondary school education in Mixed Secondary School, Onitsha Ukwuani.
Text_ortho: I bin go primary school for Aido Primary School, Onitsha Ukwuani before I con go secondary school for Mixed Secondary School, Onitsha Ukwuani.

Text_en: When I finished with secondary school, I moved on to the Federal Polytechnic Auchi to study Electrical Electronics Engineering.
Text_ortho: When I finish from secondary school, I con go Federal Polytechnic Auchi, go study electrical, electronics engineering.

Text_en: But now, I'm working with uh... Wazobia FM in Abuja.
Text_ortho: But now, I dey work wit ehm Wazobia FM for Abuja.

Text_en: We speak uh... Pidgin on our radio programmes in the station.
Text_ortho: We dey use ehm Pidgin dey do radio work for di station.

Text_en: And uh... though I chose to study Engineering in school, people will be asking, "ah, why are you in a radio house, or in broadcasting?"
Text_ortho: And ehm even dough sey na engineering me I choose to do for school, people go dey ask sey ah wetin you dey find for radio house, or broadcasting?

Text_en: But uh... it's a question of talent, and your abilities are different from your training.
Text_ortho: But ehm di tin be sey na talent, and wetin you sabi, no be wetin you learn.

Text_en: So I love to do uh... broadcasting.
Text_ortho: So I love to do eh broadcasting.

Text_en: It has nothing to do with what I studied in school or what I'm studying at the moment, but it's what I like to do; what I'm talented in.
Text_ortho: No be because sey na wetin I study for school, or wetin I dey study, but na because na wetin I like to do, na wetin I get talent for to do.

Text_en: Thats what makes me do it.
Text_ortho: Na im make me dey do am.

Text_en: And I love the job with all my heart.
Text_ortho: And I love di job as in wit all my heart.

Text_en: I love the job.
Text_ortho: I love di job.

Text_en: I'm happy that I'm doing this job.
Text_ortho: I dey dey happy sey I dey do di work.

Text_en: In fact, when I'm going to work, I dont prepare as if I'm going to work.
Text_ortho: In fact, if I dey go work, I no dey prepare from house comot say I dey go work.

Text_en: I prepare as if I want to go and enjoy myself.
Text_ortho: I dey prepare comot say I wan go enjoy mysef.

Text_en: Like I want to go and play because I see the job as a part of me, it flows from inside me.
Text_ortho: I wan go play because I see di work as na part of me, na sometin wey dey inside me.

Text_en: I dont struggle to do it, it's really very easy for me to do.
Text_ortho: I no dey struggle to do am, dey very easy for me to do.

Text_en: So... but I still hope to further my education because uh... I feel that you have so many things to do in life, and uh... I still believe that education will help me a lot.
Text_ortho: So but I still dey aspire sey I go continue again wit my education because ehm I feel sey so many tins dey to do wit life, and eh I still believe sey education go help me well.

Text_en: But anyways, I didn't learn the Pidgin English I speak from anywhere in particular.
Text_ortho: But anyway di Pidgin wey I dey speak, I no go learn am for anywhere.

Text_en: I don't... I didnt go to any particular place for the purpose of being taught Pidgin English.
Text_ortho: I no, e no get any particular place wey I go say okay make dem teach me Pidgin.

Text_en: I learned Pidgin English from people around me, from my day to day activities... the things I do everyday, I picked it from the way people I mix with speak it.
Text_ortho: I learn Pidgin from people wey dey around me, from my day to day activities, tins wey I dey do everyday, people wey I dey mix up with, di way dem dey talk.

Text_en: I don't have any choice but to go along with them so I can also communicate with them.
Text_ortho: I no get any choice dan to flow join dem so dat me sef go fit dey communicate with dem.

Text_en: So I learned Pidgin English and found out that naturally, in Delta State, the South-South area of Nigeria, Pidgin English is one of the languages everybody speaks.
Text_ortho: So I learn di Pidgin, and I find out sey naturally, for Delta State, di South, South area of Nigeria, Pidgin na one of di languages wey everybody dey take talk.

Text_en: If you want to know the general language which everybody understands in the whole South-South area, it is Pidgin English.
Text_ortho: If you wan know general language wey everybody sabi for di whole South South, na Pidgin English language so.

Text_en: It was easy for me to learn it when I was there because thats the language everybody speaks.
Text_ortho: E dey easy for me to learn am when I dey dere because na di language wey everybody dey speak.

Text_en: It's generally accepted.
Text_ortho: Dey generally accepted.

Text_en: So I didnt go to any Pidgin school.
Text_ortho: So I no go any school of Pidgin.

Text_en: Nobody called or sat me down saying uh... "this is the classroom."
Text_ortho: Nobody call me sit down sey eh dis na classroom.

Text_en: "Now sit down, let me teach you how to speak Pidgin!"
Text_ortho: Oya sidown, make I teach you how de dey speak Pidgin!

Text_en: But today, I speak Pidgin more than any other language, even my own language.
Text_ortho: But today, I dey speak Pidgin pass any other language, even my own language.

Text_en: I speak Pidgin more, more than I speak that language.
Text_ortho: I speak Pidgin more pass di language.

Text_en: So Pidgin is not something you will to learn in schools, or something like that.
Text_ortho: So Pidgin, no be sometin wey you go go school go learn, or sometin.

Text_en: It's ingrained.
Text_ortho: Na inbuilt.

Text_en: As soon as you were born and you are growing up, mixing with people, it comes to you naturally.
Text_ortho: As dem born you, you dey grow up dey mix up with people, e dey natural wit you.

Text_en: And uh... as a yound man, I s-... I know that I have so many opportunities waiting for me and I have uh... many ambitions for my career, and also for my country.
Text_ortho: And ehm as a young man, I s-... I know sey I get plenty opportunities wey dey wait for me for front, and I get eh plenty ambitions for my career, and also for my country.

Text_en: You know, working as a broadcast journalist, which I do now, I have seen sa-... I've... it's exposed me to so many things.
Text_ortho: You know walking as a broadcast journalist wey I dey do now, I don see sa-... I don, e don expose me to see so many tins.

Text_en: And I see things from different angles now.
Text_ortho: And I dey see tins from different angle now.

Text_en: Both the way things happen in our society, or politics, and every other part of life in our country.
Text_ortho: Both di way tins dey happen for our society, or politics, and every oder part of life for our country.

Text_en: And myself, I know that I can also do my part to make society and our country a better place.
Text_ortho: And me I get dat mind say I fit also contribute my own to make di society, and our country make e for better.

Text_en: I'm planning to go into politics as well.
Text_ortho: I get mind say I go join politics.

Text_en: I'll go into politics soon because I found out that if I have the plans, the ambitions, and uh... the opportunity doesnt come, I won't be able to play my part.
Text_ortho: I go do politics soon because I find out sey if I get di plans, di ambitions, and eh di opportunity no come, I no go fit contribute my own quota.

Text_en: So I feel that if I go into politics, by God's grace, I will be able to play my part to bring development to our country, Nigeria, because the way things are in Nigeria, truth be told... let's be honest, things are not working.
Text_ortho: So I feel sey if I join politics, by God's grace, I go fit contribute my own to bring development for our country, Nigeria because di way tins dey for Nigeria now, (truth be told, make we talk di truth) tins no dey work.

Text_en: And why things are not working is what we're trying to find out so we can figure out the best solution to solve everything thats not working in Nigeria.
Text_ortho: And di reason why tins no dey work, na im we dey try to find out so dat we go fit know di best solution to everytin wey no dey work for Nigeria.

Text_en: So for me, as a young man who's just coming up, I'm watching things play out, how things are happening in our country, how our current leaders are getting things done.
Text_ortho: So for me, as young man wey dey come up, I dey watch event of tins, how tins dey happen for our country, how our leaders wey dey now dey do tins.

Text_en: I'm making efforts to find out, to know how they're getting things done, noting their mistakes, what they... the things they're supposed to do which they're not doing, the things they're not supposed to do which they are doing.
Text_ortho: I dey find out, dey know how dem take dey do deir tins, dey know deir mistakes, what dem, di tins wey de suppose do, wey de no dey do, di tins wey de no suppose do wey dem dey do.

Text_en: I'm watching everything going on, and I'm also following up with the things which they are planning to do.
Text_ortho: I dey watch everytin wey dey go on, and I also dey follow up wit di tins wey dem dey plan to do.

Text_en: So for me, I'll have an advantage over the current leaders because I dont believe that the current leaders got into politics early enough.
Text_ortho: So for me, I go get more advantage dan di leaders wey dey now because I no believe sey di leaders wey dey now, dem start dis politics tin early.

Text_en: This leadership uh... thing, then at... I'm not sure they started early.
Text_ortho: Dis leadership eh tin den, at, I no sure sey dem start am early.

Text_en: If they had started earlier, they would have sat down to study what past leaders did.
Text_ortho: If to say dem start am early, de for don sidown, look wetin before leaders do.

Text_en: They would have avoided their mistakes.
Text_ortho: Di mistakes wey dem do as dem come, dem go fit avoid am.

Text_en: But what we have in Nigeria today is that this leadership will come and they will lead Nigeria.
Text_ortho: But wetin we get for Nigeria today, na sey dis leadership go come, de go lead Nigeria.

Text_en: When their time is up, they will leave.
Text_ortho: When deir time finish dem go comot.

Text_en: The next one will come, they will carry on from where the last one stopped.
Text_ortho: Di next one go come, de go carry Nigeria from where di oder person stop.

Text_en: They will carry on from there.
Text_ortho: De go carry am from dere.

Text_en: But the same mistakes that the b-... b-... other leaders made while in power, is what the new ones will also make when they come in.
Text_ortho: But di same mistake wey di b-... b-... oder leaders dem do when dem dey, di new ones go come in, dem go still dey make di same mistake.

Text_en: So that means that when the other leaders were... when they were not yet in power, they were not watching how the leaders of the day were running their own government.
Text_ortho: So, dat means when di oder leaders dey, when de never dey power, de no dey watch how di oder leaders take dey do deir own leadership.

Text_en: They dont take note of all the mistakes they were making.
Text_ortho: De no dey take note of all di mistake wey dem dey make.

Text_en: And they dont even have plans, no agenda stating that when I come into office, here are the things I will do.
Text_ortho: And de no dey even get plan, no agenda sey if I come office, na wetin I go do be dis.

Text_en: Now when they have finally come into power, thats when they will sit down to think about what they will do.
Text_ortho: Now, when de don finally enter power, na dat time de go come sidown begin dey tink wetin dem go do.

Text_en: And if you walk a-... take a look at it closely, it will look like mtschew, they are... they're confused.
Text_ortho: And if you walk a-... look am, e go be like sey mtschew dem be, dem dey confuse.

Text_en: They dont know what to do.
Text_ortho: De no know wetin to do.

Text_en: Why?
Text_ortho: Why?

Text_en: Because before they got into power, they did not have plans.
Text_ortho: Because before de enter power, dem be no get plan.

Text_en: They got into power and then start looking for plans.
Text_ortho: De enter power, come dey find plan.

Text_en: So they will be there, looking for plans.
Text_ortho: So dem go dey dere dey find plan.

Text_en: By the time they've found a plan, their time is up.
Text_ortho: By di time dem go find plan finish, deir time don finish.

Text_en: Another person will come in.
Text_ortho: Anoder person go enter again.

Text_en: The person coming in will also start looking for plans, he will begin working on the mistakes the other person had made, he will continue making the same mistakes.
Text_ortho: Di person wey go enter again go begin find plan, e go begin dey work on di mistakes wey di oder people don make, e go continue to make di same mistakes.

Text_en: Then uh... their term will come to an end and another person will come in.
Text_ortho: Den eh dat one go finish, anoder person go come.

Text_en: So now we need people who are knowledgeable; people who are exposed; people who know history.
Text_ortho: So wetin we need now na people wey sabi, people wey dey exposed, people wey know about tins wey don happen before.

Text_en: Both the things which have happened and the solution they have prepared, telling Nigerians that, "this is our problem".
Text_ortho: Both tins wey dey happen now, and den, dem go get solution, tell Nigerians sey na dis tin be our problem.

Text_en: "This particular thing is our problem."
Text_ortho: Na dis tin be our problem.

Text_en: This is what we'll do to solve this problem in our country, Nigeria, so that Nigeria will move forward, beyond where it is right now.
Text_ortho: Na dis tin we go do make dis problem stop for our Nigeria so dat Nigeria go move forward pass as e dey now.

Text_en: So for me, right, that ambition is alive and uh... with God, I believe that it will come true.
Text_ortho: So for me, eh dat ambition, e dey alive, and eh wit God I believe sey e go come true.

Text_en: Um... for me, to move Nigeria forward, we need to understand ourselves.
Text_ortho: Ehm for me, to move Nigeria forward, na make we understand ourselves.

Text_en: Um... so many things are dividing us as Nigerians.
Text_ortho: Ehm plenty tings dey separate Nigerians dem.

Text_en: And we will not be able to move forward until we get united, when we work hand in hand and come together.
Text_ortho: And na until we unite wesef, na when we come put hand togeder, join body togeder na im we go fit move tings forward.

Text_en: What I'm I trying to say is that when an Igbo man will not see himself just as an Igbo man; when a Yoruba man will not see himself only as a Yoruba man; where a Hausa man will not see himself as a Hausa man; when an Itsekiri man will not see himself as an Itsekiri man; when someone from Rivers State will not see himself as h-... someone from Rivers State.
Text_ortho: Wetin I dey try talk about, when Igbo man no go see imsef just as Igbo man, when Yoruba man no go see imsef as Yoruba man, where Hausa man no go see imsef as Hausa man, when Itsekiri no go see imsef as Itsekiri, when Rivers person no go see imsef as h-... Rivers person.

Text_en: Let everyone see themselves first as a Nigerian, before making reference to their tribes.
Text_ortho: Make everybody see demsef as Nigerian first before deir tribe.

Text_en: Until we get to that level, moving ahead will be difficult.
Text_ortho: Den until we get dat level, e go hard for us.

Text_en: Because how will you...?
Text_ortho: Because how you go... ?

Text_en: You'll hear young people from a certain area saying, "no, you are... you're not from our tribe, so you need to leave this area."
Text_ortho: You go see youths dem wey dey certain area go talk sey no una be, una no be our people, una must comot for our side.

Text_en: It doesnt make sense.
Text_ortho: E no make sense.

Text_en: Because if you look around, there's nowhere in this country where you have people of one tribe only.
Text_ortho: Because if you check, no place wey dey for dis country, wey no one tribe enter.

Text_en: Do you want to talk about Lagos?
Text_ortho: Shey na Lagos you wan mention?

Text_en: Or is it Abuja?
Text_ortho: Abi na Abuja?

Text_en: You will see people of all tribes in these states.
Text_ortho: You go see all di tribe dem for inside dis state.

Text_en: If you go to Enugu, it's the same thing; if you go to Lagos it's the same thing; if you go to Rivers State, it's the same thing; or in Calabar, it's the same thing.
Text_ortho: You enter Enugu, di same ting, you enter Lagos, di same ting, you enter even Rivers, di same ting, abi na Calabar, di same ting.

Text_en: What binds us together is this country.
Text_ortho: Di ting wey join us togeder, na di country.

Text_en: And we're in the country together, right from Imo River.
Text_ortho: And we don dey inside the country togeder right from Imo river.

Text_en: Until we're able to take the dirt away from us...
Text_ortho: Na until we fit comot dat dirty from o.

Text_en: And just a few people whose selfish interests make them ruin the process; they just dont want the people to make progress.
Text_ortho: And na just some people dem wey be sey because of deir selfish gain, wetin de gain selfishly, na im dey make dem meh dem dey put sand, sand, no just want make people dem develop.

Text_en: And... but the funny thing is that social media has opened the eyes of so many people.
Text_ortho: And but di funny ting be sey social media wey don dey ground now don open eyes of plenty people dem.

Text_en: Some may get enlightened in a good way while others may get enlightened in a bad way.
Text_ortho: Some may open deir eyes in di right way, some may open deir eyes in di wrong way.

Text_en: Because these people with selfish interests also understand that if they dont keep up with social media, they say that all the people who are under their control will be lost.
Text_ortho: Because dese people dem wey be sey de get selfish gain, dem mahnsef understand sey dat social media, if dem mahnsef no jump ontop am, de say di people dem wey be sey, de dey control go loss.

Text_en: So they come onto social media for their campaigns.
Text_ortho: Naim de enter inside social media, don begin dey do some kind campaign.

Text_en: You will notice on Whatsapp,
Text_ortho: You go see WhatsApp.

Text_en: Someone will just...
Text_ortho: Person go just...

Text_en: They'll write a stupid post, spread it, make everyone hear about it.
Text_ortho: E go compose one kind nonsense post, spread am, make everybody hear am.

Text_en: People reading it will not take time to confirm it.
Text_ortho: People wey be sey dey read am, de no go take time confirm.

Text_en: They'll just read it at face value, start spreading it all around as uh... rumor mongers that we have now, they will start uh... sh-... uh... sharing it from one person to the other, planting the seeds of evil in the minds of uh... different people.
Text_ortho: De go just read am like dat, begin spread am up, and down as eh amebo rumour mongers dat de is now, begin dey eh sh-... eh share am from one person, to di oder, just dey plant evil seed inside eh different people dem.

Text_en: Before you know what is happening, someone will start developing hatred for a fellow human being who happens to be from another tribe.
Text_ortho: Before you know anyting, person go just see im fellow human being wey come from anoder tribe, e go begin vex for am.

Text_en: What for?
Text_ortho: Sake of wetin?

Text_en: Because they're not from the same tribe.
Text_ortho: Sake cos sey de no be from di same tribe.

Text_en: But for us to move ahead, the youth will have to understand that when they come and say if an election comes up, take this, go vote for me, disorganize things, and steal ballot boxes... until we realize that we are mortgaging... (when I say mortgage, that's not clear), we are selling our future.
Text_ortho: But for us to move forward, na for di youth dem to understand sey, dat one tin wey be sey de dey give dem say okay if election come o, take go vote for me, take go scatter dis, take go thief ballot box, until we realize sey we dey mortgage (when I say mortgage, na grammar), we dey sell we future.

Text_en: We need to understand that the future is now, not tomorrow.
Text_ortho: We need to understand sey di future, na now, no be tomorrow.

Text_en: All those things they're telling us about the future... the youth are the leaders of tomorrow, no!
Text_ortho: All dat one wey de dey tell us sey di future, di leaders of tomorrow, na di youth dem, no o.

Text_en: The youth are the leaders of today.
Text_ortho: Di leaders of today na di youths.

Text_en: Not tomorrow.
Text_ortho: No be tomorrow.

Text_en: Take France for example!
Text_ortho: Take for example France!

Text_en: Or what country should I mention?
Text_ortho: Abi na which country I wan begin dey call?

Text_en: Very young people are getting into seats of power.
Text_ortho: Young, young people don dey enter inside power.

Text_en: The old people should start serving as advisers while the young people are working.
Text_ortho: Meh di old people dey advice, meh di young people dem dey work.

Text_en: Yes, we know that we need the elderly because they have seen it all, and people do say that you can't claim to be experienced in something you have not experienced.
Text_ortho: Yes we know sey we need di old people dem because de don see am, and de talk sey you no fit get experience without seeing am.

Text_en: They can advise while the young people are working.
Text_ortho: De fit dey advice while di young people dem dey work.

Text_en: Thats the only way we can move forward.
Text_ortho: Na di only way we fit move forward be dat o.

Text_en: Well, the issue of uh... restructuring and... where some people are saying that some others are outsiders in their communities, they're not supposed to be there.
Text_ortho: Well di matter of eh restructuring, and wey some people dey talk sey some people na stranger for deir community, de no suppose dey dere.

Text_en: If you check, some of the biggest investments in some areas...
Text_ortho: If you check, some of di biggest investments, for some areas...

Text_en: Let me draw examples from Kogi State where I had my secondary school education, Eda, to be precise.
Text_ortho: Make I take example for Kogi State wey I do my secondary school, Eda to be precise.

Text_en: At that time, one of their biggest boutiques where they sell clothes and other things people wear, was owned by someone from the Igboland.
Text_ortho: Dat time, one of di biggest boutiques wey dem get, wey dey sell cloth, and oder, oder tings dem, wey person dey wear for body, na Igbo person get am.

Text_en: It was not owned by someone from that tribe.
Text_ortho: No be person wey be sey na from dat tribe get am.

Text_en: Until we understand that yes, whatever is in our vicinity is ours!
Text_ortho: Until we understand sey yes o, we get we own!

Text_en: But we cannot do everything together.
Text_ortho: But we no fit do everyting togeder.

Text_en: Take a look at the motor cars, the whole process of manufacturing was not done by the company who assembled it.
Text_ortho: As motor take be reach, no be di same company wey dey do di car do everyting.

Text_en: It must work with other people in order to complete all the necessary things.
Text_ortho: E must join body with oder people dem to fit complete wetin de need.

Text_en: The electrics, the mechanics, the oil.
Text_ortho: Di electrical, di mechanical, di oil.

Text_en: They can't be producing the oil they use but they will meet and partner with the ones producing oil, so that they can work together.
Text_ortho: De fit no dey produce di oil, but de go meet people dem wey be sey de produce oil, join hand togeder.

Text_en: Take farming as an example.
Text_ortho: Take for example farm mahnsef.

Text_en: If a farmer plants uh... cassava and the cassava grows and he digs it up, will he carry it on his head when going to the market?
Text_ortho: If farmer plant eh cassava, cassava grow, e comot am for ground, e go carry am for head go market?

Text_en: He will get in a car.
Text_ortho: E go enter motor.

Text_en: It may be that the car is not his own.
Text_ortho: E fit be sey no be im get di motor mahnsef.

Text_en: Someone else drives the car.
Text_ortho: Na other person dey drive di motor.

Text_en: It may so happen that the driver is not from his tribe.
Text_ortho: E fit be sey di person wey dey drive di motor no be im tribe person.

Text_en: Until we understand all these little things, that when we get connected in little ways, we eventually achieve what we find.
Text_ortho: Na until we understand dese little, little tings dem say na small, small na im we fit join body togeder take achieve wetin we dey find.

Text_en: We can't just be, be, just be... be pretending that okay, we will do it; we will make it ours.
Text_ortho: We no fit just dey, dey, just dey, dey form sey okay, we go do am, we go do am we own.

Text_en: No island...
Text_ortho: No island...

Text_en: I mean, no man is an island.
Text_ortho: Abi no man be island.

Text_en: You need your brother as much as you need your sister; and likewise, you need your mother and your father to move on.
Text_ortho: You need your broder as you need your sister, and likewise as you need your mama, and papa to take move forward.

Text_en: So all those verbal attacks of calling others strangers, strangers, are lies.
Text_ortho: So all dat talk of sey stranger, stranger, na lie.

Text_en: Who is the richest man in Africa now?
Text_ortho: Who be di richest man now for Africa?

Text_en: Is he not a Northerner?
Text_ortho: No be Northerner?

Text_en: We know that all the...
Text_ortho: We know sey all di...

Text_en: There are so many other wealthy people around, but they dont publicize it.
Text_ortho: E get some oder people dem wey be sey de get money, but no dey loud am.

Text_en: Until we decide that yes, this person... if we have noticed that they can help us develop our land, then we should accept them, they help develop the land and we benefit from it.
Text_ortho: But until we decide sey yes o, dis person, if we don see sey im fit help us develop we land, den we accept am, e develop di land, we gain for inside am.

Text_en: They themselves will benefit from the venture.
Text_ortho: Im mahnsef gain for inside am.

Text_en: So many investments by the investors.
Text_ortho: Plenty investment by people dem wey be sey de invest.

Text_en: Take Dangote, the richest man in Africa, as an example.
Text_ortho: Check for example Dangote now, di richest man for Africa.

Text_en: Is he not planning to build a refinery in Lagos?
Text_ortho: No be Lagos now e don dey plan to build refinery?

Text_en: Did he think of his homeland?
Text_ortho: E tink of im side?

Text_en: Are most companies not in Lagos?
Text_ortho: Most of im company no be Lagos?

Text_en: Because he has discovered that the necessary capacities are not available over there.
Text_ortho: Because e don see sey di capacity no dey dat side.

Text_en: Nearness to raw materials may be the reason for building it over there.
Text_ortho: E fit be sey because of nearness to di raw materials, e build am for dat side.

Text_en: He can't say that okay, because uh... you are rich, you will build a refinery in the desert, right?
Text_ortho: E no fit talk sey okay because now eh you get money, you want build refinery, you carry am go build for inside desert?

Text_en: How do you access the oil?
Text_ortho: How you wan take collect di oil?

Text_en: You will go to the people who own oil reserves, talk to them, enter into agreement with them, and then move forward.
Text_ortho: You go go di people dem wey get di oil, talk to dem, do agreement wit dem, den move forward.

Text_en: But due to the events of the past, so many people felt that oh, because uh... some people want to take over the resources on their lands, they refuse to dialogue with them or compensate them.
Text_ortho: But because of wetin don dey happen for past, plenty people don feel sey oh because eh some people wan come collect wetin dey deir land, de no settle down gist to dem compensate dem.

Text_en: Even if they put it on paper, they dont put it in...
Text_ortho: Even dough sey dem put am for paper, de no put am for...

Text_en: Some of the people who go to represent them will fail to speak out in favour of their people, instead, they pocket some money and keep quiet.
Text_ortho: Some people wey be sey de even go represent dem, when e reach where de suppose talk, de go just carry small change put for deir back pocket.

Text_en: They will say, "ah, mstchew, he has done his best."
Text_ortho: De go say ah mtschew e don try.

Text_en: The keep their mouths shut.
Text_ortho: De close mouth.

Text_en: So these are the things we need to do.
Text_ortho: So na all dese tings dem we need to do.

Text_en: Reorientation.
Text_ortho: Reorientation.

Text_en: Start teaching the people so they understand... until we reorientate all the youth.
Text_ortho: Begin dey teach di people make de understand until we reorientate di youth dem.

Text_en: Talk to them saying, "this is it... this is it."
Text_ortho: Tell dem sey see as e be, see as e be!

Text_en: Really make them understand.
Text_ortho: Make de understand really.

Text_en: Not that they will be brainwashed.

Text_en: Alright, the House of Representatives has publicly advised the Federal Government to try to conduct some investigations into the prices of cement in our country, as it is becoming too high.

Text_en: This decision followed a motion put forward by the Honorable Abubakar Yunusa as he exclaimed that the rising price of different brands of cement # in our country without considering the negative implications it will have on the building industry does not look good.
Text_ortho: Dis decision follow one motion wey de move by Honourable Abubakar Yunusa as e come outside shout sey dis rising price of different kinds of cement inside we country without considerate of di negative implicate inside di building industry, e get as e be o.

Text_en: As he came outside, he said that if they do not investigate this issue thoroughly, it will be very difficult for a common Nigerian to build his own house in the country.

Text_ortho: So de get some kind tings wey person no fit talk on air around dis type of time.

Text_en: But there are some sensitive topics someone would like to talk about.
Text_ortho: But de get some kind sensitive topics wey person go like treat.

Text_en: But you have to be mindful of the time you're talking about it, and what people want to hear from that topic.
Text_ortho: But you gats dey mindful of di time wey you dey treat am, and wetin people wan hear from dat topic.

Text_en: Then there are some words you... you will need to come up with words because just like you coin words in English, when you can uh... pick one word and use it the way you can.
Text_ortho: Den de get some kind words wey you, you go con form because just like English wey get coinage wey you fit eh pick one word and use am di way wey you fit.

Text_en: They say everyone is their own...
Text_ortho: De say everybody na im own.

Text_en: Uh... you're the creator of your own English, right, but in Pidgin, if you create a word, you have to be very careful because there's a limit to how you can use it.
Text_ortho: Ehn you be your own creator of your own English ehen, but for Pidgin, if you create one word, you gats dey careful because de get how you go use am reach.

Text_en: Before you know it, someone will start using it.
Text_ortho: Before you know, person go start dey use am.

Text_en: People will start using it in scripts.
Text_ortho: People go start dey use am for script.

Text_en: Before you know it, that word which you think will... is not acceptable may later turn into something else.
Text_ortho: Before you know, dat word wey you tink sey go, e no sell later, e fit con turn anoder ting.

Text_en: So uh... that's it and uh... since Wazobia can be referred to as the people's station, most popular station in Nigeria (and not just Nigeria, even here in the North), right, people... people listen to us a lot.
Text_ortho: So ehn na di ting and eh since Wazobia na like di people station, most popular station in Nigeria, and not just Nigeria, even in di North here, ehn people, people dey listen to us well, well.

Text_en: So some, some words we coined have turned to lingo in the streets, everybody uses them now.
Text_ortho: So some kind, some kind words wey we don start don come turn lingo for street, everybody don dey use am.

Text_en: So all those things are inclusive.
Text_ortho: So all dose tings still take follow join.

Text_en: Yeah, but in Pidgin English, the version we speak here in Abuja is different from the one you'll hear in Port Harcourt, the one you'll hear in the western areas.
Text_ortho: Ehn but for Pidgin English sha, di one wey we dey speak for Abuja here different from di one wey you go see for Port Harcourt, di one wey you go see for di western side.

Text_en: Like most versions of Pidgin English here in Abuja, you will hear most of the things which...
Text_ortho: Like most Pidgin for Abuja here, you go dey hear most tings wey...

Text_en: For instance, if someone wants to use exclamation words, you want to like... what you'll say is "kai!"
Text_ortho: Like if person wan talk exclamation now, you wan like, you go say na kai!

Text_en: But that's... that's a Hausa word because we're in Abuja, yeah.
Text_ortho: But dat's, dat, na Hausa word because sey na, na Abuja we dey ehen.

Text_en: But in other places, they can use maybe Yoruba words, or they infuse some Igbo words to make it exciting.
Text_ortho: But for oder places, de fit use maybe Yoruba, or infuse small Igbo make di ting dey for sweet bottom.

Text_en: Thats how we speak it here.
Text_ortho: Na so we dey take speak am for here.

Text_en: Yes, I do travel.
Text_ortho: Yes I dey travel.

Text_en: I won't say I travel the most.
Text_ortho: Make I no talk sey na me travel pass o.

Text_en: I dont like the road.
Text_ortho: I no like road.

Text_en: Ah, we dont have an airport which will lead to my village directly.
Text_ortho: Ah we no get airport like dat wey go lead to my village so.

Text_en: Even from, from Garki to Gwagwalada also, I'll sleep the whole way, not to mention Abuja to Benin, I mean... or Edo State.
Text_ortho: Even from, from Garki, to Gwagwalada sef, I go sleep throughout, talk more of Abuja, to Benin, ehn or Edo State hm.

Text_en: So... but I do travel, like once in a while.
Text_ortho: So but I dey travel like once in a while.

Text_en: For instance every year, at least... I try to, at least, once I get to... I get to my state, I spend something like two weeks... three weeks before I X leave.
Text_ortho: Like every year, at least, I dey try sey at least once I dey enter, I dey enter state like two weeks, three weeks before I X comot.

Text_en: Well, they...
Text_ortho: Well, de...

Text_en: Okay, myself, I'm... I'm someone who likes to get into lots of things because I dont believe you're supposed to just uh... be on just one thing in life.
Text_ortho: Okay me I be, I be person wey dey like put hand inside plenty tings because I no believe sey person just suppose ehn dey one ting throughout your life.

Text_en: There's a saying that the average billionaire has more than five jobs.
Text_ortho: De talk sey eh di average billionaire get more dan five job wey im dey do.

Text_en: And myself, I'm still young.
Text_ortho: And me, I still young.

Text_en: So if the average billionaire has five jobs, then I wanna have six or seven jobs.
Text_ortho: So I go like get like six to seven wey I dey do if average billionaire fit get five.

Text_en: It'll be good to have seven or eight.
Text_ortho: E go good if I get like seven, eight.

Text_en: So I wont be average, you know.
Text_ortho: So I no go dey average ehen.

Text_en: So it'll be good to get involved in lots of things.
Text_ortho: So e good to chook hand inside plenty tings.

Text_en: But I've been into entertainment for a long time.
Text_ortho: But entertainment na di ting wey I don dey into since.

Text_en: Even though I've been involved in the arts.
Text_ortho: Even dough na arts I dey.

Text_en: Actually, I wanted to study fine arts.
Text_ortho: Before sef, na even fine art I be wan read.

Text_en: But because I was sluggish that particular year.
Text_ortho: But because dat year I dey draw.

Text_en: Later, from there, I went into the commercial class.
Text_ortho: Later from dat one, I come enter commercial class.

Text_en: I had wanted to be an accountant.
Text_ortho: Na accountant wey I for wan like be.

Text_en: But mstchew, that did not work out.
Text_ortho: But mtschew dat no come work out.

Text_en: So I'm a historian.
Text_ortho: Na historian I come be.

Text_en: But all these things revolve around what has been going on since my secondary school to the university, to becoming an MC, master of ceremony, and a comedian.
Text_ortho: But all dese tings still dey revolve around wetin dey from talking from secondary school, to inside university, to becoming an mc, master of ceremony, compare comedian.

Text_en: All those ones are also included.
Text_ortho: All dose ones still take follow join.

Text_en: But I realized that all these things are pushing me towards my destination.
Text_ortho: But I come realise sey all dese tings dey push me towards where I still dey go.

Text_en: So at the end of the day, artist management... talent management... they are things I enjoy.
Text_ortho: So at di end of di day, artist management, talent management, na someting wey I really dey enjoy.

Text_en: Event consulting and management and also event planning, those are things I also enjoy.
Text_ortho: Event consulting, and management, and also setting up events, dat na wetin me, I dey also enjoy.

Text_en: I also enjoy editing, I al-... also enjoy movies.
Text_ortho: I also enjoy editing, I dey al-... also enjoy movies.

Text_en: I'm someone who really loves watching movies.
Text_ortho: I be person wey like film well, well.

Text_en: There's no movie I dont like watching.
Text_ortho: De no get film wey (if I see), wey I no like watch ehn.

Text_en: And I like talking about it.
Text_ortho: And I dey like talk about am.

Text_en: So I'm good.
Text_ortho: So I dey.

Text_en: Anything that revolves around entertainment is something I like getting involved in.
Text_ortho: Anyting wey revolve around entertainment, na someting wey I dey like put hand into.

Text_en: From inst-... from fashion to music, to dance, comedy... as long as it's entertainment, I'm supposed to be involved.
Text_ortho: From inst-... from fashion o, music, dance, comedy, as long as sey na entertainment, my hand suppose dey inside.

Text_en: Thats what I believe.
Text_ortho: Na wetin I believe.

Text_en: So I must be involved.
Text_ortho: So my hand must dey inside.

Text_en: Then, I also love to talk.
Text_ortho: Den I dey also like talk.

Text_en: I dont like talking for no reason.
Text_ortho: I no dey like talk for talking sake.

Text_en: Everyone has a purpose in life.
Text_ortho: Everybody get purpose for life.

Text_en: And I try to make sure that anything I pull out from... whatever comes out of my mouth must impact someone.
Text_ortho: And I dey try make sure sey anyting wey I comot from, anyting wey go comot from my mouth must impact person.

Text_en: There's a saying that there's something useful in a seemingly useless thing.
Text_ortho: De dey talk sey in everyting wey, wey no serious, seriousness dey.

Text_en: It is said that there is sense in all nonsense.
Text_ortho: De say in every nonsense, sense dey.

Text_en: I like making more sense than nonsense.
Text_ortho: I dey like meh my sense dey pass in nonsense.

Text_en: So at least, if someone listens to you once, the impression they will have of you... because they say a first impression lasts forever, so I like to make sure that my first impression is a good one.
Text_ortho: So at least, if person hear you once, dat impression wey di person go get, because de talk sey first impression, na im dey last pass, so I dey like meh my first impression be good impression.

Text_en: If you remember, there has been an issue on the ground which has been talked about.
Text_ortho: E get dis matter wey bin don dey ground, wey bin don dey talk about, if you remember.

Text_en: Yeah.
Text_ortho: Yeah.

Text_en: Last week, we heard some news that I don't really understand.
Text_ortho: Inside of di week wey waka pass, we bin hear some talk wey no too understand.

Text_en: It seems like they are considering hiking the fuel price by five naira.
Text_ortho: Like sey de dey reason sey de wan put five naira on top of fuel money.

Text_en: Well, it's not just fuel.
Text_ortho: Ehn no be only fuel.

Text_en: Fuel and diesel.
Text_ortho: Fuel, and diesel.

Text_en: The people have started complaining about the scarcity of food, yet you want to raise prices!
Text_ortho: Ehn people con begin dey para sey food no dey ground, una wan add money again!

Text_en: It's... I said you should take it easy!
Text_ortho: Na I say take am easy!

Text_en: I know that was uh... in the past week that I started saying that people should take it easy...
Text_ortho: I know sey dat's eh inside of last week wen I bin dey talk sey make people take am easy.

Text_en: That one... that one, it happened on Friday.
Text_ortho: Dat one, dat one, na on Friday na im e happen.

Text_en: I know you don't really trust me.
Text_ortho: I know sey una no too trust me.

Text_en: Beause you've started thinking, "what are you saying, Titi? They want to increase the price by five naira and you are telling us to take it easy".
Text_ortho: Because una con dey reason sey aha Titi, de wan put five naira, and you dey tell us make we take am easy.

Text_en: Now, I'll tell you why I've been asking you to take things easy since last Friday.
Text_ortho: Now, I go tell you why I bin tell us moh we take am easy last week Friday.

Text_en: The reason is that I trust the government of the state I live in.
Text_ortho: Di reason na because I trust di government of di state wey I dey inside.

Text_en: That is the first reason.
Text_ortho: Dat one na one.

Text_en: I trust the government of the people I voted for to represent me.
Text_ortho: I trust di government of di people wey me, I vote mey de representate me.

Text_en: That is the second reason.
Text_ortho: Dat one na two.

Text_en: What about the Federal Government?
Text_ortho: And di overall government nko?

Text_en: I trust them too.
Text_ortho: I trust dem join.

Text_en: That is at the Federal level.
