Text_en: Let them reserve your seat, so that you can send me a text message that you've been admitted into the hall.
Text_ortho: Make de for reserve your seat so dat you go send me text message say you don dey admitted to di hall.

Text_en: But whether you got the message or not, based on MTN problems, you can still come to the venue.
Text_ortho: But whether you get di message or not base on MTN palava, you fit just come di venue.

Text_en: Right now, the number to send the message to is zero nine zero...
Text_ortho: Oya, di number wey you go send di message to now na zero nine zero...

Text_en: Right now, pick up your phone!
Text_ortho: Oya, pick your phone!

Text_en: I am waiting!
Text_ortho: I dey wait!

Text_en: Pick it up; pick it up!
Text_ortho: Pick am, pick am!

Text_en: Get your pen, and paper!
Text_ortho: Get your pen, and paper!

Text_en: I'm waiting!
Text_ortho: I dey wait!

Text_en: Good!
Text_ortho: Correct!

Text_en: Someone would say, "this guy can see me right in my house."
Text_ortho: E go say dis guy dey see me for my house.

Text_en: Uhuh, I have seen you!
Text_ortho: Ehen I don see you now!

Text_en: Right now, once again!
Text_ortho: Oya, move go again now!

Text_en: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.
Text_ortho: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.

Text_en: I'll call it out again slowly.
Text_ortho: I go call am slowly again.

Text_en: Dont just beep me.
Text_ortho: No bother to flash!

Text_en: I'm in the studio, and that phone is on.
Text_ortho: I dey inside studio, and dat phone dey on.

Text_en: Dont cause chaos.
Text_ortho: No cause trouble.

Text_en: Dont show me that your chances of being successful have been compromised.
Text_ortho: No show me sey de don log into your password for your village make you no make am.

Text_en: Because lack of discipline means that you wouldn't even be able get from point A to B.
Text_ortho: Because indiscipline mean sey you no go even fit go from point A to point B.

Text_en: Be very disciplined!
Text_ortho: Dey very discipline!

Text_en: Do not joke with a very serious business opportunity!
Text_ortho: No dey joke wit very serious business opportunity!

Text_en: Right now, dial the number again, now!
Text_ortho: Oya, dial di number again now!

Text_en: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.
Text_ortho: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.

Text_en: I will call it out again.
Text_ortho: I go call am again.

Text_en: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.
Text_ortho: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.

Text_en: Listen closely!
Text_ortho: Listen attentively!

Text_en: When come to my seminar on Sunday, dont come to the seminar just to complain!
Text_ortho: When you dey come my seminar on Sunday, no waka come di seminar to come dey give your complain!

Text_en: You see, this world we're in, uh... everyone has issues.
Text_ortho: You see, dis life wey we dey so ehn, everybody get problem.

Text_en: But somehow, everyone is just hiding theirs in order to find solutions to their problems.
Text_ortho: But somehow, everybody just dey hide deir own to find solution to deir problem.

Text_en: Even if you sit down today, if you stand before a governor, or a president, and you start telling your problems, when you finish, what he'd tell you is, "I'll look into it."
Text_ortho: Even if you sit down from today, dem put governor for front of you, or president, you start to narrate your problem, when you narrate am finish, wetin e go tell you is dat I will look into it.

Text_en: Then, his PA would say, "you just be on the lookout."
Text_ortho: Den im PA go say you just be on di lookout.

Text_en: My brother, you can be on the lookout till the guy leaves power, begins and ends his tenure as a senator, even begins and ends his tenure as an ambassador... he will not have looked into the problems because he has his own problems.
Text_ortho: My broder, you fit dey look out till di guy finish power comot, become senator comot, even become ehn ambassador comot, e never still look into di problem because im get im own problem.

Text_en: So now, personalize your problems!
Text_ortho: And now so, personalise your problem!

Text_en: Then tell yourself that this problem you are dealing with now, you brought it upon yourself, and this problem you are dealing with now, you will still be the one to bring yourself out of it.
Text_ortho: Den tell yourself sey dis problem wey you dey so, na you use your hand waka enter, and dis problem wey you dey so, na you go still use your hand waka comot.

Text_en: And how would you do it?
Text_ortho: And how you go take do am?

Text_en: When you are coming to the seminar, when you know that it's an investment seminar you are coming for, you will make up your mind that you will invest this particular amount; you will invest this particular amount.
Text_ortho: When you dey come seminar wen you know sey na investment seminar, you go make up your mind sey I go invest dis so, so amount, I go invest dis so, so amount.

Text_en: Not that you will just listen to it all!
Text_ortho: No be sey you go con listen finish!

Text_en: First take care of yourself!
Text_ortho: First treat yoursef!

Text_en: Then they'll go back to their house and start feeling like you dont exist.
Text_ortho: De go con go house, con dey feel like sey you no dey exist.

Text_en: Make sure a seat is reserved for you!
Text_ortho: Secure your seat!

Text_en: This Sunday, I'll be teaching you how to make a six figure income.
Text_ortho: Dis Sunday, I go dey teach una how to make six figures income.

Text_en: I know that's a huge one.
Text_ortho: I know sey dat one huge for ear.

Text_en: Then, specifically, I will be teaching you how to make about twenty thousand dollars from a little investment, the smallest is one thousand dollars.
Text_ortho: Den, specifically, I go dey teach you how to make about twenty thousand dollars from a little investment at least na one thousand dollars.

Text_en: And, at the same time, I will teach you how to make five percent on your investment, every Friday, for the next fifty two weeks, which is double your money by about two or three.
Text_ortho: And at di same time, I go teach you how to make five percent of your investment every Friday for di next fifty two weeks which is double your money by two to three thereabout.

Text_en: I wouldnt say its exactly three times as much because some fractions do go missing.
Text_ortho: I no go call am exactly three because e get some fractions wey dey miss.

Text_en: Then, at the same time, I will be bringing you into what we call "The Billionaire School", where they bring like-minded people together, teaching you what to do with business ideas, and ge-... organize yourself and choose the right career.
Text_ortho: Den, at di same time, I go dey bring you into wetin we dey call di billionaire school wey be sey de dey bring like minds together, teach you how to do business idea, and ge, organise yourself, choose di right career.

Text_en: As far as you're listening to my voice now, if you end up being poor, it's your problem.
Text_ortho: As far as if you dey listen to my voice now, if you poor, na your problem.

Text_en: It means that some things have gone wrong with you.
Text_ortho: E mean sey tings bin dey do you.

Text_en: You dont have any right to be poor.
Text_ortho: You no get any right to dey poor.

Text_en: And it's not by how you dress.
Text_ortho: And no be by how big you dress.

Text_en: Dress neatly; dress corporate; find your way to Swiss Spirit.
Text_ortho: Dress neatly, dress corporate, find yourself in Swiss spirit.

Text_en: The first small thing to do the reservation is contact zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two two nine.
Text_ortho: Di number one small to do di reservation na zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two two nine.

Text_en: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.
Text_ortho: Zero nine zero nine five nine six five three two nine.

Text_en: Send the word "reserve" and your name. They will reserve your seat.
Text_ortho: Send di word reserve, and your name, de go reserve your seat,

Text_en: Start sending it now!
Text_ortho: Dey send am now!

Text_en: Dont bother calling me.
Text_ortho: No dey bother dey call.

Text_en: Even if you call for two million years, I will not answer your call because I said, "send a text message."
Text_ortho: If you call for two million year sef, I no go pick your call because I say send text message.

Text_en: It's a common instruction for people who want to move forward.
Text_ortho: Na common instruction for people wey wan go forward.

Text_en: And this morning, if you are in the city of Port Harcourt, as soon as I leave this place, I'm heading straight to the Presidential... myself and the owner of Sahara Energy; myself and the uh... the owner of Kilimanjaro and uh... Market Square; myself and the owners of uh... O Wilson Tea Mate Bread; and also Hilda Dokubo, and lots of them, we are in the Presidential this morning and we are talking at the Niger Delta CEO Summit.
Text_ortho: And dis morning, if you dey di city of Port Harcourt, as I dey comot here now dey head straight to Presidential, me, and di owner of Sahara Energy, me, and di, eh di owner of Kilimanjaro, and eh Market Square, me, and di owners of eh O Wilson Tea Mate Bread, and also Hilda Dokubo, and lot of dem now, we dey Presidential dis morning, and we dey talk on di Niger Delta CEO Summit.

Text_en: Admission if free of charge and it's for your sake that we're organizing that event.
Text_ortho: Admission na free of charge, and na because of una we go set up dat event.

Text_en: Uh... if you can come to that venue, start coming right away.
Text_ortho: Eh if you fit come dat venue, oya, dey come straight.

Text_en: I am going there right away, I am going to take my own session.
Text_ortho: I dey go dere now, I dey go take my own session.

Text_en: That's where you will hear the English version of my talk.
Text_ortho: Na dere you go hear di English version of me.

Text_en: From this place now, we are taking it straight to the roots, where we are coming from.
Text_ortho: For dis place now, we dey do am straight to di square root where we dey come from.

Text_en: Okay, my name is Okemute Imonirhua.
Text_ortho: Okay, my name na Okemute Imonirhua.

Text_en: I'm from Delta State, I'm Urhobo.
Text_ortho: I am from Delta State, I be Urhobo.

Text_en: I was born in Warri.
Text_ortho: De born me for Warri.

Text_en: And I grew up in Warri.
Text_ortho: And I grow up for Warri.

Text_en: I stayed in Warri up until twenty fourteen.
Text_ortho: I stay for Warri till twenty fourteen.

Text_en: I had my primary school and secondary school education in a place close to Warri.
Text_ortho: Primary school, secondary school, na close to Warri I attend.

Text_en: And then, my university education too, was in Delta State.
Text_ortho: And den, university too, na for Delta State.

Text_en: So I lived all my life in Delta State, until my job brought me to Port Harcourt in twenty fourteen.
Text_ortho: So all my life, I live for Delta State until work carry me come Port Harcourt from twenty fourteen.

Text_en: I'm a graduate of library and information science, it's not because that's what I wanted to study in school, but my mom said I should study medicine.
Text_ortho: I be graduate of library and information science, not because sey na wetin I like to study for school, but my mama say I must study medicine.

Text_en: She wanted a doctor.
Text_ortho: She wan get doctor.

Text_en: Thank God that my younger brother is in his final year in medical school now, so she will have her doctor.
Text_ortho: Tank God my younger broder now don dey for final year for medical school so she go get her doctor.

Text_en: But I dont like sciences.
Text_ortho: But, I no like sciences.

Text_en: So, I sat for my WAEC.
Text_ortho: So I write my WAEC.

Text_en: I didnt pass all the subjects.
Text_ortho: I no pass all di subjects.

Text_en: Then she said, okay, I should go for the pre-degree first.
Text_ortho: She con say okay make I just do pre-degree first.

Text_en: Then I would sit for it again, until I got to study medicine.
Text_ortho: Den I go rewrite again till I must study di medicine.

Text_en: But as I got accepted to study library science, I told myseft that nothing would make me go back to sciences.
Text_ortho: But as I enter pre-degree do library science, I tell mysef sey noting go make me go back to sciences.

Text_en: So that's what made me study library science at school.
Text_ortho: So na wetin make me study library science for school.

Text_en: And I, I didn't do bad at school.
Text_ortho: And I, I don't do bad, for school.

Text_en: I came out with good grades (you know), which they call two one.
Text_ortho: I come out wit better grade (you know) wey de call two one.

Text_en: And then...
Text_ortho: And den...

Text_en: But what I really wanted to do before now is broadcasting.
Text_ortho: But wetin I really like to do before na broadcasting.

Text_en: So when I finished my education, then I got a job in a radio station as a first experience.
Text_ortho: So when I finish school, I con get work for radio station by first experience.

Text_en: With no training.
Text_ortho: No training.

Text_en: I did that.
Text_ortho: I do dat one.

Text_en: Then I went into the Youth Service Corps in Bayelsa State.
Text_ortho: I con go for service for Bayelsa State.

Text_en: During service, I went to a radio station for training.
Text_ortho: During service, I con go radio station to go learn.

Text_en: I was supposed to teach but I went to the school and said that they should reject me.
Text_ortho: I suppose to teach but I go meet di school say make de reject me.

Text_en: I dont have an interest in teaching.
Text_ortho: I no get wetin I wan use teaching take do.

Text_en: So I went to a radio station.
Text_ortho: So I con go radio station.

Text_en: There, they trained me in phonetics, and everything, news reading.
Text_ortho: De train me for dere for phonetics, and everyting, news reading.

Text_en: Then after NYSC, I got a job again in Warri.
Text_ortho: Den after NYSC, I con get work again for Warri.

Text_en: So I worked in Warri, in a radio station, as a presenter for about uh... two years.
Text_ortho: So I work for Warri for radio station as a presenter for about eh two years.

Text_en: Then I left Warri to come...
Text_ortho: I con leave Warri come...

Text_en: Actually, I wanted to come to Port... come to Port Harcourt at that time, but it didnt work out that way.
Text_ortho: Actually, I wan come Port, come Port Harcourt dat time, but e no work out like dat.

Text_en: Then I came to Port Harcourt in twenty fourteen.
Text_ortho: I con come Port Harcourt for twenty fourteen.

Text_en: I got a job as uh... they call it a call screener on the radio.
Text_ortho: I get job as (ehm de call am call screener for radio).

Text_en: Not a presenter.
Text_ortho: No be presenter.

Text_en: You're the one who sits where they receive phone calls.
Text_ortho: Na you go sit down for where de dey receive phone call.

Text_en: So before the call gets to the studio, first you'll first listen to the people, screen them.
Text_ortho: So before di call go enter studio, you first listen to di people, screen dem.

Text_en: If what they want to say doesn't make sense, you cut them off.
Text_ortho: If wetin de wan talk no make sense, you go cut dem.

Text_en: But if what they said will contribute to the program, you allow them to conne-...
Text_ortho: But if wetin de talk get contribution to di programme, you go allow dem conne-...

Text_en: Uh... you connect them to the studio.
Text_ortho: Eh you go connect dem to di studio.

Text_en: I didnt do that for long.
Text_ortho: I no do dat one for long.

Text_en: Then I got an administrative job.
Text_ortho: I con get admin work.

Text_en: So now, it's administrative and HR work I do.
Text_ortho: So now, na admin, and HR work I dey do.

Text_en: But because I still love uh... broadcasting, I get to read news, along the line.
Text_ortho: But because I still like eh broadcasting, along di line, I dey read news.

Text_en: But the thing is making it very stressful for me because the administrative work is there, and the time for news is a very sacred time.
Text_ortho: But di ting dey make e dey too stressful for me because admin work dey dere, and news time na very sacred time.

Text_en: So sometimes I miss the news, I go to read it late.
Text_ortho: So sometimes I go miss di news, I go go read am late.

Text_en: So I had to drop news reading.
Text_ortho: I con get to drop news.

Text_en: But I'm still hopeful for the time when I'll be able to go back to broadcasting.
Text_ortho: But I still dey hope for when I fit go back to broadcasting.

Text_en: Before we started a TV station in our company, I was working for Cool FM, Wazobia FM, Nigeria Info.
Text_ortho: Before we con start TV station for our company, I dey work for Cool FM, Wazobia FM, Nigeria Info.

Text_en: They opened Wazobia Mass TV, and its a Pidgin Station.
Text_ortho: De con still open Wazobia Mass TV, and na Pidgin station.

Text_en: So I went for auditioning.
Text_ortho: So I audition.

Text_en: Even my boss told me, "ah, just try it, just try it."
Text_ortho: My oga now even tell me sey ah just try am, just try am.

Text_en: "After all, you grew up in Warri."
Text_ortho: After all, na Warri you grow up.

Text_en: "So it's Pidgin."
Text_ortho: So na Pidgin.

Text_en: You know that Pidgin... to speak Pidgin, and to broadcast, mtchew, is not the same thing.
Text_ortho: Una know sey Pidgin, to talk for Pidgin, and to broadcast, mtschew no be di same ting.

Text_en: But I went for the audition.
Text_ortho: But I con audition.

Text_en: I got the job.
Text_ortho: I get di job.

Text_en: So we are yet to go live.
Text_ortho: So we never start to go live.

Text_en: When we go live now, I will be anchoring the morning show.
Text_ortho: When we go live now, I go dey do di morning show.

Text_en: And then uh... the food show.
Text_ortho: And den ehn food show.

Text_en: We have already started recording the food show (because I like food a lot) on the Wazobia Mass TV.
Text_ortho: We don dey record di food show already (because I like food well, well) for Wazobia Mass TV.

Text_en: Uh... one issue I would like to talk about very briefly, is this issue of feminism.
Text_ortho: Ehn one issue I like to talk about very briefly, na dis issue of feminism.

Text_en: Me, I'm a feminist.
Text_ortho: Me, I be feminist.

Text_en: I believe in equality of the sexes.
Text_ortho: I believe in equality of di sexes.

Text_en: Even my mother, when we were growing up, anything which my brothers were doing, we would do it too.
Text_ortho: Even my mama, when we dey grow up, anyting wey my broders dey do, na we dey do too.

Text_en: She didn't... she let you know that if your brother can do it, you should be able to do it too.
Text_ortho: She no dey, she will let you know sey if your broder fit do am, you go fit do am too.

Text_en: So even if she may not know what feminism is, but she, she was a feminist.
Text_ortho: So even if she fit no know wetin feminism be, but she, she be feminist.

Text_en: Because she suffered at the hands of her father.
Text_ortho: Because she suffer for her papa hand.

Text_en: Her father believed that girls are not valuable.
Text_ortho: Her pa believe sey girl no be pikin.

Text_en: So the father didn't get her educated, he made her suffer a lot.
Text_ortho: So papa no gree train her, suffer her well, well.

Text_en: So because of that, she treated all her children equally.
Text_ortho: So because of dat one, she treat all her children equally.

Text_en: But with feminism now, me, I feel that some people are taking it to another level.
Text_ortho: But feminism now me, I feel sey some people dey take am to anoder level.

Text_en: So this feminism is not feminist.
Text_ortho: So dis feminism no be feminist.

Text_en: They hate themselves as women.
Text_ortho: De hate demsefs as women.

Text_en: Because I have read that... I read recently that some women, maybe, are saying, "ah, why should the Boy Scouts be making women join the Boy Scouts?"
Text_ortho: Because I don read sey, I read recently sey some women maybe dey talk sey ah why Boy Scouts go dey make women fit dey join Boy Scouts.

Text_en: And then some women are calling themselves kings, king of queens.
Text_ortho: And den some women dey call demsefs kings, king of queens.

Text_en: Nothing is wrong with being a queen.
Text_ortho: Noting dey wrong wit being a queen.

Text_en: Because a man is a man.
Text_ortho: Because, male human being na man.

Text_en: A woman is a woman.
Text_ortho: Female human being na woman.

Text_en: So sometimes when you say the queen is a king, it means that you are not satisfied with being a queen, and nothing is wrong with being the queen.
Text_ortho: So when you say sometimes di queen is a king, e mean sey you no dey satisfy wit being a queen, and noting dey wrong wit being di queen.

Text_en: The Queen of England is a queen.
Text_ortho: Queen of England, na queen.

Text_en: And she has a husband, but nothing has taken her position away from her.
Text_ortho: And she get husband, but noting take her position from her.

Text_en: Some of these feminists...
Text_ortho: Some of dis feminist...

Text_en: I am a feminist, but some people are not feminists.
Text_ortho: I be feminist, but some people, de no be feminist.

Text_en: They are misleading other women, they hate being women, they want to be men by all means.
Text_ortho: De dey mislead oder women, de hate to be women, de wan be men by all means.

Text_en: I should say that many of these feminists (other than...), they are not feminists, they are anti-feminists but in the name of feminism, they are taking the struggle to a whole nother level.
Text_ortho: I should say, many of dis feminism, oder dan de no be feminist, de be anti feminist, but in di name of feminism de dey take di struggle to anoder different level.

Text_en: What I know is that if I will... when I have the opportunity to air my show, I will talk about it very well.
Text_ortho: Na wetin I know sey if I go, when I get di chance to do my show, I go talk about am well, well.

Text_en: That hating men will not make you say that we are superior to men.
Text_ortho: Sey to dey hate men, no be im go make you say we dey superior to men.

Text_en: In fact, to say that you are superior to someone, you already know that you are inferior to that person.
Text_ortho: Infact, if you wan say you dey superior to person, you know sey for your mind, you feel inferior to dat person.

Text_en: There is nothing wrong with being a woman.
Text_ortho: Noting dey wrong wit being a woman.

Text_en: And you can get all the respect you think you deserve, achieve anything you want to achieve while you still retain your respect as a woman, still living in...
Text_ortho: And you fit get all di respect wey you feel sey you deserve, achieve anyting wey you wan achieve while still maintain your respect yoursef, as a woman, still dey live in...

Text_en: I dont know if I've been speaking for five minutes.
Text_ortho: I no know wey I don talk reach five minute now.

Text_en: Or should I keep speaking?
Text_ortho: Abi make I still dey talk dey go?

Text_en: Should I continue?
Text_ortho: Make I still continue?

Text_en: So yes sir.
Text_ortho: So yes Sir.

Text_en: One of the issues which I am passionate about is feminism.
Text_ortho: One of di issues wey I dey passionate about, feminism.

Text_en: Again, another thing which I am passionate about is my belief in God.
Text_ortho: Anoder ting again wen I dey very passionate about na my belief in God.

Text_en: You know, yes, uh... I won't be able to say anything about myself without mentioning God and Christianity, you know.
Text_ortho: You know yes, ehn I no go fit talk anyting about mysef without mentioning God, and Christianity you know.

Text_en: Ah, I'm not trying to preach right now.
Text_ortho: Ah no be sey I wan preach now o!

Text_en: But basically, Christianity, for me, is not a religion.
Text_ortho: But basically, Christianity for me no be religion.

Text_en: It's just a new life.
Text_ortho: Na just a new life.

Text_en: Entering into a new life, and seeing things differently.
Text_ortho: Entering into a new life, and seeing tings differently.

Text_en: Because there was... I grew up... I was born in a Christian family.
Text_ortho: Because e get, I grow up, de born me for Christian house.

Text_en: But at a point in my life, I just told myself, "please, uh... God alone is not the way."
Text_ortho: But at a point in my life, I con just tell mysef sey abeg eh no be only God wey fit be di way.

Text_en: I tried to explore Eckankar.
Text_ortho: I try to explore Eckankar.

Text_en: Nothing is wrong with it, but then, I had an encounter with God one day.
Text_ortho: Noting dey wrong wit am o, but, I con get eh di encounter one day wit God.

Text_en: What made me...
Text_ortho: Wetin come make me...

Text_en: That day, I woke up and I was crying.
Text_ortho: Dat day I wake up, I con dey cry.

Text_en: I won't be able to talk about it now because it would be too long.
Text_ortho: I no fit talk about am now because e go dey too long.

Text_en: But, but that personal encounter made me say, "ah, I believe in God", not because I was born into a Christian home, but because of that personal encounter with God.
Text_ortho: But, but dat personal encounter na make me say ah I believe in God not because de born me for Christian home, because of dat my personal encounter wit God.

Text_en: And in my work, I have been seeing many different things.
Text_ortho: And in my work, I don dey see many different tings.

Text_en: Before, I used to be very harsh but when, you know, reading about loving your neighbour as yourself, all those things changed me.
Text_ortho: Before, I be who dey harsh well, well, but when you know read about loving your neighbour as yoursef all dose tings dey change me.

Text_en: And nothing is impossible with God.
Text_ortho: And noting dey impossible wit God.

Text_en: That's what Jesus Christ spoke about.
Text_ortho: Na wetin Jesus Christ talk about.

Text_en: And I've seen it, that nothing is impossible.
Text_ortho: And I don see am say noting dey impossible.

Text_en: Because even my life journey, from where I started from to where I am right now, everything is a journey of faith.
Text_ortho: Because even my life journey from where I start to where I dey right now, everyting na journey of faith.

Text_en: Even the TV show which I want to start so... which I know that I will do very well, is also a journey of faith.
Text_ortho: Even di TV wen I wan start so, which I know sey I go do very well too, na too journey of faith.

Text_en: So, my Christian life makes me believe that nothing is impossible for me to achieve.
Text_ortho: So, my Christian life make me believe sey noting dey impossible for me to achieve.

Text_en: I can live like... get everything which I've wanted in life, and enjoy life beautifully in health, in peace, and of course when I die, I still have hope in where I am going.
Text_ortho: I fit live like get everyting wen I want for dis life, and enjoy di life beautifully in health, in peace, and den of course when I die, I still get hope of where I dey go.

Text_en: And uh... hehe... thank you!
Text_ortho: And eh hehe thank you!
